name: Company Stock
description:
(((Work on this title will start again in 2016)))

Loosely based on stock trading, company ownership and economic stability.

Each player will start the game with a small fund and during the first round will vie for low priced stock to gain control of one or more of the companies in the game. The players will then get turns to make decision of how to grow the companies they control while adding to their personal account, company account and making sure the global economy does not go bankrupt.

The player can buy upgrades in a number of different fields to grow the company profits each round. This in turn will move the stock price higher for that company. If you are invested into a company you don't own and you feel the current owner is not doing enough for the company you can try and make the deals needed to buy out controlling stock in the company or you can dump your stock and send the price falling down.

The game will comprise of only about 20% random mechanic. Just as in real life, the best laid plans can cur-come to unexpected events. On the players turn they must roll to see how many actions are allowed for their current turn...however if you need more actions, you may buy them.

The winner is the player with the most money in the personal account at games end. While you will most likely be a company owner during the course of play, you do not need to be an owner of a company at any point to win...just make the right investments.

Buy Low / Sell High
Invest and Win

The game will incorporate player to player interaction and company to company interaction...a company can also own stock in other companies. It would not be unheard of for one company by game end to have controlling stock holdings over ALL the other companies.

Unique game-board will allow players to write onto it with vis-vis type markers, to track market progress
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Landbierparadies
description:
Every region in Germany has its own traditions and conventions when it comes to drinking their national beverage. Well, Franconia is no different. But this region is really special. You'll have plenty of chance to sample the outstanding local beer at more than 270 traditional Franconian private breweries. Nowhere else you'll find such a mass and variety of beer in Germany (or the world).

Landbierparadies is a specialized trade running five traditional Franconian pubs in the cities Nuremberg (host of the world's biggest toy fair) and Fürth selling only pure Franconian beverages and food.

Development of the card game started at the Essen fair 2009 and playtesting were done at most of their venues to catch the atmosphere. The 2 player card game inevitable themes to floor the typical wooden barrels of beer served at the pubs. Players distributes blond or dark beer cards to the barrels and try to meet the appropriate barrel number to drink it up and collect all the barrel matching (blonde or dark) mugs as a score. The famous "Schnapsrunde" might let you forget which color the barrel has and mix up your plans.

Cards produced by "Nürnberger Spielkarten Verlag"

name: EN-DANGER-ED
description:
Look on the inside of your Panda Puffs cereal box - it's a free game!

From the Game Rules:

OBJECT: To get your animal off the "Endangered Species" list by advancing them off the board. Just like in real life, you're only going to get so far and then get sent back to square one. Hopefully, with a bit of luck and skill, you'll make your way to the top. Too bad it's not that easy for the real animals!

name: Disney Memorix
description:
from the rule book

Contenent: 16 large cards; 16 small cards; 16counter;
1 playing piece; 1 die.

Object of the game:
Players need to find the hidden Disney friends and collect counters to win the game.

How to play:
Place the large cards with the illustrated side face up to form a square. Place the small cards so they are also face up in the middle of the square.
The first player start throwing the die and move the playing piece around the large card in a clockwise direction. The Disney character you land on indicate the small card you must turn over in the middle. This ends the turn.
When you land on a large card that has alredy had the matching small card turned face down, you have to remember where this card is and find it. If you find it, you may take a counter, the first player to collect 4 counter win.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Das Haus Anubis Trading Card Game
description:
A collectible card game based on the children's television series of the same name. Players use character, event and mystery cards to uncover the secrets of the mysterious boarding school and relive the events of the series.

The initial set (June 2010) featured 125 different cards, released in six-card booster packs.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Flip eller flop
description: Players are pop stars who need to hire managers, get gigs, write songs and so on in order to make it big and thus win the game. The trappings of the game largely invoke Monopoly, although the game plays differently.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Sport Dice Football
description:
A football dice game played on a felt mat. Dice are rolled and used for Offense, Defense and Kicking. Run, pass and score 20 points first in this take on one of America's favorite sports!

User Summary

name: Top: Das Geheimnis des Erfolges
description:
Each player is an entrepreneur,who wants to better with his company than all competitors. There is a race for the best employees, the best connections to the politics and all aspects of managing a company.
Comes with a basic, advanced and Team version.
Easy roll and move , collecting stuff game which was developed by some employees of the Siemens company together with Ravensburger and Wolfgang Kramer

name: Tempt & Tease
description:
Contains: 54 playing cards (the standard 4 suits + 2 jokers, all done with somewhat risque but cartoony drawings), 60 text "reward" cards (20 for Her, 20 for Him, 20 for "Play"), and small rule booklet.

Description from the back of box: Tempt & Tease is the sweet and sexy couple's card game that rewards you both as a couple and as individuals. Be the first to reach 69 points in each hand and earn a Reward card that outlines a fun and hot experience to add to your lovemaking. Quick and easy to learn and play!

name: Das Ü-30 Partyspiel
description:
User summary:

A quiz game for people who just turned 30 and want to test their knowledge about the trendy things from their youth.

The saught person or term has to be described by everything you might imagine. Each correct guess allows you to move towards victory but beware the special spots on the board which forces you to use only your hands and feet.

Translation of the back of the box:

Can you remember Tamagotchis, Techno, Beverly Hills and the Spice Girls? Very well because those things have to be explained in a creative way! How? At the beginning it doesn't care how, you may use words, your hands, your feet or a pen or whatever.
Whoever's guess is correct advances on the scoring board fast than the others.
Tension or even more fun is achieved by reaching spots fields on the board. The allowed ways of explaining are reduced to a minimum.
Due to two different playing modes it is possible to play the game with younger people. Join us on a time travel and play with your past!
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia

name: Thunder: Flash
description:
In Thunder - Flash, the player takes the role of an american squad of paratroopers.. The squad hails from the 101st Airborne Division 506th Parachute Infantry Regiment (PIR). They landed outsided their designated DZ, and need to find the rest of their squad. The game starts with the player controlling the sergeant and a private. They make their way north towards Brécourt, their target, trying to pick up as many soldiers as possible.

The game is played on a 16 by 11 grid of hexes, and the object is to make it from the southern border to the northern border of the map, picking up more soldiers on the way, avoiding capture and death at the hands of the 20 german soldiers around the woods.

A simple d6 roll against a base difficulty is made for combat checks, modified by NCOs on either side. In addition, a number of french civilians who oppose the german occupation are scattered around the map and may help the US soldiers.

With the exception of the two soldiers the player starts with, the rest of the chits are placed around the map, blank side up, so that there is no way of knowing whether you encounter a german soldier, an american soldier or a french civilian until you issue the challenge (Thunder). US troops respond correctly (Flash), and are immediately incorporated into the squad.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Six Flags-opoly
description: With many world-renowned Six Flags Theme Parks located across North America, there was temptation to make one SIX FLAGS-OPOLY edition that included all of the Company’s multiple attractions. It was decided, however, that developing a game version for each venue would create a much more personal souvenir. The decision proved to be solid, as sales were strong throughout the season and all the games were sold within the span of the promotion. The ability to add personal detail to your game is a key to success!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Mousetrap Maths
description:
A cute educational game in which players turn over a card with a simple maths problem and attempts to answer it correctly. If the answer is correct the player moves their pawn forward to the next available space on the board which has the number of their correct answer. The game is themed such that the players are mice and they may land on special squares: escape a cat, move forward to n, chased by a cat, move back to n or caught in a mousetrap, miss one turn.
There are two sets of cards, one of addition and one of subtraction, and a double sided board to go with each card set.

name: A4 gewinnt
description:
The game is played on a A1 size board which is divided into 64 A7 fields. The two players hold A7 sized cards in their own color. At first, the players take turns putting one of their cards into each of the four quadrants of the board, afterwards they can put them onto any field. When all cards have been placed, the cards can be moved to adjacent fields. Two adjacent cards can be moved together. When a player manages to form a four card (A5 sized) rectangle, he/she can take one of the opponent's cards out and place it on the rectangle - these cards are now secure (and can be moved together, too).

When a player manages to form a second A5 rectangle, he/she is the winner. The game promotes the standard paper sizes.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: ... is there a doctor in the house?
description:
To play this game, one person acts as the examiner with 2 to 5 people acting as doctors taking the exam. The examiner shuffles the cards and the players in turn take the card and answer the question. The card may require them to answer a multiple choice question, to place an organ or bone sticker in the correct position on the body diagram or to examine the patient in an appropriately professional manner. Cards are worth varying amount of points depending on the difficulty of the question. The player with the most points at the end wins.

From the box:

The interactive medical knowledge quiz.

A side-splitting medical quiz game complete with bone and organ stickers to place on a fold-out body diagram.



Thrilling life or death situations, and the chance to prod and poke real live patients.



Discover whether you are destined to be a brilliant brain surgeon or a half-witted hypochondriac.


Featuring:

52 quiz cards
fold-out body diagram
wallet containing 12 stick-on body parts
32-page concertina book, with bonus questions, quiz answers, score assessment, suggestions for alternative careers, and gory after-dinner medical facts.

name: Spelet om Europa
description: A roll and move trivia game of arbitrary length where players move across a map of Europe, answering historical, cultural and political questions about the continent. Published before the Swedish referendum on joining the European Union in 1994. There is no year of publication, but the extensive bibliography of recommended reading lists titles from the years 1991-2.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Super Route Le Mans travel game
description: Racing game for on the road, comes in the form of an racing car that can be opened. Inside you will find a circuit, some cars and the rules. There are no dices.. You can spin the wheel instead. Two ways of playing the game : Spin the wheel and place your car forwards according to what you've spun or a car game like, first one to see a tree may spin the wheel..

name: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
description:
Description from manual

the card game consists of 4 games:

Happy Families
the object of the game is to collect as many families (groups of 4 cards that belong together) as possible.

Donkey
this card game consists of 14 pairs and one donkey-card. when a player loses al of his cards he is saved and stops playing. at the end of the game the player who still hass the donkey-card has lost, all other players win.

Pairs
the object of the game is to win the most pairs (a pair = 2 cards of the same family)

Snap
snap is a 2 player game where the object is to win all cards. one by one, players turn over their top card and place it in the centre making one pile. when a turned card matches the card emediately beneath it on the pile 'SNAP' is called. the players who calls 'SNAP' first takes the centre pile of cards and places them face down under their pile.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Wheel of Fortune: Simpsons Edition
description:
What happens when you combine Springfield's favorite family, The Simpsons, with the top-rated game show' Find out in this fun-for-the-family game! To play, simply spin the wheel and call a letter. Little by little, the puzzle is revealed... and all 96 of them are based on people, places and things from the hit show. Game includes puzzle board with Simpsons frame, 96 puzzles, solutions and instructions booklet, spinner card and play money.

There's also a 'Deluxe Edition' which comes in a tin
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Hexadoms
description:
Dominoes variant played using hexagonal pieces.
The pieces are divided equally amongst the players and a start player chosen. The start player places one of their hexadoms, Second play must place on of their pieces matching one of the sides. Subsequent players must place matching two or more sides.
If a player cannot place a piece they miss a turn. Play continues until one player has placed all his Hexadoms - they are the winner. If no player can place a Hexadom then the player whose pieces show the fewest dots is the winner.

name: Dinosaur War
description:
From the publisher:

"The card game of War with a Jurassic Twist!
Don't lay an egg!

The card game of war has never been so much fun! Larger dinosaurs defeat smaller dinosaurs, alike dinosaurs go to war, and dino eggs (if not eaten) hatch into new dinosaurs."

In this game, some cards depict eggs. When a player flips an egg card, then the egg will hatch by adding 2-4 cards (depending on the number of players) face down to the pool and then a face-up card which represents the new dinosaur hatched from the egg. Also, some dinosaurs are "egg-eaters", which when matched up against an egg card, will eat the egg card before it can hatch.

name: Valeur et Discipline
description:
Valeur et Discipline is a set of rules for napoleonic wargaming with figurines al scale 1/100 or 15 mm. It's ideal for play al Corps level and with multiple players.

(From the introduction)
The players in each turn first give orders at his units, after the units are activated and declare "charge" (the enemy can react) and move (the enmey again can react or make defensive fire). The combat phase is common, with artillery fire, musket fire and melee, and ending with the moral checks.
The object of the game is to desmoralize or rout the enemy formations when they reach a determined level of losses.

name: Taktikus
description:
Taktikus is a simple two-player abstract strategy game. The game is played with eight wooden marbles for each player (white and black, respectively) on an 8 by 8 square grid of indents. The objective of the game is to capture the opponent’s marbles. At the beginning each player places his or her marbles in the first row (i.e. the row closest to the respective player). Each player then on turn moves one marble of choice. A marble may move horizontally or vertically (but not diagonally) as far as the player wants but is not allowed to jump over other marbles (of either color). Change of direction during a move is not allowed. Marbles are captured in one of two ways:

by capturing one or more of the opponents marbles (in an unbroken row or column) between two of one’s own marbles.
by moving a marble into an empty space in-between two of the opponents marbles, which are both captured.


The game ends when one player is left with only one marble (unless he/she is able to win the game in the subsequent move by capturing two of the opponent marbles) and the other player is the winner.

The rule sheet that comes with the game has a couple of diagrams illustrating the two types of capture.
The nice, small wooden board is in two hinged halves with storage compartment for the marbles inside when closed.

name: The Game of Powers
description:
The Game of Powers is a 'roll and move' design coupled with an 'economic light' engine.

Each player represents a World Bank that is trying to annex as many World Powers (countries) as possible. The player that has secured the greatest power by the end of the game is declared the winner.

Source: Taken from the introduction found in the rulebook.

The Game of Powers was originally developed in the Melbourne suburb of St Kilda by local residents in 1939 and successfully manufactured and sold by John Sands Pty Ltd (Melbourne) during WWII.

name: Mosqopoly
description:
A free download-and-print board game released in response to the 'Ground Zero Mosque' looniness.

From the game board: "Many people thought the attacks of 9/11 were about terror, but the truth is far more sinister. Yesterday, extreme Muslimists built a Giant Mosque, planted like a victory flag, at Ground Zero. That's right, the flattening of the World Trade Center nine years ago was part of a broader Islamofacist terror plot designed to circumvent local planning laws and lower the notoriously expensive NYC ground rent at the same time. Why? So that the entirety of downtown Manhattan can be turned into the world's biggest mosque - a project they refer to as The Giant Mosqtapus. If we don't stop this Megamosque now, it's tentacles will strangle the life out of this, the greatest city, in the greatest country on earth. Only you can stop Mosqopoly!"
categories: Bluffing, City Building, Educational, Humor, Political, Print & Play

name: Piratas do Caribe: No Fim do Mundo
description:
Davy Jones against Jack Sparrow. The first hides the ark and dangers while the other must collect ark and keys while fighting monsters and other foes. But the task is not easy because Jack Sparrow can use it´s special barnacle only a few times and even so he cannot see everything!

It is a beautiful game, has lots of chits, a special barnacle with red lenses, a mask and a decent board with a panel in between.

The player Davy Jones must hide dragons, giant squids, pirate ships, two empty islands, one island with an ark and one island with keys. Jack Sparrow must move his ship, one square at a time, trying to find out the ark and the keys. Each time Jack reaches a monster, the skull marker move one space and he can take a look at the other board with the barnacle. If he reaches a pirate ship he can fight or flee. If he chooses to run, the skull marker move one space. If he chooses to fight he must throw a special dice. If the value is higher than the pirate, he defeats it, if it is lower or equal, he looses a coin.
Jack wins the game if he finds the ark and the keys. Davy Jones wins the game if Jack runs out of coins or if the skull marker reaches ten.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates, Travel
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment

name: True Blood
description:
User Summary:
Fan-generated card game inspired by the True Blood books/HBO series. Players work to control a number of different characters (human, vampire, werewolf, etc.) and use those characters' special abilities to control others and gain Blood Tokens. Whomever collects the most Blood Tokens by the end of the game, wins!

(Note: The game cards contain Season 3 spoilers, so play at your own risk. Furthermore, there are some limited references to sex and drug dealers, so this is not a game for younger kids)

TURN SEQUENCE
Each turn has 9 Phases:
1. Influence Phase
2. Initiative Phase
3. Plotting Phase
4. Recruitment Phase
5. Event Phase
6. Action Phase
7. Capture Phase
8. Recovery Phase
9. End Phase

The game uses two custom card decks. The Character Deck consists of the various characters, groups and locations from the show. 5 characters are placed face up, and players pay Blook Tokens to recruit them, with bonuses/penalties to to cost of recruitment depending on where the Character is on the Recruitment Track. Once a Character is recruited, the remaining Characters on the Recruitment Track slide down, and a new Character Card is added to the beginning of the Track.

The Event Deck is drawn from by each turn by each player in the Plotting Phase to give them special actions that they can use later in the Event Phase. In addition, each controlled Character has one or more special Actions that players may use in the Action Phase to attack, capture, or control Characters from other players.

Bidding is used to control the order of players turns.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: Miss Kipik
description:
From the game description

The purpose of the game is to save the insects out of Miss Kipik's web. But look out! Miss Kipik has made traps in her web and if insects escape from her web, she may wake up very angry. You must be smart to find all traps because their never the same.

To win the game you have to save:

2 players: 8 bugs
3 players: 7 bugs
4 players: 5 bugs


First you have to spin a wheel to know how many bugs (1, 2 or 3) you must save in this round. Then you take the tweezers and try to save the right amount of bugs. If Miss Kipik doesn't wake up, then you can keep the bugs. if Miss Kipik wakes up the player must put back the bug in the right position, and it is the next player's turn.

name: Sheep Dip
description:
The object of the game is to herd sheep through the dip and into the pen. One player controls the farmer and his 2 dogs. One or more other players control sheep that try to stay out of the dip and pen. Play occurs on a grid of 18 by 18 squares. Hedges, bushes, fences and water hazards impede movement. The farmer may move vertical, horizontal, or diagonal. The dogs and sheep move only vertical or horizontal. The farmer moves the total of the throw of three dice and can divide his movement between himself and the two dogs. The sheep use one die, and cannot move next to the farmer or dogs or through natural obstacles. When the farmer or dogs move next to a sheep it forces the sheep to move away. The farmer also has additional fences that he place to block movement.

Although components are not included, complete rules were published in Games and Puzzles Magazine no. 5. It is suitable for miniatures play using model railroad accessories on a ruled grid.
publishers: Edu Games Ltd (UK), Games and Puzzles (magazine)

name: Toy Story 3 Hide and Seek Trading Card Game
description:
A collectible card game based on Toy Story 3 computer-animated film. There are 90 cards to collect for this game, and they are distributed in packets of 6 random cards. There are two numbers on each card, one for Hide, and the other for Seek. The gameplay is rather simple, and is based on comparing Hide/Seek numbers between players.

Each player must have the same number of cards, without doubles. Players shuffle their cards and hold their cards face down in their hands. First player turns over the first card in his/her deck and decides whether to play with the Hide or Seek number. The other player must play with opposite number. The winner places his/her card at the bottom of their deck, and loser must discard his/her card to the pile of lost cards. This procedure should be repeated until one player runs out of cards.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Double Cross
description:
Card game with three separate rulebooks: Conquest, Rings, and Double Cross. 52 card deck in 4 suits but with substitutions for queens, 8, 9, 10. these substitutions are scoring and penalty cards.
Conquest: This is a bridge like bidding and trick taking game but differs in that you do not bid for tricks but for number of scoring cards which must be obtained by taking tricks.
Rings: A children's matching game with a common "hand" in the middle which players hands are matched up with and scored with the scoring cards.
Double Cross: Object is to get rid of all the cards in your hand first. This is done by creating a sequenced pile in the middle of the table, (similar to Kings in the Corner). Score cards are played face up in front of you.

name: Jack Plot!
description:
Front of the box: "Get the most yield from any field with Dan the Answer Plot man."

This is a promotional game that was created by Croplan Genetics and their Answer Plot program.

From jackplotvegas.com:
JackPlot! is a CROPLAN GENETICS and Answer Plot based board game. The game is based on a year in time. Just like in real life, growers have to withstand the elements of winter, spring planting, growing season and harvest to hold onto as much yield as they can. Hopefully with the help of their local agronomist and by attending the Winter Grower Meeting and the Answer Plot Knowledge Events, growers can plan well and gain enough insight to protect and increase their yield. The player with more yield than other players (the neighbors) at the end of the game (the grain elevator), wins!

name: Ducktales: Tesouro da Pirâmide
description:
Uncle Scrooge, Huey, Dewey and Louie Duck, Gyro Gearloose and Launchpad McQuack travel to Mexico to search for QuetzalQuac Treasure. They must climb a pyramid, fight monsters and find precious itens.
The Pyramid is a 3D board with four stores. Each player must roll a die, advance his character to the square and do the action indicated by it (if any). There is a dial used to resolve battles that occur when a door is reached.
The goals of the game are: find the two halfs of a map, a lucky amulet, the QuetzalQuac treasure and go back to the base of the pyramid.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Benni Bücherwurm
description: This game helps children to learn to distinguish between colours and to recognize opposites. The game also trains motor abilities. A variant of the game, Bücher Salat, is a 'threading game', the symbols of the dice must be correctly combined and players thread Benni through the corresponding book. The first player running out of books wins the game. In the variant 'Bücher schnappen' reaction is added, where the symbols must be combined and the correct book snatched up from the table. The player who grabs the most books wins the game.

Description from publisher:

Un juego "pipí cucú" para revivir lo más divertido de la época.

En este juego, los setentosos y ochentosos, tienen que contestar preguntas, actuar, dibujar, silbar y mucho más...recordando lo más
divertido de la época.

¿Te animás a actuar representando al "Super agente 86" y dibujar un balero...o al Correcaminos; y a silbar "Menta y Limón"... o "Cleopatra"?


Is a mix between Trivial Pursuit, Pictionary and acting, everything based on the music, tv, movies and culture of the 70s and 80s. Players must act, answer questions, draw, whistle, and sing in various competitions.
mechanics: Acting, Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: Party 'Til You Puke
description:
From the box: "A Game With No Redeeming Qualities"

A roll and move drinking game where you move your piece around a game board arranged like a person's home. The object of the game is to be the first player to get from the front door to the bathroom.

name: Life of Christ: Bible Journeys No. 2
description:
Follow the life of Christ from Bethlehem to Calvary. Players move along a path that follows the events of the life of Christ and answer questions on cards that are drawn. First player to the end wins.

User Summary
publishers: Autumn House, Review and Herald Publishing

name: Kartrider World Tour
description: A Blue Marble (or Monopoly) like game with Crazyracing Kartrider license. Players move pieces by dice roll and buy properties, build shops, collect money for selling souvenirs. The goal is to earn preset victory points first by collecting souvenirs.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Santa Claus vs. The Easter Bunny
description:
A tactical game for 2 players.

So Santa and the Easter Bunny were sitting down in a cafe, drinking lattes, and Santa casually mentions that Christmas is more exciting that Easter. To which the Easter Bunny says that Easter brings more joy and happiness than Christmas. Santa, slightly miffed, says "Oh, I doubt that!". The Easter Bunny suggests "Perhaps a friendly contest is in order then. Let's see who can bring the most happiness, joy, and excitement to the children this year!". Santa chugs his latte and says to the Easter Bunny: "Bring it!!!" And the game was on!

This game is a print and play game for two players. It was designed to be relatively quick (29 turns; all quick) and be easy on the print cartridge. It also has basic strategy that may not be apparent at first. All images were public domain and taken from

The game consists of a series of bidding contests in which the winner of each contest receives a card. Cards that are won will later be used in future bids for new cards. Most contests are won by playing a card with high Excitement, Joy, or Happiness. Each card will have numbered values for each of Excitement, Joy, or Happiness.

Online play will be available shortly on Vassal.

name: Roshambo Champion
description:
A free single-player print-and-play, this game is less about actual rock-paper-scissors and more about being in a crooked Rock-Paper-Scissors (Roshambo) tournament! Exploit your opponents' weaknesses while working around your own crippling disadvantages. When that doesn't work, cheat or bribe the officials!

The game PDF is available in the files section, or can be downloaded from here.

Gameplay:
In this game you generate some simple stats for yourself, then face opponents like "The Copycat", "The Randomizer", and "The Cheat" in a simulated blind ladder-style elimination. Which opponents are dangerous and which ones are pushovers will be different every game. When the going looks too rough, either cheat to give yourself an edge or bribe the officials to change the lineup and hope the opponent you dodged gets eliminated before they match back up with you. But don't get carried away... you don't have enough money and sneakiness to fix every match.

name: Ordered to Die: The Battle of Ctesiphon 1915
description:
Ordered to Die is a Dennis L. Bishop simulation of the November, 1915, battle of Ctesiphon in Iraq.

A low-to-intermediate complexity, two-player, operational-level game, the players play British and Ottoman sides in the World War One engagement where the British attempted to capture the Ottoman entrenchments at Seimanpak Mayden Muharebesi on the drive to Baghdad. The map scale is two kilometers per hex. Each game turn represents three hours. Units of maneuver for both sides are infantry battalions and regiments, each representing between 250 and 1,000 men; artillery batteries, each with four to six guns; and groups of Arab tribesmen, each representing up to about 500 men.

Components:

* Two-Person or Solitaire
* 4-Page Rules Manual
* 68 5/8" Die-Cut Counters by Lionel Liron
* 22" x 17" Full-Color Map by Tim Allen
* Counter Identification Table

[from the publisher webpage]

name: Cocot Folie
description:
From the box:
New children game where players all have to be chickens and peck grain. Just pull back you little chicken and let it do its work and eat that small ball.
Remember, it is not just eating everything, but eating right stuff and fast. Eat 6 blue when playing with blue chicken, all other ball through back in, when all balls are gone.
A neat little game for children. First one to collect 6 of their color balls, is the winner.

name: Farben Domino
description:
A card based domino games used to teach and reinforce color identification. Cards are placed with corresponding colors adjacent to one another. The first to place all the cards in their hand wins.

--user summary

name: Cringle Bells
description:
Cringle Bells is a game about Elves, specifically Santa's Elves. It is a game about these Elves working feverishly during the last 12 hours before Santa's sleigh leaves to deliver toys. Why 12 hours? Because Elves procrastinate. They know that the one who garners the most favor from Santa (points) gets to sit at the Big Man's table for after-Christmas dinner. They know that the one who garners the most favor from Santa is rewarded a 2-month vacation in Hawaii with any other Elf at the North Pole. And the most important thing of all? There's only one girl Elf, Gizelda in the doll wigs department (and she's the only Elf that's been to Hawaii EVERY YEAR!)

All you need is a pair of six-sided dice (you're not playing Monopoly that often, are you?), 1 deck of standard playing cards, the game rules, and scoresheets.

Players take turns attempting to complete the assembly of toys that are on the conveyor belt. They receive bonus points for dice combinations, completing a toy that their department specializes in (the same suit as their score sheet), and for completing the toy that their department makes all the time (a specific card).

It's a family game for 1 or more players and available free as a print and play game.

Who will become the Great Garbanzo and earn the most Favor? Most importantly, who will get to take the beautiful Gizelda to Hawaii?
categories: Card Game, Dice, Math, Party Game, Print & Play

name: Skryptorium
description:
We invite you into middle ages where in scriptorium (latin for "a place for writing") Benedictine monks would copy and illustrate books and manuscripts. Your task in the game is to help the scribe to collect sentences that were scattered through out the monastery. The player, who will collect the most complete sentences and will deliver them to scriptorium will be a winner. Game combines spin and move with classic memory mechanic adding some special twists into the mix.

Game presents Christian spirituality and sentences of st. Benedictine. "Skryptorium" was prepared in cooperation with Benedictine monastery in Tyniec, Poland.

name: Drôles d'animaux
description:
The game contains 60 cards, these are divided in 3 times 20 each numbered from 1 to 20. The three categories are: body, face and legs.

The cards are then divided between all the players. Each player gets the same amount of faces, bodies and legs. Now the players have to make the most animals with the same number on all the three body parts.

The rest of the cards they can exchange with other players. There are different ways to do this in the rulebook. The player with the highest number of animals reconstituted won.

(User Summary)
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor

name: Wizard's Quest
description: Wizard's Quest is a free print and play game in which you take the role of a wizard about to complete his training. In order to do this, you must defeat a creature called Gegenhound which lives in a place called "The Gether." The wizard advances around a the map via die roll and looks up events in a paragraph book depending on what square he landed in. The game has three ways it can be played: The wizard can learn The Path of Mind, Path of Nature, or The Path of Shadows (dark and deceptive magic). Each of these adds variety to the game by changing the victory conditions. The game also comes with three different difficulty levels which modify the total strength of The Gether.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Spillet om de tre bukkene Bruse
description:
A childrens game based on the traditional Norwegian fairytale about the three billy goats who had to cross a bridge where a troll lives.

There is a total of nine billy goats in this game. Three in each color. On your turn you roll a color die and a "normal" die. You move one of the goats of the color the first die shows the number the second die shows. When you come to the bridge you have to draw a troll card to see if the Troll eats the goat.

Each player should collect goats from one color, but the color you collect changes when you reach a "switch color" token.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Hidden Gems
description:
This tile laying games pits two players against each other, trying to build point-winning diamonds and rubies, whilst blocking your opponent's efforts.

There are bonus tiles that let you make double moves or swap out tiles from the game.

The tiles are rhombus-shaped, with 30 per player, and each player takes their turn adding a tile to the table, one at a time, until the winner is declared.

name: Kim Bac
description:
Theme:
In Chinese, Kim-Bac means "the treasure seeker". A breath-taking treasure race in the narrow streets of an old Chinese town: that's the theme of this new game, fast paced, constantly renewed with an uncut suspense.

Kim-Bac is played in to phases: in the first one, "where is the treasure hidden?", all the treasure seekers try to put their hands on the chest that contains the secret of the treasure hideout.
In the second phase: "the treasure race", a single player, the Kim-Bac, knows where the treasure is hidden. All the others ally to capture him and share out the treasure.
Randomness almost never occurs in this second game phase. Alone against everyone, will the Kim-Bac be able to reach the treasure hideout?


Thème :
En chinois, Kim-Bac veut dire "le cherche trésor". Une haletante course au trésor dans les étroites ruelles d'une vieille ville chinoise : c'est le sujet de ce nouveau jeu au rythme rapide et au suspense ininterrompu, constamment renouvelé.

Kim-Bac se joue en deux parties : dans la première : "où le trésor est-il caché ?", tous les chercheurs de trésor essayent de mettre la main sur le coffre qui contient le secret de la cachette du trésor.
Dans la deuxième partie : "la course au trésor", un seul joueur, le Kim-Bac, sait à quel endroit le trésor est caché. Tous les autres s'allient entre eux pour le capturer et se partager le trésor.
Le hasard n'intervient presque pas dans cette deuxième partie du jeu. Seul contre tous, le Kim-Bac pourra-t-il parvenir jusqu'à la cachette du trésor ?

name: Schlaf gut, kleiner Mondbär
description:
Schlaf gut, kleiner Mondbär is for the very young and consists of animal figurines and many star tokens. The animals are dealt out, then the players take turns rolling a die. If a player rolls an animal, they can take the animal if it is with another player. If a player rolls a star, they can put as many stars back into the box as the number of animals they currently have.

The first player to get rid of all of their stars is the winner!

name: Vrooom
description:
[From Back of Box and User Summary]

Riding in the car has never been so much fun. Players outwit opponents with custom decks in hopes of becoming the ultimate Vrooomster. Vrooom! The travel card game consists of more than 175 common, uncommon and rare cards. The trip may end but the fun never stops. The journey continues by adding cards to your collection.

The aim is to score the most points before either a certain distance is covered by the transportation you are in (eg 10 miles) or when you reach a destination (eg Grandma's House). Vroom is played by playing out 'object' and 'transmission' cards. Object cards are played when the player sees the object on the card (eg 'Stop sign'). Players score points for playing objects and for collecting sets of like objects (the latter achieved through the play of transmission cards).

name: Auto Magnetic Pin Spotter Bowling Game
description:
This game comes from Irwin Co. and is circa 1968.

A regular bowling game that features a reset device so that you do not have to reset the pins yourself. You simply press down on the reset mechanism and the pins are ready for the next frame.

name: Starmäng
description:
Promotional game for Starman (Starman is one the largest provider of cable-TV and internet services in Estonia)

There are 3 different paths in gameboard (cable-TV,internet & phone services) and the objective is move 3 pawns at the end of all paths first.

Contents:

Gameboard
4x4 pawns
1 die

name: Who'd You Rather?
description:
Who'd You Rather - The Ultimate Adult Party Game

In this game you attempt to be the first player to reach $1 Million by performing risque activities or by betting on the sexual preferences of other players in the following categories (as taken from the rules):

1. Pics - Some are hot, some are not - but you must choose one!
2. Celebs: This category compares two well-known celebrities.
3. Turn Ons/Turn Offs: This category is all about the things that might get you excited...or disgusted!
4. Down and Dirty: This category lets it all out. This is where other find out what you're really about - between the sheets, that is.
5. Anything Goes: This is the action category. You'll get to see people do things you never really thought they would do.

Each turn, The active player spins to see which category they must follow. They will then be asked to perform the action required to earn cash, or select their preference of two options (A or B) presented. They choose between A or B and place their answer card face-down in front of them. All other players also place an answer card in front of themselves with the answer they think the active player chose. Bets may be placed on answers to increase the money earned by a correct guess. The active player must reveal their answer and explain themselves. All correct players earn $50K plus whatever they bet. Incorrect players lose any money they wagered.

The game includes different pics/question card sets for people who prefer men and people who prefer women.

name: Stockholmsspelet Utbyggnadspaket 2007
description:
Expansion for Stockholmsspelet.
Contains 500 new questions and 8 new player characters.

name: Convoy
description: Every player has a convoy of 7 pawns in one corner of the board. On your turn you roll one d6. You can move one of your pawns the exact number. You can only move if there are at most 3 empty spaces between your 7 pawns. You can move over your own pawns, but opponent's pawns are blocking.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Intelligenz Testspiel
description:
This is just a game for 1 to 6 players to make 10 different tests and the winner is the person with the highest IQ after the 10 rounds.

In a second "variant" there you have jokers for putting them on special tests, you think you are good at to get more points.

name: Flaps Card Game
description:
FLAPS is like an extreme version of UNO. Flaps is a shedding-type card game for two or more players that is popular in the United Kingdom and Czech Republic. The sole aim of Flaps is to discard all of the cards in one's hand; the first player to play his final card, and ergo have no cards left, wins the game.

The game uses a custom deck of cards written in both English and Czech. The game has seven levels, each level adding new functionality.
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Take That

name: Shakespell
description:
From the rules sheet:

A pocket word dice game consisting of seven white letter dice and one black symbol dice. Comes in a drawstring bag.

Each player takes a turn to shake and throw the eight dice. Using the letters on the upturned faces of the seven white letter dice, the aim is to make the highest score possible by creating one or more words of two or more letters. Players decide the number of rounds they wish to play in each game.

Each dice has a score value and these are added together to get a total for the turn. The blank has no score value and may be used as any desired letter.

If all the letters can be used in making two or three words, an extra 5 points is added to the player's score for that turn.

Six letter words add 15 points to the player's score.

Seven letter words add 25 points to the player's score.

The black symbol dice affects the player's throw by adding or subtracting points, imposing a time limit, allowing a rethrow of all dice, prohibiting multiple words or adding an extra blank.

name: Demorakel
description:
Satirical left-winged political board game. The goal is to make your political career. You need 4 demonstrations and 4 "gatherings" to become a member of the german government.
For the movement you you political units to move up to 10 spaces. Overtaking other cost extra and the spaces you land on are executed. If you run out of political units, you are forced to go on holidays.
mechanics: Action Points, Point to Point Movement

name: Answer Bingo: Addition Game
description: Maths has been turned into fun. This provides children with practice in beginning maths problems. The playing boards give answers to simple addition problems, and the playing cards give the sums - children draw cards and match the equation to the correct answer (wild cards add luck to the draw). The first one to fill a game board wins.

name: Kampen om Gävle
description:
From the publisher:
Kampen om Gävleis a game about the Swedish city of Gävle. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and its history. Players move around a track on the board and acquire properties and answer trivia questions about the featured city.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Perfekt geblöfft
description: Contains 110 cards with over 1500 fancy, unfamiliar words and their meaning. Players take turn to pick one of these words as a task for the others. The person who picked the word writes its meaning on a piece of paper while the others try to come up with a plausible definition. Then all definitions are read and everyone tries to find out which one is correct. Guessing the correct definition is worth one point; made-up definitions are worth two points per player who believed in it. To win the game you have to reach the end of the game board first.

name: Das offizielle Mölln-Spiel
description:
Mölln is a small town in northern Germany. In a playful way, the game participants discover Mölln. The players take a virtual tour of the city Mölln. The number of steps are determined by dice and the player must complete various events (Gamecards) to earn points (such as "reach the market place and you get 20 points" or "go shopping in the store XY and you lose 5 points). When a player reaches 200 points, he can reach the goal with his game character. Otherwise, he must continue his tour in the city. Players can choose whether they want to explore the city by car or by bike (other paths are possible). A very simple and unfortunately not very challenging game.

---

Mölln ist eine kleine Stadt im Norden Deutschlands. Auf spielerische Weise können die Spielteilnehmer Mölln entdecken. Die Spieler machen einen virtuellen Rundgang durch die Stadt Mölln. Die Anzahl der Schritte werden per Würfel ermittelt und der Spieler muss diverse Ereignisse (Ereigniskarten) absolvieren um Punkte zu sammeln (wie zum Beispiel "erreiche den Marktplatz und du erhältst 20 Punkte" oder "gehe in dem Geschäft XY einkaufen und du verlierst 5 Punkte"). Wenn ein Spieler 200 Punkte erreicht hat, kann er das Ziel erreichen. Andernfalls muss er seinen Rundgang in der Stadt fortsetzen. Die Spieler können wählen, ob sie die Stadt im Auto oder mit dem Fahrrad erkunden wollen (andere Wege sind möglich). Ein sehr einfaches und leider wenig anspruchsvolles Spiel.

name: Valeur et Discipline 2
description:
Valeur et Discipline 2 was published in issue 8 of magazine Soldados y Estrategia, and expands the set of miniature rules Valeur et Discipline.

This expansion add rules for engineers (sapping, mining, pontoons, demolitions), for artillery (Siege, Regimental artillery, capture) and a new formation rule for "massed battallions" (like MacDonald at Wagram).

In this expansion also are the army lists for Spain, France, Graet Britain, Austria, Portugal, Prussia, Russia, Bavaria, Poland, Saxony and Italy. The lists are classified for type of troops, periode, his organisation in game terms, moral, weapons and capability for fight in open order.

name: Avalanche!
description:
From Publisher: Watchout - it's AVALANCHE! The game of skill & concentration!
Make a mountain of marbles and skillfully remove your colored marbles with causing and AVALANCHE! Careful - only one fallen marble can cause an AVALANCHE! Experience the excitement, fun and thrilling suspense. Will you lose your marbles?

Players must collect all of the required colored marbles on their playing board. On their turn the player uses the "giant tweezers" to grab the clored marble they need. But, if any fall down the moutain, their turn is over and they get nothing! The winner is the first person to complete their card.

name: Tastomino
description:
This is a Dominoes variant with two ways of playing. The first one follows regular Dominoes rules: A player can play a tile on his/her turn which must match a tile to another tile at one end of the layout of tiles already on the table. If the player cannot do that with a tile s/he owns, s/he has to draw an additional tile. The first player to get rid of his/her tiles is the winner.

The playing pieces however, are irregularly shaped. For the second variant, the players put their pieces into a bag and have to feel which edge fits an edge of another piece. Other than that, the usual rules apply as well.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

name: Your Numbers Up!
description:
Manufacturer's Description:
First roll the 2 large dice. Then you need to add, subtract, divide or multiply the 2 numbers shown. Then flip up the appropriate key, first one to flip up all 10 keys wins.

name: Flip For It
description: Place eight number cards around the dice rolling bubble (Flippy). Press down on Flippy, let go, and watch him flip and roll the dice for you! Claim a card that matches the number on either die or their total. Easy-to-learn, fast-paced fun for the whole family!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Math, Party Game, Real-time

name: Loot!
description:
User review: Players start at Jail (where they have been held for questioning) with five one-thousand dollar bills and three INFO cards. In turn, they roll both dice and move around the gameboard, following instructions from the space on which they land and negotiating with other players whenever it is to one's advantage. The game ends when the bank is depleted and whoever has the most money wins.

The game is subtitled "The genteel game of burglary."

name: The Beautiful Game
description:
The Beautiful Game allows you to play the action of a top flight Football (soccer) match. Decisions made at the Team Level by the Manager have to backed up by skill and luck on the field by the players. The Beautiful Game is a complete game where you just have to add the dice, the A3 size pitch and cut out counters representing the players will fit on an average coffee table. Step up to using 15mm players on the pitch or make your own 1:1 scale pitch, the choice is yours.
Play one off games using the teams provided or ones you have designed yourself. Next use the campaign system to see if your team can cut it in a League or Cup competition. The rules let you play every aspect of the modern game, dodgy referee decisions, offside nightmares, goal mouth scrambles, professional fouls, hard men tackles even the crowd support plays a part!

The Beautiful Game comes with a full color 11" x 17" Pitch.
Thirty five 5/8" counters - two full teams plus substitutes
Rules for playing a Cup and League Campaign.
Two sets of player sheets gathering the tables you'll use for the match in one spot.
Two pre-generated teams and rules for building your own.


The game play represents the action one would see in a ‘Highlights’ programme like the definitive BBC ‘Match of the Day’. It plays fast and smooth once the game is learnt so you can concentrate on the action, not on the rules.

name: Keep It In The Family
description:
"The family game of TV fame."

Keep It In The Family is a game from the 1950s for two teams based on a TV show. In each round a category of questions is read out and each team bids on the number of correct answers they think they can give, until one team outbids the other. The winning bid is then multiplied by 10 and this is the number of points now at stake in the round.

The team that made the higher bid must now attempt to give their answers, against the clock. If they manage to give enough right answers, they win the points. If they give a wrong answer, the opposing team scores the points.

The game ends when one team reaches a total of 250 points.

name: Gearmageddon: The Turbo-Charged Vehicle Combat Game
description:
In Gearmageddon players represent drivers in the arenas of death established by the wealthiest princes of Dubai. Each running cars through a series of moves, shooting attacks, ramming actions, and special maneuvers, the players struggle to be the best of the best.

-- Description from the back cover of the Gearmageddon Core Rules Book

Gearmageddon was designed to be a game, plain and simple. We wanted to make something fast and fun that could be played within a hour to an hour-and-a-half with minimal brainwave expenditure. Gearmageddon is kind of a zero-calorie asphalt death match.

- From the Introduction of the Gearmageddon Core Rules Book

In Gearmageddon, there are three basic actions: move, shoot, and ram. Movement is determined by a player setting the speed of a vehicle and selecting maneuvers. Combat is performed using a target number system. Collision damage is calculated based on speeds and structures of vehicles. Driver Cards provide opportunities for rule-breaking events that can instantly change the tide of battle. Weapon and Upgrade Cards are used for quick reference during games.

In addition to rules for arena combat, Gearmageddon has rules for combat races based on the 2008 movie Death Race.

The Core Rules includes rules for cars, motorcycles and tractor-trailers. Gearmageddon was designed to be used with 1/64 scale vehicle miniatures and 3D components. The game's simple rule of erring on the side of a rules decision that causes maximum damage accelerates gameplay.

In 2011, Exploding Goat Games, LLC started the Worldwide Arena Series, a tournament that ranks Gearmageddon players according to their performance in each game played. Standings are posted weekly on the Exploding Goat Games, LLC Web site.

name: POP the Question
description:
A trivia game with a music theme. Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.

Contents: 104 playing cards
rules

name: The Verbal Game
description:
This is an educational, vocabulary-building card game based on word etymology. From the rules: "The world of words is explored in The Verbal Game where the familiar form of a deck of playing cards is used to construct words that work in everday life, as well as words for special purposes, such as college entrance testing." "...an exercise in the building of words through the combination of prefixes, roots, and suffixes."
The 52 card deck used is composed of one suit of prefix cards, one suit of suffix cards and two suits of roots, 13 cards in each suit. The 'de luxe' edition has two extra, more complex suits of roots for use after players are experienced with the basic roots. Each card has from four to eight word fragments and variations from which to choose when playing. Like a standard deck of cards, this is a game system and rules are given for Verbal Rummy, Verbalgrams, Crossword Solitaire, Verbal Chess, Tug of War, and others.
From the ALPSCO Science Series.

name: Chessgammon
description:
Chessgammon is a fusion of two of the most classic board games ever created, combining Chess-like strategy with Backgammon-like chance! It's a completely new twist on the game of Backgammon, adding a new dimensional element of strategy using Chess pieces with unique special abilities!

Chessgammon is played on a standard Backgammon board using Chess pieces rather than standard Backgammon pieces. As in Chess, Chessgammon pieces have unique special abilities which provide a new dimension of strategy to the traditional game of Backgammon.

With a few noted exceptions, all standard rules of Backgammon apply and must be learned prior to learning Chessgammon rules.

Unrelated to the 2003 game Chessgammon.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Snag
description:
The Game of Sharp Eyes and Fast Hands

Snag is quick and simple filler but unlike most party games it requires some skill.

The active player places a card with multiple symbols on them into a field of cards then rolls the dice. All players try to spot an adjacent pair of symbols on the cards that were rolled and claim them before the other players by touching the pair with their index and middle finger. Cards with the matching symbols are kept for scoring.

name: Das kleine Schokoladenquiz
description: A small trivia game about chocolate; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 nswers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

name: Das kleine Weinquiz
description: A small trivia game about wine; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 nswers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

name: Das kleine Benimmquiz
description: A small trivia game about etiquette; with 100 questions and answers. The game itself is like a notebook (with spiral binding). Each page contains 2 questions and 4 nswers, the back side contains the correct answers with additional information.

name: Executive Manager: A Manpower Game
description:
Executive Manager- A Manpower Game

Executive Manager is a business game designed for 2 to 4 players. In the game the players are put in the position of a manager who must achieve a certain production by the end of a month. To achieve this output the player must maintain a staff of 5 workers. His permanent staff consists of Mr. Noshow, Miss Tardy, Mr. Fumble, Miss Vacation, and Miss Sniffles. When members of this rather unreliable staff are out they may be replaced with Manpower employees.

Game Equipment

Game Board in 3 Interlocking Sections
Employee Tokens (Noshow, Tardy, etc. and Manpower Personnel)
Dice
Play Money
Yellow Fortune Cards
Wooden Tokens
Market Price Cards
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Game of Trianhole
description:
A ball/marble rolling game published in the 1920s by Glevum Games.

It has at least three printings, one with the company name and wooden balls, one with the trademarked company name and logo(still with wooden balls) and a later printing with glass marbles and a different scoring target.

Early version used wooden balls and had 13 scoring holes numbered from 5 to 50 - (1x5, 3x10, 2x15m 2x20, 2x25, 2x30, 1x50) as depicted on the box cover.

The later version used glass marbles and had 20 scoring holes (4 x 5 pattern) numbered 5 to 20 - (4x5, 8x10, 6x15, 2x20)

Play appears to be that each player (any number) rolls 4 balls towards the target and scores the total of the numbers where the balls settle.

Double points are awarded should a ball settle in a hole of the same colour as the ball.

Play stops when somebody reaches 100 points.

name: The Wizard of Oz: The Game
description:
The Wizard of Oz : The Game (Kids version) is an entry-level game with the objective of collecting three token cards while travelling down the path of the Yellow Brick Road and arriving first at the Emerald City. The game is played on a colorful board with beautifully reproduced scenes from the movie. This is a roll-the-die-and-move game with different spaces on the Yellow Brick Road where you collect your tokens and perhaps encounter the Wicked Witch (who causes you to lose your turn) or Winged Monkeys (who you must battle using competitive die rolls - win and you gain a Token card, lose and you miss your next turn). There are also spaces for drawing Toto cards which provide players with special abilities. Landing on an Emerald City space allows you to draw an Emerald City card and a corresponding Token card. Corner spaces are considered "enchanted". The Glinda corner space lets you move ahead 6 spaces. The Ruby Slipper space allows you to double your movement that turn. The final corner space is the Wizard of Oz and allows you take a Token card. For kids 6 years and older.

From the Rules:

Relive the most beloved motion picture of all time as you follow the Yellow Brick Road through the Land of Oz to reach the Emerald City. As Dorothy, Cowardly Lion, Tin Man or Scarecrow, you will defeat the Wicked Witch of the West, battle winged monkeys and collect your corresponding tokens. Help Dorothy keep her Ruby Slippers, Tin Man find a Heart, Scarecrow a Diploma and Cowardly Lion his Medal of Courage. Then, continue on to the Emerald City to meet the Wizard of Oz.

This is a different game from The Wizard of Oz: The Game. Notably, that game is a family game, whereas this is children's game.

name: 20 20 Dice Cricket
description:
From the back of the box:

PLAYING INSTRUCTIONS:

Agree before starting to play either 12 or 20 overs. Toss a coin to see who goes first. Bowling team must use 4 overs of 'Fast Bowling', then 4 overs of ‘Medium Pacers’ and then 4 overs of ‘Spinners’. For a 20 over game, overs 13-18 follow the same order in lots of 2 overs. The final 2 overs are the bowlers choice. Use your favourite players to compete against other favourites!

Even include yourself in the team!

HOW TO PLAY:

Bowler throws 2 dice and the batsman follows the directions on the card. The batting team then throws 2 dice and looks at the appropriate card for the result.

Example: 5th over (medium pace) bowler throws the dice and gets a 4 (inswinger). Batsman looks up Inswinger card and throws the dice. A6 is shown on the dice = 4 runs.

The only time the batter doesn’t throw the dice is on the number 8 Spinners card, which is an automatic 1 run wide.

For this game it is recommended that no extra balls be bowled for extras such as No Balls and Wides.

Commentate the game it is played and add your own comments if you wish

name: Bibi & Tina: Das große Springreiten
description:
In Bibi & Tina: Das große Springreiten players want to be the first to get their horse and its rider to the end of the track.

On your turn, roll the die, then either move forward that many spaces (stopping if you reach a barrier) or make that many attempts to leap over the barrier standing in front of your horse. To make your horse jump, lure it with the magnetic hay so that it hops the barrier. If you have a good "trigger" finger, you'll shoot to the finish line first...
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Racing

name: VeggieTales: The Madame Blueberry Hunt 4 Happiness Card Game
description:
The dealer shuffles the orange stuff-cards and spreads them all face down. Place the blue stuff-cards face down in a deck to the side of Madame Blueberry's pile of orange cards. The youngest player starts.

The first player draws a card from the orange pile and places it face up in front of him/her.
If a Thankful card with a heart is drawn, discard all of your stuff cards and the next player goes.
When an orange stuff card is drawn, put it in front of you. Even if it's a card you don't need.
If a salesman card is drawn with a $ sign, the player must draw 2 blue stuff cards. Place those stuff cards in front of you and discard the salesman card.
If the Madame Blueberry card is drawn, keep on drawing until you get a Thankful card. Put back all the other stuff cards, including the ones you already had.

The first player who gets four thankful cards to make a happy heart wins the game.

name: Gulliver's Travels
description:
A movie-related game but not Disney this time. This game made use of scenes from the cartoon film by Max Fleischer at Paramount studios. Published anonymously by Pepys because they didn't want to risk losing their good-will with Disney.
44 cards, each with an illustration and a word. Players must add a card to the centre of the table in their turn. Only the word on the card added is important. It must make sense and contribute to a proper sentence. When the 7th or more card is added and a sentence is finished, the player playing the last card to the sentence takes the 'trick'.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Word Game

name: Mickey and the Beanstalk
description:
44 cards, based on the Mickey Mouse film called 'Fun and Fancy Free'. The game also included a fold-out beanstalk in the box.
Players aim to lay sequences of cards. The cards have a a letter and number symbol on them (A2, B4, and so on). If you can complete a sequence of four cards, you win the sequence. The cards played are placed on to the Beanstalk card.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Eco Squad
description:
In Eco Squad players are confronted with environmental challenges in homes, cities and factories. By playing cards from their hands, they can implement solutions to these situations.

To start the game, twelve goal cards are taken randomly from the deck of 50, with four goal cards laid face up. Each goal card is labeled home, city or factory and shows two, three or four eco symbols, respectively, the symbols being air, water, energy and natural resources. Each player starts with a hand of five eco cards; most of these cards show one or two eco symbols, along with a description of what this solution represents, e.g., "Recycle used paper" shows one tree (natural resource) while "Front-loading washers" shows one water and one energy.

On a turn, a player either starts a stack of cards on the table in front of him (with at most three stacks in play), adds up to one card to each stack in play, or else discards any number of cards from hand. The player can also play one action card (of which there are five in the deck) and claim one goal card, assuming he has the needed eco symbols in a stack and the environmental solutions match the situation shown on the goal. ("Carpool lanes" are useless in providing clean air at home.)

At the end of a player's turn, he refills his hand to five cards. When a goal card is claimed, another goal card is revealed. Once the final goal card is claimed, the player with the most goals wins; in the event of a tie, the tied player who has the most eco symbols on his goal cards wins.

name: Caperoh
description:
The object of the game is to be the first player to remove all of your disks from the game board, through a combination of luck (in rolling dice) and strategy (deciding where to move your disks).

After each player has placed his six disks on their matching "starting circles" at his side of the board, he must then move them to the opposite side of the board into the "Hexagons & Triangles" area and correctly place them on the matching hexagons.

Players must also guard themselves against encounters with other players' disks, which can disrupt or ruin their progress across the board.

-- from the game rules

name: Peter and the Pirates
description:
This was a game based on the Disney film, Peter Pan. 44 cards, broken down to 8 sets of five plus 4 character cards - Peter Pan, Tinkerbell, Wendy and Captain Hook.
The game play is really a version of the playing card game, Sevens. The winner is the first player to use all his cards.

name: Mickey's Fun Fair
description:
Unusually for Pepys at the time, they released this game in a double sized box so that it could offer two complete packs of 44 cards, one red pack and one blue pack. It was suggested in the rules that you should use one pack for 2 or 3 players, but two packs for 4 or more.
The game seems to have 'borrowed' ideas in the playing card game Bezique. Players try to win tricks, in the normal way, i.e. you must follow suit, if you cannot, then you may trump the trick. There are no trumps at the start of the game but can be introduced later. If a player can lay down a 'marriage', that is, two pairs that go together:
The Prince marries Snow White
Donald Duck marries Donna Duck
Mickey Mouse marries Minnie Mouse
Big Bad Wolf marries The Witch
The suit of such a marriage immediately becomes trumps, at least until another marriage is announced, then that suit becomes trumps.
Points are scored for marriages and winning certain cards in your tricks.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Spellbound
description:
A word game with 160 letter tiles, 4 racks and 4 playing boards. Each player uses a hand of 8 letters, replenishing them at the end of his turn. In your turn, you hope to make a word from your collection of letters, the longer the better. However, some thought is needed because once a word is played, it can be added to, to make a longer word. Thus you would score some points for the first word, and yet more for the longer second word. So it pays to be thinking this through. The score increases as words get longer (1 for a two letter word, 2 for three, 4 for four, 6 for five, 10 for six, and so on.
They obviously had AP in the 50's because the rules say "To save time, players should be considering their next play while their opponents are playing".
A more advanced game "For experts" allows you to intrduce a little more interaction.

name: Mini-Motocross Game
description:
"A relatively abstract game but still intensely exciting form of Motocross." - from the rules.
Players roll dice to create their rider by comparing each roll to the Preparation Chart. 5 rolls are needed per rider, giving him Basic Speed, Skill Rating, Block Ability, Control Rating and Stamina Factor. These five abilities are tested at different times during the race. It is a race game but has no board, laps are recorded on paper. The winner is the first rider to complete a set number of laps.
First published in Games Unlimited's Random fanzine.

name: Radar 2000
description:
This title covers two different games:
- a classical battleship-like game, which, by using tracking system by means of polar co-ordinates, is more modern than former types;
- a "battle of missiles", new game in which success depends mainly on deduction and method.

Both games require different printed forms, but are provided with the same support for two Radar screens: the first one is used to "emit" missiles and to track firing against the enemy, the second one to place ships or missiles and to "receive" enemy firing.

name: Charge It!
description:
The Crazy Credit Card Game!
Charge It! plays like real life. Big spenders bargain hunters and cash savers all have fun shopping and spending rolling the dice and moving around the board. Vacations, TVs and concert tickets are just a few of the possibilities to charge when players qualify for the Quik Charge, American Success, Recover and Bold Credit Cards.

Decide how to divide the payday cash between expenses, credit card debts or savings. Shoppers beware - it is easy to get caught in the alluring trap of unlimited purchasing power. Debts can pile up and the bank may revoke credit cards if payments are not made on time.

The object of Charge is to acquire the right combination of "paid up" credit cards, purchased items and cash. There may be some players who believe it is un-wise to have many credit cards. Some may fail to get good credit. These players may choose to win with one credit card, one purchased Item and $4,000 cash. Can you guess how the other players will try to win? Have fun!

name: Springrings
description:
From the box:
All You have to do is to put a ring on that funny little tin ring fixed to the ring and the press down the spring with Your finger and let it go suddenly. Up goes the ring and it falls on that pretty board with different colored divisions. If the ring falls into one of the 6 divisions it scores the number marked thereon. If You are lucky Your ring falls over the peg and then, You score the number of points marked in the centre. It is real fun to see who can score the highest number in a certain number of rounds.

name: Little Noddy Car Game
description:
A simple race game from the early 50's. Players are trying to get to the Station first. Throw a die and move. You must obey the instructions on the square that you land on. For example, A Flat Tyre on space 44, which makes you go back to 33. Or a Green Traffic Light on space 16, which means you can quickly proceed to 21.
Traditional rules such as 'Have another turn if you throw a 6' and 'You need the exact throw to finish'.
A nice touch is the provision of a box to keep your pieces in. The pieces are 4 cars and a die.

name: Ja, See? Express
description:
Ja, See? Express is a free Print & Play game that is inspired by older, more traditional dice-rolling games, but distills the rules down into only the most critical and exciting elements. This allows for a quicker and easier game, while still retaining all of the edge-of-the-seat dice-rolling thrills that players love.

In turn, players roll five dice and may choose to keep their results, or re-roll any number of dice up to two additional times, while trying to make the highest point-scoring combination of die results. At the end of their turn, players record their score on the custom score pad, and play proceeds to the next player. Play continues in this manner until all players have filled their score sheet, or until one player has scored 50 points. The first player to 50 points is the winner.

This version of the ruleset also includes bonus rules for Ja, See? Express Express, the fastest and most exciting way to play Ja, See? Express yet devised.

A PDF file containing the rules and components is now available in the Files section.

name: A Giant Game Sheet of Star Wars
description: An 87cm x 61cm board,featuring various routes across the galaxy, from The Rebel Alliance start area and ending at theImperial Starship Battle Station Death Star. Players roll dice to advance along one of the routes, taking detours where indicated. The first player to reach the Death Star wins the game. The publisher claims this is an official adaption of the Twentieth Century Fox Film.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction

name: Western
description:
"The waltz of the dough ! The quest for loot!"

Western is a card game between Wanted and Cash n' Guns.

The goal is to be the first player to earn an amount of dough depending of the number of players (400.000 to 500.000 dough).

Each player begin the game with an amount of dough and some cards in hand.
There is also a bank with some money (or a money train).
Players use cards and a round die to attack each other, trying to stole some money (or lose some if the fail !), they can also use "dirty tricks" or other protection cards and sometimes fight for the money train.
The game ends when a player has 400.000 dough.

There is 108 cards in more than 20 kinds.

Rules in french can be found on the editor website (english and other languages are coming).
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Advance Junior
description: Board game in which each player has three tanks which attempt to get to the opponent's home base. Movement is by dice, but in order to be permitted to move or to make an attack, a nifty resolution mechanism is used. 2 batteries power a bulb and this is reflected by turning knobs controlled by the players. Essentially the two players each secretly pick one of red, green or yellow (colours which are also marked on the tanks), and then a fire button is pressed to illuminate the lights. Whether the action succeeds or not depends on whether the lights match or not.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Children's Game, Electronic

name: Alibi
description: Highly collectable detective game from this famous British author of detective and horror stories. The rule book outlines a detailed scenario in which a murder has taken place and one of six infamous criminals must be to blame. The players are detectives and move around a map of Britain and in various towns get to look at one of the cards which may help provide an alibi for one of the suspects, advance the investigation further or merely cause a delay. When enough information has been gathered a player can race back to the town the murderer is in and arrest him to win. Nice system which ensures it plays differently each time. Includes metal detective figures.

name: Garden Flowers
description: 44 cards, in four 'suits', 11 in each.The object is to avoid winning tricks with 'Weeds' in. The black suit are the Weeds and you must keep them out of your 'Garden. The game has normal trick-taking rules (follow suit, lead if you win the previous trick, that sort of thing). The cards are beautifully illustrated.

name: Pinkalicious Cup Cake Party Game
description:
Players work together to collect cupcakes and fill the tray by performing activities from 4 different categories. Charades. Dancing. Drawing.
Players rolling the dice to find out if they have to do a dance, act something out, make up a song or rhyme, or draw a card. You’re rewarded for your efforts with a cupcake, but watch out if you draw Peter, he takes one of your cupcakes away.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Role Playing, Singing

name: Second Down
description: Second Down is an American football game produced in the UK and targeted for younger players. However, it features a nifty method of play-calling.
