camino del bosque hacia la casa de la abuelita y recogen el mayor número de flores mientras evitan que el lobo los atrape.

El objetivo de Caperucita es recoger el mayor número de flores al tiempo que evitas que te atrape el lobo. Debes jugar tus cartas con habilidad para obtener puntos por cada pareja de flores formada y procurar que el lobo atrape a los otros jugadores. El juego termina cuando se acaba el mazo de flores o cuando el lobo ha atrapado a todos los jugadores menos
a uno.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Novel-based, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Aegean Fleet
description:
"Aegean Fleet is a contemporary game of naval warfare taking place in Aegean Sea.
Time Scale :
- 8 hours per turn
- 80 km per hex.

The players maneuver war ships, submarines, aircrafts, amphibious war ships and cargos on a map covering.

The game reuse rules from Victory Games Fleet series, but includes new weapons as missiles, grond launched ballistic missiles, SAM, cruise missiles
There are also new rules regarding submarines, Aegis ships, anti-missile defence systems, long range air-to-air missile,

The game can be linked with Arab-Israel Fleet and Black Sea Expansion

name: Asean Fleet
description:
"Asean Fleet is a contemporary game of naval warfare taking place in South-East Asiatic.
Time Scale :
- 8 hours per turn
- 80 km per hex.

The players maneuver war ships, submarines, aircrafts, amphibious war ships and cargos on a map covering.

The game reuse rules from VictoryGames Fleet series, but includes new weapons as missiles, ground launched ballistic missiles, SAM, cruise missiles
There are also new rules regarding submarines, Aegis ships, anti-missile defence systems, long range air-to-air missile,

The game can be linked with Asean Fleet.

More Information:

The game includes 6 scénarios, from very simple to more complex ones :
1 / Island Strike
2/ War Between Socialist Republic Countries
3/ Reinforcement
4/ Counterattack in Paracel Islands
5/ Tommorow the Spratly Islands
6/ Carriers at War
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Word Frolic! Village Idiom I
description:
Word Frolic! Village Idiom I is an educational card game for ages 12 and up. It teaches players 52 different English-language idioms, and provides a well-researched definition and origin for each one.

Players take turns drawing cards and reading them aloud to the other players; the goal of each round is to fill in the blank with the proper English-language idiom. The correct answer will create a terrible pun, and earn the player 2 points. There are bonus questions worth 1 point apiece, and optional conversation starters related to the card's content. The first player to 10 points wins the game.
categories: Educational, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Kinder-Quiz für schlaue Kids 4+
description:
The game contains 3300 questions and answer choices from the varied experience and experience range from pre-school children.
In his turn player rolls the die and draws a card where the question is read according to die roll. There are four possible answers for each question. Player gets the card if the answer is correct.

At the end of the game the player with the most cards is the winner.

name: Unser Sandmännchen: Komm mit ins Traumland
description:
In this game about sandman, players visit foreign countries with him: India, Hawaii or Mexico etc.
All tiles are shuffled and placed face down on the table. In his turn player turns up a tile. If the background is dark, he can either take all face-up tiles from the table and ends his turn or he can turns up another tile, but when the sandman appears on the tile the next player starts his turn. The upturned tiles stay in place for next players. When all sandmen are turned up, the player with the most travel tiles wins.

name: Welt der Wunder
description: Players are collecting interesting themes for the next show in the series, there are 6 categories - Space, Dinosaurs, Technology, Underwater, Nature and Man. On the board theme- and action cards are randomly distributed. In his turn a player must answer a question from one of the 6 categories. If his answer is correct, he may move up to three spaces, if his answer is wrong, he moves one space. If his move ends on a space with a card, the player may turn the card over - if he can use it for one of his themes, he can take it. If it is an action card, he can use it immediately or later in the game. The player who gathers his 4 themes for the show first, wins the game..
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Shake Numbers
description:
Game consists of 10 numbered dice and two spotted dice.

In a turn, the ten numbered dice are thrown and then the two spotted dice. From the ten dice you may take any number of them that total the number rolled with the spotted dice.
i.e. you roll 9 with the spotted dice: you can now take away any combination of the numbered dice that add up to 9.
If successful, you throw again, and so on.

When you cannot take way the number rolled, the total of the remaing dice are added together and that is your score.

The player with the lowest score after an agreed number of rounds, wins.

name: Basket Bounce
description:
Action game where the object is to score 'hoops'.

The board is enclosed and has a 'shooter' at the bottom right and a basketball hoop just above middle centre. The shooter is spring-loaded so that, when you pull it back and let go, it will launch a ball at the top of the board with the aim of getting it to drop into the basket. Most hoops, wins.

The game is a derivative of Bagatelle but is also quite different as it only has one scoring target (the basket).

name: Bonn-Quiz
description: Simple trivia game with questions related to the German city of Bonn. The game consists of cards with one question and answer each. Players take turns asking the other player(s) questions. A player who can answer a question gets the card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Throwdown!: The Robot Cowboy Samurai Edition
description:
THROWDOWN! is a turn based card game that uses the Draw-Attack-Discard system or D.A.D.s. During the game you will have a character, a deck, and a discard pile. First you need at least 2 or more people to play and each person will need to have their own character card (a Robot, a Cowboy, or a Samurai), and deck, (the deck contains only 50 cards and is full of attacks, equipment, and modifiers). The objective of the game is to attack your opponents deck. You do this with your character card and cards you draw from your deck. You win when their deck is completely depleted. No matter how many people play you will always attack the person to your left, so until you get down to two players you cannot attack the person that attacked you.

Setting up to play is easy just place your character card next to your deck and your discard pile will go on the other side of your character. Flip a coin to see who goes first, then follow 3 easy steps. STEP 1 DRAW - On your turn DRAW a card from your deck and place it in front of your character card. STEP 2 ATTACK - Your character must ATTACK on your turn and will automatically defend your deck on your opponents turn. Total and resolve conflict damage. Follow any additional rules on the card. STEP 3 DISCARD - Now discard the card in play and put it into your discard pile, it is now your opponents turn and they follow the 3 easy steps.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Comic Book / Strip, Fighting, Math, Party Game

name: Der Kampf um Ragnarök
description:
The players race against Eric, leader of the "Wölfe von Ragnarök", to be first at the gate af Ragnarök.
On their turn a player chooses how many dice rolls he wants to perform. Than he rolls the die that many times and moves his pawn forward. If he rolls the X the players turn is over and Eric moves the number of spaces the player chose to roll his die.
The player who reaches the gate first befor Eric does wins the game. If Eric reaches the gate first, all players lose.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Austin-opoly
description: This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature locations and landmarks from Austin.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: U.S.C.opoly
description:
This is a Monopoly clone from Late from the Sky, a publisher that specializes in themed Monopoly games. All the deeds, spaces on the board and cards feature campus landmarks and traditions from USC.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Round of Golf
description: A golf boardgame containing 9 courses. The courses are stylistic rather than realistic in their portrayal, containing colored fields and numbered circles. The players use two ordinary six sided dice and move their markers to circles with numbers that are the same as the sum of their throw. The distribution of the numbered circles is made so that bad shots are less likely to occur (ie. bunker, ruff etc.) than shots to fairway. Putting is made using a special dice. Every hole has a small rule set that makes unusual events possible, such as hole in one etc.

name: Forest Animal-Opoly
description:
Forest Animal-opoly is a version of Monopoly published by Late for the Sky, a company that specializes in Monopoly clones. All the spaces, deeds, and cards have facts about wild animals on them.

Players roll dice to determine how far they move. Landing on a space gives the player the option of buying the property. When a player collects all the properties in one color group, the properties can be improved by building. When players land on a space owned by another player they must pay rent. Rent is determined by the location of the property and the number of improvements on the space. Some spaces instruct a player to draw a card which can be beneficial or harmful to the player. Players must avoid going bankrupt to stay in the game. The winner is the last player left in the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Soccer Replay: Uruguay 1930
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1930 world cup in Uruguay and cards for all 13 participating teams.

name: Soccer Replay: 1934 Italy
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1934 world cup in Italy and cards for all 16 participating teams. For use in World Cup games only, a new Revised Referee's Card is included.

name: Soccer Replay: 1938 France
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1938 world cup in France and cards for all 15 participating teams.

For use in World Cup games only, a new Revised Referee's Card is included as well as a new Revised Build Up Table for the Long Game Variant.

name: Soccer Replay: 1950 Brazil
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1950 world cup in Brazil and cards for all 16 participating teams.

For use in World Cup games only, a new Revised Referee's Card is included as well as a new Revised Build Up Table for the Long Game Variant.

name: Soccer Replay: 1954 Switzerland
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1954 world cup in Switzerland and cards for all 16 participating teams.

For use in World Cup games only, a new Revised Referee's Card is included as well as a new Revised Build Up Table for the Long Game Variant.

name: Soccer Replay: 1958 Sweden
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1958 world cup in Sweden and cards for all 16 participating teams.

For use in World Cup games only, a new Revised Referee's Card is included as well as a new Revised Build Up Table for the Long Game Variant.

name: Soccer Replay: 1962 Chile
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1962 world cup in Chile and cards for all 16 participating teams.

For use in World Cup games only, a new Revised Referee's Card is included as well as a new Revised Build Up Table for the Long Game Variant.

name: Soccer Replay: 1966 England
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1966 world cup in England and cards for all 16 participating teams.

name: Soccer Replay: 1970 Mexico
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1970 world cup in Mexico and cards for all 16 participating teams.

name: Soccer Replay: 1974 West Germany
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1974 world cup in West Germany and cards for all 16 participating teams.

For use in World Cup games only, a new Revised Referee's Card is included as well as a new Revised Build Up Table for the Long Game Variant.

name: Soccer Replay: 1982 Spain
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1982 world cup in Spain and cards for all 24 participating teams.

name: Soccer Replay: 1986 Mexico
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1986 world cup in Mexico and cards for all 24 participating teams.

name: Soccer Replay: 1990 Italy
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1990 world cup in Italy and cards for all 24 participating teams.

The game also provides new optional Free-Kick and Penalty tables for use in the 1990 world cup only.

name: Soccer Replay: 1994 U.S.A.
description:
An expansion set for Soccer Replay.

The game consists of a tournament roster for the 1994 world cup in the U.S.A. and cards for all 24 participating teams.

name: Münchhausen
description:
Childrens card game. 22 cards feature Baron Münchhausen going hunting. The cards also have a little text at the bottom.

Deal all the cards out. The player with card number 1, lays it on the table, and then reads out the text (or Mum or Dad does). After that, the player with card number 2 places it next to card 1 and reads out the text. This is repeated with card no. 3, then 4. etc., and the first player to use all their cards, wins.

I must say this is a game in the poorest taste. It is a young children's game because there is no skill whatsoever. When all 22 cards have been read out, that would be the same as telling a short story. But, for a children's game, why pick on the subject of animal killing? Look at the card examples. They are virtually all as bizarre as you could imagine. My children would not be able to touch it with a barge-pole.

name: Durch das bunte Märchenland
description:
Simple children's card game, based on characters from Grimms' fairytales.

The cards are dealt out evenly. The first player asks any other playerr for a card that is the pair of one of his cards. If a pair is found, the enquirer is encouraged to read the rhyming text on both cards. This will make the game more interesting, especially for the younger players. He or she then places the pair in front of them. Play proceeds clockwise. When all the cards are used up, the player with the most pairs, wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Fantasy, Novel-based

name: Hallo Paket!
description:
How many presents will Steffi and Max get? It is the birthday of the twins Steffi and Max, and we're all invited. Naurally we want to wish them the best and bring lots of presents. The first packet is on the truck, and another ... and it's going! Now we have to run after the truck and load more packages on it; the more, the better! Can we get them all on the truck?

Hallo Paket! is a cooperation game. The goal is to load 12 gift packages on a truck, before it arrives at the birthday party. All children win if they can do it, otherwise all lose.

---

Wieviele Geschenke bekommen Steffi und Max? Die Zwillinge Steffi und Max haben Geburtstag. Und wir sind alle eingeladen! Natürlich wollen wir den beiden eine große Freude machen und so viele Pakete mitbringen, wie wir nur können. Geschafft! Das erste Paket liegt auf dem Lastwagen und noch eines und ... Da fährt er auch schon weiter. Jetzt aber schnell hinterher und weitere Pakete aufladen; je mehr, desto besser! Ob es gelingt, alle Pakete aufzuladen?

Aufmachung: Der Kurs besteht aus 20 Feldern und führt zu einem Haus. Der Lastwagen ist recht gut gelungen und wurde aus Holz gefertigt. Auf seiner Ladefläche können die Pakete gut untergebracht werden. Die Pakete sind kleine Holzquader in verschiedenen Farben, die auf einer Seite mit einer Schleife bedruckt sind. Sie werden im mitgelieferten Stoffsack aufbewahrt. Der Spezialwürfel hat Werte zwischen 1 und 5, sowie ein LKW-Symbol. Das gesamte Spiel ist in einer ittelgroßen Verpackung produziert worden.
Ziel: Bei diesem Kooperationsspiel müssen alle Pakete auf den Wagen aufgeladen werden, bevor dieser schließlich das Haus erreicht.
Am Anfang werden die Pakete auf das Startfeld gestellt. Der Lastwagen startet von einem etwas entfernten Straßenfeld. Jeder Spieler hat eine oder zwei eigene Paketfarben (je nach Anzahl der Spieler).
Der Startspieler beginnt und würfelt. Entsprechend der Augenzahl darf er ein Paket voranbewegen. Auf einem Feld dürfen beliebig viele Pakete stehen, man darf jedoch nicht über den Lastwagen hinaus ziehen. Kann man kein eigenes Paket bewegen, muß man das eines Mitspielers nehmen.
Landet das Paket genau auf dem Feld des Lastwagens, wird es aufgeladen.
Würfelt man ein Lastwagen-Symbol, wird das Fahrzeug um ein Feld in Richtung Haus bewegt.
Wenn bereits zwei eigene Pakete auf dem LKW sind, darf man in seinem Zug auch Mitspielern helfen und deren Pakete ziehen, wenn dies vorteilhafter ist. Auch wenn der Spieler alle eigenen Pakete im LKW hat, spielt er weiterhin mit und hilft den Mitspielern.
Spielende: Die Partie ist vorbei, wenn der LKW das Zielfeld erreicht. Hat er nun mindestens acht Pakete geladen, gewinnen die Spieler gemeinsam.

name: Funky Party Games: Knete-Fete
description: The game consists of a piece of clay, a timer and 50 cards with two words (one easier, one more difficult) printed on each of them. It's played in two teams who take turns in sculpting and guessing as many words as possible until the timer runs out. The team that first reaches 25 points wins.

name: Ein Tag auf dem Reiterhof
description:
The game board represents a stable. It is three-dimensional, with stable doors opening individually. At the front of the stable there is a circuit around which the players race their horses.
There are two versions, one for older and one for younger children. In the former, players have to answer questions to get food for the horses or move obstacles. Movement is determined by a die roll; obstacles within the range of the roll can be overcome by answering another question.
In the latter, only number cards are used. Every player secretly chooses a number card. The active player moves the number of fields shown on the number card; the other players can move one field if they chose the same card as the active player.
The first player to cross the finish line is the winner.

name: Balanza
description:
SImilar to Blockhead! and Super Blockhead! but have 25 odd-shaped wooden blocks.

In his turn player places one of he blocks on the tower and try to make the situation as hard as possible for the next player. Who place the last block to the tower before it falls wins the game.

name: Mega Mindy Bandieten Bowling
description:
Twenty Bandits escaped but Mega Mindy is ready. Try to bowl the bandits off the board with the die. Each bandit you aim off the board is worth one point.

This is a dice flicking game where you take the roll of Mega Mindy fighting bad guys. At the end of the board, 20 bandit-shaped pawns are placed, and one player starts by flicking the die to the bandits. Knocking them over is not enough. You have to flick them off the board to score a point.

Sequence of play is dictated by the color on the die. Each player has a color. There is also a neutral side, so play goes to the next player, or the current player can choose who may go next. If the die drops off the table, the next player goes.

Once all the bandits are knocked off the board, the player with the most points wins.

name: Fire from the Sky
description:
This is a board game for two players, played using 9 tokens for each player and a pair of dice. This game actually simulates is a war using projectiles between two fictional factions. The two factions hurl projectiles at each other, like in the game battleships. This game is different from battleships in two aspects - the players can see each others' boards and it is a dice roll which determines where the projectile hits.
Each player has a board of 25 squares (5 rows x 5 columns) where he deploys his nine soldiers in any fashion. Players take turns rolling the two dice. First die is used to select a row and second one to select a column. Each dice roll is a hurl of the projectile at the opponent field. The outcome of the 'hurl' is determined as below.

If the outcome on both dice are less than or equal to 5, then soldier at the square determined by the row and column found from the dice roll (if not empty) is removed. If only row dice is equal to six, then the player can choose a row. If only column dice is equal to six, then the player can choose a column. If both dice give six, then the player cannot move this turn.

Play continues till one of the players run out of all his soldiers. Then the other player is the winner. A variant can be played on a single board with all the soldiers of both players in it. Rules can be modified to accommodate 'friendly fire' (player hitting his own soldiers) or 'field battle'(if player hit his own soldier, he can move the soldier one square to capture an opponent soldier)

name: BrainBox: Vile Villains
description:
This is the first of our Horrible Histories BrainBoxes. Find out how truely vile these villains were.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner. This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game.

name: Brainbox: On The Go Cornwall
description:
Do you know what Stargazy Pie is? Or what is the largest greenhouse in the world? BrainBox Cornwall On The Go contains 55 beautifully-illustrated cards showing the very best Cornwall has to offer, and then some!

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner. This simple concept can be played by all ages and in large groups as well as a 1 person game.

Made from a minimum of 70% recycled material, the BrainBox range is fabulous fun. Find out who the BrainBox is in your family – it may not be who you think it is!

name: Rettet die Fische!
description: Rettet die Fische is a non-competitive dice-rolling game for very young children. The board shows a pond consisting of six water tiles. On these, eighteen fish tiles of various colors are laid out. Players then take turns rolling the die. If a fish symbol is rolled, a fish of that color is removed ("saved"). If a fire symbol turns up, however, there is a fire in the village and the firefighters need water from the pond - one water tile is removed. The players win if they can rescue all the fish, they lose if the pond goes dry.

name: Probsub: A Game of Nuclear Submarine Combat
description: Probsub is a set of rules which simulates modern combat betwen nuclear submarines, and also includes anti-submarine aircraft and helicopters. All aspects of anti-submarine warfare are covered except the use of surface vessels.
categories: Book, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Nautical, Wargame

name: Hockey World 1936
description:
Statistical hockey game replaying the 1936 Olympic ice hockey competition. Fond memories for me as it is the replay of the most unexpected result in Olympic Ice Hockey. Britain, yes - Britain, won the gold medal. Unbridled joy in the whole country.

It is a dice based statistical simulation. All the teams that took part are rated in areas of ability based on their performances that year. You could replay the whole competition in one evening.

Self-published by the designer.

name: Qwikstat Boxing
description:
Statistical boxing replay game. Dice decide results of fights by comparing the dice throw to charts based on the real boxer's ability. Designed so that a lot of fights can be recreated in one evening.

Includes Charts and the designer's Boxer Rating System. Over 1600 champions and contenders rated, from the 1800's to the 1990's.

name: Crustacean Multiplication Dominoes
description:
A math domino game for 1-4 players.

At the beginning of a 2-4 player game, each player is dealt six hexagonal crab dominoes. Each crab holds a number between its claws, which must be matched to the equation of another crab. Each crab has a single equation on one of its three hind edges, in which one of the factors is replaced with an empty box, that must be filled with an answer number from another crab. For example, a crab holding the number, 4, could be attached to a crab with the equation, 8x[]=32, on its back.

Once the players have placed their six starting dominoes face up in front of them, the top domino of the draw pile is then placed in the center of the play area, and play begins.

On a player's turn, they first draw a new domino, placing it with the others face up in front of them, and then try to add as many of their dominoes as they can to the line of crabs. Players may also move crabs from the front of the line to the back of the line, and vice-versa, but only if they can immediately add a domino from their hand, to one of the two new positions. If a player can no longer add more dominoes to the line, their turn is over. If a player plays their last domino, they win the game.

Players may use the answer wheel to check their math at any time.

The game also comes with two solitaire variants.

name: Action Gettysburg
description:
In the typical style of this publisher's Action XX games, this is not a simulation but more an abstract game. You must move your soldiers to win control of squares on the back row of the board. Meanwhile, he is doing the same to get at your back row squares. First to do so, wins. Movement is by dice so it is not an abstract game although it feels like one.

Lots of nice plastic American Civil War soldiers.

name: Cricket World Cup
description: Statistical cricket game. Teams are broadly rated, with dice rolls and charts deciding the outcome of matches. The designer thinks that each game will take around 10 minutes after you have learned the mechanisms of play. Thus, an entire tournament can easily be played in one evening.

name: Build'em Up Barrels
description:
Another balancing game that followed in the Tsunami named Jenga.

In this game, players get to stack plastic barrels and planks on a slowly rotating base against the clock.

The pile will tumble when the base stops rotating and you score for how much you had constructed before the collapse.

The one player game is basically "See if you can beat your best score" type of thing. Much better as a competitive game.

Battery operated.

name: Professional: Turn professional and make a million
description:
Professional is a dice rolling game where players go around the board "training" themselves in any of the four sports in the game: golf, snooker, tennis and track. It has a board resembling a Monopoly board with spaces with sports competitions, training, and both specified and random events. The game features five decks of cards: One for each sport and one for random events, much like the Chance cards in Monopoly. Also included is a variety of paper currency.

The goal of the game is to train oneself and compete in the various sports to gain a million dollars. The first player to obtain that amount wins. The tournaments are divided into minor and major competitions with varying prize amounts for the first two places, as well as a "walkover" prize which will be handed out if only one player were to enter the competition. Training cards can be obtained in the training spaces. These cards are not only necessary to gain access to competitions, but can also boost the "skills" of the player when dice are rolled. Throwing dice is done to move on the board as well as determine competition winners, with the highest rolls winning unless card modifiers are in play. Other spaces include sponsorship funding, income taxes, injuries, travel fees, sporting luck (chance cards) and the start square, which trains a player in all sports.

While the game cover says that it supports 2-6 players, the rules inside the box mention 3-6 players. While it can be player with only two players, the game works much better with more players. Even 3 is quite few and in order to really play well, at least 4 players should be present as the competition dynamics really require that many players.

It was made and printed in South Africa.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Chit Chat Girls' Night Out
description:
Chit Chat Girls' Night Out is a 'Girls only' game, revolving around 252 questions, "written by women for women", such as:


What would you like to change about your partner?
When cooking, do you follow the recipe, or do you improvise?
Which friend from the past would you like to see again?
Do you prefer large passion, or quiet love?


The questions are divided into different categories. Each round, one player (the gamemaster) rolls a die which determines the category. She draws a card from that category, which lists three questions, from which she aks one. Now, the other players have to answer the question. After all players have answer, the gamemaster gives one 'gemstone' from the stock to the player whose answer she liked best, for whatever reason.

The game ends when all gemstones have been handed out; the player who has collected the most gemstones wins the game.

name: Wer hat den Schatz?
description:
The 25 tiles are laid out face-down. In a turn, a player rolls both the dice. Now he must choose one of the tiles which contains both colours that were rolled. Each card is a combination of two colours, the background color and the object colour.

If a player is correct, he takes the card. If not, he must replace it face down in the same position it was when he chose it.

When all the cards are taken, the player with the most tiles wins.

A variant for older children is included. In this game, the various tiles have a points value and the winner is the player with the most points, not neccessarily the player who has the most tiles.

name: Extratour- vier ins Eck, das ist der Gag
description:
Objective: collect most winning points after a series of 3 games
- acting/moving by turn -
Both players place 7 coloured pieces alternately on a board - which shows 5 squares (16 triangles) - and move them;
player who forms a square scores 3 points (new game), 3 in a row 1 point (and may remove 1 opponent's piece from the board) until one player possesses 2 pieces only.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Ghosts in the Grid
description:
Ghosts in the Grid is a 2 to 4 player card game, with the flexibility to combine two or more games to increase complexity and/or numbers of players. Create the “Grid” by arranging 35 random square tiles to create the playing field, play cards to advance your “Ghost” or thwart opposing players by hacking them with “Virus” cards.

Your goal is to retrieve the Data from the Central Node at all costs! Escape with it before opposing players hack your Ghost and the System assimilates you. Each player begins on opposite corners of the assembled Grid. You play Ghost cards on yourself to move towards the center and attempt to retrieve the Data, or put a stop to other players getting to the object by playing Virus cards on them. If you have too many Virus cards on your Command Row mat at once, you will be Assimilated and will have to start over again!

Do you think you have what it takes? Prepare yourself with Ghosts in the Grid!

Game Data:

Complexity: 3 on a 9 scale
Solitaire Suitability: 4 on a 9 scale
Scale: Each player represents a Ghost attempting to retrieve the Data (center tile).

name: Pocket Quiz: Gedächtnistraining
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

Every kind of concentration tasks to make better than opponents and win the cards.
Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Wiesbadener Rundreisespiel
description:
Foreword:
The present, in his new game has the purpose of art, the beautiful spa town of Weisbaden world to your friends and admirers, many or even those who do not yet know, in a curious way to show off fancy.

Where this game can take up to 7 people. Marked with an international name-cards are placed face down and travel company of each of the players pulled a. one who is traveling cashier, who draws the card rothschild. The participants play the cards soon hang on a ribbon around the neck and Rothschild founded the common fund travel by collecting stamps per head 5 as insert. In exchange, his Everyman figure (see figure on the cover), it is henceforth to occupy the fields. Rotshchild rolls themselves do not cooperate, he has exercised his duties as a cashier for now. Should it be during the game just as gangs fund, he has the right to demand tax payments.
 
The travel company gathered at the Hotel Victoria, from where begins the tour of Wiesbaden. The whole route is divided into fields and puts each trim figure so many more fields than the owner throws the same eyes. The order in which the dice is going on is determined by the number of visit cards, ie who has the lowest number rolls first.

who is now the first hotel in Victoria, the starting point of the round trip again arrived, receives marks 5 marks the Second 3. The remaining cash asset-but Rothschild reaps for his professional services rendered as a travel clerk
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Pocket Quiz: Querdenken
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with lateral thinking puzzles. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

name: Pocket Quiz: Logisches Denken
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with logical exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions.

Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

name: Nebraska's Trivia
description:
Nebraska's Best Trivia was developed to bring hours of fun while teaching interesting facts about the great State of Nebraska. Nebraska's Best Trivia is designed for any number of players; individual play or 2 to 4 teams of 2 to 4 players on each team.

The object of the game is to complete a score card by answering trivia questions from five different categories and be the first to cross the finish line with a completed score card. But watch out! You must avoid setbacks and potential disasters brought on by your opponents as they try to complete their score cards and cross the finish line before you.

name: Donald Duck's Dolle Daden
description:
Translated from Dutch:
"You know Scrooge McDuck loves his money. On the board you can see him running in anger around the tree. He is mad because the Beagle boys turned on the windmill and now his money is blown away. He tries to catch the money. He now gives a reward to the player who stops the windmill. Donald, Huey, Dewey and Louie would like to profit this chance. Therefor they travel to the windmill. Winner is the player who reaches the windmill first."

The game is a roll and move game with some extra's. At the start of the game players receive two planks. While travelling to the windmill players must cross the water and use these planks. When they roll a 3 or a 6 they can pick up a plank from the board.

name: Fly Trap!
description: An action game for children aged 4 an up. Players must flick plastic flies into a large plastic frog (with an gaping mouth) while the frog rotates under battery power. While a fly is in flight the other players can attempt to close the frog's mouth by activating their pump.

name: Auf den Spuren König Ludwigs II
description: Advertising game to Bavaria and the Bavarian Radio broadcasts. In his turn players rolls, moves and follows the instructions of the achieved event fields like answering trivia questions. Who first reaches the goal box first is the winner, but needs to say "Long live the king", or else he must return behind the last player.

name: Kuddelmuddel
description:
Kuddelmuddel - wie bei Hempels unterm Sofa
(german pun, means roughly translated chaos in the living room)

From the box back: Chaos is nice, chaos is fun. At least family Hempel thinks that. But who looks for something in the mess sweats...The colour die and the sample card show, which kind of thing has to be found in this mess. The players look up their cards quickly to find what is missing and who finds the most gets many things from the living room to his/her victory.

Contents: rulebook, 12 sample cards, 4 * 12 picture cards, colour die.

Gameplay: The cards are sorted into piles. 1 pile = sample cards. Then 4 piles which different card backs picture cards. Each child picks one picture card pile, means they have 12 cards now. Each sample card shows 6 pictures with a different coloured frame (example: boat, book, cup, telephone, plane, whale). The die is rolled. The colour rolled is the picture or the thing that the people are looking for. The first child playing his/her card with matching picture wins.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Defenders
description:
Defender is basic unit used by Moloch for convoy and guard purposes. They have great firepower and armor and, whats important, they are cheap. The price for this is almost complete lack of hand to hand combat abilities.

This set contains 2 miniatures, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Mechanic
description:
This robot is absolute necessity on the battlefield. He is a medic, but in machine world that means much more than in our world. Not only can he fix "injuries", but also reanimate and bring back to battle unit that has been destroyed.

This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Hunter
description:
Hunter. The meat grinder. His algorithms are simple: get close to the enemy and chop him down.
This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Moloch – Kasparov
description:
Kasparov Combat Brain. Fearfull machine, build from principle that two is better than one. He acts like a Brain - without him machines are just pile of junk with some basic, ineffective algorithms. They need him to think for them, analyze, create strategies. But in contrast from regular Brain unit he himself is a deadly machine, well armed and armored.
This set contains 1 miniature, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Psight
description:
Psight refers to a collective of psychics founded by the gifted Clairvoyant known as The Seer. With the aid of a powerful Telepath (Psi-Guardian) she sought out others of various talents to swell their ranks. She organized them in preparation for a war she foresaw hundreds of years into the future. The Psight competed with each other to gain strength and to teach the future generations to use their abilities. This competition became known as Psight, after the order itself.

In Psight, each player takes on the role of a psychic within the order of Psight. The goal is to defeat your opponents using your various Powers, Memories, and Abilities. If you gain Dominance over a Domain, your road to victory may become easier, as your opponents will no longer be able to use any additional Powers, Memories, or Abilities from your Domain. However, plan your actions carefully, because one wrong move could easily spell defeat. With a well-planned strategy and a little luck, you can be the last psychic standing and claim victory!

Psight is a strategy card game designed for 2-4 players. The objective is to out think your opponent and be the last player with cards in your hand. It plays similar to many CCG's without the expense of constantly buying booster packs or individual cards. We strongly disbelieve in the pay-to-win gaming model so everything you need to play with up to 3 other friends or family members is included in the game!

Psight is also a color-blind gamer friendly game with the use of Domain names and symbols on every card in the game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Scope
description:
One shot - one dead? Scope has made it his life motto. When he looks through his sniper scope at someone, the guy is already dead.
This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: The Outpost – Light Troopers
description:
Light troopers is a cheap squad with one strong point: their carbines. Make sure they get good shooting position and keep enemies away.

This set contains 2 minis, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: Neuroshima Tactics: Heroes – Hired Gun
description:
Hired Gun. He knows his destiny - who pays gives orders. Well trained - knows how to use his shotgun. Always settles his debts. Hero is a guy with balls of steel or toughest chick in States. He asks, legions follow.

This set contains 1 mini, accessories set, random location card, additional game counters and rules booklet.

name: WWF Naturquiz: Wunder der Natur
description:
Objective: be the first collecting one card of each catagory(5): mammalian, birds, insects, fruits, vegetables
- acting simultaneously -
active player draws card asking first question/hint; player who answers first gets the card; if first hint does not work
second hint (up to five) is given...
easier version: first player collecting 5 cards wins
remarks:
seems to be an enlarged remake of Wunder der Natur

name: WWF Naturquiz   Rätsel, Rekorde, Sensationen
description:
Objectice: get most chips by answering questions correctly
- acting simultaneously -
all players make up their decisions, which of 3 answers should
be the correct one placing a bet (chip)
correct answer doubles the bet, incorrect one => lose your chip;
game ends if a player gets rid of chips.
'expert' variant: no multiple choice, give correct answer
remarks:
seems to be an expended remake of Rätsel, Rekorde, Sensationen
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: B-Movie Hero
description:
B-Movie Hero is a push your luck dice and card game with a little bit of strategy thrown in.
Your goal, as a lowly B-Movie hero, is to kill as many monsters as you can to survive. This means you will have to barricade yourself in whatever relatively safe place you can find, scavenge around for supplies, and of course, duct tape multiple weapons together to create one massive weapon of destruction that by all means should not work, but does.

How do you accomplish this goal is simple. Each turn a card is flipped over from the Situation Deck. These cards contain global effects that help/hinder your dice rolling, or supply locations for you to clear out and possibly barricade yourself in for added protection.

Once this is done, 3 dice are grabbed at random from a group of 12. The dice contain everything from weapons to barricades to scavenging abilities and killing sprees. The dice are rolled and placed aside for points, barricades, weapons, etc... But if you roll 3 "Bite" symbols before voluntarily ending your turn, you lose any points you might have gained. Play continues until somebody reaches the agreed upon victory points to win the game.

name: Die Olchis sind da  card game
description:
Objective: be the first getting rid of your cards
- acting by turns/simultaneously -
there are 9 different type of 'Olchi' cards: each card requires a specific action;
each player gets the same amount of cards (9), shuffles them and forms a hidden staple; active player places his top card upon the centre of the table and flips it => all players should perform required action, e.g. yawning, grunting...
if all perform correctly: next player's turn; a player who fails must take all the cards out of the centre.
Special card 'garbage': all players try - as fast as possible -
to cover that card with their hand; the 'top' hand takes all cards...

name: Conni macht das Seepferdchen
description:
Objective: be the first reaching target zone
- acting by turns -
cards (pairs) are shuffled & placed - hidden - upon the table;
each player places a chip (same colour like meeple), too; a (diving) larger chip is added.
Active player uncovers 2 cards - matching pair? Take them out & move your meeple 1 step ahead; if a meeple's move ends on a red marked space a player must take all chips into both hands (hidden) by splitting them and let the active player make a guess: uncovered chips let correspndent meeples move ahead, even two spaces far, if diving chip is present.

name: Teufelskicker Holt euch den Sieg!
description:
Objective: be the first completing a back four with a coach card
- acting by turns -
each player gets a set of 3 cards (attacking/defending) + 4 'action' cards(refillable); action cards are used to start/modify your offense/defense. Each successful offense adds one card to your back four; victory is achieved if you complete this with a coach card (action card).
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Shoot-A-Loop
description:
Shoot-A-Loop is a tin loop with a spring that launches marbles to the top where they will drop down into scoring holes. There are seven scoring holes with values of 25, 0, 50, 100, 75, 0 and 250 points. Included are three marbles in different colors.

The instruction sheet includes five games:

Triple Play - Each player shoots all three marbles, one at a time. The player then adds up the points for the round. The player with the highest total after three rounds wins.

Lucky Triple Play - Played the same as Triple Play, except a player picks one marble to be "lucky". That marble is worth double points.

1500 or Bust - Each player shoots all three marbles, one at a time. The first player to score a total of exactly 1500 points wins. If a player exceeds 1500 points, they bust back to 1250 and play continues.

Shoot Ten - Each player takes a turn shooting one marble ten times. After all players have taken a turn, the scores are added up. The player with the highest total wins.

Call Your Shot - Played like Shoot Ten, except that a player gets a chance to double their score by calling their shot.

name: Clear Round
description:
This is a solitaire card game which takes its inspiration from the classic game of Patience.

The object is to ride a clear round with your horse.

The cards have two types, Stride cards and Jump cards. First you have to try to make your horse take the required strides to the fence, this might be 8 for example. Then you turn over cards three at a time, like in Patience, and you can add the third exposed card to the table. If you do, the second card will become exposed and that can be used. Once you have a total of eight (in our example) from 2 or more cards, you switch to the Jump cards which are dealt with in a similar way. Eventually you ride over the 10 Jumps required to finish the course.

When you are blocked in your attempts to jump (a combination of 1, 2 and 3 required in that order) then you can choose a card that is not required. This will result in four faults or worse.

Extra rules include racing against the clock and playing with more players who each take turns to get their horse around the course whilst the other riders watch.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Sports

name: Auf der Koppel
description:
Objective: gain most horse cards
- acting simultaneously -
all horse cards are placed in the middle of the table - uncovered. Each player gets a playing board with images of these horses.
Active player flips a card: first player who shouts 'Stop' gets the card; wrong? an already gained card must be discarded.
Game ends after all cards are caught.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: It's a Knockout
description:
Card game made as a promotion by the biscuit people, McVitie's.

The game has 34 cards: 15 sets of 2 cards each and 4 Joker Cards. Each set of 2 cards represents one "It's a Knock Out" game. It's a Knockout was a hugely successful TV show that featured people representing a were invited to play very silly games. See the illustration where a man must ring a bell but he has to climb a greased slope to get to the bell. This would be a very typical It's a Knockout game.

The cards must be well shuffled and the complete pack dealt between the players. If some players get more than others, this does not matter in the normal course of the game. Every player looks at his cards and tries to find groups whose words and pictures fit together. Two fitting cards will be called a game, and the player who has one can lay it down when it is his turn to play. (If a player retains a 'game' in his hand he runs the risk of having the cards taken by his opponents.)

Each player holds his cards in his hand in such a way that the picture side cannot be seen by the other players. A nominated player starts and draws one card from his neighbour. If with this card he can form a game he can lay it down. Then his right neighbour draws one of his cards, and so on anti-clockwise. The first player to complete all his games shouts ’Knockout’ and places all his cards on the table.

The players then total up the number of points scored by each competitor on the basis of 5 points for each completed game, with the exception of the 'marathon' game (denoted by letter M) which qualifies for 10 points.

The Joker can be used at any stage of the game to complete the other half of a two card 'game', but this particular game only qualifies for standard points, i.e.5 If the Joker card is laid on top of a matching 2 card game this entitles the player to double points for the one 'game', i.e.10 points. The player with the highest number of points is declared the winner.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Das Ostfriesische Teespiel
description:
Objective: Move from your East Frisian island up to the mainland collecting 5 ingredients (preparing tea)
and get back again
- acting by turns -
each player gets an island, the 'Alte Fritz' - a neutral figure - is placed in Aurich.
active player rolls the die - you need a 'joker' stepping from island to mainland; successful?
move vertical or horizontal if possible into cities, but do not step upon 'Alter Fritz', because he'll send you to the jail (smuggler). Get these ingredients during your stay; outside you can be challenged by other players (rock, paper, scissors) to win/loose an ingredient or you may make a deal findind the one you were searching for.
Moving back to your island you must roll a 'joker'.
remarks:
Production: Ravensburger Freizeit- und Promotion

name: Funky Party Games: Blind Paint
description:
A party game that involves blindfolded drawing and guessing.

It is played in two teams. One player has to wear a blindfold so that he/she can't see what he/she is drawing. The other team members have to guess the words/phrases that are being drawn. There are easy tasks (a simple word, such as "house") and difficult ones (sometimes whole proverbs like "People who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones."). Difficult tasks are worth more points than the easy ones. The team with the most points wins the game.

Components:
- 1 pencil
- 1 sand timer
- 1 notepad
- 1 blindfold
- 50 cards
- instructions

name: Avgvstvs to Avrelian: Wargaming the Roman Principate
description:
A miniatures game, centered around the Roman Empire. The rules cover the period between the time when Augustus seized power (25 BC), right through the period of the Empire’s height, down through the crisis of the third century, and ending with the reign of Aurelian (275 AD).

Shooting and combat are determined using a number of ten-sided dice. The number depending on the size of the units involved. The dice rolls are modified by a few factors, and the result looked up on a simple chart. Units which take more than a specific number of casualties become "Shaken". Commanders have a limited ability to rally Shaken troops, returning them, at least temporarily, to more or less full effectiveness.

Games are scenario based rather than the familiar points based systems.

The turn sequence is based on a unique card based system which emphasizes command control and battlefield friction.

name: Tresorknacker
description:
Tresorknacker is a puzzle game that is meant for a large group of players (up to 40). Several groups of players compete to break into a safe by figuring out a six digit combination within a limited amount of time. In addition to mathematical and logical skills, the teams require a good deal of memory, co-operation and economy, as clues can be bought from the game moderator at varying prices of "time money".

If several teams manage to break the code within the time limit, the team with the highest sum of "Time left" + "Time Money left" is the winner. As the code changes from game to game, several rounds can be played with the same group of players.

No 21 in Christwart Conrad's "Taktisches Großgruppenspiel" series.

name: Zählefant
description:
Objective: increase your math skills

six different math games
1a more, less, equal:
Two players (groups) form a pile of cards (5) each; top cards (show numbers) are placed simultaneously into middle of the table showing sets of numbers only. The player (team) who reacts first - covering 'Zählefant' card with their bare hand if their card shows less, with the other hand (glove) if it is more - wins the cards; if it is a tie no reaction allowed; game ends after 2 rounds
1b Form sum of 4 cards and compare; similar appoach, but each team has two piles; top cards are flipped simultaneously, values must be added to the next 2 cards.
1c Form sum of 2 cards and compare; one pile - top cards are flipped simultaneously, values (top & card back) must be added to the next card

2 adjoining numbers - acting by turns -
place a '5' into the middle of the table; active player may place an adjacent number (4 or 6) vertical and/or horizontaal getting rid of own cards; player wins who has left no cards

3 sum '10' - acting by turns -
all cards are placed upon the table - hidden; active player draws two cards; if digit sum = 10 ==> cards may be kept (a '10' card must be matched by a second '10'); game ends after all cards are gone; player with most cards wins

4 who's first?: - acting by turns/use the board -
each player rolls the die and moves ahead according die roll - correct move? add 4 spaces. first player reaching target space wins.

5 cards in love: - acting by turns -
all players form a pile, flipping simultaneously top card:
if anyone can form the digit sum '10' with two cards first player who announces it wins both cards.

6 dangerous '10': - all cards are placed upon the table, hidden -
active player flips a card building the sum of top and back: flipping another one and comparing both sums player may proceed if second sum is higher; lower?: don't take it, flip it back and take all others you flipped during your turn. If you flip a '10' turn ends immidiately not being allowed to take any cards.

name: Monopoly: FC Bayern München
description:
Monopoly set of FC Bayern München, a German soccer team.
All important events, the club's own stadium investments, special meeples...
All the traditional elements of rolling, moving, purchasing, earning, and spending.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The Church Game
description:
Christian card game made by The Mothers' Union, an organisation started in mid-Victorian England and now a worldwide sisterhood.

The game is a set collecting game but unlike quartet games, the sets have different numbers of cards in them. For example, Fasts has three cards - Lent, Advent, Fridays; but Prayer has five cards - Adoration, Thanksgiving, Confession, Petition and Intercession. There are 10 sets in all and List cards are provided to help players know how many cards are needed.

The procedure for collecting the cards is traditional. In your turn, you may ask any player for any card from a set that you already have at least one card from that set. You go on until you are unsuccessful, then the turn passes to the left. There are minor extra rules relating to courtesy and mistakes. Full sets are laid out on the table and are now 'Safe'. It says that once all sets have been collected, each player scores for each set in front of them, 1 point for every card in your collection (which means the larger sets are more difficult to collect but will score more points.)

The presentation is very unusual. There is no doubt that this is a properly published game, not an amateur production. Yet the cards have very basic illustrations and all text is as if it had been handwritten. I suppose they wanted to give the impression that it was illustrated at Sunday School (which might actually be true).

THE CHURCH GAME
RULES
1. The cards are divided into sets numbered 1 to 10. Each set consists of a LIST card (no picture) and PICTURE cards, whose names appear all together on the LIST card.
2. Different Sets contain different numbers of cards. The Winner of the game is the person who has collected the greatest number of cards (not sets) after an agreed number of hands.
3. Players cut for deal, the person cutting a card bearing the highest number is the dealer but should two cut the same highest number they cut again until one is
higher than the other. Thereafter the deal passes to the original dealers left.
4. The cards are dealt out singly beginning at the dealer's left. This may result in one or more players having an extra card to begin with but this is immaterial.
5. The game begins with the dealer asking any player for ANY card by name belonging to a set of which he already has one or more cards. E.g. having in his hand the List Card "Greater Sacraments” he might ask someone for “Baptism"; or having Maniple he might ask for Vestments (the List Card); or Alb (which belongs to the same set).
6. Before every request the player making it must say “Please” and after a successful one he must say “Thank You”. If he forgets to do either his turn is immediately forfeit; if the latter he must also return the last card so obtained.
7. After a successful request a player may make a further one and continue until either he is unsuccessful or forgets to say “Please" or “Thank You". In this case the turn passes to the player on his left and so on round the group.
8. As soon as a player has a complete set he lays them on the table in front of him and they are thenceforth
"Safe" (i.e. none can take them from him).
9. A player must not (with the single exception of Rule 10 below) ask for a card belonging to a set of which he has not at least one card already. Should he accidentally do so (i.e. by imagining that an Amice is a Greater Sacrament and asking for the latter on the strength of possessing the former) he must return the card and forfeit his turn.
10. If a player whose turn it is to ask finds himself without a single card in his hand he may ask for ANY card still in play (i.e. he is exempt from Rule 9). But as soon as he is successful and has a card in his hand Rule 9
applies again.
11. When every card is "safe" the hand ends and players count the cards to their credit and score appropriately. The deal then passes as explained in Rule 3.
NOTE: When players are new to the game it is a help to familiarize them with the sets by giving them a list of the sets’ names and the numbers on them. These should be withdrawn as players’ become more familiar with them.

name: Der Kleine Schlaufuchs
description:
Young children's game related to both Snap and Memory but with differences.

The game has 72 tiles. 36 of them are all the same shape and feature various images. The other 36 tiles match the object on the same shape tiles but these tiles are not rectangular, they are loosely the shape of the object in question.

Place all the same shape tiles into the cardboard container. Lay out all the other tiles face-up around the table. At the word go, players hunt through the container looking for a tile that matches (the image) any exposed tile on the table. First to get three matches wins the round and cries "Halt!".

The same-shaped tiles are perfect for also playing a straight-forward Memory game or a game of Snap.

name: Verkade spel
description:
Players collect letters in a roll-and-move fashion. The first player to complete the word "Verkade" wins the game.

The letters are hidden face-down on the game board, and players roll the dice to move and collect them.

name: Praxis geheugenspel
description: A Dutch Memory variant, in which players try to collect matching DIY items. However, one should not match the same illustrations, but rather tools that go together.

name: Major League Baseball by Yogi Berra
description: Players select the type of pitch, manage batting strategy, coach base running. A die roll determines the outcome of the at bat. Odds of a hit are based on selecting the correct batting strategy that matches the opponent's selected pitch.
publishers: Research Games, Inc. / Athol / RGI / ARC

name: Old Testament Stories
description:
A card game similar to "Go Fish" or "Authors", it is designed to help learn fifteen Bible stories from the Old Testament. Aimed at all age levels from Preschool to Seniors.

Each Requester begins play by asking another player if he/she has a certain story and play continues around the table until all 4 cards in a particular story has been collected by a Requestor for 10 points. The person on the left of the Requestor must then try to tell the story or pass to the person on the left. If the story is told correctly, that person also collects 10 points. If not, the Requestor reads it aloud and play continues until until someone is out of cards. That person collects 10 points plus 1 point for each card remaining in opponent hands.

First person to reach 100 points after a few rounds wins.
Comes in a deck of 62 cards including "Directions for Play" and a "Publisher" fact card. Illustrated by Daniela Ianculescu.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Religious

name: Space Battle
description:
Space Battle is a power struggle between you and your opponents for control of the galaxy. This is a "take that" card game with silly cards.

There are two similar versions of the game in the box.
Everyone starts with some ship cards randomly drawn from the ship deck. Each ship gives you access to use particular kinds of weapon cards that you draw from a shared deck. These cards like "red laser" and "drones" are used to wear down other ships. Some cards destroy ships in ways outside of weaponry.

When you destroy another ship you get the printed Victory Points for it. If all your ships are destroyed you go to the deck to see if you are lucky enough to get a card that gives you another ship to stay in the game, otherwise you are eliminated from play, but victory (in one version of the game is based on points).

name: Schildkrötenreise
description:
A simple, luck-based racing game for children.

The game consists of one island tile, 4 wooden turtles, 43 cards and one six-sided number die.

The island tile is the target space that all the turtles (= wooden player pieces) want to reach as fast as possible. The cards, which show either one of several sea creatures or a smaller island, are used to create a path towards the target island tile. They are placed face down.
Players take turns rolling the die. The die roll determines how far the player may move his/her turtle. The card it lands on is turned over and depending on the type of card, the turtle is moved several spaces forwards or backwards.

The player whose turtle is first to reach the main island wins the game.

name: La Boîte à énigmes pas si scientifiques que ça
description:
Another version of the La Boîte à énigmes. This time the riddles refer to areas very familiar, and we wonder why we never asked these questions before. The answers, in turn, are often a good sense appalling.

Players or teams compete in puzzle-solving (sometimes timed, sometimes not) in order to score points in different categories. The first team (or player) to score a point in 4 of the 6 categories wins the game.

Every turn, the current player/team draws a card and hands it to the Dealer, a non-competitive figure that reads it aloud and then manages the competition between the people trying to solve the riddle.

name: Hipsters: The Card Game
description:
Can you become the biggest hipster? Collect cappuccinos, canvas bags, and LPs while avoiding mainstream items to prove your Cred.

Each player is uniquely assigned two traits (from the pool of Academic, Activist, Elitist, or Grungeling) and is dealt a hand of eight items. An item has a trait - one of the above four or the detestable Mainstream. In turn order, each player selects a card from that hand to play. A player can play the card on himself, which will give him positive score if it matches one of his traits and negative score otherwise. If the player already has a negative scoring card, he can play a negative scoring card on another player. After each player has chosen played one card, everyone rotates hands to the next player.

Each trait has one card of each of ten point values. If a card is played on a player who already has a card of that value, the new one covers and replaces the old card. At the end of the game, each player totals their score and adds or subtracts points for a run of at least two cards of the same color - scoring or losing a point for every card in the run, depending on whether that color is positive or negative for the player. Highest total score wins!

name: Donald Duck
description: A Disney related card game. The game-play is the same as Pairs (turn over two cards and if they match, claim the pair). This differs in one important way. Each pair has a points value printed on the card itself. It is the points scored by your pairs at the end of the game, not the number of pairs you have obtained. The points range from 1 to 5 mostly but one pair (Donald's face in close-up) scores 10 points.

name: The House That Jack Built
description:
Try to play all your cards in the same order as the lines of The House That Jack Built. Deal all the cards, one at a time. Some players may have more.

Whoever is at dealer's left begins by putting a House card (1) in the middle and saying line 1: “This is the House that Jack built." Then, if he can, he puts a Malt card (2) on top and says line 2, continuing to play cards and say the lines in the right order as long as he can. When he does not have the next card, he gives one card to the player on his left, who continues from where the first player stopped. Whoever plays a Farmer (10) recites the whole poem, and then starts a new sequence with a House. If anyone cannot play in his turn, he may not pass a card. If anyone makes a mistake in the verse, everyone gives him a card.

The winner is the first one to use his last card, either by playing or passing.

name: Meine Känguru Zahlen-Box
description:
A box of 60 very sturdy cards each featuring a number from 0 to 9 inclusive. The game is aimed at pre-schoolers and are designed to be attractive to young minds. There are numerous games suggested, mostly having a parent to act as referee.

For example, the parent lays out 10 cards, one of each number. Then she asks the players in turn to point to two cards that add up to 7. If the child is right, he or she gets a point. After the playxers have all had a turn, the parent can choose a different number like 5 for instance, and so on. First to get, say, three points, wins. This sort of game can easily be made more difficult by choosing three cards that add up to a number.

Nearly all the games feature counting and the recognition of numbers. The publisher has made a very good job of making the cards as nice and hard-wearing as they are.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Game System, Math, Number

name: Stowaway
description:
In Stowaway players compete for treasures using their pirate crew. Whoever collects the most value in treasure wins.

The pirates and treasures are all represented as cards; a single set of treasures from the Broken Vase worth 1 point to the Gold Bars worth 10; and a set of pirates for each player from the 1 point Cabin Boy to the 10 point Captain, plus a stealthy Stowaway.

The treasures are revealed one at a time, then each player chooses one or more pirates to send after the treasure. All pirates are revealed at once, and the treasure goes to whoever has the greatest value of pirates.

It is a game of psychology, successfully predicting your opponents' moves, and remaining unpredictable yourself are the key to winning.

Official Website: http://stowawaygame.com/
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Samstag Nacht
description:
Party/trivia game themed on the comedy show "RTL Samstag Nacht", which ran from 1993-1998 on German TV network RTL.

Components:
- 1 oval-shaped game board
- 7 tokens
- 1 die
- 110 cards (30 question cards, 30 dialogue cards, 30 action cards, 20 advertisement cards)
- chips with points printed on the back

Aim of the game & gameplay:
Collecting the most points by earning chips. Chips are earned by landing on an advertisement space and drawing an advertisement card that lets you earn a chip. The other cards contain questions (question cards), tasks that have to be done with a partner (dialogue cards), and tasks that have to be done alone (action cards). On the back, the cards contain instructions for moving the pawns. Movement of the pawns via these instructions, the roll of a colour die and the result of moving a spinner decides which cards are used. Only advertisement cards earn you points.
The game ends when all advertisement chips have been distributed and the player with the highest point value wins the game.

(Warning: On German review site http://sunsite.informatik.rwth-aachen.de/keirat/ this game has been called the "worst game I know at present" and "unplayable by the instructions included".)
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Stack-Up
description: Players take turns moving one of their 16 pieces on a 10x10 grid in order to build stacks which can be partially removed from the game and eventually to have a single piece remaining on the board and winning.

name: Paardensprong en solo
description: An abstract game, played on a 7x7 board. Each player has a single pawn, and on their turn moves it by a Chess knight's jump. The square he leaves behind is then blocked off. Once a player cannot move any more, he has lost the game.

name: Sprookjesboom Wensput Spel
description:
The 'Wensput Spel' (Wishing Well Game) is a children's game loosely based on the 'Sprookjesboom' franchise from the Dutch theme park 'Efteling'.

In the game, players start as one of the many creatures of the enchanted forest (like a frog, a snail or a hedgehog). All other playing pieces are stored -together with the prince charming playing piece- in a mechanical and musical wishing well. The players then start their journey through the forest trying to reach Cinderella's castle before the other players do. In order to win the game, they must transform their playing piece into the prince charming piece before reaching the castle.

For that purpose, players roll-and-move through the forest and whenever they reach a transformation square they may (depending whether their playing piece is shown on the square or not) transform into another creature. To do so, they drop their playing piece in an empty slot of the wishing well, then spin the handle on the well until another creature 'magically' pops up out of the well. The player then continues the game with that playing piece.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Altan Xaraacaj
description:
Altan Xaraacaj is a traditional game from Mongolia. The object of the game is to get your 3 pieces in a row.

Players take turns to enter one of their pieces on any vacant point, trying to get 3 in a row.

When all the pieces are entered, with still no series of 3 in a row, players take turns moving their pieces on the next point, provided it is vacant.

The winner is the first player to get 3 pieces in a row.

name: Pixie Pip's Sailing Game
description:
Game in the Jack and Jill Book of 1972.

It is a normal roll and move game in the tradition of the Goose games. If you land on a special space and obey the instructions. First to reach square 45, wins.

name: Jake and the Never Land Pirates: Captain Hook's Treasure
description:
Jake and his friends are looking for hidden treasure. It's well watched by the pirates. You need to gather enough dublons to trick them and get the chest!

The game is based on Disney license: Jake and the Neverland Pirates. It requires cooperation and a bit of luck. On the board you will find fantastic 3d volcanoes, treasure chests for gathering doubloons and special spinner that determines where you land. All fields on the route are special fields. Every player need to get to the finishing line before Hook encircle the volcano. Use color doubloons to get pass the pirates. The game is fun for the whole family.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Comic Meister
description:
User summary

A quirky comic-based card game where the players play cards from their hand onto the panels of a comic book, trying to elevate the popularity of the character specified on the card. The game mechanisms involve blocking and card drafting.

Game comes with one deck of cards and four 20p comic books (uncluding manual).

Translated card box back
A union of a comic book and a card game??
Simple rules!
Here's your chance to taste the mysticism of playing a game with a comic book!

It's up to you to rule the page
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Hunters' Challenge
description:
A unique, educational game that challenges a player's knowledge of hunting with educational facts, the luck of rolling the Dice, and Plenty of Fun. Your goal is to collect the items you need for hunting and on your travels hunt game like deer, bears, and other animals.

Object: the object of the game is to complete the entire trail, survive Wolf-Ridge, and get back to camp with the following items.

1. Deer and license (Deer must be bagged in Large Chopping/Hardwood hill
2. Wild Duck and License (Wild Duck must be obtained in Saw Mill Lake Area)
3. Moose and License (Moose Must be bagged in Rubber Boot Bog Area)
4. Bear and License (Bear must be bagged in Bear Claw Pass Area)
5. Waterproof matches
6. Hunting Knife
7. Compass

Rules of the game:

Before a hunter can shoot any animals, they must first obtain a hunting license by landing on a hunting license square. After obtaining a hunting license the hunter must then land on a shooting spot correctly answering a skill-tested question from the Game Warden's Question Hand Book in order to bag their animal.

In order for the hunter to finish the game and return to camp he/she must roll the exact number of squares to finish the trail.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Mountaineering Game
description:
Simple roll and move game. The board represents a winding track to the summit of a mountain. Move by the roll of two dice roll and obey any instructions on the special spaces. These are:
7. Move back to start.
13.Snowstorm. Go back 5 spaces.
17.Avalanche. Go back 3 spaces.
18.Advance to 21.
21.Fall. Need a double to advance.
28.Rest Hut. Stay for 3 throws.
34.Rest Hut. Stay for 3 throws.
37.Advance 6 spaces.
42.Mist. Need a double to advance.
49.Blizzard. Go back to 34.
50.Blizzard. Go back to 42.
59.Goats impede advance. Lose 2 throws.
60.Cloud. Go back 12 spaces.
Note the typical example in the rules of what you don't do (rather what you usually do in games of this vintage)
"Each must throw a double to begin, but does not take another turn for any double thrown during the course of play".

The winner is the first to overcome all the obstacles on the way and reach the summit.

name: Uilenbord
description:
A simple gambling game. Players start by betting a number of coins.
On their turn, players throw three dice, and look up their throw on the board. Each throw will list a number of coins to be paid, or taken from the middle.
If someone throws tripples, he gets half or all of the coins in the middle.

name: Voetbal Toto
description:
A game about predicting soccer results.

Every player starts by filling out their pool forms, saying about each team whether they will win, lose or draw. After everyone has made their predictions, players can play their counters (1, 2 or 3) to score a goal for one of the teams. The person who guessed most results correctly wins.

name: High-ways
