description: Players try to be the first to bridge two sides of the board. Every turn you throw two dice, that determine the places on the board where you can build. You start by building simple pieces, that can then be replaced by bridging pieces.

name: Großmütterchen erzählt Märchen
description:
(translation: In the Land of Fairy Tales)

Simple roll-and-move game with several event spaces ("move forward", "skip one round", "move backward") set in a forest with several Grimm fairy tale illustrations.

The Little Grandmother is telling fairy stories and the board reflects this with each special square being linked to a particular fairy story. If you land on one of the special spaces, you must obey the instructions. First player to reach space 75, wins.

name: Beach Party Bingo
description:
From the Rules:

"Beach Party Bing is a fast to learn and fun to play, and like most Coin Creature games all you need is dice and some pocket change.


* *


Object of the game - the first player to cover all 12 spots on their game card is the winner, with the losers giving the winner a Monster coin from the Coin Creature based game or a card front the expansion pack!"

Basically, this a dice version of the classic bingo game incorporated into the Coin Creature world of RAK Graphics.

name: Naval Battle Group
description:
Naval Battle Group is a modern naval wargame designed to be played with naval miniatures.
Game scale (both time and distance) is variable, and is determined prior to play, while time scale can be changed based on circumstances.
Its rules tell how individual ships and aircraft move, detect enemy contacts, and attack them. Weapons inflict realistic effects, and proper naval tactics produce accurate and believable results.
Game-play is with dice, and no game boards are used - a protractor and tape-measure are used to measure distances and angles. A calculator is useful for determining distances based on the scale used.
Included are statistics for real-world surface, subsurface, and air units, allowing for any number of historical or what-if scenarios.

name: Ping, Pang, Pong!
description:
A simple dice game for children that incorporates drawing using a drawing template, and a rock-paper-scissors element.

In the basic variant, the active player rolls the five colour dice up to three times per turn. The highest number of identical colours is the number of spaces he/she may paint or cross out on the penguin's racing track on a sheet of the notepad. To make this easier, there is a drawing template that covers all five possible cases (1-5 spaces). The first player to have covered the complete track wins the game.

In the advanced variant, an ice pyramid has to be covered instead of a straight track. In addition, all players roll at least one die, even if it is not their turn: each player gets one die, the active player the remaining dice. The active player can try to win matching dice from other players by winning a rock-paper-scissors duel (which is re-themed as ice floe, water and rock). The first player to have covered his/her pyramid wins the game.

The drawing template also includes a penguin shape that the children can draw on their sheet and add further details, like hats or clothes as a drawing activity.

name: Versunkene Schätze
description:
Five treasures have sunk beneath the waves, and both players dive down from a recovery ship and try to be the first to recover three of them. Each turn, they roll the die and move exactly that many spaces if they can.

Published in Spielboexchen September 2012.

name: Découvrons Paris
description:
The object is to discover Paris and win the maximum monuments.

The board represents Paris with its main sites, their values ​​ranging from 1 to 5 points (only the Eiffel Tower is worth 5 points). Each site is represented on a nice place on its support site plan.
Each player places his token on a starting point. Rolling "6" is required to start nad in his turn player rolls the dice and move on the board-grid and try to reach beyond the monuments.

Once a player reaches a certain score (6 to 16 points depending on the number of players), he must go to the foot of the Eiffel Tower. To take the symbol of Paris, the player must make roll "1" or "2" depending on the position of the game-piece from the Tour.
The Eiffel Tower taken, the game ends. The winner is the player who scores the most points.

name: Cadbury Air Race
description:
Game published on the back cover to the Knockout Fun Book in 1956.

The rules: To play this thrilling game, you need a die, a dice cup (an egg-cup will do) and some coloured counters or buttons for aeroplanes {one for each player). Any number of players can take part, and the first to touch down on square 52 is the winner. With your last throw of the die you must get the exact number to reach 52 - if you throw too high a number you must wait another turn. We're sure that you’ll enjoy this game as much as you enjoy Cadburys Milk Cnocolate.

name: Pride: Newcastle Edition
description:
Trivia game for four players or teams.

Each card has a number of questions; A Home 1, a Home 2, an Away 1, an Away 2, a Bonus question and a Champions League question. Each player starts on his own track. There is no interaction between the tracks.

In a turn, a player rolls the die to see which question he will be asked. It will be for one of the Home or Away questions. The Bonus and Champions League question are special and cannot be rolled on the die.

A Home/Away question is worth one or two spaces to be moved on your track. If you land on a Yellow Card space or a Red Card space, various negative effects come into play for you. When you have reached the end of your track, you must answer a Champions League question to win the game. If you get it wrong, you just stay there and next turn you will get another Champions League question.

name: Speed
description:
This game is in 'The Children's Book of Games, Puzzles and Pastimes'. Here are the brief rules:

This exciting game, for two or more people, is played with ordinary playing cards. Deal a hand to each player. The first player now turns up a card, which is left on the table, and proceeds according to the instructions on the Key to 'Moves' chart. If he turns up, say, a seven, then he “goes forward” four by taking four cards from the next player, Should he turn up a card which tells him to “go back,” then he has to give that number of cards to the following player. The game proceeds until each player but one has run out of cards. The remaining player is the winner of this gruelling race. It is more exciting if several people play.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Racing, Sports

name: Crazy Cubes Bowling
description:
From Rules:

"Line'em up, stack'em, put'em in a triangle. Any way you play'em, the goal is to "Bowl'em over."


Each player has 2 shots to try to bowl over the Crazy pins.
Score 1 point for every Pin you knock over, and 6 points for a complete strike.
The winner is the player with the most points after 3 rounds."
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Sports

name: Halo Conquest
description:
Halo Conquest

A game of Conquest

By Eli Silver

In this game, you play as the legendary Master Chief as you attempt to complete missions of vital importance. The Covenant have once again attacked the UNSC, and you are needed to stop them.
When you start a new game, you can pick any skulls you want. Like the Halo games, the skulls will make the mission harder. However, if you are using the scoring, they will also multiply your score. Choose a mission, receive your starting equipment, and then set out.
During your turn, you will advance or retreat, then fire at the enemy (assuming you have ammo). Afterwards, the enemy will fire back, (assuming the enemy is still alive). You'll have the option to take cover and reduce the likelihood of bieng hit, or stand in the open and get a better shot. You can toss Grenades, snipe the enemy, or bash them to death with a melee. You can also pick up weapons from dead enemies.
When a zone is clear, you can advance to the next zone, and then the next, hoping to complete your mission.
Good luck!

name: The Ahold Family Game
description:
Card game presumably made as a promotional game for Royal Ahold, a huge conglomerate in the food retail sector and made to celebrate the new Millennium.

There are 48 cards, divided into 12 sets of four cards. A number of games using the pack are described.

First game: Happy Families: Despite title this is a regular Quartet game. Collect sets and the one with the most when all the cards are collected, wins.
Second game: Codebreaker. Problem setter chooses a code, consisting of a regularly recurring pattern of cards; Example: Red, Green, Green, Blue - Red, Green, Green, Blue, and so on. He takes cards that match this pattern and reveals the first card. If no-one guesses the code, he reveals a second one, and so on until someone guesses the code first and wins.
Third game: Pairs. Traditional memory game but as there are no duplicate cards in the pack, a player must identify pairs of cards within the same set.
Fourth game: Card Race. For two players. A frenetic game of matching cards. Three cards are dealt face up and one face down. The 44 other cards are shared ouzt between both players. At the word "Go", both players start revealing cards with the objective of being able to lay a card on one of the revealed cards. A card that 'goes' must be the same colour or the same letter (A B C or D) or the same geographical name. First to use all their cards on to the three stacks, wins.
Fifth game: Beggar-My-Neighbour. The traditional British game.
Sixth game: Fortune-Telling. A game and not a Tarot-like prediction system. In their turn, a player turns over a card. The cards are ranked from red A to D, green A to D and blue A to D. The player must 'predict' the next card he turns over as being higher or lower ranked than the revealed card. If he is right, he can try again. If he is wrong, his turn ends and the next player tries. If the card revealed is identically ranked, that ends the player's turn but he does not have to miss a turn. First to turn over all his cards, wins.
Seventh game: Tops. This is exactly the same mechanism as traditional Top Trumps.
Eight game: Patience. A solo game. Cards are ranked as in the Fortune-Telling, described above. As in traditional Patience games you win if you can sort the cards in order.

name: Stop-Over Lübeck
description:
The game consists of two sub-games.
In the first game players take the role of journalists and try to get to the sat-van as quick as possible in order to upload the three pictures they have to capture in this game. The pictures are all Lübeck-buildings or sites and have a UFO sighting on them.
This is a Malefiz kind of adaptation.

In the second part the game (backside of the board) journalists try to get the cover-story (word-guessing approach) before other players can beat them by running up the stairs of the publisher's office first.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Safe in the Ark
description:
User Summary

Safe in the Ark is a family game with a Noah's Ark theme. Each player begins the game with an empty (plastic) 'ark.' Players then roll the die to move their pawn about the board collecting each pair of animals. Since only three of the pairs are available at a time, players must try to choose the most efficient route.

name: The Very Hungry Caterpillar Match and Munch Game
description:
Players trade, collect and match five of the Very Hungry Caterpillar's food tiles in various sequences, for example five oranges or four strawberries plus an apple. A winning combination is traded for a butterfly token and the player's hand is replenished. The first player to collect three butterfly tokens wins. This game is intended for ages 3 and up so no reading is required.

Wild cards, which can fill in for one fruit tile per hand, are the various foods the caterpillar ate on Saturday in the Eric Carle story such as a cupcake or sausage.

The game parts fit in a soft bag that looks like the caterpillar. The game contains 55 food item tiles, 10 round butterfly tokens, a card showing the winning combinations, and a small directions leaflet.

name: Qwikstat Golf
description:
Self-published statistical golf game. System designed to play very quickly, allowing for whole tournaments to be played in one evening.

Statistics for nearly 1,000 golfers are provided and around 100 courses to choose from. The statistics have been generated from the 1940's to the early 1990's. All dice rolls are compared to various charts to get the result of a tournament eventually.

Scoring is as per normal golf so the winner is the one with the lowest number of shots.

name: Wang Wang & Funi
description:
The Hungry Panda Game!
Spin the spinner and match the colours as you play the easy game with younger children, helping one another find food that pandas might like to eat. Or, flip the board and complete to see who can collect the most matching items in the family game. Then, in the bonus game, use the cards to play "Panda Pairs", but watch that you don't get stuck with the odd one out!
- From the back of the box.

name: Wer kennt Augsburg?
description:
"Who knows Augsburg - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Augsburg.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.

name: Schwarze Gürtel des Munchkintums
description:
[Translation of German Text]
The first prize in each Munchkin Fu Release tournament was a stylish black obi (karate belt) with the following text: "Black Belt of Munchkinism +3 bonus. Really."

1. The Black Belt of Munchkinism and its bonus has been approved by none other than Steve Jackson. It is official and may be used in any game.

2. Each player may only wear one black belt of Munchkinism. Whether it is worn around the waist or as a sash (for the somewhat stouter player), is irrelevant. The Black Belt of Munchkinism is always valid. Although the belt is very long, it may not be used by two or more players at one time.

3. The Black Belt is considered small object, has no value, and does not occupy a slot (hands, arms, etc). If it needs to be taken off, it is moved to (or next to) the discard pile.

4. If a player loses their Black Belt of Munchkinism (due to trade, thievery, or death), he can not put in on again, unless he changes his gender.

It should be understood that a stolen Black Belt Munchkinism is given back to the owner after the end of the game.

[ORIGINAL TEXT]
Der erste Preis bei jedem Munchkin Fu Release Turnier war ein stylischer schwarzer Obi (Karategürtel) mit folgender Aufschrift: "Schwarzer Gürtel des Munchkintums. +3 Bonus. Wirklich."

1. Der Schwarze Gürtel des Munchkintum und sein Bonus sind von niemand geringerem als Steve Jackson abgesegnet worden. Damit ist er offiziell und darf in jedem Spiel eingesetzt werden.

2. Jeder Spieler darf nur einen Schwarzen Gürtel des Munchkintums tragen. Ob er um die Hüfte oder als Schärpe (für die etwas stärkeren Spieler) getragen wird, ist gleichgültig. Der Schwarze Gürtel des Munchkintums kann jederzeit angelegt werden. Auch wenn der Gürtel besonders lang ist, darf er nicht von zwei oder mehr Spielern gleichzeitig eingesetzt werden.

3. Der Schwarze Gürtel des Munchkintums gilt als kleiner Gegenstand, er hat keinen Wert und belegt keinen Slot (Hände, Rüstung o.ä.). Wenn er abgelegt werden muss, wandert er auf den Ablagestapel (bzw. daneben).

4. Sollte ein Spieler den Schwarzen Gürtel des Munchkintums verlieren (Handel, Dieb, Tod oder beim-um-den-Tisch-tanzen-abgefallen) kann er ihn nicht wieder anlegen, es sei denn, er wechselt das Geschlecht.

Es sollte selbstverständlich sein, dass ein geklauter Schwarzer Gürtel des Munchkintums nach dem Ende des Spiels vom Besitzer an den Eigentümer zurück gegeben wird.

name: Quizz'N Cook spécial apéro
description:
200 additional questions for Quizz'N Cook about drinks.

This is a Trivia game with questions about the kitchen. All questions have multiple choices.
Draw a card and ask! Who answers correctly scores a point.
Who has the most points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Trivia

name: A Race to Rescue Snow White
description:
A straightforward dice game in the tradition of Goose games. Move along the track according to die roll. Obey instructions should you land on a special square (Red - bad, Blue - good).Throw an exact number to get into the castle and rescue Snow White.

This appeared in The Walt Disney Treasure Book, published by Odhams Press, circa 1960 I would guess. Look at the nice way the publisher has chosen to remind readers that you will need counters, a die and a dice shaker before you can start the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Explore the River
description:
Game published in More Games, Puzzles and Pastimes, published by Odhams Press in 1959.

The Rules:
This is a game for two, three or four players It is played with ordinary playing cards. Each player, in turn, draws the top card from a pack placed face downwards. When a player draws an ace he takes it and can begin the game. When, in his turn, he draws a two, he takes that as well, until he has a complete series and so reaches the Source. The cards drawn but not required are placed face upwards in a separate pile, which is turned over and drawn from again when the first pile has been exhausted. The sequence of cards may be collected irrespective of suit, but the following particular cards carry forfeits or advantages:
2 of clubs: Attacked by crocodiles: Miss 2 turns
3 of spades: Boat upset by hippopotamus: Miss a turn
4 of hearts: Calm water: Miss 4 turns
5 of spades: Boat wrecked in waterfall: Miss 4 turns
6 of diamonds: Guide shows short cut: Omit 7 and 8
7 of clubs: Attacked by hostile tribes: Miss 2 turns
8 of hearts: Favourable winds: Take an extra turn
9 of spades: Follow false trail: Miss a turn
10 of clubs: Catch malaria in jungle: Miss 3 turns
Jack of diamonds: Rainstorm lowers temperature: Take an extra turn
Queen of spades: Boat damaged in rapids: Miss 2 turns

You should cut out four small paper boats, differently coloured, as markers, and move them up the river as the cards fall.

name: The Fishing Game
description:
Game that appeared in More Games, Puzzles and Pastimes , published by Odhams Press in 1959.

Rules for this novel game:
For this game you require a pack of playing cards. Shuffle and place them face downwards on the table and each player in turn, commencing from the left and going round clockwise, draws one card from the top of the pack. You must not look at your own cards until all have been drawn from the pack. Each player then turns up his “catch” and adds up the total number of ounces.
You will see the weight of each fish is given in the picture together with numbers which represent the numbers on an ordinary playing card. If you draw a 9 or Jack they are too small to count and you must return the 9 with one fish from your catch and return the Jack with two fish from your catch to the pool.
If you draw a 2 you will find you have been “caught in the weeds” and you must return your heaviest fish to the pool. As there are four 2’s in the pack you may have to return more than one fish.
Divide the total number of ounces you have “caught” by 16 to turn the ounces into pounds, and the first to “catch” 100 pounds of fish will be the winner.

name: Foolin' around
description:
The ultimate party game for family and friends, this game will have you foolin' around with your team mates no matter where you are.

You've got the friends over, dinner was great and the latest release DVD was equally good, but there's more to a great night with friends than a dinner and movie. What ever happened to fooling around and a good laugh - after all we use to do it all the time as kids?
Foolin' Around is a great party game for entertaining guests and getting your friends (or family) to truly 'bond', so to speak.
Test your impersonation, miming and balancing skills against your friends; discover how well you really know them; expose your talent for deception; find out if you are a truth or dare personality; and so much more...

Whose going to score the most points? Are your friends up to it? How far are you prepared to go? With over 100 cards you'll find a huge variety of hilarious games you've never seen before plus some classics with our very own Foolin' Around twist!

With over 100 game cards to choose from, an evening of frank and fun discussion, true or false questions or something more boisterous using balloons, play tape, mimes or charades is sure to get your party going.

Each game has a saucy twist for you and your friends to laugh at - simply split yourselves into two groups to decide who still knows how to have a good time (just don't forget to keep score).

Whatever the occasion, gathering around this hilarious adult game with a nice bottle of wine will make the most of your next party.

The Foolin’ Around Party Game requires 6 or more players and includes a score pad, role of play tape, Foolin’ Finger, sand timer, balloons, 110 choice question cards and playing guidelines.

The object of play is to beat the other team. Use your wits, imagination and sheer determination to score the maximum points. Choose from Foolin’ Around cards in six different categories: Messin’, Balloonin’, Mimin’, Guessin’, Blindfoldin’ and Darin’. This game encourages fun with balloons, mimes and charades, thinking and observation, and fun in the dark. The perfect gift for friends to turn any social occasion into party time.
Please note: The Foolin' Around Party Game is recommended for adults over 18 years of age. Not suitable for children under 3 years old as some parts represent a choking hazard
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Storytelling, Team-Based Game, Voting

name: Aladdin
description: A children's trail game from the Walt Disney movie. To win you have to inflate a genie (balloon) with the magic lantern.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: So ein Durcheinander!
description:
A game in the range of 'minis' by Ravensburger.

There are five tiles and each tile has a different assortment of five colours along each edge. Spongebob likes yellow and Patrick likes pink, so those are the two colours used.

Five tiles are laid out in a neat row. In his turn, a player may rearrange the tiles as much as he likes, even turn them over (the tiles are double-sided but not identical. When the player is ready, the five tiles will feature Spongebob or Patrick in the centre. Remember which colour the character likes. Example. If the five tiles are Spongebob, Patrick, Patrick, Patrick and Spongebob. This would be a pattern of Yellow, Pink, Pink, Pink, Yellow. All the other players (not the player who arranged the tiles) now look for that pattern around one side of the five tiles. The first to spot it puts their finger on it and the other players check to see if he is correct. If he is, he gets a juicy hamburger tile. If not correct, the others continue to look.

The first player to get 4 Hamburger tiles, wins.

name: Alle Machen Mit: Kofferpacken
description:
Promotional item for Ernsting's Family, a large chain of fashion shops in Germany.

The game mixes trivia questions (with a bit of tasks thrown in) and set collecting. The idea is to pack a suitcase with 5 matching cards /same colour).

Every player gets 5 cards and 5 cards are dealt question side up in the middle of the table. In a turn, a player chooses one of the question cards and a question on it that he would like to try to answer. If he is right, he gets the card. He can never have more than 7 cards so any extra card over that must be discarded.

If a player gets 3 matching cards (3 items, 2 items plus a suitcase) then he must lay down the set in front of him. Jokers can be used to represent one item of clothing or they can be discared to claim one of the face-up cards without answering a question.

First to get 6 matching cards (i.e. 1 suitcase and 5 items, all in one colour), wins.

name: SOS
description:
Will the ship sink or not?
Perhaps the ship dwarf can help

S.O.S. Is a exciting game because you need skill and a little bit of luck.
A game with real water! But no fear: a large receptacle ensures that everything stays within the limit.
And if you spill some water, don't worry, there is a piece of cloth to wipe it away.

Purpose of the game:
It comes down to skill: Who drops water so convenient and carefully in the sailboat, that ship does not sink?
The goal is not to sink the ship, so you have the least you knots in your rope.

The player whose turn it is, throw the dice and then pour the water from the bowl into the floating boat as the number of eyes that he has thrown . So up to three shoots or better yet droplets.

It is important that for each point you rolled on the dice, you have start again to pour the water from the bowl into the floating boat. More drops from a single pouring count as one!

Is the player skillful, and the boat sinks not during his turn, then the next player must show his agility. Also, he should throw the dice and then pour the water into the boat.

Sinks the boat, then the player whose turn it is, must lay a knot in his rope.
Then he makes the sailboat empty and turn it back on the water. This player begins the next round.

The game ends when a player have three knots in his rope.
The player with the fewest knots in his rope, is the winner.

name: Wer kennt Bonn?
description:
"Who knows Bonn - The Original City Quiz"

Do You know Yor city or region? With over 500 questions about Bonn.

The Quizmaster draws a card and asks a question. Plyayers bets correct answer with A/B/C/D-cards face-down or use their joker card. Correct answer scores points and player may continue answering. Wrong answer eliminates player from the session.
Game last until there are no players or the session is over.

Player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting

name: Trivial Pursuit: Music Edition – from Pop-Rock to Classic
description: CD version of Trivial Pursuit in its Music edition. From Pop-Rock to Classic music, the CD features a song/composition and the players must answer the question related to the track.

name: Felli
description:
Felli is a two-player abstract strategy board game from Morocco. It is related to Alquerque and draughts as pieces leap over one another to capture. Felli's closest relatives are actually several thousand miles away in the form of Lau kata kati from India and the game called Butterfly (game) from Mozambique. One main difference is that the Felli board has only one horizontal line across its breadth as oppose to two found in the other two games.

There is another version, and perhaps even the correction version, where the pieces are promoted to "Mullahs" upon reaching the other player's first rank. The "Mullahs" are like the "Kings" in International Draughts, and they can move any number of unoccupied spaces. They can also leap over an enemy piece from any distance, and land any distance behind it.
The game is also called Fich.

The goal of each player is to capture all the other player's pieces, or stalemate the other player by immobilizing its pieces.

The board is two triangles joined together at a common vertex. Each triangle has one horizontal line that dissects it across its breadth. A line also dissects both triangles across their lengths through the common vertex. There are a total of 13 intersection points of which the pieces are played upon.
There are a total of 12 pieces of which 6 pieces are black and 6 pieces are white.

Gameplay and rules:


Players decide what colors to play, and who starts first.



In the beginning, each player's 6 pieces are set up on their respective triangle. The only vacant point is the common vertex which is also the middle point of the board.



A piece is moved one space (in any direction) per turn onto a vacant point following the pattern on the board.



A piece captures an enemy piece by the short leap as in draughts. The player's piece must be adjacent to the enemy piece, leap over it, and land onto a vacant point on the other side. The leap must be in a straight line and follow the pattern on the board. Captured pieces are removed from the board.



Only one piece may be used to move or capture per turn. Players alternate their turns throughout the game.



Mullah Version: If playing the "Mullah" version, then pieces are promoted to Mullah upon reaching the other player's two corners on the first rank. The Mullahs may move any number of unoccupied spaces on the board, and capture an enemy piece from any distance and land any distance behind it provided no other pieces are in between. Multiple captures are allowed. If a non-Mullah piece captures enemy pieces in a sequence of multiple captures, and happens to land on the other player's first rank corners in the process, the player's piece does not become promoted to Mullah. Captures are compulsory.


(Source: Wikipedia)

name: Alles Zauberei
description:
A witchcraft-themed memory game for children.

The 25 cards are printed on both side. One side shows one of five magic objects (elixir, charm, magic hat, spell book, owl) on a white background. The other side shows one of five hiding places (bed, grandfather clock, chest, tripod, fire place) on a coloured background. There is one card for each magic object/background combination.

The cards are laid out on the table, with the coloured hiding place side facing up. The start player rolls the two dice. One die shows what object the players are trying to find. The other specifies what hiding places they players may search to find that object (i.e. if one die shows the owl and the other the bed, the players are allowed to turn over the bed cards to find the owl). If the active player manages to turn over the correct card, he/she gets to take the card and rolls the dice again. His/her turn ends when he/she turns over a wrong card.
The sixth side of the dice is a joker - the lucky player gets to choose the magic object, hiding place, or both (if he/she rolls the joker on both dice).

If a player rolls a combination that has already been found and he/she remembers, he/she gets to steal it from that player.

The game ends when all five cards of one type of hiding place have been claimed. The player with the highest number of cards wins the game.

name: De Unesco-Regenboog
description:
Card game published as a promotion for UNESCO. The tile means 'The Unesco Rainbow'.

The cards feature the letters U N E S C or O. There are eight of each letter and, in the main, they have different coloured backgrounds.

Each player, in turn, may lay a card on the table, that can legally go next to another card. There are none at the start so a U must be placed. After that, you may lay an N next to the U. You can place the N alongside the U or beneath it. The next player may now play a legal letter next to any card on the table. Thus, the word UNESCO will be spelt many times perhaps, horizentally or vertically. Think of it as a UNESCO crossword. If you cannot play a card, you draw one from the stock.

The first player to use all their cards wins the round. The other players total the value of cards left in their hands and take a score for them. Colour matches can matter because this makes a more penal score. After an agreed number of rounds, the player with the lowest score wins.

name: Flinke Rechner
description:
Objective: gain most point by fixing squares
- acting by turns -
During her/his turn each player places a (yellow) meeple on the board (a grid of 5x7 squares), filling one free corner of a square;
as soon as one (or more) square(s) is(are) fully occupied number(s) within is(are) added or subtracted (depending on colour) to/from your account.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: Von Kontinent zu Kontinent
description:
Objective: earn as much money as possible carrying goods with your ship all over the world - game ends after 50 rounds
- acting/moving by turns -
each player buys goods (max 2 - only one per kind of goods) at your starting port; roll the die and move forward; ending at a port you may sell goods (up to your choice) and may buy (whats available - if there is space enough) at the current rate;
if the marker - after each player has finished her/his turn - is moved forward ending on a red space draw as many 'chance cards' as ships are in a port; before next turn all changes have to be executed.
Starting round 50 each player has to move her/his ship to the next port.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Economic, Educational, Nautical, Transportation, Travel

name: Θησαυροκυνηγοί
description:
Ancient ruins of a pyramid were discovered and Huey, Lewey and Dewey along with Dolly are on a mission to dicover the ancient artifacts! Can you help them achive their goal?

Players take turns rolling the dice and they enter the pyramid where they "dig" for treasures in each pile of tiles (using the little cuppings that come with the game) and they stop once they hit a dirt or a a minus tile. Once the pyramid is empty from all the tiles they head back to the finish line and the one with the most points win!

name: München
description:
Quiz game about München (Munich) landmarks.

The board is a map of the city, with a track wandering through it. If a player is the first to land on one of the numbered spaces, he draws the card from the deck of 30 cards and reads out the information on the blue side of the card. Then he turns the card over to see what instructions he has to follow. This are fairly predictable; Miss a turn perhaps, roll the die and move backwards, and so on. The player then takes the card and keeps it in front of him where all the players can see it. The card will have a value ranging from 5 to 30, with the value being commensurate with the penalty value of the instruction on it. If a subsequent player lands on a numbered field that has already been taken, then he treats the space as a normal space without number.

When the numbered space 30 has been reached, that player has finished. The others play on. When all the players have reached the 30 space, the 'won' cards are added up and the winner is the one with the most points.

name: Musi-Matics and Musi-Winks
description:
"Two sitting down round games for everyone" as the box says. But I have a mint box and contents, all the cards are still joined at the perforations, but the rules only relate to Musi-Winks. So Musi-Matics will not be described here.

MUSI-WINKS
A Round Game for Everyone
In each packet are,
TEN HAPPY SAM FACES, TEN MOURNFUL MICK FACES and THREE WINKER WILLY left and right EYES. They are perforated so as to be torn into a total of 86 small cards.
As the name implies the game is best played to music and a piano, gramophone or other music should be available.

INSTRUCTIONS TO THE M.C.
Shuffle the 86 small cards and put the pack into an elastic band. Ask the players to sit or stand in a circle and when the music starts the pack is passed round. At intervals the music is stopped and on each occasion 3 (more or less according to the time available) players commencing with the one holding the pack take the top card. When the music recommences the pack is passed on by the last player to draw a card and play continues until all the cards are used up. Twelve players would each have on the average about 7 cards.
Each player then proceeds to make up complete faces, observing the following rules:
1. A Winker Willy Eye (left or right, but only the appropriate one) can be used to make a complete face with Happy Sam and Mournful Mick Cards, mixed if necessary although it is advantageous not to do so.
2. If a Winker Willy. Eye is not used then Happy Sam faces must be made up entirely of Happy Sam Cards; likewise for Mournful Mick faces.
3. Any player holding a Winker Willy Eye may exchange it with any other player for three other cards.
4. Only ONE Winker Willy Eye can be used in making up a face.

SCORING—
Complete Faces—
A face made up of 1 WINKER WILLY EYE and 3 HAPPY SAM CARDS or 3 MOURNFUL MICK CARDS ... 10 points
A face made up of 1 WINKER WILLY EYE and mixed HAPPY SAM and MOURNFUL MICK CARDS ... ... 8 points
A complete HAPPY SAM FACE ... . 5 points
A complete MOURNFUL MICK FACE . 5 points
Features—
Odd cards are valued as follows—
A complete MOUTH made up of HAPPY SAM OR MOURNFUL MICK CARDS or both .... 2 points
AN EYE ... 1 point

The winner is the player scoring the highest number of points.

name: Test Match Game
description:
Game found in The New Book of Games, circa 1950. Two boards are provided, one for the batting side and one for the bowling side.

Opening batsmen, before beginning play, are allotted a colour, either red or white. When a batsman is out, the next batsman in takes the colour just vacated.
One counter is used for batting and one for bowling. These are placed on the squares marked “Start”.

To start play, the bowler throws the dice and moves his counter forward the number of spaces indicated by the throw. Should he fall on a red square, the “ball” is considered to be playable and the batsman is enabled to make a scoring stroke. He does this by throwing the dice and moving forward the number of squares on the batting chart thus indicated. The number of runs shown on the square is credited to the batsman on whose colour the counter is lying after the move is completed.

If the bowling counter falls on a wicket-taking square, the batsman who is out is the one whose coloured square is occupied by the batting counter. After taking a wicket the bowler bowls again before the batsman can make a stroke. Should the bowling counter fall on a square marked “extras”, these runs are credited to the batting side, but the batsmen make no stroke, and therefore the bowler must play again.

Batsmen cannot be out when lying on the square marked “Start”. It is a simple matter to work out the averages of all the different batsmen, and if bowling averages are also wanted, six throws of the dice would constitute an “over”.

Each of the two players controls a team of 11 batsmen, two of whom must always be batting at the same time. When 10 wickets have fallen the innings is considered closed, so that one batsman is left “ not out.”

name: More Well-known Advertisements
description:
Party game that features some nice nostalgic British advertisements.

The host puts the 18 advert cards around the room and each player gets a card to record their answers. When the host thinks that enough time has gone by, he calls 'Time'. Everyone hands their answer sheet in and the one with the most correct answers wins.

Products featured mix well-known with obscure (to modern minds anyway).

name: Comic-Cars Walt Disney Grand Prix
description:
"Preparations"

Next to start the first game, you have to carefully remove the figurines carved in cartons, which are then inserted in the transparent base. Each participant chooses prpopria figurine.
All figurines are placed on the starting.

"Goal of the game"
The aim of game is to get there the first to finish with your cards.

"Rules of the Game"

The youngest player starts the game, and pulls dice first. The figurines are moved so many square, how many points are made with dice: If a player has pulled a "five", cause to your figurine of five steps. If a player arrives with his figurine on a square occupied by the figure of a player, they can be reached both on the square; Then we go on a square can stay two or more figures, without one should "go away" or "eliminate" other.
But that's not all, because when they leave Mickey Mouse, Donald Duck and company, there is always something! There are, for example, the red square, coming on as you always have surprises.
When a figure at the end of its move, it stops on one of these "red square", you will immediately carry out the provisions it has prescribed.
The eight red square have the following meaning:

Square 4: you forgot to pay "entry in the race!" Get back to square one! when it reaches your next turn, you will have to start over.

Square 9: What a disgrace! You have a flat tire! To replace the wheel must remain stationary for a turn to play!

Square 13: Due to the great nervous tension, you went off the track and forced to follow the path of emergency marked with orange. To square 22 can finally get back on track and continue running normally.

Square 17: As every driver intelligent and well informed, you are able to skillfully exploit the wake of the other players. So roll the dice again.

Square 24: are you afraid of this journey full of twists and you're forced to slow down. You may proceed only if the dice with one or two shots

Square 32: too fast! You drifter and lost valuable time. You can re-rolling the dice only when you passed by at least one competitor. If you are already in last place, then you can proceed to the game normally.

Square 35: other drawbacks! Always proceeding at full throttle, you have used too much fuel and your tank is now empty. To refuel you are forced to stop in the pits for a turn.

"End of the game"
The player who first comes to Goal with his figurine won the game. It is not necessary to come and stop right on the destination square, if the score of the dice is higher than necessary, unnecessary steps are not counted.
The game continues until the last competitor has crossed the finish line.
publishers: Otto Maier Verlag, The Walt Disney Company Italia

name: Open Sesame
description:
In this card game players try to be the first to form a sequence of cards reading "OPEN SESAME" in the one colour whilst taking care that the "40 Thieves" don't get the phrase first.

If playing for points, the first player to 1001 wins.

name: Hond-opoly
description:
The game looks like the real Monopoly, but totally focused on the animal theme. In dog-opoly you buy for example different breeds where you can place a doghouse or dog bone later in the game.

Watch out that you do not end up in the shelter or to pay a fine because you have fleas!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: merk's
description:
Objective: identify as many as possible of the cards shown to you
- acting by turns -
the pile of (72) cards is shuffled; a certain amount (depending on difficulty level) of cards is faced up and quickly turned down again. Active player must mark (with red piles) as many symbols on the board as thought being shown. Each matching symbol gives a victory point, a non matching ones a malus.
next player's turn..

name: Warlords of Rhaemar
description:
In Warlords of Rhaemar your Warlords face off against other mighty Warlords. Choose your equipment wisely and you may just come out ahead.

This is a card based equipment strategy game. You draw or draft your Warlords and then draw from the 4 equipment decks. Each round you choose a Warlord to play and then equip them with mighty artifacts or lash out at your foes with horrible curses. Surviving warlords are scored at the end of the round and a new round takes place until every player has been starting player. After the final round, the player with the most victory points is the Ultimate Warlord!

name: Trivial Birmingham
description:
This is a set of trivia questions about Birmingham, Michigan and surrounding area intended for play with Trivial Pursuit board, pieces and rules. Birmingham is a northern suburb of Detroit. Trivial Birmingham has six categories.

Business (Blue) - Local retailers and other merchants, past and present.
Civics (Orange) - Area government, education and community services.
Geography (Green) - Streets and other landmarks of Birmingham and surrounding Oakland County area.
History (Yellow) - People, places and events that shaped Birmingham.
Leisure (Brown) - Entertainment, the arts, sports, restaurants and other leisure time trivia.
Michigania (Pink) - Facts from all categories, about Detroit and the entire State of Michigan.

name: Sound Memory
description:
A modern twist on the traditional game of Memory. THere are 24 tiles featuring 12 pairs. The pairs are represented by appropriate sounds on the electric gadget (who is called Marvin the Mouse).

The tiles are placed face down on the table and shuffled around. In a turn, a player presses the Green Arrow button on Marvin and a random sound will be heard. Now the player must look for the pair related to that sound. If successful, the player keeps the pair and presses the blue button on Marvin so that the same sound will not feature any more in the current game.

The 12 sounds are:
Cat, Thunderstorm, Road-Drill, Church Bell, Dog, Children, Wind, Birds singing, Rain, Car-Horn, Barrel Organ and Footsteps.

The winner is the player with the most tiles after all the tiles have been matched.

name: Monopoly: Isle of Anglesey
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Isle of Anglesey, in the UK.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rugrats
description:
Promotional game issued by Singapore Airlines.

Four games are described that can be played with the cards.

Game 1 is Rugrats Match-Up and is played like Pairs in Britain but like Memory in the rest of Europe.
Game 2 is Look for the Rugrats! Each player rolls the die (that has to be assembled) to see which Rugrat they are for that round. All the cards are laid out face-down. The seemingly same card backs actually hide an image of one of the Rugrats, and you have to use the special viewer to see it. So it is a race to find your Rugrat as each player searches at the same time. First to find their Rugrat claims the card and then the die is used again to determine which character you are for round 2, and so on. The player who wins the most cards, wins.
Game 3 is Rugrats Hideout. Players draw one card each which they can look at but must keep secret. Players take turns to ask 3 questions to try to find clues as to which card your opponent holds. If you guess the most correct answers, you win.
Game 4 is Rugrats Showdown. This is played like Slap Jack.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Monopoly: Liège
description: The famous Monopoly game. In this version you can buy, sell and trade the property of the Belgium city Liège (aka Luik/Lüttich).
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: Quickfunds Dubai
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Quickfunds Dubai, a company located in Germany.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Monopoly: The Beatles Yellow Submarine
description:
ALL ABOARD THE YELLOW SUBMARINE!

Travel 80,000 leagues under the sea to the unearthly paradise known as Pepperland in this colorful Yellow Submarine edition of MONOPOLY. All you need is love to help The Beatles battle the Blue Meanies as you buy, sell and trade your way through the Sea of Science, the Headlands, Nowhere Land, the Sea of Holes and more.

Ad hoc, ad loc, and quid pro quo! So little time! Advance to Go!

Monopoly, the classic game of property trading with a Beatles theme.

Game includes 6 collectible pewter tokens; Yellow Submarine, Dreadful Flying Glove, Jeremy Hillary Boob, Love Sign, Sgt. Pepper Drum, Old Fred
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Sewer Battle Game
description:
Master Splinter has sent the Turtles out to get some Pizza for dinner. While traveling in the sewers, they are attacked by the evil Shredder and his minions!

Game Objective: Be the first player to get your Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle back to Sewer Lair space first!

Game Play: Players spin the Turtle Spinner and move the indicated amount show along the board path. Bad Guys move at the beginning of each players turn. If a Bad Guy lands on a space with a player’s Ninja Turtle a battle will take place.

Starting the Game: Get ready for some serious Turtle Action as you fight your way to getting some Pizza! It’s Cowabunga Time Dude!!

Turn Summary: The player next to Turtle player spins the Bad Guys Spinner and moves the indicated Bad Guy shown on the spinner. Example: If spinner arrow lands on 1 or 3, then the Shredder pawn will be moved the number spaces towards the player’s Turtle pawns. If a Bad Guy lands on a space with a player’s Ninja Turtle a battle will take place.

Winning the Game: The first player to their Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtle back to Sewer Lair space wins!
categories: Children's Game, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Party Pigs
description:
[From the box]
A card game for the swine in all of us

Party Pigs may be played with friends or any other group of swine. To win you will want to scarf up the most points by cleverly combining the cards in hoof (hand) with those in the pig pen (community cards) to make the best piggy poker hands possible. While you are busy scarfing up points you will need to keep a sharp look out that some scheming pig doesn't stick you with the Dirty Swine card. An evening of pleasure for two to six piggies.

There's also a 9-card solo puzzle of the same name and vaguely similar box front art, which comes in a box about the size of a 2-deck card game and thus may be mistaken for a boardgame at a quick glance.
publishers: Heye Verlag, The Game Works, Inc.

name: Sicher ist sicher
description:
Players are on vacation by car. They start with their pawn at the parking lot. They advance by roll of the dice. All players must go to one of the 6 vacation spaces and spend money there. At certain spaces, they can buy a card ("Ausweis") which will help against bad events (avoid paying money e.g.). Most important is the membership card of the ADAC. A player who spends his vacation in a location of the ADAC will be paid for his next dice roll.
After an agreed time, all players head for the parking lot. In order of arrival, they receive a certain amount of money. The richest player wins.
Content:
board, 6x10 cards (Ausweiskarten), 48 event cards, 6 pawns, 2 dice, playing money, rules
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Magic Sport Kids
description:
Card game published by a German private health care company.

Deal out all the cards. You must play a card to the middle of the table if you can. A legal card to play is any card to a sport if that sport has never been played before. Or a legal play is to play the next card to a card already on the table but the card played must be the number above the sport card you want to play or the one under:
For example:
Let us say that on the table is No. 4 Watersport. A legal play to this card would be the Watersport card numbered 5 or 3. If one of these is played, the next player could play a Watersport card if he chose, provided it was numbered one below or one up again. There is one Champion card which serves as a Joker.

When a card is played by any player, score the points for that player on the card (same as the number) and record this on a score-sheet. The cards rank from 1 to 6 and there are 5 different sports possible in play.

The winner is the first to use all their cards.

name: Ich lerne Naturkunde
description:
Young children's educational game.

There are 12 different mini-boards, each consisting of five jigsaw-type pieces. There are five versions of play which can be intended for different age groups. All the games though relate to collecting pieces and forming complete boards. The games range from very simple where the players do little more than to complete 5 mini-boards each. The gameplay is negligible, Mum just piles up the pieces and then the children look for the pieces they are interest in.

And so each game adds a little more gameplay, ending with a game for three players where the pieces are traded back and forth. The winner is still the one who completes their assigned boards first.

name: Buffalo Round-Up Game
description:
Game that appeared in the 1992 children's annual, The Desperate Dan Book. The rules:

Howdy, folks.
It’s the Cactusville Cattle Market and the local ranch owners are in town to buy up cattle. The biggest buy is a herd of buffalo which has been split amongst four neighbouring farmers. You have each been hired by one of the farmers, to get his share of the herd home first.
So let’s get them steers a’rollin’!

This is a game for two to four players.
You will need a dice and coloured counters (coloured pieces of card will do just as well). Each player must start on their own coloured circle in the middle, the highest roll of the dice deciding who goes first. The players must follow their coloured arrow and go round the board in an anti-clockwise direction. If they land on a square with instructions on it they must follow these instructions. The winner is the first to get his or her coloured counter to the ranch of the same colour.

(A longer version of the game can be , played where each player has an equal amount of counters. When each throws, they can then decide which counter to move. The winner here shall be the one to get all their counters home!)
categories: American West, Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Century 21-opoly
description:
Century 21-opoly is a marketing/promotional board game released by Century 21 Real Estate. It is a derivative of Monopoly and its game play is identical to Monopoly in most respects.

The primary difference is that the properties, utilities, cards, etc. are oriented to the Century 21 Real Estate corporation. Aside from this, using the roll-and-move mechanic, players buy properties, build houses and hotels, and collect rent from fellow players. The player who doesn't go bankrupt is the winner.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Champion of the Great Horse-Race
description:
CHAMPION, of the great race, is the game where all participants can win with their favorite horses.
An exciting race at a gallop or obstacle course! Who cut the finish line first? The ideal way to play in a fun and relaxing.

In the game each player receives a race horse, a horse stable and Derby Dollar 25,000 as initial capital.
During the game you have to overcome obstacles and ditches and fields of action you can win or lose a lot of money.
The "Champion" will be the one who will succeed the first to bring all 6 horses in his stable!
At the beginning of the race you can bet on a horse as the winner of the race and whoever comes first, with the payout will buy a new horse at the Derby-Office!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Educational, Racing
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Smarticulation Language Edition I
description:
The game consists of 40 Challenge cards. Each card has one Primary Challenge and three Bonus Challenges.
The challenges come in four types: 1. Out on a Limerick --- Fill in the blank at the end of the limerick with the correct Greek or Latin prefix.
2. On the Road --- Identify the author of each imagined diary entry, and the work of fiction he or she comes from.
3. The Eschewbox --- Correct the grammatical errors. The number of such errors is in parentheses at the end of the challenge.
4. Rooted Out --- Replace the bracketed words in the challenge with one of the multiple choice answers. The bracketed words essentially are a definition of the answer.
Players take turns being the reader, with the other players, beginning in a clockwise direction from the reader, attempting to answer the Primary Challenge. The first player to answer correctly selects a bonus challenge. If he cannot answer it, then the next player gets a chance, and so on. Each correct Primary Challenge answer is worth two points, and each correct Bonus Challenge answer is worth one point. The first player to reach 10 points wins.

name: Ich spiele es
description:
During the Wiener Spielefest, "Spieleberater" move around to explain games to the visitors.

Simple cooperative game for kids: Move any pawn, but not the one moved by the previous player and not the one actually forbidden to the next hidden tile. Reveal it (it shows a part of a board game) and place it onto the appropriate picture. If you pass a clock symbol by moving, add 1 hour on the clock. All children win if completed all games before 9 "game hours".

advanced competitive game for families: In addition, all players start with movement points they spend during their turn. If a player adds a picture tile, he will get 3 or 5 victory points (by chance). Moving tiles not spent count 1 victory point at the end in addition.

Was added to a description of recommended games available in Austria

name: Rob Delaney's War of Words
description:
Rob Delaney's War of Words is a party game based on the tweets of Rob Delany, who has been named "Funniest Person on Twitter" by a number of media organizations. In the game, players are competing to be the first to cross a finish line, and they advance by doing well in three types of competitions, with the type largely being determined by the space on the game board where a playing piece is located:


"This Means War!" – On this space, the active player duels an opponent with each of them reading a Delaney tweet and the other players voting on who presented the line best.



"Firing Blanks" – The active player reads most of a tweet, but leaves a BLANK in the text. The other players each suggest a word or phrase to fill in the blank; whoever the active player judges best moves ahead two spaces, while this player moves ahead one space for each answer that he matches with an opponent.



"Loaded Questions" – This works similar to the previous category, but players are submitting answers to questions based on tweets.


Whoever makes it around the track first – whether through an exact die roll at the start of a turn or spaces advanced thanks to doing well on a challenge – wins!

name: Donald Duck Big Game Box
description:
Consist of 20 different games that can be played with your favorite Disney characters. Choose from trail games, skill games, checker games, races, a maze, and solitaire games.

Components:
- Gamesheet
- Spinner
- 4 Plastic Playing Pieces
- Die
- 36 Plastic Discs
- Instructions

name: diZe
description:
In diZe you are the last hope of humanity, ravaged by a zombie epidemic that has returned the dead to life. Your mission is to kill all those nasty undead and bring peace to the world.

diZe is a solo dice game for one player with a duration of ten minutes. Your goal is to capture and execute all zombies. At least, you must kill as many of the undead as you can.

The game components are 20 dice that represent both zombies and humans. diZe is a press your luck game. You will make successive dice rolls required by the game and use dice values to kill zombies or infect humans.

name: Tuintopia
description:
In the Dutch game of 'Tuintopia' you will be building a garden.

The game is a strategic game in which you and your opponents build together on the same garden, trying to score as many points as you can.

You will score points by making connections, i.e. a waterpump delivers water to a vegetable garden (which needs water to grow the vegetables) and then you gain one point.

name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles ‘Turtle Power' Trading Card Game
description: Panini are proud to announce the launch of their exciting new trading card game based on the legendary cartoon from Nickelodeon; Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles. The franchise is back with a brand new look and awesome new content and Panini's all-new trading card game will draw on this and is sure to be a huge hit with Turtles fans. Featuring all of the lead characters, the collection will follow the Turtles as they fight to clean up the streets of New York and defend innocent citizens from Shredder and The Kraang. The collection will boast a host of fantastic trading cards, limited edition cards, collector's binder and game board for collectors to play and trade with each other.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Flag Frenzy USA
description:
In Flag Frenzy USA, players try to match flags on cards in their hands with flags on the table, emptying their personal card deck before anyone else can.

Flag Frenzy USA consists of 49 flag cards and 10 region cards (two each of West, South, Northeast, Midwest and Islands); each flag card shows eight state flags, and any two flag cards have exactly one flag in common, similar to the cards in Catch the Match and Spot It!

Game play differs from those titles, however, as two cards are placed face-up on the table at the start of play while the remainder of the deck is distributed evenly among the players. All players take two cards in hand, then everyone simultaneously tries to play onto the face-up cards by spotting the matching flag and giving its state's name when playing the card. With a region card, the player has to name a flag in the region being played.

After playing one or two cards, the player refills her hand. The first player to play all of the cards in her deck wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Real-time

name: Narvik 1940
description:
"Narvik 1940" simulates the battle fought in april/may 1940 between German forces that inavded Norway and Norwegian army supported by ally expeditionary corps, formed with polish, english and french units.

Game was attachted to the 3rd issue of "Dragon Strateg" magazine and published in 1997.

"Narvik 1940" uses "Bitwy Drugiej Wojny Światowej" system rules.

name: Trishogi
description:
Trishogi is a shogi variant for two players. The gameboard comprises 9×10 interlocking triangular cells. The game is in all respects the same as shogi, except that piece moves have been transfigured for the triangular board-cell geometry.

Source: Wikipedia

name: Gundam War Nex-A
description:
The successor of the Gundam War CCG. Although most mechanics are still similar, Gundam War Nex-A was designed as the next "age" of the CCG, featuring a different card backs and streamlined rules.

As the namesake implies, players take control of the various Mobile Suits and pilots of the different Gundam series. In addition to the previous shows, such as the ones set in the Universal Century like Zeta and Char's Counterattack, the game also features the alternate timeline series, such as Wing, 00, Turn-A and, the newest addition, Gundam Age.

Similar to Gundam War, combat in Gundam War Nex-A is still divided into two zones, Earth and Space, with the players able to designate different Units into squads. Players attack one another in turn, attempting to deplete each others' Nation Pile(Draw deck), in order to win. Character or Operation cards can be placed on existing Units, giving the assigned Mobile Suit or Armor a bonus in its stats or additional effects. Command cards also give one time effects which players may trigger during their appropriate phases. Ace cards, the rarest card type typically found in boosters, combine Units and Characters into one cost efficient card.

Unlike Gundam War however, Gundam War Nex-A no longer has Generation(Resource) cards. Instead, each card can be played as a resource. Further, Roll-ing(Tapping/activating) a card may now include a cost in resources. Alternatively, players have the option of using Graphic card, which combines resource generation, buffing and defense into one card.

Though the card backs of Gundam War Nex-A are different from Gundam War, Gundam War cards can still be converted for use in Gundam War Nex-A, though with a penalty or drawback of sorts.

Gundam War Nex-A is only available in Japanese.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Science Fiction
mechanics: Area Movement, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: City of Gears: Shadows in the Steam
description:
The City of Gears holds many secrets.

One of the more persistent rumors is that a band of outcast engineers lives deep within the rusted bowels of the city.

No one knows if these mysterious souls exist to help or cause injury...or if they are nothing more than SHADOWS IN THE STEAM...


This CITY OF GEARS expansion pack adds a thrilling new card mechanic to the gameplay. The expansion comes with 35 cards.

Now, when a a player rolls the Production Dice at the start of his turn and end up with blank results, he may draw one "Shadows in the Steam" card. This cards have different effects that might benefit the player or hinder his opponents.

A player may hold up to three cards in his hand and only one card can be drawn at a time, regardless of how many blank faces the player has rolled.
categories: City Building, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Worker Placement

name: Vyazma or Bust: An Eastern Front Campaign & Scenario Pack I Ain't Been Shot, Mum!
description: June 1941, and the Russian hammer smites against the Soviet Union. Panzers stream eastwards amid fierce fighting as the Soviet Revolution fights for its very existance. Set amid the turmoil of Autumn of that year Rob Avery foucsses on the battles that were fought on the Smolensk-Vyazma axis, and presents nineteen scenarios for IABSM in a linked campaign format that may be played time and again with different permutations.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: Das kleine Liebesquiz
description:
A small trivia game about love with 100 questions. The game itself looks like a notebook (with spiral binding).

Each page contains two questions with multiple choice answers; the back side tells the correct answer and provides additional information.

name: Dwarves and Dragon
description:
Dragon's gold is the best gold! The Dwarves know that, and so, when asked to make a golden dornik for the Trollgod, they set out to get some gold from Arngaxx the Dragon. Dragons hate to give up their gold, and they rather enjoy eating dwarves. There is no way the two sides can come to a mutually satisfying agreement.

The dwarf player moves his three dwarf pieces into the dragon's lair, using checkers like movement on a gridded map of the dragon's lair, and tries to carry off pieces of the dragon's gold. Meanwhile the dragon player moves the dragon, using checkers-like movement, in an attempt to eat the dwarves. The dwarf player wins if he gets three pieces of gold out of the dragon's lair. The dragon wins if he kills all three of the dwarves.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Player Powers

name: Nightmare: The Trading Card Game
description:
Nightmare is a Trading Card Game. ( TCG/CCG )

Set in a world of shared nightmares and featuring 13 different Phobias to deploy against your own subconscious and that of your enemies, Nightmare will test your ability to remain focused and escape your fears.

Deploy strategy, planning, and a bit of Delusion before you lose your soul forever in an experience that combines the familiar with the never before seen in a compelling new twist on TCG gaming.

What Makes Nightmare Different?
Nightmare isn't your typical cookie cutter clone.

Nightmare shares some very fundamental TCG conventions with other games but the core structure and setting is completely unique.

We're going to explain everything as we go along, but what you're in for can best be described as "wicked" in every sense of the word.

Nightmare will also feature Achievements, DLC, and many more world first features! There's even a Novel Length Storyline planned!

About the Game Structure
There are 121 different game cards.

Players design and build a single deck made up of a certain number of cards.

Card Types
Nightmare doesn't have "spells" and "creatures", it features Phobias, Entities, Delusions, Doubts, Uncertainties, Guilts, Synaptic Misfires, Paranoia's, and Entropies.

Game Overview
At the beginning of a game, players shuffle their decks (called “Mind”) thoroughly and draw cards.

Players decide who goes first, by random selection.Each player may place one Delusion per turn.

Play progresses through turns and stages until one player loses their all of their Lucidity, thus losing the game or achieves 100 Lucidity. If there are more than 2 players, the last player still holding on to some Lucidity is the winner and buys their sanity with the souls of their opponents or achieves 100 Lucidity.

This is just the surface. Players will have to contend with Madness, Repression, and Regression in their struggle to escape their Nightmare.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Horror, Mythology
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: 3D Dominos
description: 3D Dominos is a game played with 32 rectangular prisms made up of two cubes fused together, then colored on the exposed faces in one of two colors. Under pressure of a sand timer, players try to match up faces on a growing three dimensional structure, maximizing their scores by matching the most faces in the most difficult places. In addition to the pieces and sand timer, the game includes a serpentine scoreboard and scoring tokens in four player colors.
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Tile Placement

name: Gran Premio de Monza
description:
¡Welcome to Monza international circuit, where the best pilots of the world race for formula 1 great prize! As a real pilot, you'll have to use your reflexes and choose quickly the cards that allow you to accelerate and advance in the race. But you must be precise, you're running at a speed of 250 km/h and a bad decission could take you off the track. ¡Speed up, advance and win in this speedy tabletop game!

Contents:

54 80 x 80 mm cards
1 rulebook

¡Bienvenido al circuito internacional de Monza, donde los mejores pilotos del mundo compiten por el gran premio de la fórmula uno! Como un verdadero piloto, deberás utilizar tus reflejos y elegir rápidamente las cartas que te permitan acelerar y avanzar en la carrera. Pero deberás ser preciso, ya que corres a 250 kilómetros por hora y una mala decisión te hará salir de la pista. ¡Acelera, avanza y gana en este velocísimo juego de mesa!

Contenido del juego:

54 tarjetas de 80 x 80 mm
1 reglas de juego

name: Wielki Skarb
description:
The goal is to bring the treasure of Wieliczka Salt Mine to the surface. To get the treasure you must bring 10 groszes to the treasure chamber. You get treasure by meeting workers form the mine, legendary creatures and characters from the mine or by answer questions about the mine.

The game is a typical roll and move game where you move one pawn and following the instructions on the square you land on.

name: Länderkenner
description:
Geography cardgame. There are name of the country and flag in face-up side and information about the different categories in face-down of the card.
Player must place the top card from the deck in any category pile (continent or climate zone categories etc.)
Then he turns the card around and checks if it is correct pile to score a point-chip.
If deck is exhausted the player with the most chips wins.

name: Logicon
description:
From rules (translated):

In Harkinta-peli (Consideration) you play with differences: shapes, colors, sizes and thicknesses. Each play tile has their own special properties and each property gives one point. No tile is exactly the same as another. In this game a child can learn with an adult to see the differences in the tiles and in which way a tile differs from one or more other tiles.

Observation capabilities develop and after a few rehearse tries the player is able to pick out the best place for a tile on the board so that it differs as much as possible from the previous tiles, at the same time making it harder for the other players to find good placements, thus keeping them from gaining points.

In this game you have to think forward, plan your next move and rethink your moves when your opponents do not play a tile that would've given the most points.

(Year published is a guess based on picture)
publishers: Berliner Spielkarten, Orda Industries Ltd., Semper

name: Arcade Revival
description:
2 to 4 Players relive the golden age of American arcades by starting their own. Each round vintage arcade equipment cards like pinball machines, foosball, ping pong, pool tables and video game machines are auctioned off. Players must manage which machines make them money and how much space the equipment takes up in their rented back rooms. "High score" cards are earned each round by players who best use the space available to them or earn the most tokens.

Each round players must: adjust which equipment cards they will use and what goes into storage... Repair equipment that is out of order,.. And choose whether to advertise. Tokens are earned each pay day by the roll of dice. Some equipment will earn more tokens and some offer a greater probability of earning. Players also decide each round to purchase newly available equipment, or steal opponents equipment that they have in storage. The game ends when a player collects 11 or more high score cards.

name: Ko-No-Ha
description: Ko-No-Ha (The Tree's Leaves) is a wooden dexterity game themed around a tree and its leaves. The game comes with a wooden tree stand, leaf-base and 30 wooden leaves of three different shapes (fan-shaped, diamond-shaped and spade-shaped) and three colours (red, green and yellow). Players take turns rolling a pair of special dice. One die has the three colours on it and each color appears twice. The other die has the following numbers on it: 1,1,1,2,2,3. After rolling both of these dice the player must combine the number and colour. The player must then place the total number of correspondingly coloured leaves on the leaf-base. The player can place the leaves in any fashion, so long as they do not fall from the tree-base. Once finished the player pass the dice to the next player (clock-wise order) and that person repeats the aforementioned steps. If during the leaf placement stage any of the leaves fall off the tree the player doing the placing loses the game. All players managing to complete all leaf placement stages successfully win the game. Alternatively, if all other players fail during the leaf placement stage, the remaining player wins.

name: Jeu des Retrouvailles
description:
From the box: "471 ans d'histoire de l'Acadie. Jeu éducatif pour tous les âges. 471 questions et réponses."

This trivia game for 2 to 4 players was published in celebration of the First World Acadian Congress held in South-East New Brunswick, Canada in 1994. Beginning at the commemorative Acadian church at Grand Pré, Nova Scotia, players roll a d6 and move their tokens along four tracks on a map taking them through the main Acadian settlement areas in North Eastern North America. Depending on the colour of the space a player lands on, she must answer correctly a trivia question about one of three themes in Acadian history: blue for dates, white for people and red for places. When falling on a yellow space, players re-roll. The first player to reach South Eastern New Brunswick, where the first "Retrouvailles" took place in 1994, wins.

name: Quest for Destiny
description:
Quest for Destiny is a card-laying game and characters in the game are based on medieval fantasy.

Players start with four Cards (either Spell or Area Cards) and control a Character Card. The Characters will start at the corner of a 7x7 imaginary grid. The aim of the game is to lay Area Cards to build a path and move towards the Objective Card in the middle. The first player who reaches the Objective Card wins the game.

During each player's turn, he has three actions. Firstly, he can play either an Area or Spell Card; or discard and draw a new card. Area Cards allow you to progress towards the middle. Spell Cards aid your progression or hinder your opponents' progression. Secondly, he can move his Character Card into an adjacent unoccupied Area if an Area card is played. Lastly, he draws cards back to a hand size of four.
mechanics: Area Movement, Network and Route Building

name: Hazards
description:
A gambling game played during Colonial times in the US. It plays with 2 standard dice and is similar to Craps.

The roller first rolls to establish their target number, rerolling until they get 5/6/7/8/9. Then there is a special roll, on which there are extra instant-win and instant-loss values. Then there is a roll to determine the hazard number (rerolling if the target number comes up). Then the roller keeps rolling until they hit their target (and win) or the hazard (and lose).

During the special second roll, there are extra rules:
- if you roll your target number, you win
- if you roll 12, you win if your target number is 8
- if you roll 11, you win if your target number is 7
- if you roll 2 or 3, you lose

The odds are stacked solidly in the roller's favor.

name: Märchenball
description: In Märchenball, the princesses have come from across the country to the fairy tale ball. Each princess wants to dance with Prince Charming, so he's a busy guy on the dance floor. Find your way into his arms, though, and you'll receive a star from him as a thank you. The first princess to collect four stars from Prince Charming has also won his heart — and the game!

name: Hexago
description:
Hexago is a variant of Go played on a hex grid (of undefined size and shape, although an overall hexagonal shape for the board is suggested). Stones are played on the spaces, not the intersections.

The rules are a bit different from those of Go. Hexago has no ko rule and no cutting. Most importantly, players cannot pass, and in fact are required to fill in their own eyes if no other moves are available.

The rules were published in Games & Puzzles #5 (September 1972).

name: Slasher
description:
When the name of the game is horror; SLASHER will leave you in stitches!

SLASHER is a game of dark humor which concerns itself with the slice-n-dice brand of horror film that seems to be so popular in today's cinema. The game centers on the making of a film about an evil Slasher who is plaguing the fraternities of a college campus.
