The players, who each represent one of the besieged fraternities, provide the action and plot twists to our ill fated story. The winner of the game emerges as the hero-/heroine of our spine chilling, shriek filled, gore-o-matic tale.

name: Quests
description:
Do you have what it takes to be a knight of the round table?

King Arthur has an opening in his legendary roster of heroes! With just the right combination of strength, fortitude, and originality, the job is yours!
Accept His Majesty's quests, make the realm a better place, and secure your name in the history books... before your rivals get a chance!

Each turn players roll dice and commit them to match different quests from the king. Collect sets of matching colored quests or one of each to win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: NFL Rush Zone Trading Card Game
description:
You have been chosen to be an NFL Rush Zone Guardian. Join a team of brave Guardians, defending the Core and battling on the gridiron. Suit up Guardian, and gather your team of Rusherz and prepare to battle. Make sure to power up your team of Rusherz with the 32 team Megacores and your collection of PowerStickerz – all in your quest to score the most Touchdowns!

Each game consists of 4 quarters, with 2 battles in each quarter. In every quarter, each player starts one battle on offense, and one battle on defense. The player with the most TD tokens at the end of the last battle wins.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Sports
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: The Great Adventure Kids Bible Card Game Set
description:
The Great Adventure Kids Bible Card Game Set is a fun-filled and beautifully illustrated system designed to teach children as young as three the "big picture" of salvation history. Kids young and old and adults, too will have fun while learning the story of the Bible.

Instructions for six games are included, from the easier "Memory and "Go Fish" concepts, to the more complex "Rummy," "Crazy Eights," "Doubt It," and "Spoons." These cards are designed to help players learn the progression of the periods of Bible history by color as well as recognize key characters, events and Bible references. Perfect for home, classroom, and religious education settings.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Religious

name: Jogo Código Da Vinci
description:
Um enigma é lançado e você precisa prestar muita atenção nas letras que estão misturadas no tabuleiro para decifrá-lo no tempo da ampulheta. Se achar necessário, peça ajuda a Robert Langdon, que tem dicas essenciais para você. Quanto menos dicas você usar, mais pontos conseguirá marcar e, assim, montar este enigmático quebra-cabeça. São 396 palavras!

O jogo consiste em tentar descobrir, com o menor número possível de dicas, a palavra que será formada pelas letras que foram espalhadas no tabuleiro. Para cada acerto, são concedidos pontos na forma de peças de um quebra cabeça. Quem terminar o quebra cabeça primeiro será o vencedor!


A puzzle is thrown and you need to pay close attention to the letters that are mixed on the board to solve it in the time of the hourglass. If you find it necessary, get help from Robert Langdon, who has essential tips for you. The less tips you use, the more points you will score and, thus, assemble this enigmatic puzzle. There are 396 words!

The game consists in trying to find out, with the least number of hints, the word to be formed with the letters that were thrown on the board. For each right guess, points are granted as pieces of a puzzle. The first to finish the puzzle is the winner!

name: Yamato 2199 Game: Chapter 5 – Raise the Siege
description:
Tactical level wargame based on Japanese animation series Space Battleship Yamato 2199.

Both players are fleet commanders of the Gamilas Empire, and they alternately battle against Terran's space battleship Yamato. When a player engages against the Yamato, their opponent controls the Yamato.

Each turn, players determine initiative. The players take turn managing movement and combat in any order. The movement is affected by facing. The combat is affected by fire power, range, armor and dice.

Each Gamilas fleet has 27 fleet units. Yamato is loneliness, however she is very strong and tough.

The player who sinks the Yamato wins the game.

The game includes a rulebook, a game map, and 50 die-cut counters.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Uni-Spec: A Synergic Auction Game
description:
Uni-Spec (also called Spec in the rules) is played on a 7x7 grid. The grid spaces are purchased one at a time by players; on each turn the active player chooses an unowned space to be sold. If it is one of the spaces on the main diagonals, it has a printed price (from 1-7 units) and the player simply buys it. Otherwise an auction is conducted.

Each space on the board has an intrinsic value of 1, but a group of orthogonally-connected spaces is worth the square of its size.

If players need more money, they can take loans equal to half the value of their owned spaces. The rules for this are a bit unclear (no mention of repayment, for example). Players can also sell spaces back to the bank to acquire cash; such spaces are not resold to players (a fifth color of marker is provided for them).

The game ends when all spaces have been sold. The player with the greatest net worth is the winner.

A few simple variants are provided (e.g., ignore the prices on the main diagonal spaces, don't allow loans, etc.).

name: Turku-peli
description:
Players are citizens of Turku and their mission is to show the city for tourists. They need to move through several sightseeing places and then end in the railway station to finish their mission. First one to complete the round is the winner.

The play area is a stylized map of Turku with several different routes around the city. Players move by rolling a die. Some of the locations are marked with red, and on those locations something special happens and players refer the rulebook.

The game is most likely a fundraiser, several local companies are shown on the map and the special locations have references to them.

name: Pariah
description:
User summary:

A simple he-thinks-that-I-think card game.

Players have a set of cards numbered 1–6, where 6 is the king and 1 is a simple pawn. The back of each card is the Pariah, which is zero.
Each turn, players roll a die each and may play face down any card of that number or lower. All turned face up, and you count number of wins. The King wins over all cards except the fool (2), all other cards win over the fool. If a player has played a card higher than the number he rolled, he cannot turn the card, and it's a Pariah, which loses to all. Each win is awarded 1 point.

Every card has a special power, that usually affects his ability to play next turn. For example, the Pariah allows the player to not roll the die, but choose die result for the next turn.

This is repeated for 5 rounds, which counts as one hand. The player with most points after three hands wins the game.

name: Yumekaki
description:
In Yumekaki, players play cards and tell a story that intertwines together. Cards have special symbols in their drawings that tell the player in what way they should tell their part of the story, e.g., telling the story in ten syllables, creating a dialogue with the items in the art, or telling an unfinished story that the next player must pick up. The game ends when players play a card with a popped bubble indicator the second time.

The game comes in two sets: the Starbox and the Moonbox. They can be combined for a larger game.

name: Aka Fuji
description: Aka Fuji is a dice-based game that uses 15 numbered craft sticks. The sticks have illustrations on either side: a red Mount Fuji on one side, and a blue Mount Fuji on the other. Six cards, separated into three red Mount Fuji cards and three blue, are passed out to players. The players' goal is to use the custom die results to turn the sticks over to the side that matches their card. The player, or team, who first flips all the sticks to the side shown on their card wins.

name: Speelgoedkist
description:
Card game from the Dubbel en dwars series. All cards are printed on both sides. During the game you need both sides.

There are a number of cards with toys on the table. The top card of the discard pile is turned over. Everyone grabs now ASAP cards which comply with the requirements on the card on the discard pile. This Continues till the deck runs out.

The player with the most cards at the end wins the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Die Ketchup Vampire Card Game
description:
A cardgame based on an animated TV-series called "Die Ketchup-Vampire". Game includes 56 playing Cards and is similiar to an old german traditional cardgame called Mau-Mau that is close to the wellknown UNO.
Players will start with 6 cards each and play one card each turn following suit or color. About half of the cards have wellknown rules like "draw 1 or 2 cards", "lose turn", "choose color", but also special rules like "guess card under the magic book card played", or "stop play and play card no matter whose turn it is".

Game ends when one player has played all his cards. Cards still in hand will score negative points.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: KickShot Soccer Strategy Board Game
description:
Described by the Publisher/Designer:

There are One Bra-zillion™ ways to score with KickShot and Rio-lize™ your soccer goals. KickShot® is a board game for 5 year old kids through adults that closely mimics an actual soccer game. Play KickShot with dice, action and referee cards to strategically move the ball across a board, intercept, and score goals. The game supports three levels of play depending on age and desired challenge.

Learn proper ways to execute soccer action with endearing characters
- Move the ball down the pitch with action cards
- Earn referee cards for penalty, corner kicks, offside and direct free kicks
- Advance through three levels of play: kids "grow" from Junior, Warm Up and League Games

KickShot Board Game and all the associated products make ideal birthday and holiday gifts, and fundraisers for soccer clubs and non-profits. The products will surely get the entire family into the spirit of World Cup 2014.

name: Wolf Chess
description:
As in standard chess, White moves first in Wolf Chess and the winning objective is checkmate, but the game is played on a 10x8 game board that contains a number of special pieces. The king, queen, rook, bishops, and pawns move and capture the same as they do in chess. Special pieces and changes to normal chess rules are as follows:


The wolf moves and captures as a chess rook or a chess knight.
The fox moves and captures as a chess bishop or a chess knight.
The nightrider moves and captures as a chess knight extended to make any number of steps in the same direction and in a straight line.
The sergeant moves and captures one step straight or diagonally forward. A sergeant can move, like a chess pawn, a double-step straight forward on its first move.
A pawn (but not a sergeant) may capture an enemy pawn or sergeant en passant.
Pawns and sergeants promote on the last rank to queen, wolf, fox, rook, bishop, nightrider, or knight. Pawns (but not sergeants) have an additional option of promoting to an elephant; the elephant piece, not present in the starting setup, moves and captures as a chess queen or a nightrider.
Wolf Chess has no castling.

name: Wishful Thinking
description:
Will you guess the answers in time, or is that just WISHFUL THINKING™? Let's see how quickly you make the connections in this fun and challenging word guessing game... You have 60 seconds to figure out the three Mystery Words on the card, which all begin with the same letter. Ready?

The Presenter says "Think of words that start with J" and then gives the first Hint: "Voyage". The answer? JOURNEY. If the next Hint is "Shock", say "JOLT". If the final Hint is "Extra-large", say "JUMBO". The more you solve, the more spaces you move on the board. There’s a twist: Opponents bet which Mystery Word you’re least likely to guess - so make them regret it! This quick-thinking and fast-paced game is great fun for everybody.

name: Der bunte Pipifax
description: Players roll a colored die and are allowed to place a piece of the color they rolled on a space of the same color on their "Pipifax", a jester whose clothing they need to fill with pieces.

name: Triangel Domino
description: Players place triangular tiles with colored edges, trying to form squares. However, tiles can only be placed in a way so that adjacent edges have the same color. Some triangles contain apples or pears. Forming squares where all tiles contain the same fruit yields double points.

name: Bimbes
description:
Objective: Be the first arriving at Berlin having successfully collected 8 million Euro (illegal money) for the upcoming elections 2002 in Germany
- acting/moving by turns -
'dark-black' satirical approach describing a world of corruption, bribery... using offshore accounts in bordering countries financing upcoming elections.

Roll & move, draw cards... making up decisions to collect and stash money, make promises and betray others...

Game reflects the political scandal about the German former chancellor Kohl.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hoppsan
description: Each player gets a deck of picture cards. The cards are laid picture down a few meters/feet away from the game board. Then one of the players spins the spinner. The spinner shows the cards the players need to find, and the way the players have to move to their cards. Then the players turn their cards up one by one, and the first one to find the card, shouts "Found it!" This card is placed on the game board, and the next player spins the spinner. The first person who finds enough cards, wins.

name: Scrabble: Disney Theme Park Edition
description: This version of Scrabble mimics the base game of Scrabble with some key differences. Players score bonus points for spelling Disney Themed Words (ie MICKEY or Haunted MANSION), but they also receive cards that they can play to assist them or delay their opponents. Definitely a Disney twist on an old classic.

name: 8-Bit Swordsman: Clash For the Prism of Punishment
description:
The Prism of Punishment awards its bearer with unfathomable strength and power, but it must be earned through a trial of strength and the bloodshed of your opponents (some Human, others not so much). The combatants take turns playing cards for movement around the arena, attacking their opponent, and scoring points. The first player to earn 15 points (and not have Curse: The Second Journey successfully played on them in response) has earned enough Shards to fuse them together to complete the Prism and earn victory!

Features and Components:


4 player tokens
10 rocks which hinder moves/attacks, placed by the players on the field prior to beginning the game.
72 Cards, 2 Types(Equipment cards for moves/attacks, or Curses: cards which hinder opponents while poking fun at/giving a nod to old-school rpgs.)
2 double-sided game mats, printed and designed to form a storage box!
categories: Card Game, Medieval, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Queue, Grid Movement, Open Drafting

name: Glück zu im Salamander-Schuh!
description:
Promotional 'Roll & Move' game. Object: be the first to reach space 50, moving by turns.

Players choose one of the well known comic figures (from the comic Lurchis Abenteuer), throw the die and move forward. When ending a move on a marked space, follow instructions printed/illustrated on the map.

Remarks:
Likely published mid-1950s
Names of the comic figures/tokens: Frosch Hopps, Zwerg Piping, Mäuserich Mäusepiep, Igel Igelmann, Gelbbauchunke Unkerich and - of course 'Lurchi', the salamander;
Game was distributed by Salamander shoe shops. A logo of the local shop was printed on target space.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Racing

name: Grand Tactics: Rise of Novice
description:
From the Kickstarter page:

"Every three years, in the prosperous city of Matilda, an event is held in which the lord of the city will choose the finest and bravest warriors to join the ranks of the Matilda Defenders. This battle tournament tests the team's tactics and strategies to convince the lord and to show the citizens which team is worthy to be part of the renowned Matilda Defenders."

Inspired by a number of tactical games played over the course of our gaming years, including: Tactics Ogre, Front Mission 3, Rhapsody, Disgaea, Vandal Hearts, Vanguard Bandits, and lastly, the game that inspired us the most, Final Fantasy Tactics.

Kill all enemies - the word says it all, simply wipe out all enemies on the battlefield. Protect your leader and defeat the opposing side leader.
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Medieval, Miniatures, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Game of Quoits
description:
Also includes the Game of Archery and Game of Morrice.
Double Sided Game Board opens to full color Game of Quoits board on one side (11” x 9” x 3/4”) and the 2 Games of Archery and Morrice on the other side.

Components: 26 Round Wooden Game Pieces (9 Blue, 9 Natural, 4 Green, 4 Purple).

From the rules:

GAME OF ARCH

Implements - Twelve men, a set of three for each player, and the Double Teetotum. The men represent and are called arrows, and are shot at the target by the proper moves. The object of the game is to see who will make the best shots with his three arrows. All moves are made by the spin of the Teetotum, using the mum of the numbers obtained by the spin, and moving an arrow aver a corresponding number of spaces. Spin for lead. The highest spin plays first. The arrows are first entered according to the spin, beginning st. and counting from the space at the flag-staff. After entering, each player, in turn, advances his arrows ac-cording to his spins, until they reach the target. Any arrow that is carried beyond the target by the spin is a miss, and counts nothing. An arrow is carried beyond the target when there are not enough spaces for it to be moved over, to use up the spin. Each ring of the target represents two spaces, one on each side sf the bull's-eye, as though the target were divided by a vertical (meat its center.

The arrows are moved from the flag-staff to the target as though the whole formed one continuous line of 23 spaces-7 in the target, and 16 outside. As soon as an arrow reaches the target its move is ended. Two or more arrows of the same, or of opponent players, may 'soupy the same space at the same time. The game is ended when all the arrows have reached or missed the target. Each arrow on the outer circle counts 1; on the next ' circle, 2; on the third circle, 3; and, on the bull's-eye, 6.

The player having the largest count wins the game.

GAME OF MORRICE (Nine Men's Morris)

Implements - Eighteen men in two colors; a set of nine for each player. The charming game of Morrice, which closely resembles, and is probably the source of "Go-Bang," is the inside game, laid out in black lines, with circular spaces at the points where the lines cross or intersect each other. The object of each player is to get three of his men in a row, that is, upon the three spaces on any one of the straight black lines. All of the lines are used alike, no distinction being made between the long and the short ones. Play in turn throughout the game, and place or move but one man at a time. The players in turn, first place their men, one at a time, upon any vacant circular space, each trying to get three men in a row, and at the same time playing to prevent his opponent doing so. Thus, a player trying to form a row, will lay down two men upon the same ; but the opponent, if on the lookout, will lay down one of his men on the third space of the same line, and stop him. Sometimes players scatter their men in such a manner, that by laying down a single man, they have two ways by which they can form rows, upon their next turn, and as only one of these can be stopped by the opponent, they necessarily gain a point. Each time that a player, forms a row, he captures and removes One of his opponent's men front the board, but must, if possible, take one that will not break his rows. When all the men have been placed upon the board, one at a time, as above described, the players try to form rows by moving their men from space to space, in any direction. Sat all moves must be along the lines, always moving to the next space. As often as a player forms a row, whether in placing or moving his men, he captures one of his oppoaent's men. As soon as either player loses all but two of his men, he can form no more rows, and therefore loses the games

GAME OF QUOITS

Implements - Sixteen men in four colors—a set for each player, and the Double Teetotum. There are two sets of Quoit spaces, at each side of the board. The first and third players play for one set, and the second and fourth for the other.

Play and spin in turn. The highest spin leads. Use the sum of the numbers indicated by the Teetotum in making the moves, except in case of a doublet, which has its corresponding numbered Quoit space. The first player spins and places his man upon the Quoit space which corresponds to his throw. The others follow in turn playing in the same manner. Four rounds are played in this way, and the score is then made up. The count is as follows : Each man on the hub counts ten ; on a double number, three ; and on the other numbers two. In addition to the above, the man nearest to the hub counts five I the next nearest, three'; and the third, one. If two men hit the same space, the first corner is set back one space, if the rear space is vacant ; if occupied, the man goes for-ward on space, but should this space also be occupied it is removed from the board and does not count for its player. When four rounds have been played, the game is begun anew, and the play continues until some one of the players scores 60, which wins the game. The object of the game may also be to see which will make the highest score in four rounds.

name: Kinto
description:
This educational game consists of 100 cards: twelve 1, 2, 3, 4, addition, subtraction, multiplication and division cards, two "double" cards, one "no addition" card and one "no multiplication" card.

The object of the game is to obtain a total of 15 points by adding, subtracting, multiplying and dividing the points on cards played in front of you, while trying to block other players from reaching 15 points. Each player starts with a hand of 4 cards. On their first turn, each player plays a single point card onto the table in front of themselves to form their pile, and then draws a card from the draw pile to maintain a hand size of 4 cards. On subsequent turns, each player may take one of two actions:
- Play 2 cards (an operation card (addition, subtraction, multiplication or division) and a point card) onto their pile or another player's pile, or
- Discard one of the cards from his/her hand to the discard pile and draw a card from the draw pile.

A scorekeeper is appointed at the beginning of the game, and keeps track of each player's score as they play cards on each player's piles.

The first player to reach 15 points is the winner.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Math

name: New Brunswick Bi-Q
description:
This trivia game was created as a project of Geary Elementary School to celebrate the bicentennial of the Canadian province of New Brunswick.

The game consists of 130 trivia cards covering 5 different categories: Tourist Attractions, Bygone Days, Famous People, Travelogue and Hodge Podge. Each card contains 4 questions, for a total of 520 questions. The game also comes with a single standard 6-sided die and single page of instructions.

No specific age range or number of players is specified. The instructions suggest playing as individuals or teams, while playing to one of two possible win conditions:
- After each correct answer, roll the die and score that many points. The first individual or team to 50 points wins.
OR
- The letters in the words "NEW BRUNSWICK" are assigned numerical values from 1 to 6, as follows: "123 456123456". Thus the number 2 is assigned to the "E" of "NEW" and the "S" of "BRUNSWICK". After each correct answer, roll the die and acquire the corresponding letters in the words "NEW BRUNSWICK". The first player to spell the words "NEW BRUNSWICK" wins.
publishers: H W Wilson Printing Co (1965) Ltd

name: Grammar Girl's Peeve Wars
description:
Peeve Wars is a card game for 2 to 4 players and is appropriate for people of all ages.

The base deck contains 18 individual card designs mixed to make a 72-card playing deck. The goal of the game is to amass a peeve army you use to annoy your opponent(s) to death. You start with 3 cool points. Each time an opponent successfully annoys you, you lose a cool. When you completely lose your cool, you lose the game.

name: The Hunger Games: Catching Fire – Victors Game
description:
The fire has started -- You and the other rebels are here to see that it keeps burning all the way to The Capitol. Using different card combinations to score points, you must gather the most resources to best aid Katniss and the cause... But watch out! One of the other players may be a Capitol spy who will attempt to steal victory from you!

The Catching Fire Victor's Game is an easy-to-learn game of strategy and deduction as players look to maximize the cards that they play while also anticipating the strategies of the other players.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction

name: Ferien in Österreich
description:
The players move their cars according to their dice rolls on the road from the start near Vienna to Schwechat. When they arrive in a city, the players have to answer a question about this city. For the right answer they get a game coin. The Player who gets the most coins wins the game. The first player to reach Schwechat gets the 3rd place, if he hasn't enough coins to get the 1st or 2nd place.

This game was published in the 1950s or 1960s.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Word's Out
description:
The game has a 5x6 array with each letter of the alphabet on it, plus 4 "free letter" spaces. Each player draws a card with a 6-letter word on it, and on his turn the player rolls two coordinate dice, find the space on the board so designated, and if it's in his word, he places a chip by that letter. If he can't, he draws a card which may let him do things like removing an opponent's chip, swapping words, etc. One of the dice has a "choice" option to choose any space in that row.

The winner is the first one to place chips for all the letters in his word.

name: Das Millionenspiel
description:
The players buy merchanise for 1 million mark at the beginning of the game. The goal of the game is to sell their goods fast and for high Prices. The Player with the highest profit wins the game. Each game turn has two phases. In the stock exchange phase the prices für the goods are determined. In the sale phase the players travel the world by plane and try to sell their goods for the highest prices.

The game seems to be from the 1960s. or 70s.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Simulation

name: Monopoly: The Here & Now Limited Edition – Special Irish Edition
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Ireland.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: All Bunnies Eat Carrots
description:
A sarcastic and cheeky game for all ages. Earn the heart of these fuzzy critters to win and maybe snatch your friends' along the way!

All Bunnies Eat Carrots, nicknamed ABEC, is quick to learn and easy to play. Players gather items, find bunnies, and initiate actions using the cards they’ve been dealt. There are 11 bunnies to find and collect and each has its own needs and difficulty level. The higher the point value of the bunny the more difficult it is to collect it! Players only need to collect three bunnies to finish the game and the player with the highest combined value of bunnies wins! Simply put, collect the bunnies’ needs, the first player to collect three bunnies ends the game, and the player with the most points wins!

Each player starts with 5 cards. On their turn they may either draw three cards from the deck or look at the top three cards of the discard pile and pick one card. They may play as many cards as the wish during their turn. This includes playing bunnies in front of them to begin collecting. Every bunny has four unique needs that a player must obtain to collect the bunny. Once all the items have been gathered the bunny is finished collecting and is the player’s for the rest of the game!

The game also has action cards to help players develop strategies to give them the upper hand!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Set Collection, Trading

name: Skylanders Swap Force: Battle of the Elements Game
description:
It's the exciting, head to head, Skylanders board game. Players roll their die trying to be the first player to match their Skylanders special element. But beware of Kaos, if he shows up that will cost you. Collect the most cards and win!

Players each have a side of 5 Skylanders on their force and a die with the elemental symbol of each of their 5 Skylanders and a wild symbol. The one battle at a time, the two Skylanders across from each other do battle. Both players roll their dice simultaneously, if their Skylander's symbol comes up, they win and collect the two Skylander cards. A wild is considered a symbol, and the Kaos symbol is considered a loss. Ties are re-rolled. This is done for each Skylander. The only exception is the Kaos Skylander, in which case you lose points if you collect them, so you hope they are taken by the other person instead.

The player with the the most points (Skylander cards minus Kaos cards) wins.

name: Reis ümber söögilaua
description:
Players roll the dice and move around the board answering the questions about foods and cookery.
The game board reminds a little bit Chutes and Ladders. If player must slide down he may answer a trivia question correctly instead. Player who finishes first is the winner.

There are 500 easy, 500 medium and 500 hard questions and 3 variants for each questions. Who answers correctly.

name: Mine
description:
Cards have three pairs of dice printed on them. You roll the dice and place a chip on the matching spot on a card. When a card has all three of your chips you call "Mine" and take that card. Rolling doubles lets you remove an opponent's chip or add a chip to a card, if it's not frozen. On your turn you may freeze a card by placing your pawn on it. No other player may play on that card.

The first person to collect the designated number of cards (3-5 depending on the number of players) wins the game. With a little strategy, offense, defense, and some luck you can make the game yours.

name: Pinky Piggys Quartett
description:
Despite the name, this is not a standard Quartett game. There are 40 cards in 9 sets of four plus 4 Jokers. It is a simple children's game. Each player has a hand of 4 cards and must draw one from the undealt stack. If a set of four is acquired, it is laid down in front of the player. A Joker can be any card. If a Joker is in a displayed set, a player drawing the actual card may substitute it and add the taken Joker to his or her hand. When all the sets are collected, the one with the most wins.

It is made by the famous chocolate maker, Ferrero.

name: Stamps: Postzegelverzamelspel
description: Object of the game is to complete a collection of postage stamps. A collection is complete when you have 8 stamps (cards) with at least 3 of the same characteristics (such as stamped, large format, issued before 1945, coming from The Netherlands, etc.). In their turn, players throw a dice and move their pawn across the board in any direction. On the board are locations where you can get stamps or lose them. This can be done by exchanging with other players or on the market, by buying, selling or taking a chance card.

name: Flitzpiepe: Das Berliner Schimpfwortspiel
description:
Memory-style game to build Berlin-German swearwords out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting Berlin dialect words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun.The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to dicussions about local dialects, but the one finding most (new) matching pairs is the winner.

name: Lecksfiedle: Das schwäbische Schimpfwortspiel
description:
Memory-style game to build Swabian-German swearwords out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting Swabian dialect words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun.The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to discussions about local dialects, but the one finding most (new) matching pairs is the winner.

name: Mia san mia: Das Bairische Weisheitenspiel
description:
Memory-style game to build Bavarian sayings out of pairs. Just for the fun of learning or revisiting Bavarian dialect words.

The game plays like memory (unlike memory you don't keep matching pairs - put them back on the table, again). One word is the first half of the full word, one the second (1:1 match). To avoid unclarities, the matching parts have the same color - wrong combinations result in funny new creations, adding to the fun.The cards contain also an explanation what the resulting words actually mean (for those that did not know the word before).

It's mainly a fun party game leading to discussions about local dialects, but the one finding most (new) matching pairs is the winner.

name: Rummy Runners
description:
Rummy Runners is a card-melding territorial game for The Mystique Deck and a standard Hexpack, in which 2–4 players compete to claim 3 hexes in a straight line, or any 4 contiguous hexes.

Taking advantage of the nature of the hexpack, the board is modular, and the setup can be completely different every time you play.

Each turn, you may meld a set, you must draw a card. Valid sets are as follows:

a group of three or more of the same number
a flush of three or more of the same suit
a swatch of three or more cards of the same color


As the "Rummy" part of the name implies, you may scavenge cards from other players' melded sets in order to flesh out the set you are melding from your hand. After melding a set, if you have two or three of the three colors of a suit-number combo, whose matching hex has not yet been claimed, you claim it permanently. Furthermore, if you control a majority of the hexes 1–5 of that suit, you immediately (and permanently) claim the null.

The game features several variants, as well:

Controlled Zoning — Setup is not random; instead, players take turns adding hexes to the board.
Border Disputes — Hexes claimed with just two colors can be stolen; however hexes claims made with all three colors are still permanent.
The Hard Way — Groups and flushes are no longer valid. They are replaced by these two sets:
a sequence of five cards: 1–5.
a suite of four cards: one each of suns, moons, arms, crowns.

Piecepack — Play the game with a standard piecepack, instead of a standard hexpack.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Set Collection

name: Cars 2: Spy, Detour, Wrenches, & Red Light Green Light
description:
Includes 4 card games: Spy, Wrenches, Detour and Red Light Green Light. Collectors tin with a holographic image on the front.

Red Light, Green Light is played like "War".

Spy is a matching game.

2 to 4 player card game. All cards are distributed to player into individual piles, face down. The top card of each is turned face up in turn. If it matches the top card of another pile, that pile is placed on top of the active players face up cards, with the turned over card. If not, just the turned over card is placed on top. If you run of a draw pile turn over the face up pile. If you run out of cards entirely you are out of game. Last player left wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bible Wars: The Board Game
description:
Bible Wars: the board game, takes the tactical level Bible Wars Card Game to the next level.

The game features the same 6 cultures on a strategic map of the Holy Lands. In the game each culture is trying to capture and hold onto 18 territories to win but, it's not easy.

The first player each turn is randomly determined. Combat is determined, not only by who has the most armies, but by terrain and the playing of cultural army cards. The cards give each side an advantage to add to their die roll. Combat can continue several rounds until the attacked retreats or the defender is eliminated. There is no retreat for the defender.

Cultural advantages include Egyptian Chariots, Philistine Giants, Babylonian War Elephants, Israeli Heavenly Interventions, Canaanite Additional Local Forces, and Assyrian Professional Units.

name: Monopoly: Maine Edition
description:
Theme
Players take the part of land owners, attempting to buy and then develop their land. Income is gained by other players visiting their properties and money is spent when they visit properties belonging to other players. When times get tough, players may have to mortgage their properties to raise cash for fines, taxes and other misfortunes.

Gameplay
On his turn, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he has the opportunity to buy it and add it to his portfolio or allow the bank to auction it to the highest bidder. If a player owns all the spaces within a color group, he may then build houses and hotels on these spaces, generating even more income from opponents who land there. If he lands on a property owned by another player, he must pay that player rent according to the value of the land and any buildings on it. There are other places on the board which can not be bought, but instead require the player to draw a card and perform the action on the card, pay taxes, collect income, or even go to jail.

Goal
The goal of the game is to be the last player remaining with any money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Hundspelet
description: The game consists of a deck of 54 cards. On each card is a different dog breed, belonging to one of 10 different groups and one of 22 different subgroups. Each player gets five cards from the start. Each round you get to ask one player for a certain cards that you need to complete a subgroup. If the other player has the card, you get it and can ask for another card. If the other player doesn't have the requested card, you have to take a card from the draw pile and it's the next player's turn. When you have a complete subgroup, you put it on the table. When the deck runs out, you count the score. You get points for all cards from a complete subgroup, and a bonus if you have two or more subgroups within the same group.

name: Ex Labrys: Beware the Minotaur
description:
Navigate your pawns across an ever-changing maze, while avoiding the Minotaur.

Players can rotate, swap, and shift tiles to create a path, while blocking opponents. They also move their pawns in an effort to get across, and the Minotaur in an effort to eat opposing pawns.

name: NUMZEE
description:
Cards

There are twelve icons, each with a different point value. Each six-sided card has either two different sets of three identical icons (ie: 3 Fire icons and 3 Beaker icons), or has one set of identical icons (ie: 6 Beaker icons), known as a hextuple. (Hextuple? We made up this word. Think of a "double" in dominoes.) The value of each card is the sum of the values of each icon and is displayed in the center of each card.

Hextuples

A hextuple is a card where all the icons are the same. There is a hextuple for every icon. Every round of the game is started by placing a hextuple in the center of the playing surface. You can play just one round, or you can play multiple rounds, starting with a different hextuple each time. Choose it before distributing cards to the players.

If you play a hextuple during your turn, you can play another card during your turn to match it.

Scoring

During your turn, you play one card from your inventory by matching icons with one or more cards already played. Your score is the value of your card plus the value of the cards you matched.

Replenish

You must always have ten cards in your inventory. You can keep your inventory in your hand or just place them in front of you on the playing surface. After you play a card, you replenish your inventory by drawing a card from the pile. If you play a hextuple and are able to match it with another card from your inventory, you draw two cards.

Jokers

Jokers are wild. They can match any icon and each of the three Joker hextuples can be used to match six cards at once. They have no point value when played, but make sure you play them, because their value switches to 100 points and count against your score if left in your inventory.

Ending Rounds

Keep playing until all the cards in the pile are drawn. Then play until someone has played all their cards or until no other play can be made. Each player then adds up the card values left in their inventory and subtracts the sum from their score.

Ending Play

If you play multiple rounds, you can add the scores from each round to determine the winner. Or, you can treat each round separately and award a point to the player with the highest score for each round, and the winner is the player who won the most rounds.

name: Viva Niku
description:
User summary
ビバニク (Viva Niku) in English means "Viva Meat". Viva Niku is a card game with a theme of an eating race in a grilled-meat party.

In a grilled-meat party in Japan, they sometimes have a yakiniku bugyou (grilled-meat governor) who annoys everyone else by intervening in everything about grilling meat, such as when this meat should be turned over or lifted from the plate, who should eat that meat. Sometimes the Governor gets furious at you if you have slightly overgrilled meat.

To reflect the situation, this game favors the Governor.

Each card has a big effect and a small effect such as "Gain 400 kcal/Gain 100 kcal". Each round, the opening player plays a card, saying "big" or "small". Then in clockwise, the other players must play the same card and declare "big" or "small" if they have, or pass if they don't. Small effects are granted to all players who declared "small", but the big effect only goes to one of the players who declared "big", and if the Governor is involved, it's the Governor that grabs the big effect.

Everyone else tends to be worried about the Governor's hand. Be cautious until you manage to take over the Goverment's position.

The game ends when a player gains total of 2500 kcal, and the player with the most calories wins the game.

The first edition of Viva Niku is labeled for 3-5 players, while the second edition is for 4-7 players.

Publisher's summary
Tonight, it's "The Day of Meat" for a family. Now, it is good to eat meat! Steal! The desire to follow!
However, I must suggesting a happy "mother of grilled meat magistrate" because noisy when lust for ...

Of all the people who eat a lot of meat, the player who took the most calories is the winner. Not just lucky, the aim of the game is to win by psychological methods. It is more pleasant with more players in many cases. And ending within 30 minutes with many players, please enjoy the chance to play again.

The game is based on irregular trick-taking systems such as Witch's Brew. The designer added card-drafting and stronger elements of competition between players. However, the rules are still simple.

Publisher's summary
焼肉をします。一番たくさん食べたプレイヤーが勝ちます。
焼肉奉行に振り回されながらもトング片手に肉を食べる、癖のあるバッティング・ドラフトゲームです。
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Alhara Systems (アルハラシステムズ)

name: Squinkies Boys Battle Game
description:
This is a game with custom rubber dice made for small rubber figures called Squinkies. Each player starts the game with a number of Squinkies.

The game is played on a six square grid with symbols in each of the grids and a 'Pit' where spare fighters are kept (a downloadable PDF).

Players take turns rolling a die. The die roll determines whether you remove Squinkies from play, regenerate previously defeated Squinkies, lose a turn or reroll a die.

The last player that has Squinkies remaining wins the game.

name: Klassekampen
description:
Klassekampen is a political game modelled on the classical Monopoly game. Each player represents a political party. Votes replace currency, and players strive for control over political issues instead of shares.

The mechanism of the game parallels a traditional Monopoly game. Votes are used to take control over more political issues, which again are used to gain more votes. The aim of the game is to conquer all other players by overtaking all their votes.

The game is published by Klassekampen, a Norwegian radical-left newspaper (the term Klassekampen means 'class struggle'). The game is not sold, but is rewarded to readers who helps the paper in getting more subscribers.

name: Time Vandals
description:
Take control of skaters across the ages as they compete to be the first to place their tags on various points in history.

Players take turns moving one space across the board, taking any actions they move across in the process. Tags require paint cards to complete, match the cards you pick up to the ones shown on the tags then move past a painting spot to leave your mark and gain points. Create longer tags for more points, use special abilities to alter the cards in your hand or position yourself to block off other players routes.

The game ends when all paint spots are taken, then the player with the most points wins.

name: Guinness World Records: Das Miniquiz
description:
In Guinness World Records: Das Miniquiz, you can put to the test your knowledge of more than fifty interesting, bizarre, and unbelievable records from around the world.

Guinness World Records: Das Miniquiz also works as an expansion for Guinness World Records: Das Spiel.

name: Alaska!
description:
"A Game of Travel... Adventures... Facts... Fun!"

Alaska! is an adventure game for the entire family. As you travel around the 49th state, you'll be collecting adventures and learning interesting facts about Alaskan history, geography and current events.

You travel around the state of Alaska to different destinations, collecting "adventures" as you go. Once you assemble a certain number of adventure sets, you return to Ketchikan. the first to do so wins.

name: Island Survival
description:
A competitive game where all players compete to be the first off an island by collecting the oars to a raft they have to build. Meanwhile they have to try to maintain resources on the island to stay alive such as food, water and shelter. Players battle it out till one person sails off or everyone else is dead. Can you survive?

Island Survival pits you against your opponents. As you find food, water and shelter you also collect items left from previous castaways that help you survive. In your search for items to survive you will come across pieces of a raft. There are eight pieces in all and as each piece is uncovered everyone must assess their health and pay the price for their missing essentials (food, water and shelter). Once all 8 raft pieces are found, the first person to take possession of both oars is able to sail off the island and win the game. Of course, you can always take your hand made weapons and hunt the other players. Last man standing always gets off the island.

This is a turn-based card game with combat decided by dice rolls and strategic card playing. As you role play one of six unique characters, you will find new ways to survive the island.

name: Space Precinct: Police Cruiser Card Game
description:
Card game based on characters in the Police Precinct television series created by Gerry Anderson.

Players aim to win the game by collecting four different criminals first.Collecting these cards is mostly done by the luck of drawing cards you need. There are Police Cruiser cards that allow for a little interaction between the players. In effect, they make people miss a turn.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: MALPRACTICE!
description: MALPRACTICE! is an original card game filled with sabotage and surgery. Players act as doctors in an extremely poorly run hospital; every round a new patient is admitted, and players take turn treating him. The goal of the game is to heal the patient on your turn, while sabotaging your friend's treatments until they lose and get sued. The game is for 3 to 6 people, and takes approximately an hour per game. Rated 16 and up due to drug references.

name: Green Lantern Power of the Ring Game
description:
The path is filled with excitement and danger: will you master the four constructs that you need to defeat Parallax? When you arrive at the lantern with the ring, press on the lantern to see the result. An unlit ring means you have to go back on the track. A lit ring means... you've won! Light up the ring and recite the Green Lantern oath!

Players roll a pip die to move around a circular board. Only after collecting all four types of Green Lantern Constructs will a player leave the main board and have an opportunity to win the game. Varying spaces along the way distribute Constructs or force players to discard Constructs, while other spaces allow a player to send themselves or other players to a space of his or her choosing.

Two notable components also affect game play. By landing on a ring space, a player might take the Lantern's ring (an actual light up ring component), allowing him or her to roll the pip die twice and pick from the outcomes. Finally, even after collecting all four Constructs, a player must successfully charge their ring to win. A large Lantern battery piece gives a player a roughly 2/3 chance of victory by spinning a plastic piece, pressing a button, and awaiting the random response.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Clankball Legends
description:
Clankball Legends is a turn-based, dexterity sports game coming soon to Kickstarter. It combines the strategic disc-flicking of Carrom or Crokinole with the excitement of tabletop hockey.

You are the player leading a team of Legends from across the galaxy to victory in a futuristic and brutal version of hockey. You guide your Legends by flicking them throughout the arena while scoring goals, using power-ups, and pummeling your opponent into the ground. The goal is to score more points than your opponent by the end of the match.

name: California Bound
description:
Standard of the Goose type game. Players roll a die to move along the track, obeying any squares with instructions. First player to reach California, wins.

Very traditional example of this sort of game, including rules like 'Throw a six to start' and 'you need an exact roll to finish'.

Game appeared in the Buffalo Bill Wild West Annual, Number 10

name: Das Kiel-Spiel
description:
Commercial game, related to Monopoly, for the purpose of promoting Kiel, a city in Germany.

The players move around a board consisting of 40 squares. Most of the squares are showing companies to be bought - with values between 1000 and 8000. Three companies are forming a set with the same colour. Whenever a player lands on a win&loss-square, he/she must draw a card following instructions.
As soon as one player goes bankrupt, the game ends, all company cards are sold for their original price. Player with most money is the winner.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: We All Hate Your F#*cking Friend
description:
From the Kickstarter description:

We All Hate Your F#*cking Friend is a fast paced and irreverent card game, that really brings out the very best in worst behavior.

Let's say that you meet with a regular game group, and that group has lost a player. You need to fill the empty seat. All the regulars bring an imaginary friend with them, and your only job is to keep your friend from making a fool of him or herself, alienating the host's spouse, and other various acts that would get them sent packing.

We All Hate Your F#*cking Friend is a deck game with positive and negative cards all about what your "friend" does during the game. Play your cards smart and make your "friend" look good, or play against other players' "friends" to make them look like a tool.

Just keep your friend in his seat! The person with the most tolerable friend wins the game.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Brain Quest Numbers Counting Game
description: [From back of the box] Numbers Counting Game is a fun way for kids to get comfortable with numbers. Kids use Picture cards to perform addition and subtraction problems while collecting Picture tokens for their scoring boards. Numbers Counting Game teaches young children number recognition and counting skills.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection

name: Westonopoly
description: This spin off of the classic game, monopoly, was designed with components relating to the company Weston Foods. This rare board game was printed in small numbers and only given to employees of the business.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Inter-Cup
description:
Two-player game of football. Multiple games can be played to simulate a full tournament. The game includes coupons for registering tournament games.

Players take turns rolling a die and use the result to move the ball according to prespecified paths.

name: Pettersson und Findus: Aufruhr im Gemüsebeet
description: A simple guessing game where all players select a color, then a pack of chips are randomized and players move as many spaces on a track as the number of times the color they guessed came up. A catch-up mechanic makes sure the players stay reasonably close together.

name: Carnology: The Car Identification Board Game
description: Carnology is a board game for car enthusiasts. A visual game of car identification, Carnology challenges players to guess the car make, model and year to score points and move around the board. This game quizzes your car knowledge from the 1900s to 2012 and challenges players to e.g. spot a '66 Corvette from 100 yards or tell the difference between a BMW, MGB or TVR just by looking at a front headlight, bumper and grill. Questions and challenges are distributed across nine categories of cars. The first player to the checkered flag is the winner.

name: True to Life Baseball
description:
True to Life Baseball is a dice/board game that accurately simulates all the drama of a real baseball game. In extensive testing the average team runs and hits were within 3% of actual game stats. TTL Baseball comes with 6 teams from the 2011 season. Each team has 23 players printed on 3 separate 8 1/2" x 11" card stock ivory paper. The player sheets come in 3 hole punched sheet protectors that make the game easily transportable in a standard binder. (binder is not included)

The game has 4 different player modes; intro, basic, advanced, and 'Ultra Simulation Mode' which consists of using the advanced version along with all optional rules. After familiarity with the rule set, average game times range from 20 minutes for intro games to 40 minutes for advanced games. USM games would take a bit longer.

The game is for 1 to 2 players and is highly suitable for solitaire play. TTL Baseball has over 1800 hours in development. The advanced game was designed first, then to shorten average game times a simpler pitching system was designed for the basic game. Finally, the intro game is a simplified version to allow players to start playing games without knowing all the advanced rules.

Think you could have managed a team to a better season record than the actual manager did? Now you have the opportunity. Play a single series or an entire season with season player stat sheets available separately. In addition, extra player sheets are available for most seasons that add an additional 4 players to every team. This would bring each teams roster to 27 players.

This game features base stealing, squeeze plays, maximum pitch counts, pitch guessing, defensive depth adjustments for infield and outfield. The advanced games pitching system is perhaps the most accurate available. Optional rules limit use on how often each pitcher may be used within any 5 game period. Bullpen managements are included to keep track of pitcher use. There are also ballpark ratings that make parks either allow more or less home runs just as in reality. A rare play table accounts for almost every possible play possible in baseball. ie. triple plays, double steals, power outages, rain delays leading to arm stiffness for starting pitchers, outfielders colliding....etc.

TTLB uses a unique pitching check mechanic that uses a separate roll on 50% of key batting outcomes. This 'Pitcher Check Roll' (PCR) ensures that both hitter and pitcher attributes are taken into account. This makes both pitchers ERA's and hitters BA's as accurate as possible.

name: Schliess ab !
description:
Objective: Cover most of 81 squares filling them with your colors
- acting by turns -
On a 9x9 squared wooden board each player places a red tile, forming a boundary on one side of 81 small squares.
As soon as you can close up (= schliess ab) one or more of these small squares you must fill in your colored slide(s). Being successful you must place another red tile.
Game ends after all small squares are covered.
Note:
Likely published early 1970's

name: NRW-Quiz
description:
Objective: Gain most bonus chips; learn more about the federal state NRW (Nordrhein-Westfalen) of Germany.
- acting by turns -
On a board with six nested circles starting in the outer circle each player moves around according die roll. At the end of a circle you cross over to the next inner one. Ending on yellow, green or orange space left neighbor must draw a card and reads 1 (yellow), 2 (green) or 3 (orange) questions, which must be answered.
Correct? Get 1/2/3 bonus chips; wrong? Depending on position (circle no.) you may ransom yourself (with matching no. of chips) or step back/skip turns. Ending on a blue space you are not allowed drawing a card.
After on player has entered target zone game ends immidiately.

name: Unique Ice Hockey
description:
Two player ice hockey game, authorized to use the official 1974 Ice Hockey World Championship Tournament Emblems.

Each player selects a national team, the teams are identical - only names and picture vary. The players are set in a rink and then players alter turns to play action card (such as attack, shot, save, off side etc) from their hand and try to achieve a position where they can score. Only one card per turn can be played, a new card is drawn after the played card is resolved.

The idea is to score goals and win the match. When the deck runs out, the period is over. After the third period is over, the match ends.

Rules say that the maximum players is six, but that is only for tournaments - only two players can play at the same time.

name: Castle: The Detective Card Game – Murder Board Promo
description:
Set of three promo cards to add to the base game.
Includes Murder Board Discussion, Murder Board Evaluation, and Murder Board Review.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Murder/Mystery

name: Synesthesia
description: In Synesthesia, players take turns suggesting a subject, then everyone makes a word relating to that subject using the cards in their hand, the twist being that the cards in your hand have no letters on them; instead the cards each represent the first and last letter of the objects, numbers, and colors featured on that card. The goal is to bank the most cards from successfully created words.

name: Analogies
description:
At the beginning of each round, any player may suggest an analogy. The analogy should be of the form “What is the ______ of ______?” For example, “What is the Texas of Europe?”, or “What is the Model-T of the Animal Kingdom?”

Everyone secretly comes up with an answer to the analogy. When everyone’s ready, each player says his or her answer in turn. (You’re not allowed to change your answer after you hear someone else’s!) You get a point for each other player who came up with the same answer you did.

Play until someone reaches a predetermined score.

name: Herakles
description:
It's not simple being Herakles. Everybody seems entitled to tell you what great heroic thing to do next, this Hera goddess keeps harassing you most annoyingly and in case you are too heroic, the gods might just kill you off for being hubristic. And in that case, no historian will publish your great deeds. Not even your good friend Appolodor.

In the Microgame of Herakles, the two cards you have available to choose from each round are handed to you by your neighbours. From those cards, you have to play one. You want to place heroic deeds in your play area, but only 2. The moment you place a third, the gods deem you too heroic and you are out of the game. Other cards allow you to manipulate the cards in front of you and others.

As soon as only one player is left or the stack runs out, the game ends. The player with the highest score in his play area and hand still participating in the game wins and is declared the new Herakles. After a set number of rounds, whoever was Herakles the most, wins.

name: The Saddle Club Cross Country Game
description:
Join Stevie, Carole and Lisa in the ultimate cross country course. Complete jumps and collect cards along the way, but watch you dont fail the vet check. Contains 3D moulded jumps for an authentic cross country experience. Colourful moulded horses for easy player identification.
Winner is the person to cross all jumps and then cross the finish line.

name: White Turns Red: The Battle of Orel. Oct. 1919
description: White Turns Red depicts the high water mark and key battle at Orel, some 200 miles from Moscow. It was here that the White Army made its attempt to breakthrough to Lenin's Moscow. To be sure, when the Whites seized the city from the weak 13th Army using aircraft and tanks, Lenin and Tolstoy were in panic mode. So much so, they began massive defensive work programs building barriers on Moscow approaches. The White Army seemed unstoppable with its elite, well trained and armed Volunteer Army. All resources were diverted and sent to the Orel area. First, the Reds had to halt the advance and then counterattack, otherwise, Moscow could be reached. The main forces of the Red Fourteenth and Thirteenth armies continued their retreat toward the north and northwest under attacks from the White forces. Kornilov’s division defeated the right-flank units of the Thirteenth Army and captured Orel on October 13. The retreat of the Red 7th and 9th Rifle divisions exposed the flanks of the main attack force, and its communications with the Thirteenth Army were disrupted. From the 13th to 19th, The Whites held the city but their flanks were being broken. The Reds took it on the 20th.
publishers: High Flying Dice Games, Perry Moore Games

name: Asterix Mission Game
description:
This is a regular deck of cards but on each card also has 4 symbols on it with values.

One card is put face down in the middle of the table.
The rest of the cards are dealed.
Cards are put face down in front of each player.

The active player chooses one symbol category from his top card. The other players also play their top card. The person with the highest value in the chosen category wins the round.
Cards won are put on the bottom of your pile.

When you win a Asterix, Obelix or Idifix card you can use the special red looking glass card to look at the hidden code on the back of the card in the middle of the table. Finding the card with those exact symbol values among the Asterix Obelix and Idefix cards is the mission. When you win that card in a round or find it on your turn on your pile you have won a mission.
The found mission card will have the new mission on it's back.
The first player to complete 2 missions is the winner.

Another variant that comes with the game is just play until you won all cards and not bother about the mission.

name: Mix-Econo
description:
Mix-Econo is an educational game designed to acquaint the players with the meaning and use of everyday economic terms such as money, wages, industry, finance, inflation, banking, savings, etc. It is essentially a game to teach the social science of Economics.

Mix-Econo associates the actions of people with the changing value of money. The cards used in the game represent different phases of the economy and are marked with a monetary value. The object of the game is for each player to choose proper cards so as to end up with an amount of money as close to stable point as possible. The winner is the person having the amount of money nearest (above or below) the set stabilized amount of $200,000.

name: Rock Paper Scissor Mayhem
description:
Rock Paper Scissors meets Strategy.

Rules

1) Each player gets one set of Rock, Paper, Scissors (RPS) cards.

2) Deal 5 trick cards to each player.

3) Each player puts one of their RPS cards face-down in front of them as their active RPS card.

4) Players may not look at any active RPS cards (not even their own).

5) Each player picks a trick card to play and holds it up to indicate they are ready.

6) All players reveal their trick card simultaneously.

7)Resolve the trick cards from lowest number first to highest last.

8) When an RPS card is replaced, reveal the old card to all players. A card may never be replaced by itself.

9) Play trick cards this same way until all players have played 3 of their trick cards.

10) Each player reveals their RPS card, getting one point for each other RPS card they beat. Using the classic rock beats scissors, scissors beats paper and paper beats rock.

11) Play to 7 points.

These cards vary from allowing you to see your opponents unused RPS cards, to swapping yours to your opponents cards, to forcing your opponent to switch your card or even blocking moves.

name: Dino Match Card Game
description:
Dino Match:
Try to build one of 5 types of dinosaurs from a hand of three cards and from draw pile or receiving a discarded card. first player to complete a dinosaur wins.

Dino Rummy:
With a dealt hand of 6 cards, players in turn try to complete 2 dinosaurs by drawing from draw or discard piles. first player to complete 2 dinosaurs wins.

Or try your creativity mixing various head, body and tail cards into new mysterious dinosaurs.

name: UNCORKED! The party game of wine, wit & wordplay
description:
Gather your buds and taste! UNCORKED! is a wine-tasting game best played with 4-8 players and 4 different wines (any kind will do). It can be played at home or on the go, and requires no previous wine knowledge, so it’s fun for the fully ripened connoisseur to the unevolved amateur.

Each round, the "wine waiter" introduces a new wine and a new theme card to inspire players to write hilarious wine descriptions. Theme examples include, "If this wine had a job, what would it be?" or "Use sexual innuendo to describe this wine." The wine waiter reads all submissions aloud and the object of the game is to earn “Perfect Pairing” points by correctly guessing WHO wrote WHAT. If you guess correctly, you earn 1 “Perfect Pairing” point and you get to guess again. If you are guessed correctly, you are eliminated from the round.

When there’s just one wino left standing, that person becomes wine waiter of the next round. The wine waiter also awards 1 point for the answer they like best, and 1 “gratuity” point to themselves. You play as many rounds as you have wines, and the player with the most points at the end of the game is deemed winner and MASTER CONNOISSEUR and will seal their victory with a grand toast!

name: Dungeon Talk
description:
Dungeon Talk (DT) has been described as a hilarious mix of Dixit, Apples to Apples, Munchkin, and with a sprinkle of story telling fantasy RPG. DT can be learned in 5 minutes and played in under 30 minutes with endless replayability.

Dungeon Talk is a 2-6 player fantasy party game for family, adults, and kids and comes with over 280 game cards with 12,000 variations for endless re-playability.

Basic Game Overview: In the basic game, a new fantasy picture is revealed (each picture is on a huge 6x4 card). Players choose a Talk Card from their hand which they feel best represents the picture, is the most silly, or drums up the most laughs. One player acts as the Adventure Master, which rotates every turn, reads each Talk Card aloud then chooses a Talk Card he/she likes most. This continues every turn until a player's Talk Card is chosen three times!

Advanced Game Overview: After choosing your hero (each having a unique game power), you'll draw 5 Dungeon Talk cards (talk cards have funny sayings, quotes, etc on them).

Talk cards are used by you to describe an adventure card (a fantasy scene with some really cool art). Each turn a new adventure card is drawn from the current Act deck of your quest. The acts are The Fellowship, Journey, and Destination.

Each turn a new player acts as the Adventure Master (AM). Players, except the AM, chooses a talk card from their hand and plays it face down.

The AM then draws a random talk card from the talk card deck and shuffles it in with the players' chosen talk cards. He reads aloud each talk card and chooses one he/she feels best describes the picture, is the funniest, most outrageous, drums up the most laughs, and so on.

If a player's card is chosen he gains a level and loot (loot can be in the form of gold coins, equipment,potions, spells, or weapons which can be used to aid yourself or hinder others).

If the random card was chosen, one player is cursed (a random negative effect is played on him). Throughout the game, players can use their special hero power and unique items they've earned to help themselves or hinder other players getting too close to winning!

The game ends when a player reaches glorious level 5! Whomever has accumulated the most gold wins! There's a few more rules but that's the general gist of Dungeon Talk.

name: Monster Extermination
description:
Overview from the publisher:

Monster extermination is a game for 2 to 3 players to discover who is the best Monster Hunter.
Each player use six different magic weapons to repeal 30 different monsters.
Who's the best hunter of them all ?
It's time to find out.
Let's get started

name: Hochzeit auf Bedsparypark
description:
Your story - your rules!

A grand social event is at hand. Arthur Devenhorst, heir of the time-honoured country estate of Bedsparypark has announced his wedding with Amie Winters, nursemaid of a neigbouring manor. But the festivities are ill-fated, for his father is distressed about his son's choice. And other influential persons want to marry into the Devenhorst family themselves. Will love triumph? Will his adversaries be successful? Or will the couple fall victim to its own secret past? Make your own story and see for yourself what happens.

Wedding at Bedsparypark is a narrative card game in the Mini Story series by Noris Spiele. Cards determine their role, their relations to each other and their secret goals. A game last over five rounds, after which the winner(s) are identified as related to their goals.
mechanics: Hand Management, Role Playing, Storytelling, Trading

name: Parenthood
description: A humorous card game where players promote their own kids' growth and success while sabotaging other players' kids with life's issues. Players play as individuals or as couples running a household, and they attempt to score points by "raising children" and "getting them out of the house." Opponents block children's forward progress by playing impediment cards called "issues" that must be removed by playing suit-specific "remedies," such as T.L.C., Education, Discipline, or Money. The game is played in hands.
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Storytelling, Team-Based Game
publishers: Ad Magic, Inc. (AdMagic Games), Past Go Gaming

name: Eastwood Deadliest Gunslingers
description:
Eastwood Deadliest Gunslingers is a multi-player card game. Set in the wild west of america. Players Draw five cards to shoot it out for a quick best out of three gunslinger gun fight.
Each players deck has two card types "Shoot" and "Fate". One the players turn they may play one "Shoot" card to deal damage to the other players character. "Fate" Cards my be played at any time by both players for a variety of out comes.

The winner is the player who wins two out of three gunfights.

name: Fröschlein aufgepasst!
description: Players are using a die to move their storks on a hexagon shaped grid in order to catch the frog that's appearing on water lilies and is also moving on the grid based on the die. The first player to catch the frog three times wins.

name: Mulligan's Wild
description:
From the box:

Object of the game: Move all the tees from the tee box to the green. Don't forget this is an exciting, strategy game with lakes, sand traps and obstacles. So get your golfers together and have fun.

User Description:
Mulligan's Wild is a golf-themed roll-and-move game with a "send your opponent back to the start" mechanic similar to Backgammon or Sorry. Although this game claims to be "Golf game of the year," the golf theme seems entirely pasted on. Players roll dice and try to move their pieces (or "tees") out of their tee box, along the track, to their green and then into their hole. There is a special "Mulligan's Wild" die included, which allows players to move a number of spaces of their choice. First player to move all tees onto the matching green and into the matching hole wins.

name: Twinny
description: Find the same picture on two different cards and mark them with your token. The player who collects the most cards this way wins the game.

name: Epic Death!: Hardcore Mode
description:
In this first expansion for Epic Death!, it is a time of even more mighty heroes and much-desired ancient treasures, as a host of brave new adventurers step forward to claim lost artefacts of unimaginable power. It's time to go Hardcore!

Hardcore Mode contains two brand new modules for Epic Death! which add all new game-play to the base game. If you're looking to bring in more strategy and depth to the game, this has been made with you in mind!

Hardcore Mode is broken down into two modules: A set of Epic Adventurers (comprising of 40 cards) and a bunch of new Epic Loot (made up of 52 Cards). If you like, they can be played with individually but for the full Hardcore experience it's very much recommended that you bring them together.

You'll also remember the incredible treasures found in the original game. Epic Loot adds an entirely new Loot deck full of Magical Loot which can affect gameplay in surprising and... 'interesting' ways when equipped on your Adventurers. You'll get 40 all new Loot Cards as well as 12 very special Heritage Powers.

There's a reason we're calling it Hardcore Mode...
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Portal
description: Portal is a victory point based game in which you use cards to drive the movements and actions of your pieces on the game board.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting

name: Quiz-a-Majig: The Crazy Quiz Contraption
description:
In Quiz-a-Majig: The Crazy Quiz Contraption, each player starts with six colored marbles. Choose from one of the five double-sided category sheets and install it in the spinner. Throughout the game, players take turns being the quiz master. On your turn as the quiz master, push down on the lever to get the letter and category dials spinning simultaneously.

Once the spinning stops, the quiz master reads the category and letter aloud - "Countries! L!" All players think fast to come up with a word that fits the category and begins with the letter shown. If you think you've got it, throw one of your marbles into the bowl. Don’t tell out the answer yet because many marbles might go in, but only one will make it to the bottom first. All others will be sent to the tray to be used again later.

The player whose marble made it to the bottom first has five seconds to call out their answer. If they're correct, the quiz master turns the dial counter-clockwise and the marble falls into the quiz tube. But, if they're wrong, the dial gets turned clockwise and the marble can't be used again for the rest of the game!

Keep up the spinning, marble-tossing, and answer-yelling fun for as long as it takes. The first player to get all six of their marbles into the tube wins the game. But if that doesn't happen and the tube gets filled up to the line, the player with the most marbles in the tube wins!

Think fast, pay attention, and try not to lose your marbles as you play the fast-paced game of Quiz-A-Majig.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia, Word Game

name: Space Station Disaster
description:
Space Station Disaster is a light strategy game. You and your opponents are building a space station by laying out hex tiles. But most of the tiles contain disasters like aliens, radiation, and fire. Your goal is to use matching equipment cards to fix the disasters. If you fix a disaster you get a point.
