If you don’t have the right equipment you’ll have to run away or risk being injured and losing points. The game starts off easy but soon you will be cornered by disease and mad robots hoping to draw a teleport tile to escape.

Through clever tile placement, strategic movement and a bit of luck you try and fix more disasters than your opponents before the space station is finished.

The game plays in 30-60 minutes depending on the number of players. With a different order of tiles each game you get a unique experience every time.
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Psycho!Therapist
description:
A humorous party game for 3-8 players. Players take on the role of a Psycho!Therapist and attempt to treat people with problems ranging from weird to WTF?!

This game is like something out of Whose Line Is It Anyway, and Machine of Death.

Components
Cards: There are a variety of cards in Psycho!Therapist. Each is described below:
TYPE Cards: These cards have adjectives that describe the way the client presents themselves, such as Angry, Friendly, Groggy, etc.
CLIENT Cards: These cards typically identify your client’s occupation, such as Doctor, Lawyer, Ice Cream Truck Driver, etc.
PROBLEM Cards: These cards provide a description of the kind of problem the client has, such as a phobia, being on probation, or medical illness that is related to the behavior.
BEHAVIOR Cards: These cards describe the specific action the person is taking that is deviant, dangerous, dysfunctional, or causes distress such as: Giving play by play commentary on other people’s behavior, doing inappropriate things on the copy machine, or poking an eye out (Mama told you it would happen!)
TOOL Cards: These cards list objects, some very specific (a 10 foot pole) and others up the players imagination (something that begins with the letter B) that the player uses to enhance their chances of a successful treatment. These also contain a modifier (+5, +10+) which is added to their dice roll to determine success or failure.
DICE: The dice included in the set are called Percentile Dice. There is a tens dice and a ones dice. The scores range from 01 to 100 (a roll of 00,0). Thus a roll of 40 on the tens dice and 7 on the ones dice equals a result of 47%.
MODIFIER Cards: these are double sided, with +10 (in green) on one side and -10 (in red) on the other. These are used when players either make exceptionally good rolls (critical success) or exceptionally bad rolls (critical failures).They only last until they are played on their next turn.
GAMEBOARD and PLAY MATS
The Mats are included to help you keep score in terms of Therapeutic Successes, Therapeutic Failures, and to keep track of the Tools you use.

The Base Mechanic: Players will come up with imaginative treatments for the clients described in the game. Patients are made up of a Type, Client, Problem, and Behavior. So when creating a random patient for the game, you draw one of each card and place them together (Game mode determines if they are laid out in the center of the board, or stacked with only the TYPE card on top face up).
All patients have a Base Chance of Success of 50% to start (though this can decrease if a Player fails in their attempt at Psycho!Therapy). Players then describe their treatment plan with the patient in an attempt to cure them. Using the Tools adds to the chance of the Players success. Players will rarely have more than 3 Tools, but the bonuses are cumulative. Whenever Tools are used, they modify the Base Chance of Success (hence, a player using all three tools that have +5 modifiers now has a 65% chance of success).
Once the treatment plans have been described (and in some modes the Clinical decides which player’s treatment plan sounds best), the modifiers from the Tools are added together, the player rolls the dice and tries to get the target number or below in order to have a therapeutic success.
So if Player 1 had used all three tools and gained a +15, they would need to roll 65 or less on the percentile dice (50% Base Chance + 15 from the Tools = 65% chance of success).

A Role-playing Suggestion:

Completely Optional but very fun: Instead of just drawing the cards and focusing on the solution, the game can be a lot more fun when other players decide to improvise things the client might say or do. Remember that they will generally be compliant with the therapist and the use of tools (refer to the Type cards – hence, in the case of a Belligerent Client, the therapist might just have to make them use the tools despite their stubbornness, a Shy client might have to be coaxed or encouraged to use them). This opens the window to some really funny one-liners and statements!


Also, don’t be afraid to invent other objects that help place the Tools in context. You can certainly use other things besides your tools, they just don’t add to your chances of Therapeutic Success (see the example in the next column where Mark used an emergency air mask).
When Tools are generic, such as “a flask containing a liquid”, you get to choose all the details!.
To help with the characterization of the patient, think of any stereotypes about the Client first. Then, think of what would be frustrating to them about their job. What would they complain about? This is a good way to get a funny initial feel for the Client. You can even name them if you want!

Winning And Losing The Game
See the different modes for specific win/lose conditions. In general, the game continues until a Psycho!Therapist reaches 4 Therapeutic Successes, or there are no more clients to treat (either all in jail or have become Serial Killers).
Alternate Rule #2 (for Court Ordered or Dark Mode): If having no winner bothers you, the person with the most Therapeutic Successes when the game stops is considered the winner.

name: Mura Korogashi
description:
This is a two-player game about building a farming village in rural Vietnam. The board comes in two double-sided halves that can be fit together to form four different configurations. The assembled board displays a 6x6 grid, with each row and column marked by the face of a die. Six of the squares on the board (those with identical row and column numbers) are action spaces.

Players purchase tiles that represent resources, such as food or animals, or buildings. These tiles are then placed on the game grid. On each turn, the active player takes one die chosen from among the dice rolled by the opponent, then rolls three remaining dice and may select one of those three. The player then resolves any actions or income produced from tiles on the board where the rows and columns corresponding to the two dice intersect. Any income may be used to purchase more tiles to be placed on the board.

The players are striving to reach five specific goals. The first person to reach three more goals than the opponent (3 vs. 0 or 4 vs. 1) is the winner. If no one leads by three, the game ends when all 30 non-action squares on the game grid are filled, and the player who has obtained the most goals at that point is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Tile Placement

name: Rotten Railway!
description:
A simple roll-and-move game from the British magazine Horrible Histories #23.

The board consists of a track with 33 spaces. On your turn you roll one six-sided die and move your pawn that many spaces. If you land on an event space, you simply follow the instructions.

The first player to reach the finish wins.

name: KASAKASA!
description: In KASAKASA!, players control cockroaches, trying to best infest a house. This game was released at the Fall 2014 Tokyo Game Market.

name: The Red Dragon's Lair: Robin Hood the Rogue – Expansion Character
description:
Robin Hood the Rogue is a 36 card expansion character for The Red Dragon's Lair Adventure Card Game.

Robin Hood can hide and attack enemies from the shadows!
Exclusive The Game Crafter Edition Card Backs!

This expansion set includes a single Character Deck, plus components to add a brand new character to your game.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Role Playing

name: Look Out! Toy Story
description:
There's a big chaos among toys in Andy's room. The toys played hide-and-seek and now all of them are lost. Mind the colours symbols and character appearancee and the friends will Surely be found.

The aim of this short game is to get rid of all the cards.

At the beginning of the game cards are dealt evenly to all the players. Three different toys (or other objects) must be placed in the center of the table. Each round players unveil their cards simultaneously and when two or more of them depict the same character (in exactly the same pose) owners of those cards have to touch according toys as fast as possible. Player who touches the toy as the second one (or touches the wrong toy) collects all cards from the table and put them to the bottom of his/her stack. If there's no pair of identical characters, players unveil another cards.

There are 9 cards that change the rules:

3 cards with Mr. Potato Head - character game (looking for certain character in the ssame pose)
3 cards with Hamm - colour game (looking for a card with backgground in the same colour)
3 cards with alien - symbol game (looking for a card with the same symbol in the corner)


If a special card appears the rules of looking for pairs are immediately changed.

A player who is first to unveil all of his/her cards wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Real-time

name: Just the Job
description:
Card game. Objective is to be first to collect three sets of cards. A set consists of a Job card + a Skill associated with the job + 2 x Personal cards (being adjectives associated with the job).

There are also Guess, Swap and Challenge cards which are used to allow cards to be questioned, in case the owner of the set has played cards that don't match to the Job card.

The Job card is always face-down but other cards are exposed, allowing opponents to consider these cards and make a guess as to the Job card.

There is a lot of bluffing because if you can complete a set with the wrong cards, it still counts to your target of three sets.

A 30 second timer is included so that the challenges have a limited time to prove or disprove their opinions.

name: Paris Dakar
description:
A card game with 32 cards plus a rules card. The cards are illustrated with photographs from the famous annual rally from Paris to Dakar. There is also text on the cards which, if you read the cards from the first to the last, tells the story of participants. Finally, each card is numbered 1 to 32.

The object is to collect sets of cards in numerical order (3,4,5 for example. All the cards are dealt out. In your turn you can ask any player for a card. If he has it, he passes it to the question player who can then ask for another card from the same or different players. When someone is asked for a card that he doesn't hold, the questioner's turn ends. Once sets of at least three cards are collected, they are laid face-down in front of the player, who may add to them during the rest of the game. The game ends when the last card has been played. The player with the most cards on the table, wins.

name: The Red Dragon's Lair: Secret Passage
description:
The Red Dragon's Lair: Secret Passage is a fantasy adventure for two players in which you become a Warrior or Witch Doctor on a quest to slay an evil dragon. You control the actions of a daring adventurer finding the way through a deadly jungle filled with monsters, and treacherous traps. In the mysterious dark an deadly jungle your quest continues against the evil forces that oppose you. Your daring efforts to reach the Red Dragon's Lair is where your adventure begins and your quest awaits.

Your goal is to survive the jungle and find The Secret Passage, enter the Red Dragon's Lair and slay the Red Dragon. You and the other players join together looting monsters and plundering the dungeon in search of magical items and weapons!

This game is a character-driven game, which uses both cards and dice to deal with the many obstacles within the dungeon and the Red Dragon's Lair. Players play cards from their hands and roll dice to complete their goal.

Players choose a character deck at the beginning of the game then equip their special items and weapons. Each character is unique and uses different styles of play.

Working together players battle monsters and avoid traps on their way to the Red Dragon's Lair. If you slay the Red Dragon you win the game!

In addition to being a standalone two-player game, The Red Dragon's Lair: Secret Passage functions as an expansion for The Red Dragon's Lair.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Medieval

name: Hupsis!
description:
Hupsis is a dexterity game, where a card board waiter tries to keep his balance and not to drop any plates from his tray.

At the start of the game you have to assemble the card board waiter, which is swinging on a stand. You also have a common stock of card board plates, with different foods printed on them. At the start of the game every player gets few banknotes and when you run out of money, you drop out of the game. Last player with money wins the game.

On your turn you add a plate in to waiters tray. If the waiter swings and plates drop, then you must pay him a tip. If plates don't drop, then you succeeded. In both cases it's the next players turn to add plate. This goes on until only one player has money.

name: De Jongens Tegen De Meisjes
description:
Translated from the Box:

Once and for all decide which sex is the strongest!
De Jongens Tegen De Meisjes (The Boys Against the Girls) is a battle between men and women. In seven different rounds plus a final round two teams play against each other. Bet on the opponent's answers wisely and collect the most coins to win the game.

name: The Avengers
description:
Publisher's Description:

Race to Florida! The United States is on RED ALERT! Red Skull is threatening to spread his infamous dust of death all over the country. All the states, except Alaska and Hawaii, are at risk. It's up to you, the Avengers and Force Works, to get to Florida as quickly as you can and put an end to Red Skull's deadly plan. Remember, Kang and his temporal duplicates are out there to prevent you from accomplishing your mission!

The Avengers was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play. It is a roll-and-move game where players must move four markers (one at a time) in a numbered sequence from state to state on a map of the United States, starting in Washington and ending in Florida. Some states contain instruction to move forward or back or lose or gain a turn. If a player lands on a state occupied by another player's token, they must move back five spaces. First player to reach Florida with all five tokens wins.

name: The Incredible Hulk
description:
Publisher's Description:

Lure Absorbing Man to the Water! Absorbing Man has decided to eliminate the Incredible Hulk. He has set up a trap for the Hulk in a hydro power plant. You must join forces with She-Hulk and the Hulk to get rid of Absorbing Man, once and for all. Here's the plan. Since Absorbing Man can absorb the properties of anything he touches, She-Hulk and the Hulk will attempt to make Absorbing Man turn himself into fire. Then they will throw him into the sea, where he will disappear forever!

The Incredible Hulk was published as part of the Marvel Comics Super Heroes Game Book, and the board is a double-page spread of the book which is laid flat to play. It is a fairly standard roll-and-move game where players must move two tokens representing Hulk and She-Hulk one at at time along a track by rolling an electronic die. Along the way, some spaces will move players forward or back or cause a loss or gain of a turn. If a player lands on another player's token, he or she moves back four spaces. First player to reach the end with both markers wins.

name: Age of Nobles
description:
User summary:

The players are lord of house during Victorian England, and must, during six rounds, build up noble fame by having a staff of maids, important connections and land strips.

Each round, a number of cards (maids, noble connections and lands) are laid out, and each player has 2 pawns that he may use to claim cards. Knocking away another player from a card costs money that goes into the treasury; and the treasury can also be claimed. Lands cost money to claim, but brings an income each round.

The 3rd and the 6th round there is a scoring round, in which players get points for maids, combinations thereof, noble connections and land. The player with the most points at the end wins.

name: Pato Aventuras
description:
This is a Disney related game and the name means 'Duck Tales'.

The shuffled deck is placed face down. The first player draws a card. If it is a 1, he plays it front of himself. If it is not a 1, it starts a personal discard pile for that player. Play continues in this vein but once owned discard stacks start to appear then a player may add his drawn card to any stack of the other players or himself as long as the number on the played card is consecutive with the top card on any player's stack.

When the last card has been taken from the central pile, the game continues and the first player to get rid of his discard pile, wins that game. He scores nil and the other players score 1 for each card in their hand. After a pre-arranged number of games, the player with the lowest score wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: The Red Dragon's Lair: Secret Passage – Exclusive Kickstarter Pack
description:
Exclusive pack purchasable during the KS campaign for the game The Secret Passage to the Red Dragons Lair.

Contains:


2 Jungle Card Allies
2 Jungle Card Lost Treasures
2 Character Friends
2 Buttons

name: The Ruinous Beauty
description:
User summary:
The Ruinous Beauty is the English name given by the game designer to his game 傾国-KEIKOKU- although the game is not released in English yet. The Ruinous Beauty implies a femme fatale.

A two-player game staged in the spring-fall era of China (770 – 220 BC). Players play cards face down, determine their powers, and may move their troops forward as much as they have bet on the outcome. The first player to gain 21 points wins. Wisely using the Spies that you can send into your enemy's country, and the Imperial Ordnance that give you an advantage in battle, are the keys to victory.

Publisher summary:
中国の春秋戦国時代をモチーフにした2人専用ゲーム。伏せられたカードの強弱で勝負し、賭けたチップの分だけ兵を進めます。21ポイント先取すれば勝利。敵国に送り込んだ【潜伏者】と、戦いを有利に進める【勅令】をうまく使い、対戦者を出し抜きましょう!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Modular Board, Open Drafting

name: Zuqi
description:
Zuqi is a game of intense strategy in which players try to achieve the classic goal of getting four pieces in a row or occupy all four corners at once, but there's a twist. Each piece in your arsenal has unique movement abilities, capture abilities, and other powers at their disposal, and you may only bring 5 out of 8 of them to every game, so each game will play out very differently.

With unique rules that keep the game balanced and fair from beginning to end, every game is intense, and even if you're winning in one moment, the tide can quickly turn. Compete with your opponent for supremacy on the battlefield in a mental tug of war. You take one piece from him, he places another. He takes one from you, you place another. Eventually something has to give, and it shall. This is a game of strategy and skill and only the strong shall prevail.

name: 1-2-K3
description:
From the publisher's website (Translated from Dutch):
Play with your favorite girl trio! The K3 board game is a real hit for kids that love K3. Try to collect as many K3 trios as you can by rolling the dice. Whoever collects the most K3 trios wins the game. Suited for kids ages 4 and up.

name: Ridspelet
description: Choose your horse, roll the dice. A race to the finish line.

name: Letter Chess
description:
Letter Chess is a solitaire word game that combines Word Search and Chess. Players move letters like Chess pieces to string together words that connect horizontally, vertically and diagonally on a 7-by-9 grid. To score big assemble long words and make sure you have a end of game strategy to clear the board.

Setup: 48 Letter tiles are randomized on a 7-by-9 grid. At the start of the game there are 15 empty squares near the center of the board. The center horizontal row is always empty. Bordering the center row, two rows are made up of four empty squares and three letter squares (like a parapet which is the alternate name). Use any word game you may own to play the game.

Game Mechanics: The main object of the game is to assemble words on the grid. Eligible words must have letters connected on the board horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. Acceptable words must be at least three letters long. Words cannot be played more than once per game and proper nouns are not allowed. Individual letter tiles cannot be used twice in the same word (such as “o” twice to spell book or “d” to spell dad).

During a single turn, a player can move multiple letters together to construct words. All letters moved during a turn must be used to construct a word that round. Consonants can move any number of squares horizontally, vertically or diagonally (like a Queen in Chess) to an empty square. When moved, however, consonants cannot jump over other letters. Vowels can move two squares horizontally and one square vertically, or two squares vertically and one square horizontally (like a Knight in Chess) to an empty square. Unlike consonants, vowels can jump over other letters. After a word is constructed those letter tiles are removed from the board and play continues. The game ends when all letters have been used or no more plays are left. Lastly, the letter “Y” moves as a consonant even if used as a vowel.

Scoring: Letter Chess uses simple formulas to tally a score at the end of the game. So when playing keep a pencil and paper nearby. Vowels count as 2 points and Consonants count as 1 point. The letter “Y” counts as one point even if used as a vowel. A word is tallied by multiplying the letter score by the letter count. For example, “murals” has a tally of forty because there is a letter score of eight (two vowels and four consonants) and a letter count of five (8x5=40). There is a bonus score when all the letters are cleared from the board. The bonus is calculated by multiplying the number of rounds by 10 and subtracting that amount from 200 (arbitrary number). For example, a whole board was cleared in twelve rounds then 200-(12X10)= 80 points. When letters remain on the board with no more moves left those letters are tallied as a word and subtracted from the score. For example if the letters “I, X and O” remain on the board. The letter score is 5 and letter count is 3 which equals 15 minus points.

At most there are 16 rounds per game assuming all words are 3-letters long. In Letter Chess, a high score is in the 400’s and a low score is around 200.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Print & Play, Word Game

name: Arcology
description:
The boardgames sets in the Small City trilogy and expands the concepts of the game in the future.

Arcology

The 21st century…The quest for Happiness has become the ultimate holy grail for the entire population world. Thanks to your work at the town hall in the Clinic, Tramways, Card City, Town Center and Small City games, your town is growing rapidly and you are attracting new Residents almost every day. You are now in charge of a new challenge: to arrange the towers of downtown Small City so that your dear citizens are as happy as possible and get their dose of happiness too!
Succeed, in the same tower, in coexisting apartments, Commerces, and offices on several floors. Develop green spaces, relaxation and Recreation areas for the sake of harmony! But the most important thing, in such a tall tower, will remain the planning and management of the elevators so that your residents do not lose patience to get home at rush hour!
categories: Abstract Strategy, City Building, Economic, Science Fiction

name: Star Wars Yatzy
description:
As in Yatzee you throw five dice. You can throw each die 3 times and you score by getting certain combinations.

In Star Wars Yatzy you don´t have a fixed set of combinations, but instead you draw mission cards. Each player have two mission cards and they draw a new if they have less than 2 cards. you dicard a card if you finish a mission. If you don´t use all your throws you can add one mission card.

When one player have finished 8 missions the game ends and the player with most points wins.

name: Sergeants D-Day: US Paratrooper Sergeants expansion
description:
The US Paratrooper M1 Garand armed leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant. The M1A1 Thompson armed leader comes as a private soldier, junior NCO and senior sergeant.

Contents:


2 Sergeants armed with a M1A1 Thompson and M1 Garand
32 Cards, 6 Soldier cards, 26 Action card
2 Hidden Movement markers
2 Soldier markers

name: Sergeants D-Day: German Light Infantry Assault Team expansion
description:
The German Light Infantry Assault Team brings to bear awesome automatic fire-power for assaults on the enemy. Featuring a MP40 and Panzerfaust armed soldiers, this team is a welcome addition to any assault.

CONTENTS:
1 - German MP40 armed Standee with base and markers
1 - German Mauser98 w/ Panzerfaust armed Standee with base and markers
2 - German Mauser98 Rifle armed Standees with bases and markers
4 - sets of Soldier, Core and Rank Cards (8 cards)

(Contains: 4 soldiers and 32 cards)

First sold during Kickstarter for the base game.

name: Guess My Story
description:
An English party game, loosely based on a long forgotten television show.

12 cards are provided, each of which contains a different personal “ story,” all of them famous in the sense that the Daily Press has, or would have, given them headline publicity. They are modern, historical, legendary, or fiction.

One player to be Chairman. He takes all the cards; no one eise must see them yet. He selects one card and chooses a player (the Challenger) who will answer questions as though he were the person about whom that story was made. The Challenger and the Chairman sit together facing the other players, who become the “ panel.” The Chairman announces to the panel the free information, as printed at the top of the card. This is the only “ free ” information given. The panel have to discover what the Challenger’s story is by questioning him (or her), and they ask any questions they wish, one at a time and in turn. The Challenger gives the answers, Consulting the information provided on the card about “ his own ” story. The Chairman may help and advise the Challenger in his answers. In answering questions, the Challenger should use the first person “ I.”

It is the story which has to be discovered, not necessarily the name of the person concerned, though it is usually simpler for the panel to find the name first, which will lead them to the story quickly.

The Chairman may announce a time limit, say 5 minutes, after which the panel if still unsuccessful have been defeated, and the Challenger announces his story. A new Challenger is selected for each story.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Dora the Explorer Let's Go! Adventure Game Book
description:
Five basic Dora the Explorer Games, to teach color and number recognition, sequencing, patterning and game play skills.

Included games are "The Race to Abuela's House", "Vines & Logs","Catch the Stars!", "The Nutty Forest Maze" and "Beach day!"

Short description per game:

The Race to Abuela's House: players spin the spinner to race to Abuela's house, but if they land on an obstacle, they need the spinner to land on the corresponding tool before moving on.

Vines & Logs: shortened version of chutes (logs) and ladders (vines).

Catch the Stars!: the game board shows a pattern with six different colours. Players spin the spinner (that shows colours now) to spin the required colours for their next step, in a race to the other side of the board, where te stars await.

The Nutty Forest Maze: players spin the spinner to race to Tico's treehouse. They have to choose the right way through the maxe, and can loose turns (when encountering Swiper the fox) or getting extra moves (when encountering stars).

Beach Day!: players spin the spinner and move to the first next square showing the same picture as the picture shown by the spinner to race to the beach (candy land variation).

name: Skæg med tal-spillet
description:
Det er skægt at tælle med Hr. Skæg.
I dette spil for førskolebørn lærer de små børn at genkende tallene fra 1 til 10, at tælle fra 1 til 10 og at øve sig på at skrive tallene.
Drej pilen, flyt brikken på spillepladen og udfør opgaven på kortet. Børnene skal tælle ting, skrive tal, hente ting og pege på ting med forkerte farver. Desuden skal de hoppe forskellige slags hop. For hver opgave barnet klarer vinder det en Skægbrik til sin samleplade.

IN ENGLISH:


It is fun to count with Hr. Skæg.
In this game pre-school children learn to recognize, write and count the numbers from 1 to 10.
Turn the arrow, move the gamepiece on the board and do the task on the card. The children must count, write numbers, find things og point at objects with wrong colors. And they get to jump different kinds of jumps. For each task the child does, it wins a Skæg-token for the pointboard.
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Math, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mit Riesenspaß zum Riesenrad
description:
This game takes place in a fairground. Your goal is to bring all your four pawns in the gondola of the ferris wheel. The first player who accomplishes this wins.

The board is build up of 12 double-sided tiles which are placed on the empty spaces at the beginning of the game.

Every turn, a player rolls the dice and moves one of his pawns. If the pawn lands on a red field the Player may take an empty tile and place it with any side on a free space on the board.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: Word Riddles
description:
Party game. Each guest is given a card and a time limit. On the card are 32 clues in groups of eight.
1st 8 = Ages - all answers end in 'age'
2nd 8 = Gents - all answers end in 'gent'
3rd 8 = Flowers - the answer to each clue is the name of a flower
4th 8 = Trees - the answer to each clue is a tree
Being riddles, some of the clues are very cryptic.
At the end of the time limit, the guest with the most correct answers, wins.

name: Pot-Pourri
description:
Party game. A quiz for guests. All guests get a card and a time limit.
The themes are in 4 categories (42 answers needed):
1. Holiday Choice - on the left is a list of jobs and the answers are place names but the correct one will something associated with that job.
2. Bird Words - Anagrams of bird types
3. What's her name? - Cryptic clues with a girl's name as the answer.
4. Clip Words - More cryptic words that combine in part to make a new word.

When "time" is called, the guest with the most correct answers, wins.

name: Dip Words
description:
In each box are fifteen perforated sheets which provide 150 slips. A letter is printed on each and in all there are 10 of each vowel and 5 of each consonant except Z which is entirely omitted. There are also 3 dice.

INSTRUCTIONS TO THE M.C.
Suppose there are 12 players. Divide them into 4 teams of 3 players and seat them at tables or suitable furniture in groups of four so that at each fable there is a member of each team. A dice is allotted to each table.
Put the vowels (well mixed) in one box and the consonants in another; then place the boxes in a convenient position.
At a starting signal one player at each table throws the dice. If he throws a 6 he gets a vowel, 1 blind from the box as quickly as possible. If he throws 1 or 5 he collects a consonant. Figures 2, 3, 4 do not count. If he throws a useless figure he passes the shaker to the player on his left who shakes and plays accordingly, but if he has thrown a useful number then after collecting a letter he throws again until his is unsuccessful, when he passes the dice on. (This prevents crowding round the letter boxes).

When all the letters are used up, or at the end of an agreed time the 3 members of each team get together and make up as many words as possible (plural nouns not counting) from their letters, bearing in mind the following method of scoring.
A word of 6 letters or more ... Scores 20 points
A word of 5 letters scores 15 points
A word of 4 letters scores 10 points
A word of 3 letters scores 5 points

A time limit of 5 minutes or so should be fixed for composing. The team scoring the highest number of points is the winner.

name: Κυνήγι ερωτήσεων: για παιδιά (Quiz Hunt: For Children)
description:
A competitive game with 600 questions about Greece and the whole world especially for children.

The game play is simple: Each player rolls the dice and according to the outcome of the dice he is being asked the corresponding question. If he answers right, he collects the card.

The player or the team with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

It extends a series of trivia games series: Κυνήγι Ερωτήσεων
1.History
2.Animals - Plants
3.Science
4.Culture
5.Sports
6.Geography
7.20th century
8.Greece

name: Superfight: PAX South 2015 Promo Pack
description:
This is a set of two cards for Superfight that was released at PAX South 2015. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.

Both cards contain a printing error, referencing the event as PAX South 2014, not PAX South 2015.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Bad Habit
description:
Description from the publisher:

Bad Habit is a co-operative game for 2-5 players in which you must work together to learn the patience and empathy necessary to help those who suffer from Non-Suicidal Self Injury. It is our hope that this game can provide a unique perspective on the subtle challenges involved with this taboo subject.

name: Domenica In
description: After the auctions phase, the game takes place in different hands. Each player must reconstruct the perforated cardboard on your TV the same path of red and green stamps and which are reproduced on the diagram of the presenter. During each hand is also held a treasure hunt to find the green peg. At this point you will face the test of the quiz that will to win more points.

name: Walt Disney's 101 Dalmatians
description:
Kids dice game. Roll two dice per turn, and pick up either one or two bones, based on the dice combination, or claim an empty bowl. The player with the most bones (or puppies in empty bowls) at the end of the game wins.
The box states a starting age of 7, but kids age 5+ should have no problem playing this.

From the box: Rolly, the tiny and ever-hungry Dalmatian puppy, is not the only one intent on hoarding as many bones as possible for himself. All his cute little friends are just as eager and make a dash, barking loudly, to empty the doggy bowls. The one who retrieves the greatest number of bones is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Secret Service
description:
Some important high-security documents are lost from the Prime Minister's Office. Prime Minister calls hurriedly the Secret Service and asks them to rush and catch the spy the fastest. The spy succeeds to erase his tracks.

Will the Secret Agents be able to surround and catch the spy?A hunt from town to town and from country to country, which takes the breath away from all those involved!

Do you want to be a Spy or a Secret Agent?Choose sides and start the hunting all over Europe until you complete your mission!

In Secret Service, one of the players takes on the role of the Spy. His job is to move from point to point around the map of Europe taking cars, trains, boats or airplanes. The secret agents – that is, the remaining players acting in concert – move around similarly in an effort to move into the same space as the Spy. But while the criminal's mode of transportation is nearly always known, his exact location is only known intermittently throughout the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Siege! Fun Family Card Game
description:
From the back of the box:

"The goal of Siege! is to collect unit cards or take them from other players, until you have 3 full sets!

"Use Order cards to exchange a unit card with another player, receive the winnings from a jousting tournament, pay money to the treasury, draw more cards, retreat, capture the treasury, and more fun actions, to help you build your war chest and be the first to have 3 full sets!"
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Treasure Map
description:
Treasure Map uses 16 unique double-sided cards. One side of the cards is used to layout the island. There is treasure hidden somewhere on this island. Then players use the other side (the map-side) of the card to play one of the several different ways to play.

Game Mode: Treasure Island
One every space of the island without an icon, place a coin. The each player chooses a space with an icon and places their pawn on it.

Then players take turns playing cards, and choosing on of the available actions from the card.

Move to the icon - move your pawn to the icon on the card, if this cause your pawn to move in a straight line then pick up any coins passed along the way
Move steps - move your pawn one space for each set of footprints on the card, picking up any coins passed along the way
Pick up via strokes - for each stroke on the card, pick up one coin from an adjacent space


First one to 12 coins wins.

Game Mode: Gentlemen Pirates
Each player takes one card and looks at the icon on the map-side of the card. This is where they treasure is hidden.

Players then asking yes or no questions to try to locate each others' hidden treasure.

Example questions:
Is you treasure hidden next to a red icon?
Is your treasure hidden on the coast of the island?
Is you treasure hidden by a palm tree or a lighthouse?

Players take turns asking a question, the first one to figure out where their opponent's treasure is hidden wins!
mechanics: Modular Board, Pattern Recognition, Team-Based Game

name: Cthulhu Madness: Midnight in the Graveyard
description:
From the publisher's website:

It's 1923 and you are in a graveyard. Bad things are about to happen. Real bad things... Hope you survive!

This is an intermediate level Engle Matrix game. This now comes as a story telling game. Players take turns moving character tokens on a map to set up scenes and create sections of the narrative. Each addition to the story is evaluated in terms of how likely it is to happen and how well it fits with the overall story. This evaluation determines the number that needs to be rolled for the new segment of the story "to happen" and to be added to the main narrative.
The player who contributed the most significant elements of the story is the winner of the game.

name: 8-Bit Battle
description:
The legend of the 8-bit battle goes as follows. In a distant kingdom lived a King who ruled over a mighty nation. But alas, the kingdom was torn in two as factions began to form against the King. Now the king must draw upon his closest allies else he will battle against them for the future of the kingdom. They are: The King, The Warrior, The Wizard, The Queen, The Goblin and The Villagers.

This game creates several unique strategies. Do you choose items or characters that you can stack up to ensure victory, but at the risk of letting your opponent have automatic victory points because you cannot engage in every battle? Or will you go with special characters like the wizard who have a high probability of victory on their own? Or will you use special items to gain the advantage by increasing your attributes or peeking at the other players cards before you have to make a decision. The choice is yours, but choose wisely, because every decision you make will lead to victory or your untimely demise.

Setup

The 8 character cards are shuffled and placed between the two players, face down. Each player draws two cards, then decides which of the two to keep and which to put back. Shuffle and repeat until there are only two character cards left. These two cards are randomly distributed.

Repeat these steps for the item cards except stop once each player has three item cards. Place the remaining item cards to the side as they will no longer be needed this round.

Game Play

The player who went first is now the attacker. They select one character card and one item card and place them face down.

The second player is now the defender. That player selects a character card face up and an item card face up. If a card allows additional cards to be played, it is played now.

The attacker then reveals their cards. If a card allows additional cards to be played, it is played now.

The battle: If the attacker's Attack value is higher than the defender's Defense value, the attacker wins. Else the defender wins. In the event of a tie, the defender wins.

Winner takes all of the cards and puts them in their discard pile. Once a player is out of characters to play with, the other player places the rest of their cards into their discard pile.

Players go through their discard pile and count up the Health Points (which are victory points). Player with the most points that round wins the round. Winner decides who goes first for the next round. Best of 3 rounds wins the game.

name: On the Line
description: Each card in a deck shows a different geometric pattern. A card is drawn. The player then takes his four thin, transparent, identically-shaped pieces and tries to arrange them - usually with some overlapping necessary - to match the pattern on the card that is drawn. This game can be played solitaire or as a two-player race.

name: Talons & Teeth
description:
Talons & Teeth, a 2015 Korea Board Games contest finalist, and Scott Czysz's very first game design, is a wildlife habitat / food chain card game for 1 to 3 players.

Each player is dealt one of three available habitats: Woodland, Grassland, or Wetland, then starts building their habitat with two or more food sources that fit their habitat. Then, add animals to your habitat that eat your foods. Complete your habitat by placing a predator.

Cards are color coded to easily identify which foods go with which habitat, and which animals eat which food.

The deck also includes Hazard and Roam cards that can affect the habitats.

Cards have point values (a deer is worth more than a chipmunk). Once one player completes their habitat with at least 2 Foods, at least 4 Animals, and at least 1 Predator, each player's habitat is scored, and the player with the highest score wins.

name: Die drei ???: Das verfluchte Schloss
description:
This simple roll-and-move-game was published as an insert in a "Toffifee" Box and promotes the second "Die drei ???" movie as well as "Toffifee".
The first player to reach the diamonds and answers corectly a question from the question card wins the game. On certain spaces events occur, that hinder or benefit the player. If a player gets on a space with a picture, he has to perform an action as described on the action card.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing, Trivia
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Yabba-Dabba-Doo
description:
You move around the board by throwing a die, trying to collect all of the different character cards: Betty, Barney, Pebbles, Bamm-Bamm and Dino. For example, if you end up on a Barney square you take a Barney card. Immediately after you've picked up the card the player to the left of you gets a chance to steal your new card by guessing which one of all Fred's (because this game is about Fred no matter what card you pick up) favorite hobbies is on the back. There are 5 different hobbies represented on each and one of all the character cards (fishing rod, grammophone, grilled meat, golf and TV). So the chance to immediately steal the card is 1 to 5. Once you've collected one of every character card you need to get back home as quickly as possible in order to win.

When you're picking up cards you might get a specialty card. If the back of the card has a picture of Wilma you must move your piece to the beginning. A picture of a happy Fred lets you take one card from an opponent, and an angry Fred makes you give one of your cards to an opponent.

name: Krydsord
description: A word game, where players have to place letter tiles on a board to create words, trying to achieve more points than the opponent.

name: Honningtyven
description: The goal of the game is to be the first player to get rid of all their pieces. Players will roll a dice with five different colors on the sides, and search the board for a bear with the appropriate color. If the player is right, he may get rid of one of his pieces, but will have to take one if he is wrong.

name: Tentacle Bento: Culture Club
description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Tentacle Bento: Cephology Club
description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Tentacle Bento: Kibachan
description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Ellie Lou's Memories
description:
This memory game contains 12 sets of puzzles and their respective puzzle boards, which are used to play a number of competitive or cooperative games within the predetermined time limits.

For example, when playing a competitive game, each player chooses a set of puzzles and places its pieces in the center of the playing surface face down, together with other players’ puzzle pieces.

All players take turns pointing to a missing piece on their own puzzle boards and turning over a puzzle piece to see if there is a match. Before passing the turn to the next player, any matching puzzle piece is placed on the corresponding puzzle board, while a mismatched puzzle piece is turned to face down again in the center of the playing surface.

The goal of this game is to be the first player to complete his/her puzzle board.
publishers: Kuraki Mura B.G. Studio, Swan Panasia Co., Ltd.

name: Premier Anglais
description: Children are introduced to their first English words by seeing, hearing, and speaking them. Included are a pair matching game and a bingo game. Early exposure to a foreign language promotes children's communication skills and strengthens their self confidence.

name: OneOneOneTwoThree
description:
Players are given identical hands of six action cards which they will use to manipulate a stack of two double-sided tokens (through actions such as "flip stack" and "swap tokens"). The stack starts the game in a random sequence.

Each player sets one card aside at the game's start. Then, for each round, each player chooses a card from their hand, both being revealed simultaneously. The uppermost colour on the stack determines which player's action takes effect first. When both cards have been processed, they are discarded and the top colour on the stack determines that round's winner.

The game is played over five rounds, the score for each round being one, one, one, two and three points respectively. If tied, the initially discarded cards are used to play a tiebreaker round.

name: MusiQwiz
description:
A quiz game about the music stars and their music. You will be on a musical travel from under the sea to the air - and beyond to the Universe!
First to get out of the "King of Rock'n'Roll" field win and become the the MusiQwiz (Music Wizard)

The backside of the board contains shorter version of the game.

name: Chain of Nations
description:
The board shows 100 fields (10x10) which show 50 Muslim counties (each 2 times).
Each player has 3 to 7 country cards on his hand (dependent on number of players).
On Players turn he Plays one of his Cards and places one of his Stone on one of the 2 fields with the same country.
The choosen field has to be empty. If this is not possible he can choose any free field.
The first player (or team) which has first 5 markers in a line (horizontal, vertical or diagonal) wins.
The game is designed for maximum 12 players in maximum 4 teams.

name: Eight-by-Eight
description:
It's like Pente, but on a smaller board with a dash of luck and little press-your-luck for garnish on top! Your goal: Form a straight, contiguous horizontal, vertical, or diagonal line of at least five pieces of your color. For 2 to 4 players. Plays in 30 to 45 minutes.

You play Eight-by-Eight in the spaces of an 8x8 grid. Each column and row is numbered so every space is paired with a unique pair of numbers from 1 to 8 (ex: The spaces 4,2; 4,3; 4,4; and 4,5 are adjacent to each other and form a straight horizontal line.). On your turn you roll an eight-sided die. Now you have a choice: Play a piece in any vacant space in the row or column you rolled (ex: You roll a "6." You may play in any vacant space in the column numbered "6" or the row numbered "6.") or you can place one of your pieces on the number you rolled to "black it out" and roll again. If you roll a number you've blacked out, your turn immediately ends.

The first player to get five or more pieces in a straight line (horizontal, vertical, or diagonal) wins the game. Quick, easy, and with more strategy than you'd expect.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Enclosure, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Digimon: Monster Match
description:
The 36 tiles are separately placed face down on the table. The object is to collect a set of 4 characters. A set needs a Kid at first and then followed by related tiles - the In-Training Digimon, the Rookie Digimon and the Champion Digimon. These are collectively known as a Team.

The game play is easy. Reveal a tile. If you can use it, take it. If you can't use it, it is shown to the other players and returned face-down to the table.

If an Evil Digimon is revealed you must duel with another player. A duel is resolved by a die roll each, the highest thrower wins. If the challenger wins, the other player has to turn over one of his tiles. The Challenger gets the Evil Digimon as it is worth points at the end of the game. If the challenged player wins, he gets the Evil Digimon tile and the challenger turns over one of his tiles. A further advantage on winning a duel is that you can turn back a tile in front of you if it has previously been turned face down.

The game continues until there are no more tiles from the middle of the table to be revealed. Points are awarded for:
A complete team (all face-up) scores 5 points.
Any other turned up team members in uncompleted teams score 1 point each.
An Evil Digimon in your possession scores 2 points.
The player with the most points, wins.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Video Game Theme

name: Mauseschlau & Bärenstark: Abenteuer unter Wasser
description:
A dice driven child game.
The story behind is,that the Player try to dive for a treasure which is garded by a octupus.
There are action fields, where the player has to draw a card and has to answer questions or make Actions (e.g. acting a special situation.
The Player who is first back on the ship with his treasure wins.

name: Pages of War: M.O.D.E
description:
This is the First in the Pages of War Series of Card Games: M.O.D.E (Men, Orcs, Dragkins, Elves)

Pages of War: M.O.D.E is a richly strategic game with simple mechanics and a unique flavour.

You take on the role of a bard of 1 of the 4 races in the western lands of the continent of Murghingale: MEN of the Blue Mountain, ORCS of the Black Hills, DRAGKINS of the Cloudy Peaks, and ELVES of the Verdant-Wood.

As a bard of one of these races your goal is to tell the greatest tale of its glory and strength by reciting the rhymes and songs of history.

BASICS:
Each player gets a deck (Historia) of 30 cards containing 22 heroes of 3 of the 5 suits (Axe, Bow, Sword, Lance, and Winged), 3 Jacks (generals of their 3 suits), 3 Aces (special tactics) and 2 monarchs (King and Queen).

The Goal is to create chapters (groups of heroes) that are strong enough to find the other players' Kings and Queens and destroy them - defeating other players' chapters and collecting their cards as spoils of war as you battle to achieve victory.

Once a player's King and Queen are destroyed they are eliminated from the battle to win but can turn the tide of combat with their remaining cards by adding their heroes to the chapters of other players.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Worker Placement

name: Scary Apples to Apples Snack Pack
description:
Mini game pack or expansion for Apples to Apples.

The wild card and party game that provides instant fun for four to 10 players is now scary fun! Still as easy as "comparing apples to apples" you simply open the box, deal the cards and you're ready to play! Select the card from your hand that you think best describes a card played by the judge. If the judge picks your card, you win that round. Everyone gets a chance to be the judge! Each round is filled with surprising and outrageous comparisons from a wide range of people, places, things and events. Add to your Apples to Apples Party Box or play as a standalone game. Fast moving and refreshing, Apples to Apples is perfect for any get-together with family and friends!

name: Dora's Carnival Fiesta
description: Join Dora, Boots and friends for their party at the carnival. A cooperative effort to collect tickets by playing carnival style activities like ring toss, feeding apples to barn animals, knocking over milk bottles and other fun games. Turn over the tickets at the end of play to reveal puzzle images. Together, complete the spectacular carousel. puzzle in the middle of the game board. There are 6 different carnival activities to play. BONUS Dora and Boots pawn figures included.

name: Les Petits Pirates
description:
Les Petits Pirates is a mini game played on a single, small game board. In Les Petits Pirates, players are pirates, working to gather resources and gold while trying to prevent their opponents from doing the same. Through action selection and dice manipulation, players will plunder, attack, and sail the seas in their quest to bury enough treasure and enjoy a decadent pirate retirement!



Features:Les Petits Pirates is an easy game to expand for more players or larger games. A single 5.5” x 8.5” game board can support 2-4 players with 3 ships each. Multiple game boards can be combined, or a larger board used to easily expand the game for 5-6 players. Special rules and map also allow for solo play. More variety can be easily introduced by simply printing new maps that can be used alone or combined with other maps. The game can easily be re-themed for a variety of genres, like Vikings, Space, High Fantasy, etc. Les Petits Pirates can easily be played with just the game board and typical household items, like dice and coins, but the game lends itself to having a ‘deluxe’ edition that includes nicer components.



Overview:Les Petits Pirates is played in two phases per round. In the first phase all players roll Action dice for their pirate ships and then place them in turn order. In the second phase each Action die is resolved from the lowest to the highest. This means that the player order for the second phase changes every round. Each die provides a choice of Actions, from attacking other pirates to plundering ports to burying gold. However, players are able to manipulate their dice by spending gold and resources to take their desired action. The first player to successfully bury twenty gold coins is the winner.



Accolades:Les Petits Pirates has been tested at Protospiel and other game design meetups. Les Petits Pirates won 2nd place in the 2015 MicroGame Print and Play Contest on Board Game Geek. Les Petits Pirates was a finalist in the KBG Design Contest.



Print & Play:Print & Play files are available in the Web Links section at the official page (at http://georgejaros.com/LPP )
mechanics: Action Queue, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Variable Phase Order, Worker Placement

name: Woof
description:
Woof is a danish board game for the whole family... and their dog.

Woof contains 200 different questions and exercises in different degrees of difficulty, so everybody will be able to play, even the dog. An exercise could be having to stand still on all fours for 20 seconds or sit with a treat on the nose for 2 seconds.

If you answer questions correctly or complete an exercise you gain a (cardboard) treat, but if you fail you gain a (cardboard) dog poo. If you collect 4 dog poo tokens you are out of the game.

name: Lauf, Pinguin!
description:
In Lauf, Pinguin!, four little penguins are on their way to the penguin playground, jumping from ice floe to ice floe while also trying to collect anchovies and sardines.

But suddenly dangerous orcas appear between the ice floes. Who will reach the penguin playground first? And who will have caught the most fish?

name: Tentacle Bento: Work Study
description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Tentacle Bento: Fitness Club
description: Metal miniature and Expansion Card for Tentacle Bento
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Miniatures

name: Chat Game
description:
A party game with cards of three categories: Description of words, Pantomime, Lists

Split into two teams! The more the better! Make sounds, pantomime or anyhting you can to describe the most words to your teammates!

name: Alchemy!: Famous Alchemists, Amazing Potions, & Remarkable Places
description:
From the publisher:

This expansion for Alchemy! introduces new rules that can be included in the base game. In addition to 21 new potions the contents of this box allows you to play Alchemy! as a famous alchemist each with their own unique ability or in a new location with unique rules and conditions.

name: Stop
description: The players start with 175,- gamemoney and have to get from their starting point to the roundabout and a crossing on the other side of the board and back to their starting point, while minding the traffic rules. The first to achive this, gets a bonus of 50,-. Movement is determined by a die and the traffic lights at the center of the board. While playing, the players have to pay fees or receive bonuses. The game ends when the first player returns to his starting point and the player with the most money wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Promptoyo
description:
A game requiring a sharp eye and a quick hand !

Where you need to be the first to find the card with all of the elements appearing on the dice. Be careful and be quick because although the cards may look alike, they're all different! Keep your eyes open, and beware of the traps !

Each round, the dice are rolled, and players search for a card that has all the elements that are on the rolled dice. The first player that finds the correct card may advance his score marker. When a player reaches the last space on the score track, he wins the game!

name: Desafío Energético
description:
Desafío Energético is a family boardgame about the development of the oil industry and the distribution of its products to different regions in Argentina.

It's a game of two to four players with a duration of 30-45 minutes.
The goal is to get as many points through the fuel supply to different provinces , building refineries and developing production areas.

To supply a province, the player must place chips in each area of the production chain : exploration, production , refining and transport networks , which connect these boxes with different provinces.
During his turn , the player can make one of two choices:

Take two cards from the deck.
Change 3 or 4 equal cards to place tiles on the board and expand the network.
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: Circular Dominoes
description:
From the Publisher's site:

An original way to play this classic game of dominos. When the pieces are placed together they form a circle. The vintage illustrated cardboard pieces create a different scene with each game. Presented in a vintage style cardboard box.

name: Psycho
description:
From the back of the box:

Psycho is a great game for all the family for 2 to 6 players. You will need your wits about you as you travel around the Brain Drain squares before landing in the Consulting Rooms and finally entering the shrinkery.

The pitfalls you must face involve Self Analysis where you must divulge your thoughts about a particular picture, or even the Brain Wave squares where you must remember and repeat sequences backwards! It's fun, fast and very frustrating. It could really drive you nuts!

name: A Horse Racing Dice Game
description: Roll the dice and try and to get your horse to the finish line first!
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Party Game, Racing

name: Hacker Dice
description:
In Hacker Dice players are hackers trying to gain control of a network of servers for their own nefarious (or virtuous!) purposes.

The game combines a Yahtzee-style mechanism of rolling dice with a memory element of remembering the defenses of the servers. Players gain control of servers by breaking through their defenses. They can increase their chances by creating malware.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Memory, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Modular Board, Network and Route Building

name: Monopoly Junior: Sofia the first
description:
Trade your lesson books to learn royal lessons in this magical edition of the Monopoly Junior game!

Collect and connect the 5 pieces of your royal tiara puzzle to WIN!

name: Think in a Blink Need to Know Knowledge
description:
Think in a Blink is a fun, interactive safety and ethical trivia game designed to teach children how to stay safe and to be kind.

Think in a Blink is an interactive family game where children "laugh while they learn." With humorous questions and brilliant illustration, Think in a Blink empowers children with "need to know knowledge" so they can respond safely and appropriately to life's detours.

In this edition of Think in a Blink there are four destination areas: Home, School, Recreation and Shopping. Each area is color coded and has 16 spaces for questions. The player/team rolls the number-die and moves the number spaces indicated. When a player reaches the middle he collects the souvenir piece for that location.

Object of the game:
To answer the questions correctly and collect all 4 souvenir pieces. The player or team that collects all 4-souvenir pieces first is the winner.

name: Dennis the Menace
description:
Often confused with Dennis the Menace and Gnasher, this is actually a very different game of set collection and movement.
Players are required to move around the board to different locations, collecting Menace and mischief cards while avoid Dad and the Slipper! The location cards all require a different number and combination of Menace cards to be completed and the first to complete a set number is the winner!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: La Quête des Chevaliers
description:
La Quête des Chevaliers (Knights' Quest) is a boardgame that is primarily a memory mechanic game.

The two players face each other, both players must remember the location of the Excalibur swords and dragons laid about the board. Then they close their eyes, moving their finger on the plateau to reach the castle of their opponent without touching a dragon. And when they find Excalibur, they win gold coins. Players must therefore memorize the course and stay well focused. The winner is the player who wins the most coins by reaching the other's castle.

name: Bluff-Yatzy
description: Bluff-Yatzy is a variation of Yatzy, where the player can hide dice with the help of 3 stackable cups. The player may when be bluffing about the result. The winner is the player with the best dice-combinations and/or best bluffing skills.

name: Bubble Guppies Fin-tastic Field Trip Game
description:
From the box:
"8 place to visit, 4 games to play! Use the 4 double-sided game boards individually to play a fast-placed, token-collecting game. OR, put them together to make your very own game board and the race begins! Collect tokens from each area and be the first one home, to win."

Bubble Guppies Fin-Tastic Field Trip Game is a spin-and-move game where players move their characters around the track, collecting tokens. The board is modular and may be reassembled in different configurations. Each section represents a particular location, such as a museum, farm or supermarket. The object of the game is to visit each location and collect a token from each before returning to the starting space. To make the game more challenging, tokens can be placed face-down to add a memory element.

There are also three other versions to play the game included. In Gil's Game, players must claim tokens held up by a game leader by matching them to pictures on their board. The first player to fill his or her board wins. Molly's Memory Game is a re-theme of the classic matching game Memory. In Mr. Grouper's What's Missing? Game, players take turns playing the role of Mr. Grouper. Mr. Grouper lays out five tiles. After looking at them, other players close their eyes and Mr. Grouper removes one tile. Players in turn try to identify the missing tile. The first player to identify the tile wins it. The next player to the left then becomes Mr. Grouper. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Pass the Grass
description:
From the publisher:

Pass the Grass is an interactive board game that borrows elements ranging from the innocent world of Milton Bradley to the psychedelic vibe of the Grateful Dead. Rolling both dice and joints, players make their way around the board in a quest for the perfect buzz while completing hilarious challenges and satisfying their lust for “munchies.” Pass the Grass can be played with 2 or more players but they must be 21 or over. Clearly, this is a game for adults (cough).

Take turns drawing cards (and puffs) and complete challenges to win. Includes: 1 game board, 2 dice, 6 game "tokens," 2 decks of cards, and a rule book.

GAME PLAY: Everybody puts $1 in the jackpot. There are two sets of cards, you roll dice and there are places on the board that tell you to do different things. You take a card, and each card will tell you to do something different. There are credit and pass cards. A credit card means you do what the card says, which could be anything from taking a hit off a joint, to eating some munchies, to telling an embarrassing story. If you take a pass card, you pass it to anybody and then they have to do it. If they choose not to, they’re out. If you land on the jackpot, you get all the money and everyone replenishes it with $1 each, but it can be more if players want. Players who choose not to ante up are out. Last player still playing wins the pot. (Everyone else wins a nice buzz.) For a shorter game, play ends when someone lands on the jackpot.

Players may substitute a shot of booze for a puff of pot.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Operation Escape E.V.I.L.
description:
Four scientists from across the world have been invited by the Earth Vision Industrial Labs (E.V.I.L), to create a chemical potion that would eradicate malnutrition from our planet. However, after reaching the laboratory, the scientists realise that the E.V.I.L Chairman has other plans in mind and is looking to rule the world with a potent mind control potion. On refusing to cooperate, they were locked-up within the laboratory. Can you help them escape E.V.I.L?

The game basically involves moving on the board from one spot to another (based on die roll), each spot either gives you the option to buy some chemical, or steal money from prison guards. Essentially, you need to obtain all the resources needed for your eventual goal (decided at the start of the game), then move towards a location on the board, which is the warden's office and then die-roll your way out of a secret track to the end of the game. If you are the first one to do that, you win!

name: Prehistoric Game
description:
The game is based on Ludo. The aim of the players is to feed their dinosaurs.
Two players have 4 herbivorous dinosaurs and two other players have a carnivorous dinosaur. Winner of the game is the player who first had 6 tokens with food and return to their lair with all the pieces.
Herbivores collect tokens by bypassing the round by the board and return it to its lair. Carnivorous dinosaurs get a token every time you step on the same field with another dinosaur.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Company: The Business Operation Card Game
description: In Company: The Business Operation Card Game, players can buy and sell goods in order to build their company — that is, their personal deck of cards. During the game, players must manage real estate cards that inflict regular maintenance costs on their owner, possibly causing severe cash flow issues during the company start-up section of each round.

name: New Zealand (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Slovakia (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: The Incredible Hulk Game
description:
Players start out as Banner, get angry and change into the Hulk, smashing everything in their path as they try to get to the Abomination.

The objective of the game is to knock the Abomination cube into your color's win area.

After moving Banner to a transformation square you take your turn by rolling two dice that can allow you to move, attack or revert back to Banner.

You are working against the other Hulk players to defeat the abomination yourself.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Rekin Finansowy
description:
The box description (in Polish):
Giełda, makler, akcje i obligacje... Te i inne ekonomiczne terminy weszły już na trwałe do naszego języka i życia. Proponujemy grę, która wprowadzi nas w świat giełdy, oswoi z prawami rządzącymi rynkiem i finansami. Grę dla wszystkich, bo wszyscy odczuwamy skutki prawdziwej gry giełdowej.

Monopoly-like game about stock exchange. Buying and selling stocks, obligations, etc. to earn more money than other players.

The tracks on the board are two circles, touching on one edge.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Chasin' Cheeky
description:
Join Elefun's newest friend, the trouble-loving Chasin' Cheeky monkey in this ring-tossin' Chasin' Cheeky game. In this up-and-active game, Chasin' Cheeky will race around the room as you try to get your colored rings on his tail. Once you get all of your rings onto his tail, be the first to grab his banana and shake it with Chasin' Cheeky to celebrate your win.

Play again by putting the banana back in Cheeky's mouth.

name: Wave of Fictions (fan expansion for Ophidian 2350)
description: Wave of Fictions is a 140-card expansion set plus 3 brand new promo cards.The Wave of Fictions set was the first and last Ophidian 2350 CCG set to be made with a mix of official Ophidian 2350 CCG cards with Fan Submitted card making a unique set that expanded the Ophidian 2350 CCG Universe in a way never made before in the card game industry.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck Construction, Player Elimination

name: Ophidian Legends (fan expansion for Ophidian 2350)
description:
The Ophidian Legends is a 25-card expansion special mini-set and has as the main theme the Legendary Ophidian League Gladiators. And there’s more, much more as we also showcase in a 5 cards subset focusing the most brutal war that happened in the Ophidian Universe, the Demon Wars!!!

And as if that is not enough the set also brings back the Reindeer's Minions that were seen last year in the Holiday 2004 set, after all we’re on Christmas Season, and although we don’t have the return of Arkon Klaus, this set also includes a 5 cards subset with many cards for him (or any other Gladiator) to use.

The expansion also features two brand new mechanisms:

Legendary Cards

This Set include Gladiators, Minions and Pumps with a keyword that indicate that they are Legendary Characters, this keyword is currently seen in two Gladiators cards Arkon Klaus (from Holiday 2004 set) & Pestilence (from WOF set). The Legendary Characters are Ophidian League Gladiators, they may be included in any Team, and they act like any regular Gladiator. When a Legendary Gladiator is destroyed he is placed in the Funeral Pyre, and your opponent’s gains the double of the VP of the Legendary Gladiator. The Legendary cards are also unique cards, and even though they don’t have the keyword written on them, they automatically count as unique cards.

Minions that act like Gladiator Cards

This Set include Minions with the following text “CARD NAME counts as a XVP {DISCIPLINE}{DISCIPLINE} Gladiator”. Currently only one Minion cards has this Mechanism, Doombringer (from The OutWorlds Revelations set). The Minion can use Pumps that apply for the stated Disciplines and VP, but for all the purposes the card is still a Minion card. It also mean that when the Minion is destroyed he also is Placed in the Funeral Pyre alongside the Gladiators cards, and as that the
opponent will gain the VP mentioned on the Minion card. If the Minion card has also the Legend keyword, the VP that the opponent will gain when the minion is destroyed is determinate by the Legendary Cards Mechanism.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Deck Construction, Player Elimination

name: Matringo
description:
User summary:
In the game of マトリンゴ (Matringo), players control three sisters of Matryoshka (Russian dolls) to gather colourful fruits from a tree.

You roll a die three times, first to move the youngest sister, second for the middle, and third for the eldest. The younger two sisters drop fruits from the tree, and the eldest picks them up and put them into current player's basket.
When a player fills their basket, a round ends and players collect victory points according to their fruits gathered. The more fruits of the same colour you gather, the more victory points you gain.

All components are hand-made with a collaboration with a pyrography (wood burning) artist.

Publisher's summary:
マトリョーシカの三姉妹がカラフルな実を集めるゲームです。
ダイスを振ってマトリョーシカを動かします。
木の上の二人が実を落とし、木の下にいる娘が実を拾います。
カゴに実を集めていっぱいになったら全員同時に点数計算をします。
同じ色を多く集めた方が点数が高くなります。
箱を含め、内容物はすべて手作りで、ウッドバーニング作家とのコラボレーション作品です。

name: Democratyk
description: This game recreate the first democratic elections in spain in 1977 after Franco period. Each player choose a political party and start with money for the political campaign. Roll the die and move your counter on the map. If you finish the movement on a city square, you remove and take a square counter wich represents votes, if not some event happens, . The game finish when all votes have been removed from the board. The player with more votes and secondary money wins the game.

name: Mice in a Maze
description:
Somewhere outside your safe nest there is a tasty cheese. The catch is that the stupid humans have not only placed it in a maze but also that the maze keeps changing. Nevertheless, you want that cheese, even if it means that you have to face dangerous traps. Beware, there are other mice in the maze as well and they may trick you to leave the cheese in their nests instead.

For each cheese that you take to your private nest, you score 1 point. For each cheese that you take to a shared nest, the players of the adjacent private nests score 1 point each. The player with the most points when all cheeses have been taken or no more actions are possible wins.
