The game starts with 7x7 maze tiles, of which only the central one (the Cheese Chamber) is turned face up. The players start with 1 maze tile each. Each turn, a player does the following:

1. Move your mouse as far as you can along the path. In a nest, you may choose not to move, and in the Cheese Chamber, you may choose through which exit you move.
2. Move marbles as far as they can along the path. Marbles are traps that return mice to their nests and cause them to lose 1 turn.
3. Replace a maze tile anywhere in the maze by placing the one on your hand face up. If the maze tile you replace is turned face up, the next maze tile you replace must be turned face down.

When you leave the Cheese Chamber, you take a cheese, and when you enter a nest, you leave the cheese there, even if it is not a nest of your own. If you are hit by a marble, the cheese is left in the maze, and if you pass another mouse, you exchange whatever you carry. If you move out of the maze, you return to your nest and loses one turn while the cheese is returned to the Cheese Chamber. If the path is a loop, neither mice or marbles move.

The combination of free placement of maze tiles and forced movement through the maze creates a strong take that mechanism. Not only can you prevent other mice from finding the cheese but you can even force them to take it to your own nest. When you place a maze tile, each other player gets to place a maze tile so you must be very careful when moving in the maze!
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Take That, Tile Placement

name: Goat Army
description:
Goat War has broken out!
As such, the goats have been prepared and reinforced to carry their army to the victory.

Goat Army is a strategic and cooperative card game where you challenge your friends to a battle with armoured and crazy goats. NSFW deck available!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Territory Building
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Olympiade Spillet
description:
Olympiade Spillet is a quiz game about the Olympics.

It contains 1.000 questions about the Summer Olympics from 1896 till 2000 (excluding the unofficial 1906 games). They are divided into 5 categories: Ceremony and ritual (blue), sports (yellow), Danes in the Olympics (red), athletics (green) and legends (orange).

It can be played by 2 to 5 players or teams.

Each player/team rolls a die by turn and then has to answer a question in the category rolled. If you answer correctly you will receive a marker in the same color. If your answer is wrong nothing happens and the next player gets his turn. The object of the game is to collect a marker of each color. If you roll a color that you already have you will loose your turn.

The sixst side of the die is blank. Whenever this is rolled a punishment will be dealt. Who will receive this punishment is decided by spinning an Olympic torch. What the punishment is can be decided from game to game. Usually it is to loose a marker or your turn but for party games it can be getting a round for the table or something similar.

name: Funny Bunny Rhyming Game
description:
Find two bunnies with words that rhyme. Remember where they are, it's memory time! 2 levels of play.

Includes:
4 double-sided game cards
40 bunny cards
Activity guide

Players put the 40 bunny cards in the middle, face down. Each player takes a game card which has 4 spaces for bunny cards. Players each draw a bunny card and place it on their game card. This is the word they must rhyme. Players take turns turning over a bunny card. It if rhymes with their first word, they add it to their game card. If not, they turn it back over. The other players may turn this same card over if it rhymes with their word, or they may turn another card over. First player to fill their card with 5 words that rhyme, wins.

name: Wild Word Adventure
description:
Product Description:
Motivate beginning readers to build 3, 4 and even 5 letter words! Reinforces letter recognition, beginning and ending consonant sounds, rhyming and spelling. Color coded for 3 levels of play.

Includes:


80 self-checking question cards
104 lowercase letter cards
25 word cards
Animal pawns
Game board


Grades: Kindergarten +

How to play:

Pick a word card, then roll the die and hop around the board.
To earn a letter, correctly answer the question that matches the color you land on.
Be the first to match up all letters to those on your word card to win!

name: Fossil Hunters
description:
Fossil Hunters is a game of area encirclement for 2-5 players. All players have access to the same slab of rock. The goal is to split it apart, divide the spoils, and form complete dinosaur skeletons. Large dinosaurs are much more lucrative, but incomplete skeletons do not score!

Using wooden sticks to divide the board, players collectively determine which tiles will be claimed and by whom. As the board splits and shrinks, players are pressured to finish what they've started before every fossil is claimed. Timing is everything, so sometimes it is best to take a partial turn and conserve resources for later. Each player also holds a unique single-use tool. This should be employed at the best moment for the greatest reward.

Fossil Hunters is a short small-box game, taking only 20 minutes to play.

name: Fairmondo: das Spiel
description:
Fairmondo is the project to create a global online-marketplace - owned by its local users. This is realised through a network of independent local co-operatives in every covered country. The first prototype was launched in Germany in September 2013.

The makers of Fairmondo have now turned their experiences into a co-operative card-game. The players have to hold their ground as operators of online-marketplaces against the market leader who is trying to install a monopoly.
The player have to bring together supply and demand, build up a strong community and cooperate cleverly to establish their alternatives.

name: それでも勇者は行く (The Brave Still Go Around)
description: In それでも勇者は行く (The Brave Still Go Around), people live in fear of the shadow of horrible monsters, so brave heroes must confront these monsters of the world using swords and magic (and 48 cards and seven dice).

name: Monster Collection Trading Card Game: God Eater Burst
description: Based on the God Eater video games the Monster Collection Trading Card Game features person and monster cards. It comes with a mat, 50 card deck, and special dice.

name: Witchfinder
description:
Players try rooting out witchcraft in their opponents village.
Each player has a deck of 9 character cards which they will use by drawing one and then playing one each turn in an attempt to locate the opponents witch card and avoid taking curses.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management

name: Masha and the Bear: Trouble in the Garden
description:
Masha and Bear lavish care and attention on the fruit and vegetables in their garden: the strawberries, raspberries, carrots and all the other healthy delicacies. They love picking them and nibbling on them. But what’s THAT? Every night, uninvited guests get amongst the beds and help themselves to the fruit and vegetables. Who on earth can it be? Get your thinking caps on and start guessing!
Who knows which animal is going to cause havoc in Masha and the Bear’s garden next? The player to guess correctly the most times can advance his figure the furthest, and wins the game.

Each player selects one animal card. Each player places the selected animal card face-down in front of them. The other three animal cards are put to one side, also face-down.
Once all the players have decided on one animal and have put down the animal card in front of them, face-down, the youngest player takes the shaker, shakes it vigorously and then tips all the chips out onto the table. The chips must be separated such that the top side of the chip is clearly recognised.
Now each player turns their selected animal card face-up and compares it: How many animal chips can you see that show the same animal as depicted on your own card? You are allowed to move your figure precisely the same amount of fields up the game board.

The player whose figure is the first to reach the final field is the
winner.

name: Hauska Kiusa
description:
Hauska Kiusa ("Funny Tease" in english) is an childrens card game from early 1980s. The idea is to divide the cards evenly between two, three or four players leaving the "Kiusa"-card at the center of the table.
The players, in turns, play the cards by rules. The first player without any cards in hand wins. Who has "Kiusa"-card in hand loses (he/she gets minus twenty five points), other players get one minus point for every card they have in hand.

name: Shotzee! Dice Drinking Game
description:
From the box:
"The intoxicating game of skill and chance! Cheers! It's always happy hour when you play this outrageous party game! Take a chance and roll the dice--this may become your latest vice!"

Shotzee is a Yahtzee-like game (hence the name) that incorporates drinking but can also be played without it. In the game, players roll dice to try to assemble either a full house, strait or a Shotzee (five of a kind). On his or her turn, a player rolls five dice. Each die will show one of six symbols, which may instruct the player or another player to drink, or may display a "party foul" for which no one drinks. The player will then look as his or her dice and decide which ones he or she wants to save (in order to try to get one of the winning combinations) and then marks those saved dice on a score card. Players then refill their glasses and play passes to the next player. When the original player plays again, he or she rolls however many dice were not "saved" on the first turn, trying to complete the chosen combination. Play continues until one player completes a winning combination of dice. The game comes with six tiny plastic shot glasses.

name: Mo Mo Toretore
description:
User summary
In the game of モーモートレトレ (Mo Mo Toretore), you are an alien Primary Schoolchild. During a school outing to the planet Earth, your teacher told you to capture cows in the field.

The teacher specifies how many cards you must play, and you play that number of cards. If the cards' total face value equals a cow's number, you can capture the cow. (Your arithmetic skills are tested because you are a Primary Schoolchild).

If you are the only one who played your number, you get the whole points, otherwise points are divided among players who played that number.

With cute illustrations, this card game can be enjoyed by all, from children to adults. This game is especially good for those who frequently play with Primary Schoolchildren or new gamers. The first edition is published in Japanese but English rules are available online.

Publisher's summary
モーモートレトレは、宇宙人の小学生となってウシを捕まえるのが目的のゲーム。
先生の指示の枚数のカードを使って手札の数字とウシの数字をあわせよう。（簡単な足し算引き算が必要です）
自分だけが出した数字なら独り占め、他の人も出してたら分け合おう。

かわいらしい絵柄で、お子様から大人まで楽しんでいただけるカードゲームです。
特に小学生くらいのお子さんやゲーム初心者の方と遊ぶ機会が多い方にお勧めのワイワイと楽しめるゲームに仕上がりました。
publishers: キングダイズゲーム (KingDaiz Game)

name: Christmas cracker cannon game
description:
An abstract strategy game for two played on the intersections of the square of 9 cells, making a 4x4 playing area. One player has 6 red counters, the other has 6 blue.
Starting position: Red places 4 counters along the upper edge, and the remaining two counters on the two points on the sides that adjoin his two corners. Blue places his 6 counters on the remaining edge points.
Players take turns to move one of their counters either vertically or horizontally. The rules do not state how far a counter may be moved.
If, by moving a counter, a player creates a horizontal or vertical line of exactly 3 counters, consisting of two of one colour and one of the other, then the singleton is removed from the board. Rules suggest, but do not confirm, that the line of three must be unbroken. No capture is made if a line of four is created. Rules do not state what happens if horizontal and vertical unbroken lines of 3 are created simultaneously.
When one player loses all his counters, the other is the winner.

This game was included in a Christmas cracker in England in about 1998.

The name given above is a place holder, as no name is given. It was chosen as the board is embellished with a picture of a person with a cannon! The game is printed on a small piece of glossy paper, which also bear the rules. This is folded into quartets, and supplied in a small polythene bag, along with six red counters, and six of another colour (blue or yellow), weighing just 4 grammes.

name: Confrontation
description:
In Confrontation, players choose between being members of the student protesters and Establishment teams. The latter is broken down into ten subgroups, including the military, Washington, city hall, the university administration, etc.

The goal of the Establishment theme is to keep things the way they are. The students will use peaceful protests, strikes and riots to change society for the better.

The game consists of 11 team cards, 4 results charts (effectively CRTs), 16 confrontation cards, 18 student tokens, 6 police tokens, and 36 Establishment resources tokens. Each side debates the issue at hand, commits resources to confrontation, then consults the results chart to see who wins.

name: Fylgia
description:
Fylgia is a abstract strategy game. The winner is the player with playing pieces left on the board.

Every player has 5 pieces and the board is 8x5 big. On your turn you can only move one step diagonally. And you can also only strike diagonally. Every time you do a standard move you can change a bonus-counter one step to a max of three. To use your bonus is the only way to move in a straight line, in any direction accept diagonally. And you have to move as many steps as your bonus-counter is on. Before or after such movement your are allowed to do a standard move diagonally. After the movement is done, the bonus-counter is reduced to nil, and you have to start to get new bonus.

name: Boggle: M Happy Meal
description:
The game components consist of eight strips, each with four letters on each side, printed in a vertical column. Four of these strips are taken at randon and arranged on a 4x4 square.
Players try to form as many words as possible from the letters in the array, Each letter used in a word must be connected orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to the next. Players score one point per letter with an extra point for any Q used. Most points wins.

name: Saikoro no Are
description:
User summary:
The publisher refers to サイコロのアレ (Saikoro no Are) as 'That Dice Game' (an ironic joke).

Saikoro no Are is a mind game that uses dice, but players are not allowed to roll any die.

Active player's goal is to earn points by making a specific hand, such as three of a kind or four dice in sequence, with six dice. Non-active players' goal is to prevent the active player from making a hand by correctly specifying what number the active player chooses.

For each die, do the following actions:
1)The active player chooses a number and places a die to show that number. This action can be performed secretly or publicly.

2)All non-active player guesses what number the active player chooses, and place a die to show that number secretly.

3)Then, the active player may spend two victory points to change the number chosen.

4)Finally, all players reveal their dice. If the active player's chosen number equals any non-active player's, the attempt fails and that non-active player gains victory points.

Once the active player has failed a number of times equal to the number of non-active players, that player's turn is terminated with no victory points.

Otherwise, when the sixth attempt is finished, the active player gains victory points according to the hand made with the six dice. After each player has taken their turn being the active player, the highest scorer wins the game.

Any conversations, including bluffing, are encouraged during the game. The rules of the game are simple, but free conversation makes the game intriguing and exciting. You'll never know the strange feeling until you play.

Publisher's summary:
サイコロを振る事を禁止した今までに無い新感覚な心理戦ゲームです。
手番プレイヤーはサイコロの目を対戦相手にばれない様に役を作ります。
対戦相手は手番プレイヤーのサイコロの目を当てる事で点数を稼ぎます。
ゲーム手順
手番プレイヤーが先にプロットし、その様子を対戦相手が覗いてもOK！
その後、会話を自由に行い対戦相手がプロットを行う。
一度プロットした後は、一斉に公開するまで決して変更してはいけないが、
手番プレイヤーのみ２点支払うことで自由に変更しても良い！
単純ルールなのに奥の深い戦略。対戦相手の裏をかいて高得点を狙え！
遊ばないと伝わらない、不思議なゲーム感覚です。

name: Superfight: PAX Prime 2015 Promo Pack
description: This is a set of nine cards for Superfight that was released at PAX Prime 2015. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: BATLHEX
description:
From the publisher:

BATLHEX (pronounced bat'l-heks) is a novel strategy board game played by two opponents who battle against one another with game pieces on a hexagonal board. To win a player must be the first to capture all of the opponent's pieces. Each player’s ability to move or return a piece to the board is determined by rolling a die. This highly replayable game, which features a game board, die, twelve game pieces, and a rule sheet, incorporates a unique method of play that makes the game both easy to learn by the youngest players and a challenge for mature gamers. (Level: Beginner-Intermediate)

BATLHEX Commander is a variation of the basic game that removes the die and adds a Commander piece to both sides. The object is to capture the opponent's Commander first. All of the pieces (with the exception of the Commander) share the same unique movement capability, and both player's have a chance to bring a captured piece back during a turn if they occupy a certain hex. BATLHEX Commander allows both players to think several turns ahead and develop various long-term strategies. (Level: Intermediate-Advanced)

name: Go Nutz
description:
Each player gets a squirrel and the objective is then to collect nuts in each of the five colors.

You move around the game board by dice rolls and collect nuts by landing on the squares with the colored nuts on them. When you roll your die you must move the entire roll unless you can reach a nut with less.

A fox is also in play and blocks the road he is on. The fox is moved freely on the board (not following paths) by a player when he rolls a one - though not to squares containing nuts or other players.

Player also start with 2 random pine-cone cards giving advantages that can be used during the players turn (jumping over the fox, exchanging a nut of one color for another and such). You can get more cards in 2 ways - either by landing on a pine-cone square or by landing on a square that contain another squirrel. When landing on such a square each of the 2 players have to roll a die and the one with the largest roll gets the pine-cone card.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Unnützes Quizzen: Dies & Das
description:
Unnützes Quizzen: Dies & Das ("Unuseful Knowledge: This and That") is a German Trivia Game with obscure facts various things.

From the Publisher (translated):
"Test your unuseful knowledge! How many underpants does the average german man own? Why can't astronauts burp? And on which chromosome is the gene for ear wax located? The big questions of the animal kingdom - in this quiz from the popular section of the NEON magazine, they will all be answered."

From the publisher (German):
Teste dein unnützes Wissen! Wie viele Unterhosen besitzt der deutsche Durchschnittsmann? Warum können Astronauten nicht rülpsen? Und auf welchem Chromosom liegt eigentlich das Gen für Ohrenschmalz? Die großen Fragen des Alltags – in diesem Quiz zur beliebten Rubrik aus dem NEON-Magazin werden sie alle beantwortet! Für zuhause, für unterwegs, für zwischendurch: 99 Quiz-Fragen zum Immerdabeihaben.

name: Monster High: Monsterkrasses Such-Spiel
description: Players in Monster High: Monsterkrasses Such-Spiel want to collect the eerily beautiful images of those in school in order to complete their photo album — but which monster fits where? Only those quick enough to find the proper photo album page for the images will collect them, and whoever first collects six images wins!

name: Bullshit Quiz
description:
The Bullshit Quiz is a game about populism and right-wing extremist positions. It's satirical and tries to sensitize the players for extremist views or statements. The populists in the game and their statements are original ones from current social debates in germany. The game is designed by the authors of a famous satirical news site. They've also created the Minderheiten-Quartett.

From the publisher (translated and abbreviated):
Welcome to the Bullshit Quiz - the interactive crashcourss in Populism.

The game consists of 2 phases:
In the Quiz-Phase quotations of right wing populists are read out, the players must guess who said it (out of a selection of 4). The winner takes a bullshit card.
In Phase 2 players must a create a funny sentence with their bullshit cards, which is then rated by the others.
The game includes cartoon drawings and short biographies of the 30 populists.

From the publisher:
Herzlich willkommen bei Bullshit Quiz - dem interaktiven Crashkurs in Rechtspopulismus.

Haben Sie das Gefühl, nicht von Ihrem Normalsein zu profitieren? Haben Sie es satt, dass sich Politik und Medien immer nur mit den Problemen von Minderheiten beschäftigen? Sind Sie auf der Suche nach einer beruflichen Veränderung?

Werden Sie noch heute Rechtspopulist!

Dazu müssen Sie nicht in teure Ausbildungscamps nach Russland oder Sachsen reisen. Sie können das Populisten-Handwerk auch ganz bequem und spielerisch im heimischem Wohnzimmer erlernen: Vom Sesselpupser zum Opinion-Leader in nur 60 Minuten!

Das Spiel besteht aus 2 Phasen.


In Phase 1, dem "QUIZ" gibt es abhängig der Spieleranzahl unterschiedlich viele Runden. Ein pro Runde wechselnder Quizmaster


liest ein zufälliges Zitat vor. Die Spieler müssen nun aus einer Auswahl von 4 Populisten wählen, wer diesen Bullshit von sich gegeben hat.
Die Spieler die richtig geraten haben, bekommen eine Bullshit-Karte.


In Phase 2, dem "Bullshit", kann jeder Spieler nun den Populisten nacheifern.


Aus den erhaltenen Bullshit-Karten bildet man einen möglichst lustigen Satz, der von den anderen dann bewertet wird.
Die Wertung der Mitspieler + der Bullshit-Faktor der Karten werden addiert und bilden die so eine Endwertung.

Durch die Quiz-Runde erfährt man viel von den Populisten (Steckbriefe enthalten).
Die Zitate sind gut ausgewählt und mit Quellenangabe hinterlegt.
Die Populisten sind durch schöne Karikaturen dargestellt. Die Spielanleitung ("Book of Shame") ist klar geschrieben und einfach verständlich.

name: See-Schlacht
description: See-Schlacht is a card game based on battleship. Each player receives a couple of empty sea cards, 3 single ships (red ship cards), 1 small fleet (2 brown ship cards) and 1 large fleet (3 yellow ship cards). First each player lays out his sea cards in a grid defined by the players (e.g. 4 x 5 cards). Then each player replaces secretly empty sea cards by his ship cards. Single ships are placed by its own, fleets need to be placed on adjacent spaces. In order to trick the oponents he can also replace empty sea cards with other empty sea cards. The game consits of players taking turns in naming a card in an apponents area (e.g. 3rd row, 4th card). The named card is flipped. As sea cards have identical sides players should try to remember which cards have been named. Each player whose ships are all turned face up are out of the game. The last player with hidden ships wins the game.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Nautical

name: Mammals Versus Reptiles
description:
A roll and move game for two players. One player is the mammals, and the other the reptiles. Players roll a special die to move their team of animals along a path to complete a journey to the other end of the path. However the mammals are travelling the opposite direction of the reptiles. No cohabitation of a space is allowed. If two different animals arrive at the same space, one must restart their journey from the beginning.

The game uses special dice, and if the special icon is rolled, an animal must move one space backwards. The board features a few "safe" spaces. The game is won by advancing all of your mammals/reptiles across the path first.

name: InWords
description: In the game of InWords, players spin the wheel in the game board to select a common, everyday word for the round (e.g., Cold, West, Grand, etc.). They then compete to produce answers containing that term which fit into one of the categories listed around the game board (People, Places, Things, TV, Movies, Music). As answers multiply, the challenge and the point totals get larger and larger.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia, Word Game

name: Spoiler
description: This Domino variant adds pieces which enhance strategy. A "Link" allows for the connection of any two dominoes. A "Deadend" terminates a string of dominoes when played at the end. A hexagonal plastic starting board has each number, one through six. The additional piece designs are included in the typical domino distribution. with pips up to six, the total number of tiles is 48. The game is played in rounds, and scoring follows each round until a pre-determined point value is reached.

name: Grand Prix Racing Game
description:
2 Fast 4 you!
Fast racing cars ~ public pitstop ~ playing money ~ digital dice & more... 2 to 4 players ~ several levels ~ age 5 to 105 years

Players must collect as much money as they can during the laps of the race (to be agreed by the players, from 5 minimum to 18 maximum). If a player runs out of money, immediately abandons the race. Race is over when a player finishes all the laps or when the bank runs out of money. The winner of the game is the player who has the biggest amount of money collected.

name: JYNX
description:
JYNX is a Contract Rummy-type card game that compounds hilarious must-perform actions on players—by players—to prevent them from winning. Because of its unique interactivity, JYNX can be played with a family-friendly G-Rating or NSFW R-Rating depending on players.

JYNX naturally invokes the two things I love about card games: Everyone laughing and everyone trash-talking as the game gets closer to finding a winner. JYNX can go in any direction the players choose, and that asks for fun memories and great game nights.

name: Quatre Bras 1815
description:
Game covers battle of the Quatre Bras, fought against Ney and Wellington during the Waterloo campaign.

Game was published in the magazine "Dragon" as an expansion of the "Waterloo 1815". Contains two scenarios, historical and fictional, with random arrival of the units and possibale usage of the Prussian forces as well as French D'Erlon corps.

name: The Secret Of The Atomic Bomb
description:
The goal of the game is to built an atomic bomb.
The game is played in three phases. In the first phase the players try to collect 4 cards of one country by exchanging cards between neighboring players by the roll of an even number. If a player collects 4 cards of a country he contolls this country and enters phase two.

In the second phase the players move around the game board, starting at their own country. Some spaces hinder or benefit the players. They collect fissionable material (atoms) to build an atomic bomb by placing two atoms on any space he occupies in any country that has entered phase two. If a player has collected 11 atoms, his country enters phase three.

In the third phase the players build an atomic bomb by moving the 11 collected atoms from the white dots inside the factory to the blue dots.

The first player to finish his atomic bomb, wins the game.

The Game was published between late 1945 and 1947.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Taking out the Trash
description:
The first in a series of four games by Green Games, Taking out the Trash focuses on the seemingly simple act of recycling. Packed full of information on each of the three trash types featured in the game (landfill, recycling and organics), it raises important questions about the materials we use and where they end up.

The game can accommodate between two and four players. It consists of 58 oversized cards, including 9 Action Cards which add an element of strategy. With hands of four concealed cards, players pick-up and discard one card per turn as they try to collect sets of four matching Trash Cards to "fill" each of their bins. The first player to "fill" each of his/her three bins wins.

This intentionally simple mechanic keeps play time short at around 10 minutes, making it ideal for classroom applications and as an icebreaker to the otherwise quite serious subject of sustainability.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Environmental

name: All About Town Waterville Maine
description: The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a residence square to the bank and shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with the travel cards for all locations contained on his shopping list wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Superfight: PAX South 2016 Promo Pack
description: This is a set of nine cards for Superfight that was released at PAX South 2016. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Political Animal
description: Play as an animal candidates in this seven-states country, win states by predicting/manipulating and  voting cards, in order to get close to the approval rating and be the president.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Humor, Math, Print & Play
mechanics: Hand Management, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Voting

name: Kingdom: An Enchanting Game
description: Kingdom is a game where players battle against each other trying to be the first to match “The Ideal Kingdom” which needs to be made of the right collection of cards. However, the right cards needed in this game may not be the right cards in another game. True, you may pull the same set of cards, but it is highly unlikely there are 531,441 different combinations. You could push ahead getting the right cards in the positions you need them to be in, or do you work to thwart other players efforts. Adding the change a winning combination of the ideal kingdom allows for changes in strategy from one game to the next. Each player starts with three cards and needs to work to create the “Ideal Kingdom” which is a combination of six cards. Each color of card has specific attacks, defense, and special action. Certain colors cards can only sit next to other certain color cards, and coming in contact with opposing cards leads to inactivity or removal. That has something to do with court politics. Cards are drawn and played in turn order, with actions being directed by the cards you have laid out in front of you. Some of those actions allow you to draw extra cards, look at another player’s cards, steal cards, or battle. But, your strategy has to be planned so you can create the ideal kingdom to win. There are 9 major game changer cards in the deck, like creating Immunity from the Black Plague, or Jesters that will play tricks and change the cards. This actually helps the player with the least amount of cards to actually come back and try to win.

name: The Princess and the Frog
description:
Contents: Two finger puppets, a wooden "coin", and rules for free-play as well as for two games.

The two games are: a hide-and-seek type game and a very simple coin flip game.

name: Guldgrävarspelet
description:
Players are gold diggers and everyone needs to find as much gold as possible. Each gold discovery weighed on the scale and gives the player the equivalent amount of gold nuggets. Many dangers lurk on the road. Beware of rattlesnakes and bandits!
To find the gold you need to get on a green site. Once there, take your pick or shovel to loosen the "place". Add "place" on one weighing pan and then gold on the other, it is your gold. If you end up on the trading station so you have to pay in the same way as when you found the gold, it also applies to the saloon. If you encounter Indians, robbers or rattlesnakes, you must wait until the danger is over.The game continues until the gold reserves is over, the one who has the most gold wins.

name: CardRPG
description:
CardRPG is a Solitaire RPG card game played with a standard deck of 52 playing cards, dice, and a character stats sheet. It was created by Ray of Ash and is featured on the Pagat Invented Games list.

Gameplay begins by dividing the cards into a face up attack deck and a face down monster deck. A card is selected from among the royals to represent the player and strength and hit point stats are determined by rolling six sided dice. The player draws hand of attack cards for each point of strength.

The game progresses through a series of monster battles. Monsters stats are determined by dice rolls and an attack pile of four cards is set aside for it. The player and monster alternate playing attack cards from their respective piles, the player by choice and the monster randomly until one of them is defeated. The player may attack with pairs simultaneously for double attack points.

Hit points are reset following the conclusion of the battle and a new monster is created. Experience points are gained in the amount of the hit points of the defeated monster and gold is gained equal to half of that amount. Experience points contribute to the leveling up of character stats and gold may be used to purchase attack cards from the attack pile. A player who dies in battle may be resurrected by voiding gold and experience points. The game may be concluded or suspended at any time.

name: Budget
description:
From the instruction sheet:
"Budget exposes students to some of the realities of real-life economics. The value of home ownership, insurance, and investments is stressed. Careful budgeting, though subject to unexpected events, is rewarded on Pay Day. ...The winner of BUDGET is the player who has the greatest wealth at the end of play."

From description found in a home-school resource catalog (6/2018):
Set your own limit for time (such as 1 hour).
Intended for grades 4 - 12.

name: Röda Tråden Djur
description:
Röda Tråden Djur is a quizgame where the answer of all the questions are about animals. The game plays like the other games in the Råda Tråden series.

The game comes with 80 cards with two subjects on each card. Every subject have 10 clues. One of the players reads a card and knows the answer, tells the other players the subject, and then, one by one, going thru the clues. The players can try to answer on high levels and get a higher score, or wait to answer and get lower score. Every player starts each subject with 10 points, and loses one for each new clue. The winner is the player with most points at the end of the game.

name: Svenska Matspelet
description:
A Swedish quiz game about swedish food. Contains 600 questions in 6 categories ("Food practices", "Food history", "Swedish Favorites", "Kitchen knowledge", "Smorgasbord" & "Guess right").

The player in turn roll a die to choose which category to answer a question from. The winner is the player who has the most points when all cards have been used once.

name: Charader
description: Charader is a word guessing game, a variant of the classic Charades. The game contains of 50 cards. Each card has 5 words on them, and one "performance" objective that must be fulfilled. The players are divided into two teams. One person in a team reads a card, and must get the other persons in the team to guess all the words on the card, without saying a word, just be doing gestures, and must also fulfll "performance" objective, eg. once during the charade correct their clothes, to get one point for the team. The charade must be done in a specific amount of time. Then it is the other teams turn. The team with most point in the end of the game, eg 10 rounds, is the winner.

name: Familjecharader
description:
Familjecharader is a word guessing game, a variant of the classic Charades. This is a family variant of the game with cards with pictures on them.

The game contains of 100 cards. Each card has 1 picture on them, eg a shark, a pencil or a rocking horse. The players are divided into two teams. One person in a team looks at one card, and must get the other persons in the team to guess what was depicted on the card with gestures, to get one point for the team. To do sounds (not words) is ok. The charade must be done in a specific amount of time. Then it is the other teams turn. The team with most point in the end of the game, eg 10 rounds, is the winner.

name: Estanciero Express
description: This express edition of Argentinian game Estanciero. The original version is drawing heavily from Monopoly, this express version is also drawing heavily from Monopoly Deal. The game items are geared toward reflecting traditional ranching in Argentina. The gameplay it's also similar to Gin Rummy.

name: Feed-A-Frog
description: Divide up into two teams and throw a bug token to the hungry frog. Each team takes a turn until all tokens are played. The team that feeds the frog with the most bugs is the winner.

name: Sveriges (ot)roligaste ögonblick
description: Sveriges (ot)roligaste ögonblick is a quiz game. The theme is Swedish history, but not normal history, but more of Swedish gossip, like classic TV moments, watching storms, successes, scandals and incredible events. Players play 1 vs 1, or in teams. A team get points by giving right answers, and first team to a certain amount is the winner.

name: Star Wars: Hands Down Game
description:
Game description from the publisher:

Keep your wits about you and your eye on the cards to win at this fast-paced Star Wars version of the Hands Down card game! All you have to do is watch for matches on the spinner to the Star Wars character cards in your hand. If the spinner lands on C-3PO and you have that card, slam it down on the Target token as fast as you can! Get rid of all your cards first, and you're the ruler of the galaxy – and the winner!

Includes 20 cards, 2 Target tokens, spinner with arrow and base, and instructions.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Iron & Brass: Duel
description:
Iron & Brass: Duel is a 2 player, 9 card "nano-game" originally created for the 2016 9 card nano game contest. The game is an infantry skirmish card game. Each round of the game is a 3 vs 3 infantry encounter.

Each player will have 6 soldiers - 1 on each side of the 3 cards. These soldiers are labeled A, B, C, D, E, and F for clarity. Each soldier (card face) is also named alphabetically to give it more of a human touch.

Each soldier card has 2 actions per side, for a total of 12 actions per player.

All battle resolutions are:
1) Determine # of dice to roll: Attacker's dice +/- Defender's modifiers
2)Roll the determined number of dice, 1 or more "6" = opponent card side (not the entire card) is defeated. So, in effect, the game will play as if each player has 6 1-sided soldier cards, but in reality, each will have 3 2-sided soldier cards. Hope that makes sense.

The game challenges each player to decide which soldier actions to play, where to play them, and when to attack.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Onore no Shinjita Michi o Ike!
description:
User summary
己の信じた道を行け! (Onore no Shinjita Michi o Ike!) in English means literally means "Go the way you believe!".

In this game, players explore far deep into a cave to collect gems. There are several forks in the cave. You must choose which way to go, or go back out of the cave. What you encounter depends on your choice, ranging from a gem to even the dreadful dragon. The deeper you explore, the more valuable gems you find, but the risk goes highter too. After three explorations, the player who has collected the greatest total value of gems wins the game.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは洞窟を進み、宝石をできるだけたくさん持って帰ることを目指します。洞窟には分かれ道があり、選ぶ道によっては、宝石ではなくドラゴンに出会うこともあります。洞窟の奥へ行けば行くほど価値の高い宝石がありますが、その分危険度も増します。3回洞窟に潜り終わった時に所持している宝石の価値の合計が最も高い人が勝者です。

name: Superfight: PAX East 2016 Promo Pack
description: This is a set of six cards for Superfight that was released at PAX East 2016. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor

name: Capitalism, USA
description:
Each quarter our fair city accepts four applicants to become part of our citizenry. These applicants will be given all the same connections and resources to prove to the leaders of our city that they are worthy to become one with the populous. Five hundred members of a random workforce and the ability to produce goods and services from different aspects of business. It is their goal to be as profitable as possible and succeed in creating a workforce that is focused solely on profit. There will be troubles along the way, from political insiders, government interference, and those seeking social justice. Our city is one of peace and profit driven by money and power. Are you worthy to be part of our community?
Welcome... to Capitalism USA.

Players are all billionaire industrialists that are taking on a new business in Capitalism USA, seeking residence, it is your goal to obtain the most money before one player reaches a completely their full potential of Profit and Progress. Each player is given five Workforce cards, these are laid in front of each player face up. displaying a human workforce residing in Capitalism, USA. As the game progresses they will become an automated workforce that is more profitable for you the billionaire.

Each player is dealt FIVE Workforce cards, these will represent your workers of your new company. Place them face up, showing the occupation, in front of you for the remainder of the game.

The game ends once a player has flipped all FIVE Workforce cards to Profit and Progress. The player with the most money is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Moomin's Card Game: Nyoro Nyoro Biri-Biri
description:
This is a Japanese press-your-luck game based on characters created by Finnish children's author, Tove Jansson. Each player is trying to collect the most Hattifatteners, mysterious, ghost-like creatures who grow out of the ground and are attracted to electricity.

The deck in the middle of the play area represents the mountain the Hattifatteners congregate toward, drawn by the lightning at the top. Each player begins with three plastic Hattifatteners. On their turn, each player will draw cards until they meet one of three conditions:

1) Collect 12 Hattifatteners represented on Nyoro Nyoro cards.
2) Draw a Biri-Biri card, causing them to discard all cards in their play area.
3) Choose to stop drawing, and pass to the next player.

Some cards allow you to take Hattifatteners from the field, or from other players; some cards cause you to lose Hattifatteners to the field. When the draw deck is exhausted, the player with the most Hattifatteners wins.

name: Six up
description:
Wooden game of the Maxis line, specially designed with big pieces, easy to grab, to allow kids and elderlies to play together.

Six up consists of a vertical wooden piece with six vertical tracks made of holes. Each player has six wooden tokens (red and blue). In turn, each player rolls a die and chooses a token to go up one of the tracks. If a token lands in a hole already occupied, it ejects the previous token. If a token reaches the top of its track no one can go up this track no more. Game ends when all tops are reached. In the case of a tie, count the highest positions of tokens that have not reached the top.

name: Developers Against Humanity
description:
This is a promotional game released by the software company "Stackify" to entice people to demo their product.

It is a Cards Against Humanity clone, with all of the cards referring to software development and/or computer geek humor.

The rules are even expressed in scrum/agile terminology.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: ÖFB Fußball-Quiz
description:
A small trivia game about soccer. It contains 80 questions on 33 cards that center around soccer rules, teams, players, and personalities.

Cards contain two or three questions in ascending difficulty; the player on turn can choose one difficulty. For the correct answer of question one you get 1 point, for question two 2 points, and so on. The game continues until one player accumulates 10 points - the winner of the game.

OFB stands for Österreichischer Fußball Bund (Austrian Soccer Association).

name: Head Hints: Disney Descendants
description:
From the publisher:
"Heads up! It’s the game of clues, secrets, and silly stunts! Maleficent is up to her evil ways, and she’s mixed things up right before Ben's coronation! In this fun Head Hints game, your job is to put on your crowns and work as a team to defeat her. Can you guess what mystery character you are? If you can all guess 12 Mystery cards before 4 Maleficent cards show up, everyone’s a winner!


Includes 4 crowns (4 bands and 4 attachments), 20 Mystery cards, 30 Spell cards, and instructions with play mat.



Head Hints game challenges you to guess mystery characters
Everyone wears a crown
Work together as a team to guess characters
If you guess 12 characters before 4 Maleficent cards appear, everyone wins."

name: AHHBANG!
description:
User summary
AHHBANG! ("AHH!" is sound of a zombie growling. "BANG!" is sound of a cop shooting a gun. The name is created from these words.)

AHHBANG! is a speed card game where cops fight zombies to protect civilians.

Each player initially has seven cards (one civilian, two cops, three zombies, and one randomly-dealt special card). Each round, players play one card face down, then reveal them simultaneously. If number of zombies exceeds that of cops, all cops and civilians played are killed. If they survived, players gain five points for the civilian played, and one point for the cop. Play seven rounds and the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
To "BANG!" of "AHH!"
警官がゾンビを撃ち殺すか、ゾンビが警官を食べるかを、数で決めるカードゲームです。

name: Schmovie: Table Top Day 2016 Felicia and Wil Schquid Trophies
description: This is a set of two schquid trophies featuring Felicia Day and Wil Wheaton. These promos were released for Table Top Day 2016.

name: Riddle Moo This
description: Riddle Moo This is a children's game. All the players has a button to press, that makes a Moo sound, and gives them a chance to answer the riddle. The players draw a card. On each card there is three clues to what the riddle's answer is. Players read one clue after another. And them someone want's to take a guess they press there Moo button. The first player to guess right get's one point. The player with most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: "Black-out"
description:
This game was dated by the vendor at 1939, but the board bears no publisher or date marks, only a proud "Made in England". Certainly it was published just pre-war or early war, since it's objective (other than fun) is clearly to familiarize players with all of the people and equipment needed to deal with the bombing of London.

The game features a striking black board with an outline of the west end of London and its major streets. The objective is to move one's car from one corner to the opposite corner, either between Marble Arch and Charing Cross or between Hyde Park Corner and Holborn. There are four cardboard cars with wooden stands enabling one player to start from each corner.

The game is played with a deck of 52 cards, four each of 13 different people, signs or pieces of equipment: Red, Amber and Green Crossings; Road Refuge; Fire Alarm; Auxiliary Fire Squad; Air Raid Warden; Policeman; War Auxiliary Policeman; Fire Fighting Equipment; Sandbags; Fireman; and Sand Buckets.

The streets are littered with barriers, each of which requires one of the 13 card symbols to get past. Plotting a winning course across blacked-out London therefore requires not simply finding the shortest route, but the best route available with the cards obtained.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Privatizace
description: Czech humor party boardgame about economy and privatization. Players uses dice to earn and save money in their circle of job. When someone decides it is enough to invest goes to center cicle and pushes luck in auction with other players in investmens circle. Object of auction is surprise because it is revealed after payment. Companies you own earns money for you but costs taxes too. Be careful it is possible to go bankrupt! Who went bankrupt three times is eliminated. After negotiated number of devaluations, which decrease all players cash, game ends. Who is richest wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Word Savvy
description:
The Anagram Word Game.

Expand your vocabulary and find out how anagrammatically correct you can be!

name: Match Plus
description:
From the publisher:

The goal is to be the first player to use up or deplete his/her pile of chips. Chips are played when a Set of three or more cards is played in a row (vertically, horizontally, or diagonally), placed on top of each card in the Set.
mechanics: Modular Board, Open Drafting, Pattern Building

name: Uzumaku Campaign
description:
User summary
In the game of 渦巻くキャンペーン (Uzumaku Campaign), players are candidates for the next US President, and struggle to win the election.

There are four influence types: Popularity, Economy, Military, and Religion.

They go on a stumping tour to States such as New York, Florida, and Pennsylvania. In these States, they build influence of specific type, gain supporters spending influence, control votes per supporter, and obstruct opponents by negative campaigns.

At the end of game, number of votes is calculated according to number of supporters and votes per supporter ratio for each influence type, modified by undecided votes. The player with the greatest number of votes wins the election.

With little card text and no special powers, this gamers' game requires you to adopt various influence management tactics according to opponents' moves.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーが大統領選挙に出馬して、選挙を勝ち抜くゲームです。
ニューヨーク、フロリダやペンシルバニアといった都市を回って
サポーターを増やしながら、相手にネガティブキャンペーンを行い、
浮動票も獲得して勝利を目指します。
テキストや特殊能力はほぼありませんが、駆け引きとリスクがとても強いゲーマーズゲームです。
mechanics: Modular Board, Set Collection, Turn Order: Time Track
publishers: Alhara Systems (アルハラシステムズ)

name: THE Houki Guitars
description:
User summary
THEほうきギターズ (THE Houki Guitars) in English means "THE Broom & Guitars" (with the emphasis on THE intentional).

In the game of THE Broom & Guitars, you lead a music band of high-school students, and compete against rival bands with your live performance.

This game is based on the traditional Japanese game Shichi Narabe with some twists.

There are four suits that correspond to parts of the band: Vocal, Guitar, Bass, Drums, and each suit has seven levels ranging from 1 to 7,

You buy an instrument card you want to upgrade, and at a later turn you place that card out at appropriate position on the board like Shichi Narabe (the card being placed must be adjacent to an existing card), but unlike Shichi Narabe, vertical connections and diagonal connections are allowed as well as horizontal connections. You advance your skill of that instrument (or vocal) in this way.

Once all cards of one suit are bought, it's time for live performance. All players count victory points according to skill levels they reached for each suit.

That's one round. After the second round, the highest scorer wins the game.

Publisher's summary
メンバーを集めてバンドを結成します。
バイトをして楽器を入手したり、楽器を練習をやりつつ
ライブで客をより熱狂させたほうが勝者です。
カードを一定のルールを元に出し、それに応じてコマを進めるゲームです。最も効率よくコマを進めることを目指します。
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Modular Board
publishers: Alhara Systems (アルハラシステムズ)

name: Burgers & Beasts
description:
Burgers & Beasts is about building the best burger for the masses of adventuring customers that come your way. These adventurers will face many great foes, but their greatest challenge will be in finding a good meal. That's where you come in. Customers will be pouring out the Adventuring Cave, hungry for their favorite food: Burgers! Along with those Adventurers also come the fearsome Beasts that attack the nearby castle. Your job is to create the best burger to attract the strongest fighters and defeat the Beasts that threaten the castle…and gain a little treasure while you’re at it!

Build Burgers: Defeat Beasts; Gain Diamonds!

name: Memory Kleurenspel
description:
Children's wooden memory game consisting of a wooden board with a round disc in the middle with 32 holes, 32 toadstool pegs and a dice with six colours.

Place the toadstools in the holes on the central disk. Roll the coulor dice an then remove one of the oegs from the central disc. If the colour under the peg matches the colour on the dice you get to place the toadstool peg on one of the eight circles on your corner of the board. Otherwise, place it back in its original hole.
First to collect eight toadstool pegs wins.

name: Animals (fan expansion for Dominion)
description:
This is a fan created expansion for the card game Dominion. This print and play expansion contains 3 new kingdom cards: "Karnickel", "Hofhund" and "Edler Schimmel".
The cards are available as downloads (jpgs, German version) in the gallery section. English version soon to come.

Diese Mini-Erweiterung beinhaltet 3 Karten (die sich auch aufeinander beziehen): "Karnickel", "Hofhund" and "Edler Schimmel".

name: Intrachange
description: Intrachange is a marriage of Chess and the I Ching inspired by The Glass Bead Game conceived by author Hermann Hesse. Gameplay proceeds as in normal Chess with the exclusion of the moves Castling, En passant, Promotion of the pawn, and Check/Mate. The gameboard consists of a standard chessboard superimposed with the 64 hexagrams of the I Ching with a different arrangement from the opposing black and white perspectives. Each chess piece is associated with one of the six line ranks of the Hexagrams based upon type and a yang or yin line based on color. Each player begins by making an exoteric move according the normal movements of Chess. If the piece lands in a square that doesn't match the line type in the associated rank of the I Ching Hexagram, then a second esoteric move is made to the appropriate correlative square. All pieces except the knight may pass through other pieces during an esoteric move. Pawns may only capture pieces esoterically after exoteric movement to squares of the seventh rank of the board. The game ends by moving a piece onto a square occupied by the opponents King.

name: Become a King
description:
Become a King is a solo game in which the player works their way up the ranks from a baron to a king. Using a deck of cards the player can choose the path of diplomacy or force to gain control of the kingdom.
Each turn the player will choose a Lead card giving them a certain bonus of Force or Diplomacy. The Lead card will also determine how many cards can be played as Followers. Followers will add more Force or Diplomacy to the player's turn and may also grant special abilities. Using these the player will gain new cards and will be able to manipulate their deck.
But beware! Along the way the player will create rivals that will fight against him in the final effort to gain control over the kingdom. The more rivals you create the higher the strength of the kingdom that stands before you will be!

Do you have what it takes to Become a King?
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Galactic Traders
description:
Description from the publisher:

Galactic Traders is an easy to learn game of trading goods across the galaxy.
The game is played over several rounds divided in 2 phases:
1) Trade goods phase
2) Deployment phase
During the 1st phase, players scour the galaxy in search of trade goods they will later sell to planets in distant solar systems. Acquiring trade goods is very quick and simple. Players
draft cards from a deck of goods and add them to their hands. The first player draws cards equal to twice the number of players (for example, 6 cards for a 3 player game) chooses one and passes the rest to the next player. The rest of the players do the same, except for the last. The last player, chooses 2 cards then passes the rest to the previous player. This happens until the first player takes the last remaining card. (example: Nick, John and Mary have 6 cards to draft. Nick goes first chooses 1, then passes 5 cards to John. John also chooses 1, then passes 4 cards to Mary. Mary chooses 2 then passes 2 cards to John. John chooses 1 then passes the last card to Nick.)

During the 2nd phase, players deploy their trade goods gathered from the 1st phase on planets of their choice. But the real reward is not money. The real reward is the trade agreement that may be established with a planet. If such a trade agreement is active, a player may benefit from it later on the game.
Planets are divided in Age I and Age II. Age I planets provide trade agreements and just a few credits, while Age II planets provide lots of credits but no trade agreements.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Open Drafting, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection

name: Pelle the Train driver
description:
There are different animals moving on the train.
You can add a car to either end of the train on the table next to another car so that the same animal species are side by side or
You can put the train stop next to the pack. Then the players will put on the train stop the cards which have the passenger shown in the train stop.

The goal of the game is to be the first to get rid of all your cards.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Trains

name: Stranded No More: Captain's Revenge
description:
Description from the publisher:

Nearly five years have passed since your crew led a mutiny against you, Captain Oscar Locke. After surviving the island and the unfortunate souls who landed there to bury their treasure, you have set sail back to your old pillaging grounds, the West Indies. A little birdy has informed you that your former crew has split up and now five of them are leading their own vessels. It’s time to take back what’s yours by any means possible. Whether you steal their treasure without them knowing and sail away or decide to send them to Davy Jones’ locker afterwards, your goal is to collect all five treasures and return safely to the open water.

SNM: CR is a free Print and Play solitaire game that relies on dice rolling to move both the player's ship, 5 other NPC ships, and to decide all combat. The goal of the game is collect all of the treasure held by the NPC ships without being sunk.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Push Your Luck

name: LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! – The Original VOL 1
description: Gameplay in LOLZ: The Gift of Laughter! is team based. A player from each team will place a "Mouthis" around their lips, pulling their lips back and making pronunciation difficult. That player will then attempt to reach a few words from the card they have drawn. They may repeat themselves as often as they would like and must get their teammate(s) to correctly guess the words they are trying to pronounce within 30 seconds. Afterwards the opposing team takes a turn. The first to five or ten points wins!
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Sanaseikkailijat
description:
All players are dealt the same letter cards. Players simultaneously try to find and write down as long words as possible using only the letters available. Letters are divided into two categories, red and black. Each black letter used scores two points and each red letter three points. Bonus point die rolls are awarded when players reach certain thresholds on the score track. Game is played over four rounds with increasing amount of letter cards. First round with seven cards, then eight, nine, and finally ten letter cards.

Who can find the longest word? Whose word brings most points? Young players learn spelling during the game.

Contents: board, 288 letter cards, 2 sand timers, player pawns, paper and pens, die, rules.

name: Kes Leiab Esimesena?
description:
The game consists of 300 image squares and a modular game board. The game board has 300 different items, which must be incorporated to find image squares. Image squares also have interesting additional functions, which make the game even more exciting. The game can be played in many different ways, both basic and advanced rules. Therefore, the game is suitable for different age groups - from tiny kids to adults.

Players pull the picture-tiles from the bag and must find the needed pictures from the board. First player gets the tile as a point. First player who finds the required number of pictures first is the winner.

name: Le Toton Equlibriste
description:
This is a small manual dexterity game produced by French game publishers Villard et Weill in the late 19th Century as part of a large box of mixed games marketed by the company.

The game consists of a small wooden top and a game board set into the box. The board is a 4 x 4 grid of squares with a diamond in the middle. The 17 resulting spaces are numbered and separated by raised cardboard ridges except for a gap between each square and its numerical neighbors. Players start the top spinning in square 1 on the upper left corner and must tilt the box to guide the top through the gaps up to the 17 (diamond) space in the middle.

The rules printed inside the box lid sets three possible victory conditions. The winner can be the player who reaches the highest number with a single spin, the one who can record the highest total from three spins, or simply the first to succeed in reaching the centre space.

name: Croopo: The Trading Card Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Croopo is a fun, strategic, two-person trading card game where players battle each other by carefully choosing Creature, Power-up, and Terrain cards, and rolling dice to determine the outcome of each turn.

Croopo can be enjoyed by kids as young as six years old, and by adults of all ages. For younger kids, rules may be modified for simplification, for example, by omitting Terrain or Power-up cards from the deck.

Each game takes around 30 minutes. All you need to play Croopo are two decks of cards (one for each player) and two six-sided dice. A game board is also available to help beginners place cards correctly. Players can build custom decks by choosing different combinations of cards from their collection in order to develop new strategies of game play.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Anduine: First City in the West
description:
Description from the publisher:

...and upon returning to the land of men, the Elders of the High Council made that fateful decision. Go West. West into the wilderness, where wretched Goblins roamed and the Warlock held sway. West, into the blackness of Thil Asara. Their mission was clear. To set a beacon to quell the dark, a beacon that would grow in brightness and strength. A shining light to announce to all the world that they had returned. And that light came to be known as “Anduine - First City in the West.”

In Anduine - First City of the West, a cooperative fantasy board game for 1-5 players, each player will take a role as a member of the Elvish Elder council: Galadhon Master Builder, Nienna the Ranger, General Istaras, Mardiel the Sorceress and Mithrond, Lord of the Elves.
Together they will build a new city, master challenging Events and defend their fledgling home from vicious Goblin Raids.
All while the Warlock lies in wait, plotting to defeat the Elves and destroy the city of Anduine, once and for all.

Negotiation and strategy are paramount, as players will come together to decide how best to use the resources of the Elves to develop and defend their city. Players will research new magic, master new abilities and command the Elves of Anduine to construct a city worthy of legend.
With teamwork, planning and a little luck, the Council of Elders and the Elves of Anduine, will successfully defeat the menacing Warlock and his hordes once and for all.

name: Samurai Warlords: A Game of Conquest in Feudal Japan (1192-1603)
description:
INTRODUCTION
SAMURAI WARLORDS is a semi-historical game where one to four Players assume the roles of minor Samurai Warlords, or Daimyo, in Japan during the time of the Wars for Domination. There are two Periods that Players can choose to Play. The first is the Kamakura Period (1192-1333) when there is a risk of Mongol Invasions. The second Period is the Sengoku Period or Age of Civil War (1467-1603) which is set during the time of the Wars of Unification. There are many rich rice paddies, thick forests with deer and boar and rolling hills, all ready for the taking as the riches of Medieval Japan can be yours. All you need is to demonstrate a firm hand and fruitful estates. A strong sword (or Katana) and loyal followers are also required to maintain your lands and ensure the villagers are providing the proper taxes. You must also be able to defend your territories from rival Lords and invading Mongols.

GAME OBJECTIVE
Players assume the roles of Samurai Daimyos in Feudal Japan during either the Kamakura Period (1192-1333) or the Sengoku Period (1467-1603) with the goals of expanding and improving their territorial control. Daimyos do this by raising Retinues and conquering neighboring territories. Daimyos can, also, improve their holdings by building Hans (Hamlets), Manors and Castles. A Game consists of up to 10 Campaign Seasons. Players may agree to play fewer or more as desired. The Player, who at the end of any Campaign Season (Spring, Summer or Autumn) controls the greatest Settlement Value from their Hans, Manors and Castles, is the Victor.
categories: Medieval, Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Ninja War
description:
Issue game of Wargame Japanese History #26.

A card game where players take on the role of ninjas and attempt to complete various missions, ranging from assassinating targets to stealing teaware masterpieces from under the noses of their owners.

Every turn, each player must play a "Mission" card from their hand. Players roll two dice and check that against the difficulty level of the mission (located in the top-right corner of the card).

If a mission is successful and they survive, that mission and its accompanying amount of "legend points" are added to the player's career record. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

However, other players may assist or interfere with the outcome of missions, so negotiation and strategizing are important aspects of play.

name: Watch Ya' Mouth: NSFW Expansion #2
description:
Description from the publisher:

If the first time only left you wanting more, we’re always DTF. Let’s do it again, bae. Take your oral game to the next level. Order Watch Ya Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #2 right now. You know you want to. Warning: if the first NSFW expansion pack grossed you out, then it’s time to accept that you are, in fact, only safe for work. Loosen that tie, let down that hair, and play on, playa.

Watch Ya’ Mouth, The Original Mouthguard Party Game, is authentic and hilarious. Often imitated, never duplicated.
3-10 players
Hampered by cheek retractors, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, such as:
Beer tastes like barley and b∪tth0le.
Butt plugs for the whole family.
Funky fart fumes!

Watch Ya Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #2 comes with 155 depraved, explicit phrase cards and 6 blanks (161 total cards). Our cards are strong, thick, and durable for years of hysterics and beer spills.

name: Host Party: Trailer Trash Tragedy
description:
This is a murder mystery party game for 8-14 guests.

Setting / Theme:
This annual party banquet takes place at Gonagen Trailer Trash Park, where the residents have gathered to guzzle beer and box wine, and chomp down vittles while they celebrate nothing in particular "just a good ole time for all of us to get together," says Big Hoss Beaver, the host. However, this year the event was dampened by the unforeseen murder of one of the residents! Who, at this totally unfashionable party, created this trailer trash tragedy? All guests will have fun playing out their individual characters and investigating this unpredictable event. Whodunit and why, are the mysteries the rest of the trailer folks are determined to solve before the murderer strikes again!

The Gonagen Trailer Trash Park is the setting for this murder mystery game for 8-14 player guests. All of the residents come together to celebrate this grand event, the Annual Trailer Park Smorgasbord Dinner and Dance party. However,the party is overshadowed by the murder of one of the residents!

How to Play
Planning:

Host of the Murder Mystery picks the day/time and location for the game which will take 2-3 hours and finds out how many guests can attend.
Host creates guest list and assigns each guest one of the characters to play.
Host sends official invite with their character background to each guest.
Guests create / purchase a costume based on their character. Thrift stores are good for this.
Host decorates and plans for food for evening.


Playing the game:

As guests arrive, the host gives them their instructions for the first round which will include things to say/do/ask.
After all actions are completed, instructions are given to guests for Round 2.
Repeat again for Round 3.
In between rounds you can eat or have activities based on the theme.


Ending:

Everyone discusses and says who they think the murderer is.
Each guest reads their final clue in order leading up to the murderer.
Winner are those that guessed the murderer.
If nobody guesses correctly the murderer wins.

name: Best of the Worst
description:
Best of the Worst is the game of life's lesser moments! Do you remember your WORST first date? How about your WORST trip to the dentist or WORST day at school? Sure they all seem terrible at the time, even life-threatening in some cases! But over time, you can look back and there's usually a pretty good story attached to the experience! That's BEST of the WORST! Do your BEST and tell your WORST! For 3-6 players.

Draw a card and come up with your best story to go along with the worst scenario on the card

Tell what really happened or go ahead and stretch the truth if you'd prefer

It's up to everyone else playing to determine if what you're saying is a true story or a bogus story. Every player who tells a story advances one space and gets an additional space for every vote they receive.

name: Wyspa Skarbów
description:
In Wyspa Skarbów players take on the role of expedition commanders who received a message about an old pirate treasure that is hidden on one of the caribbean islands. They embark on a journey to acquire legendary riches.
The player must go through three stages of the game, which in turn will make him closer to the final success.
On the first stage players search for treasure maps in the island to enable further exploration.
On the second stage the objective is to find the key, which makes it possible to open the hidde treasure in the third and final stage.
The winner is the first to overcome all the obstacles
and reach the hidden pirate treasure.

name: Rapa Mão
description: Roll a die to move one of your 3 hand pieces and steal other players coins. Last player with coins is the winner.

name: Huddle Up!
description:
Huddle Up! is a game for 2 players, ages 7+

The aim of the game is to get the most penguins in your color in a huddle, as pieces of the ice flow, they are standing on break away!

Materials
Hex Board with 37 spaces
36 pawns or cubes, 18 Black and 18 White, representing the player’s penguins

Setup
Place the board between the players.
Next starting at the top row, place a penguin one to a empty space, alternating Black then White while skipping the center space on the board.

Definitions
Group – Adjacent penguins of either color are considered a group and a single penguin with no adjacencies are also considered a group.

Play
One Player plays Black the other White.
Decide who starts, turns then alternate.

On a turn,
• Move a penguin away from your starting position, 3 spaces in any of the 6 directions, avoid moving over empty spaces or the center space.

• You must end your move on a space occupied by 1 or 2 penguins.

• You must move if you can, otherwise, you must pass

• No more than 3 penguins in a space.

• If you land on a space occupied by 2 penguins, and one of the 2 penguins is a friendly penguin, your opponent’s penguin is bumped off and removed from play.

If a group is split into 2 groups that is divided by empty spaces, the smaller group is removed from play.

If a group is split into two or three equal size groups, remove the group/groups that do not have the penguin that caused the split to occur.

The game ends when both players pass.

Scoring

Majority controls a space

Total the number of penguins controlling a space.

1 - Friendly Penguin on a space = 1 point
2 - Friendly Penguins on a space = 2 points
3 - Friendly Penguins on a space = 3 points

Spaces controlled by both players are not scored

Objective
Player with the most penguins in the largest connected group in his color, wins
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: MASSIVE! Attack of the Tyrant (マッシヴ!Attack of the Tyrant)
description:
User summary
マッシヴ!Attack of the Tyrant (MASSIVE! Attack of the Tyrant) is a game of a battle between two monsters as seen in monster films like Godzilla and Gamera. Players control their own monster to defeat their opponent. No tricks are needed. Just slam it, kick it, and blow it away!

Players take five parts-cards of their monster. Cards represent their body parts: two arms, two legs, and body. They place these parts to form their monsters.

Each turn, you draw an action card, or when you think it's the time to act, you play any number of action cards to approach and attack your opponent at once.

Whenever you move or attack, the physical position of the parts-cards is important.

Walk: Move one of your legs by one step. You may rotate your leg in any direction as long as both of your leg cards touch at an appropriate point (do not overlap your leg cards). Adjust your body and arms accordingly.

Dash: Walk twice.

Punch: Place an area-of-effect card from one of your arms. If the card touches the opponent's body, the body is pushed back, and if this cause the body to be detached from its legs, the opponent loses its balance and falls prone.

Kick: Same as punch, except that an area-of-effect card is placed from one of your legs.

By combining action cards, you may make a super attack such as slam, stomp, and smash.

You win the game if your opponent falls prone three times.

Publisher's summary
男子なら誰しもが経験したであろう怪獣ソフビやアクションフィギュアでのごっこ遊び、ブンドド…
そのブンドドを完全再現したテーブルゲームが、このマッシヴ！シリーズです。
ゴジラやガメラといった怪獣映画でお馴染みの巨大怪獣同士の喧嘩をイメージし、「殴れ、蹴飛ばせ、吹っ飛ばせ！！」をテーマにした、これまでのボードゲームの常識を覆す、全く新しいプレイ感覚のゲームです。
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Mythology, Science Fiction

name: Thrash'n Roll: Amplified
description:
Desription from the publisher:

Amplified is an expansion for Thrash'n Roll game.

It makes gameplay smoother and much more intense. The expansion allows for 5-player games. Additionaly, it introduces new characters, which will help your band to reach the peak of their fame. Thanks to revised rules game becomes more intuitive and exciting.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Simulation, Worker Placement

name: Out of Sight
description:
The "out of sight" game to play. For groovy gamers of all ages.

The object is to collect as many marbles as possible without uncovering any of the red dots that are "out of sight"

Marbles are set on all open circles so the red dots underneath cannot be seen. Then a spinner is spun that changes the position of the red dots to unknown areas.

The players spin the "Fickle Finger of Fate" spinner to tell them how many marbles to remove. If a red dot is under the marble, the player must return as many marbles as it takes to cover all the holes.

If the player who uncovered a red dot cannot cover all the open holes, then the game is over and the player with the most marbles wins.

name: Infected: The board game
description:
A new of its kind strategy board game for 2 to 6 players. Take your viruses and battle your opponent's occupied cells, but be careful, the cure syringe is also part of the game. Take risks and dominate the game. Challenge your friends and let them Infected.

Featuring built-in neodymium magnet characters and fully magnetized board.

Play Infected in single mode or in team mode with your friends.
Each player takes at the role of one color virus and battles his opponent's occupied cells with the purpose of infecting other player's head viruses to win the game. Avoid the cure miracles, make the right moves to infect cells, take risks and dominate the game. Let your friends Infected.

Infected: The Board Game is not like other games. Here, players don't start in the same place each game played. Infected randomize the way to start each game by spinning the Infected spinning disk and throwing the dice at the beginning of the game.

All viruses start in each player's head virus, so protecting your head virus is something to always keep in mind.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: The Most Brilliant Mage
description:
Description from the designer:

The Most Brilliant Mage is a short CCG-like game for two players that can be played with a standard deck of cards. In the game, the players are Mages casting spells and summoning the elements to fight for them.

Each turn, players cast spells and/or summon elements in an attempt to have the most power in play. Players are fighting a tug-of-war for points, similar to games like Twilight Struggle, and if a player gets to 3 points, she wins.

The game was designed to mimic the more meta-decisions involved in CCGs while being able to be played with just 18 cards. Strategies like Aggro and Control are present in the game. There are also options for pre-built decks and drafting.

While it does not have the depth of true CCGs, The Most Brilliant Mage is a brain-burner that can scratch that same itch.

name: Insectini
description: Yikes! All the foliage in the forest has been stirred up by a violent gust of wind, and 36 little critters have lost their shelter. Equipped with the appropriate leaf cards, the players in Insectini need to hide the insects again leaf by leaf as quickly as possible.
