Two new Guilds are given official recognition with this set, with the emergence of 2 new Guild Leaders. Oliver Rose leads the Treeforge Guild and Crystallus is the self-proclaimed leader of the Shardveil Guild.

Set Breakdown:

This set consists of 43 cards, including:
8 Rares
15 Uncommons
20 Commons
In addition to introducing new mechanics like freeze and reveal, Existence Games wanted to spoil players by giving them a full foil energy deck in these decks for no extra cost.

Creature Types:
This set introduces the following creature types:

Mushfolk
Storm
Shark
Phoenix
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trading

name: Tensor Chess
description:
As in classical chess, the object of Tensor Chess is to checkmate the opponent's king.

The game is played on an 8X10 board with a new piece added to the array; the Tensor Beast.

The Beast Manuevers dependent on interacting with the new piece. The beast can move one square in any direction like the king.

The beast can also leap forward or backward over its own or opposing pieces and land on the next square if that square is unoccupied. It can leap diagonally, or leap horizontally along a row (rank) and vertically along a column (file). The beast can hop both vertically and horizontally on the same turn, but horizontal and vertical leaping cannot be combined with diagonal leaping.

The beast cannot move one square and then begin leaping. Nor can it leap and simply return to its starting square as this would be skipping a turn. It can, however, return to its starting square on the same turn if it captures an opposing beast by its final leap.

The beast can only capture an opposing beast and can only be captured by an opposing beast. A beast captures an enemy beast by hopping over it rather than landing on the same square.

For example, a beast may hop over an enemy beast, not capture it, and proceed to hop over and capture another beast.

Or a beast may hop over an opposing beast, and not capture it on that first hop, but then hop back over the opposing beast (moving in the other direction) and capture it on that hop, all on the same turn.

In addition A bishop, rook or queen can pass through a beast of its own color, but not through an enemy beast.

A beast acts as a shield for its own pieces and blocks opposing pieces.

A pass through may involve more than one beast.

A king may pass through only when castling.

Similarly there are unique ricocheting and propelling moves associated with the Beast.

A beast may pass through another beast when propelled.

A pawn may pass through only on its first move and only when moving forward to an unoccupied square. Pawns cannot pass though and capture.

name: WWII: Full Global Conflict
description:
WWII: Full Global Conflict is a territorial strategy game covering the second world war. A variant of the Axis & Allies board game system, and a flagship game in the Empires of History game series, it offers an easy to play D10 based combat system and territories with resource values for production. More than 7 years in the making, it stands as king atop the Empires of History line of historical strategy games.

Two full color game maps present Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, Asia and the Pacific in detail. Movement between the maps is clearly defined and a comprehensive series of off map boxes contain North America, South America, the Atlantic central and lower Africa and more. One game: the entire war. With Manpower Limits, detailed technology development rules, and accurate historical detailing, Empires of History: WWII provides all of the game play quality and historical detail that gamers have come to expect from the Empires of History board game series.

With over 1700 counters, 11 nation sheets and 3 political options booklets, players assume the mantle of command of the Axis & Allied forces with an option for the US player to play with their own agenda. The game comes with a standard 1939 start for the war, but with the available political options, the game can either follow the path of the war or diverge from it fairly substantially. Limited resources like Oil Resources, Manpower Limits and difficult to defend naval sea trade resources, neither side has it easy and both should experience the desperate need for very limited resources.

A game for 2-8 players.

name: Questo e Quello: i colori degli animali
description:
Each player on his turn plays a puzzle piece out of his hand of three. A piece can be played if it can be "associated" with at least one of the other pieces already on the table, along one of the two "variables" of the game.

The two "variables" are the color of each animal (white, black, brown, pink, green, white/black) and how it moves (two-legged, four-legged, flying, swimming).

The two pegs of each puzzle piece only allows the interlocking with another piece belonging to the right category. For example, the panther can be associated with the gorilla (because they're both black) or with the polar bear (because they have four legs).

But how do you win? Making the winning combinations before opponents, which are in all five different types and give different scores.

The winning combinations and the corresponding prize tokens that you earn to keep track of the points are explained in detail in the rules of the game, but an example of a winning combination can be to complete a row playing the fourth and last animal of pink color, or completing a column by attaching the sixth and last animal that flies ... Easy, right?
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: I Spy Fish
description:
I Spy Fish is a 3-in-1 family cardgame including 48 oversized picture cards for 1-6 players.

In three different game modes players try to collect matching pairs by asking other players for cards (I SPY FISH), by grabbing open cards from the table (SNAP), or by flipping two cards on the table (MEMO).

name: Animal Bird Fish Card Game
description:
Animal Bird Fish is an educational card game for children of all ages that helps to prepare children for reading and identifying different animals.

The main way to play is called "Lucky Sevens":
All the cards are dealt out to all the players. The dealer starts by playing a number 7 of any group; Animal, Bird, or Fish, the next player must follow suit/group and play a number higher or lower. Or he may play a 7 of any group. If you cannot play you must pass. When a player runs out of cards he is the winner. He receives a score equal to the number of cards left in the other players hands. It has a bit of a trick-taking mechanic. Players play to an amount agreed upon before the start of the game.

Because the cards are numbered it can also be used to play Rummy, Snip and Snap - which is similar to war, and Rally-up - a game where players try to get 12 consecutive cards of one group by passing 2 cards face down to the player on their left.

name: Wulong: Po der Panda
description:
English:
Panda Attack!
You are allowed to shake the dice cup after the active player looked at the throw.

German:
Panda Attacke!
Du darfst den Würfelbecher kräftig durchrütteln, nachdem der aktive Spieler sich den Wurf angeschaut hat.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck

name: Escape the Alps!
description:
Escape the Alps is a solitaire game that uses grid movement, dice rolling, and resource management.

Synopsis:
You are a captured WWII Airborne Ranger imprisoned by the German SS in a castle in the Alps. You've been put through hell and still you've only given your name, rank and serial number. As they take a break from interrogating you, you manage to break open the window to the room and climb out onto the ledge. You immediately notice the 500ft drop to the rocks below and feel the cool chill air of the Bavarian Alps. You work your way to the face of the mountain and look up to see sheer rock hundreds of feet straight up with occasional patches of snow covering section of the mountain. You have two choices; climb to freedom with no turning back or get recaptured and await certain death from the SS. Your choice is clear, climb the mountain and escape the Alps.

Your goal is to climb up multiple rock faced cards using dice to manage your movement direction. On each rock face card are hazards, benefits, rest points and location markers. You must climb through natural rock conditions as well as snow conditions.

Certain dice arrangement can gain you another movement die or allow you to modify existing direction die.

Each game is different due to 12 individual rock face configuration and marker locations.

WINNING CONDITION:
Successfully manage your climbing piece up the face of a mountain to the top without falling. You must manage your climbing route and try to pass through specific zones while trying to avoid losing as little fatigue as possible.

LOSING CONDITION:
Become too fatigued or lose your grip and fall off the rock face; losing the game immediately.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Print & Play, World War II
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board

name: Neighborhood Nitro Racing
description:
Neighborhood Nitro Racing is a racing experience for 2-5 players where players build their kart and then race. The game features dice rolling heavily as a mechanic, but also incorporates elements of strategy.

In the first phase, players select pieces to their kart, as well as lay down pieces of the track everyone will be racing on. In the second phase, the players race, trying to roll successfully while avoiding obstacles and the other racers. Players can also try to get ahead with a risky mechanic known as Turbo, rolling less and less dice to extend the turn.

The game prominently features an imaginative, cartoon art style and theme, as players build their karts out of tin foil armor, cardboard space ship wings, denim sails, barbell anchors, and more.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Superfight: PAX South 2017 Promo Pack
description: This is a set of nine cards for Superfight that was released at PAX South 2017. Each swag bag contained 1 random card.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Humor, Party Game, Science Fiction

name: Steppin' Stones
description:
"You’re Stuck in the Muck and there’s only one way out … lay out a series of stepping stones and run your way across. Easier said than done, for in this game you are your own worst enemy … well OK, you’re the only player, so just try not to goof it up too much! A puzzling challenge for the analytical thinker – or a mindless diversion for the rest of us."

A solitaire game for the piecepack game system. Win by moving all four of your pawns safely over the Stepping Stones and back to their home tile. The game is played in two phases. The first phase uses the results of dice rolls to move and flip coins. When all the coins of a given color have been flipped, the die of that color is used in the second phase to move the pawn and coins of that color.

name: Fisherman: Swan Lake (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Adds swans on the 15 River tiles that increases the value of a river

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Gold Mines (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
This expansion adds a new landscape feature and gold trade goods. (Several years before the official Goldmines expansion.)

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Mills and Bakeries (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
It introduces mills and bakeries.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Upper Carcassonne (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
It adds different levels to cities.

Approved by carcassonnecentral and carcassonne-forum
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Medieval

name: Hit Zone
description: Its a roll and move music trivia game with a 3D board. The game is created by a Dutch radio station. and published by "King"

name: Collection
description:
Collection compares favorably to the popular cooperative game Pandemic. In Clopper's game, a group of players must work together to resolve three major crises across the globe. The object is for players, who each represent different types of CIA officers, to collect enough relevant intel to resolve all three crises. If any one of the three impending disasters boils over (as represented by three increasing "fire" meters), the team loses. Every game must have at least three players to fill the roles of "political analyst," "military analyst," and "economic analyst." Those three are only able to collect intel in their specific fields, while additional players (up to seven on a team) have their own specialties.

The difficulty comes from the low number of actions each player can do per turn, along with how quickly the fire meter ratchets up. Players can take two actions per turn: move your agent around the globe, foster new relationships in your current location, or attempt to acquire intel. The latter move is a dice roll. Those rolls are bolstered by having more relationships in a certain zone, by having fellow agents in that same zone (if they offer a specific "colocator" bonus), by having bonus cards, and by how good your relationship is with a specific agency.

name: Ninja Math Game
description:
Karate-chop your way through addition and subtraction to become a maths master!

Getting Started:

Each Player chooses a bingo card. Place the cards on a flat surface, with the sides with blue(for addition) or red(for subtraction) origami stars facing up.
Put the spinner and bingo chips in a central location where all players can reach them.
Each player gets on bingo chip to mark the "free" space in the middle of his or her bingo card.
Players may use scratch paper and a pencil to take notes during the game.

Playing the Game:
The youngest player goes first.
For addition, on your turn, spin the spinner twice and add the two numbers together. when you know the sum of the two numbers, see if it's on your bingo card. If so, cover it with a bingo chip.
For subtraction, on your turn, spin the spinner and determine if the the number it lands on is the answer to any of the subtraction problems on your bingo card. If so, cover it with a bingo chip.
Game play moves to the left and continues until a player has three bingo chips in a row. If you have three in a row, yell out "Ninja Math!"
For an additional challenge, try playing until someone has filled all of the squares on their bingo card.

name: BBC Just a Minute Card Game
description: Players are challenged to speak for 1 minute on a given subject without hesitation, deviation, or repetition. Players take turns being given a randomly determined subject to speak on for 1 minute. If they hesitate, deviate from the subject on the card or repeat a word other players may challenge them, successful challenges score 1 point and take the subject. Players score if they are unsuccessfully challenged, are speaking at the end of the minute or gain a bonus point for speaking for the full minute without interruption.

name: Pun Pong
description:
Pun Pong is the first game from publisher Bread and Circuses. The game pits two team of punsters against each other in a head to head battle of wits and words.

One Pun card is drawn for the table, along with a rules card which sets up a specific guideline like making your Puns rhyme, or they must be included in sentences to form an ongoing puntastic story.

Teams bounce their puns back and forth until one team becomes stumped or repeats a pun, then the round is over.

The first team to 8 points wins.

Different game modes are available to be accessible to all different levels of player, from the punitiate to the pro's.

-description from publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Evil Eye
description:
Panic Vision is a game with a macabre atmosphere!
All players together must blow on the candles (as long as they are yellow) to help Oscar out of his coffin but beware! Tombal Father watches and throws rays that will hit the player too slow to hide, giving 5 seconds of penalty (and the candles go red).
The winner is the player who will have the most breath on the candles after the 45 seconds of the Tombal Father way.

A game that is played in the dark for even more fun !!

—user summary

When the electronic candle is yellow, blow out the candles as many times as you can to score points - but don't get caught!

Hide quickly, because if the Evil Eye sees you, your candle will turn red. You will not score any points until the candle turns yellow again.
​
If your candle blinks when the coffin pops open, you have won! Look in the coffin to see the winner's score!

Play this game in the dark!

—description from the publisher

Il faut souffler sur les bougies pour aider Oscar à sortir de son cercueil mais attention ! Père Tombal surveille et lance des rayons qui vont toucher le joueur trop lent…
Un jeu à l’ambiance macabre à souhait !
Un jeu qui se joue dans le noir à un ou plusieurs pour encore plus de fun !!

—description from the publisher (French)

name: Antarctica (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description: This Antarctica map should offer similar play to the US editions. It is intended for 2 to 4 players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Open Drafting

name: Marsupilami
description:
Marsupilami is a family board game based on the famous comic.

In Marsupilami, one of the player plays the Marsupilami while the others play the photographer. The aim of the photographers is to come closer to the Marsupilami on the board to have a good shot. The player playing Marsupilami should prevent the photographer taking any pictures, kicking them out of the board with his tail. Whenever the Marsupilami manages to kick a photographer out, he takes his role and the player who was playing the photographer takes the role of the Marsupilami onward.
categories: Adventure, Animals, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Louisville-Opoly
description:
How do you make a game about The Great City of Louisville, Kentucky? While it’s impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Louisville we could into this box. It’s full of amazing architecture, beautiful greenspace, thoroughbreds and of course… one Mega Cavern - a little something for every Louisvillian! Looking for a fun way to experience The Derby City?

Here’s a quick idea of how to play! Buy your favorite Louisville properties, increase your rent by collecting City Blocks and trading them in for Keys to the City. Sound easy? Well, add in some traffic jams, property tax and parking fines and it gets a little more difficult and a lot more fun! Get your game on! So choose your token and advance to GO Louisville!You may soon be the Mayor of Louisville… or cruising along the majestic Ohio River aboard the famous Belle of Louisville!

This is Louisville... and it’s your roll!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Trailer Park Boys Opoly
description:
A greasy spin on the classic game. Take turns moving around the Trailer Park buying businesses from Sunnyvale, bankrupt the other players, and avoid getting evicted to win!

Play as one of 6 unique tokens like Swayze train, shopping cart, dope trailer, and more. Features sheds & trailers and Way She Goes & Community Day cards

-description from publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Superfight: 2017 Year in Review
description:
Mini expansion sold at conventions. Contains 12 White and 6 Black cards that can be added to any Superfight game.

White:
Fidget Spinner
Mocking Spongebob
The Kids from Stranger Things
Kim Jong Un
Trio of Amazon Warriors
An Evil Clown That Can Turn Into Opponent's Greatest Fears
The Cast of the Emoji Movie
Schoolchildren Armed to Defend Themselves From Bears
United Airlines
Distracted Boyfriend
Pick A Hurricane
Salt Bae

Black:
Armed With A Magical Can of Pepsi That Solves Everyone's Problems
Riding an Undead Ice Dragon
Opponent's Character Was Forced to Resign and Replaced by (Draw a Random Character Card)
Staring at a Total Solar Eclipse
Armed With a Szechuan Sauce Fire Hose
Opponent's Attributes are Fake News
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Joshua: Hebrews vs. Pagans
description:
In Joshua: Hebrews vs Pagans; will you like Joshua conquer the promised land? Will you avoid the Sin of Achen and the Plague of Peor? Will you be tricked by the Gibeonites? Will Caleb and Othneil be at your right and left hand? Will the Ark of the Covenant remain safely in the hands of Eleazar, Phineas, and the Levites? Will 1 of your soldiers put to flight a 1,000 of the enemy?
As the Pagans, how long will Ai hold out? Will you keep Balam the Son of Beor from Hebrew justice? Will you unite to defeat the Hebrews? Will you take advantage of Hidden Movement, Concealed Pieces, Fortified Cities, and Siege Sorties? Will you utilize off-board Ambushes, the Iron Chariots of the Canaanites, and the might of the Philistine Anakin to drive the Hebrew invaders back across the Jordan River?

Joshua is card driven game. Joshua must conquer three of the major tribes, or two of the major tribes and most of the minor tribes in order to win. The Pagans win by stopping Joshua.

—description from the publisher

name: Finn Bjelkes Popquiz
description:
Finn Bjelke's Popquiz Boardgames is a trivia game based on the popular NRK(Norwegian Broadcasting Corporation)-program, where you can really show off your knowledge of music. Maybe you know the name of all the songs on the radio, and all the band members, but do you know much about pop? Do you know who warmed up for Rolling Stones the first time they played in Oslo, or which Ray Charles song Kayne West has sampled?

After a million conversations about music among your friends, you now want to prove that it is you who is the biggest music lover. Now all the hours with LP-records, worn CD's and music streaming finally counts. Pop music is the soundtrack of life, and here the music is the focus.

Somebody will say that you don't need to know who was the drummer in The Beatles before Ringo Starr, or what has Elvis Presleys middle name. They can't be more wrong. Without this essential knowledge, you never will become the greatest in PopQuiz!

The d10 dice guides you fast to the correct music category. Now you must show what you know! Answer correctly, you move closer to the goal. Do you answer incorrectly, you can now enjoy that you have learned something more.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Music, Party Game, Trivia

name: Economy
description:
In Economy, players representing different countries develop the resources of their respective lands to create an industrial civilisation.

Commencing with significant natural resources scattered throughout their lands, players struggle against the handicaps of a small population and the ravages of famine and disease to establish the basic amenities of civilised life, such as Governments, Hospitals and Education facilities. The tempo of development quickens as players increase their populations, mechanise transport systems and trade with one another to obtain commodities which they need.

As more and more people are freed from agricultural activities, the industrial workforce increases, factory construction commences and the manufacturing industry is born. The steel, chemical, electrical, alumina and petroleum industries follow one another in rapid succession ushering in the modern era.

The winner of the game is the first player to build and operate a supersonic passenger airliner.
categories: Civilization, Educational, Industry / Manufacturing, Territory Building

name: Elias Lönnrot: seurapeli
description: A travel game published to celebrate 80th birthday of Finnish writer Elias Lönnrot. A roll-and-move, where squares on board depict life events of Elias Lönnrot. Players have game marks, which are lost and gained during the game. Rest of the bank is split as a reward for two first players to reach square 80, three quarters of marks for first and one quarter for second player.

name: 本の虫 (Book Worm)
description:
User summary
本の虫 (Book Worm) is a deduction game with Japanese horror and suspense. Players work through actions on the 18 cards found on the book shelf. The game is published in Japanese with Japanese and English rules.

There's a rumor in the school library and the game had already started.

It's a long time ago story, a book-loving girl called "Book Worm" suddenly disappeared. Something magical happened, and the book she borrowed last was returned to the bookshelf of the school library.

The players arrange the cards to make the shelf of books. Within this might be the Book Worm book. Players work through the books, following the actions to deduce which it is, in order to avoid it.

There are three rules to find out the returned book.

1. You always borrow the book from one side of the shelf.
2. Follow the action on the title of the book.
3. The one who borrows the book with "Book Worm" on the library card will disappear and lose the game.

Publisher's summary
The Tale

It’s a long time ago story. In a certain place, there was a girl who loved books. She was called by everyone “Book Worm”, because she always
went to school library and borrowed a lot of books everyday.

One day, she suddenly disappeared. Nobody knew her whereabouts. Everyone talks to about her disappearance away from school like spirit person. Something magical happened and, the book she borrowed last, was returned to the Bookshelf school library.

Few decades later, the story of the girl “Book Worm” continued in the school library by everyone as ghost story. One day, a boy said to many student.
Let’s play the game to find out the location of the “Book Worm” that was last borrowed by the girl named “Book Worm”. Then, they started play the game.

Purpose
Players place BOOK cards orderly in a horizontal row on the table. The cards are called Bookshelf. When game is started, player will always pick cards from Bookshelf on the table, which means borrowing a Book from Bookshelf. Any player who picks up a joker card that is written “Book Worm” in Japanese character “本の虫” with a red color stripe on top.

物語

少し昔のお話です。
あるところに本が大好きな女の子がいました。
毎日のように学校の図書室に足を運んでは
本を借りていたので、
『本の虫』と呼ばれていました。
そんな彼女が、ある日忽然（こつぜん）と姿を消しました。
彼女のゆくえ行方は誰にも分からず、神隠しとして
学校中の噂（うわさ）となりましたが、
不思議なことに、そのとき彼女が借りていた本は
図書室の本棚に戻されていたそうです−。

彼女のことが
すっかり怪談話として伝わるようになった数十年後、
図書室に集まる本好きな学生たちの一人が
こんなことを口にしました。
「『本の虫』が最後に借りていた本を探すゲームをしないか。
借りた本の題名に沿って次に借りる本を決め、
貸出履歴に彼女の名前が入った本を借りた人が
どうなるのか確かめてみよう。」
こうして始まったゲームが
新たな物語の幕開けとなるのでした。

ゲームの目的

プレイヤーは
順番に横一列に並べた本を端からおもてにしていきます。
（これを『本を借りる』と呼びます）
その中で、貸出履歴に『本の虫』と書いてある本を
借りてしまったプレイヤーがゲームの敗北者となります。
本が持つ様々な効果を駆使し、
相手と本をよく見て勝利を掴みましょう。

name: Please Pass the Mustard!
description:
Please Pass the Mustard! is a fast-action card game for 2 to 6 players, ages 8 and up, in which hungry eaters select the foods they want to eat and then shop for the mustards that go with them.

The first player to place five different foods on his or her "dishes" and also play the five paired mustards wins the game.

Players roll dice to determine an action for their turn, and then play and draw cards representing various dishes, mustards, wild cards and ketchup, which is used to ruin other players dishes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Zoot Suit
description:
Zoot Suit is a speedy game of card matching. You have to get rid of nine cards by matching each previously-played card by suit, by color, by background pattern or with a WILD card. It's fast, it's fun, and it's a fantastic five-minute family game for kids and adults.

—description from the back of the box

name: Patrol: A Coloring Card Game
description:
GAME SYSTEM



This entry is to allow for discussion/rating of the game system as a whole. It is not for a specific product or release. Versions will appear on the individual item pages.





The Patrol: A Coloring Card Game features soldier cards with unique artwork and abilities. 2 players split 5 Soldier cards into patrols to utilize strategy and a hide/reveal system to destroy their enemies. At the end of the battle, soldier cards that are still alive and face up receive a level(+1/+1). The player gains 1 point for each level gained this way. First player to 20 points wins the war.
Players are also able to enhance each card with 12 different colors/abilities. Each color/abilities provides a unique play style and allows for the creation of unique decks for each player. Players draft their deck by coloring in their cards to pull from 1080 different combinations of cards.—description from the designer
mechanics: Open Drafting, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: Curse of the Shadow Spire
description:
A shadowy spire has arisen nearby and with it came evil shadow creatures that have been ravaging the countryside. As a great champion of the kingdom, your challenge is to travel the lands gathering weapons and allies with the goal of assaulting the spire and ridding the land of shadows forever.

Curse of the Shadow Spire is a solo game that can be played in about 30 minutes.

You will play as one of four heroes of the realm. Each hero has different goals and route to victory. They will need to explore and locate three powerful relics to gain access to the shadow spire.

Each turn you will adventure and explore a new terrain hex. There you will uncover the mysteries of the realms. Visit locations such as Temples, Markets, and Catacombs. Endure events such as Traps, Curses, and Plages. Fight evil Shadows. And slay the Shadow Dragon to gain one of the three relics you will need to gain access to the Shadow Spire.

As the game progresses the Shadow Spire will gain strength. Once you have found all three relics and gained access to the spire you may assault it in an attempt to defeat the shadow forces guarding it and win the game.

You will play as one of four heroes:

Crusader: As the Crusader you will be recruiting an army of Knights to help you defeat the shadows of the spire. You will need to defeat shadows, and venture into dangerous catacombs to gain the precious gold that you need to buy Food for your troops and recruit additional Knights.

Wizard: you will be working with dwarven miners to gather the finest arcane crystals buried deep in the mountains. These crystals power you spells but you will also need to kill shadows and venture into dangerous catacombs to gain gold that you need to to hire them.

Ranger: you will be summoning powerful beasts and scouring the forest and crafting the most perfect arrows to aid you on your quest to defeat the shadows of the spire. You will need to kill shadows and venture into dangerous catacombs to gain gold that you can use to recruit powerful allies and heal your wounds.

Priest: you will be destroying shadows and gathering their essence to use against them in your attempt to defeat the shadows of the spire. You will need to kill shadows and venture into dangerous catacombs to gain gold that you can use to recruit powerful allies and tithe for blessings.

Multiplayer

As each hero plays differently, the game may be played by up to four players simultaneously. All heroes will work together to recover the relics but only the hero that defeats the spire will be honored as the grand champion of the realms.

—description from the designer

name: Flowchart of Life
description:
Flowchart of Life is the game where one or several players struggle for happiness and survival on their way through the social realistic flowchart.
Sometimes you have a choice, but very often you have to roll a die and hope for the best.
Sometimes your skills that you have acquired earlier will be useful, and sometimes other players can help you.
This game is very quick to learn so all the best of luck with your life, both in this game and for real.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Doctor Who Alien Armies Trading Card Game
description:
Alien Armies was a trading card game published by Panini Comics in the fourth quarter of 2009.

Panini launched it as an affordable collectible trading card game in October 2009. In November, two Collectors Tins were issued, each with sixty regular cards and an exclusive card.

Starter packs contained:


Alien Armies Game Board (one required per player). The players could mount their strongest cards, ready for play against an opponent by beating their opponent's corresponding score.



Collector's Binder. A plastic-sleeved folder to house the collection, with a removable cover insert. It listed details and had a checklist of all 260 cards.



Four packs of 6 assorted cards (also individually available from retailers)


Booster packs contained 6 cards.

The 260 cards were made up of various card types;


180 Standard Cards (Cards numbered 1-180)
40 Glitter Foil Cards (Cards numbered G1-G40)
20 Super Foil Cards (Cards numbered F1-F20)
20 Super Foil Emboss Cards (Cards numbered E1-E20)


The foil embossed were 1:8 even though the pack says 1:4.
Foil (1:4)
Glitter (1:2)

Also 20 "Limited Edition" not in packs.

Types of cards: Equipment, Ally, Villain, Doctor, and "Children in Time"

Doctor Who Magazine #414 was the only way to get the foil 10th Doctor card.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: MicroStars Microdome Soccer
description:
MICRODOME Soccer puts your squads to the test to prove who's best.

The game uses MicroStars miniatures, each having five statistics on their base for Passing, Tackling, Crossing, Shooting, and Dribbling. Different base colors denote better player skills in specific areas. You'll need to build a balanced team including defenders, midfielders, and strikers and of coarse a top-notch goalie. Winning is about knowing your player's powers and when to best use them.

The objective of the game is to complete 32 moves in each match (16 in each half) and score more goals than your opponent. The game is played on a pitch marked with a grid, where each grid point defines what may be accomplished from that position.

Moves are made by calling and winning Skill Challenges allowing you to progress the ball to better positions down the pitch. There are 5,6,7,8, or 9 Skill Challenges in each Move and you can only score from one of the 32 shooting positions. Of course the goalie will have a chance to block your shot.

Contents:
- MicroDome play pitch and stadium that doubles as a carry-case
- 16 exclusive MicroStars miniatures including 2 black-base "rares"
- 2 goals
- Stadium backdrop and benches for your teams
- Rules of Play
mechanics: Grid Movement, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Sum Fun
description:
Use the tiles you have picked up to make SUMs. Once all of the tiles are out, the winner is the first person to use all of their tiles to make valid SUMs. Everybody plays the game at the same time, there is no waiting around for another player to take their turn as each person makes their own SUMs independently from one another.

SUM FUN comes in a handy blue zip-up canvas case, meaning it’s easy to take anywhere, whether it be in a class room, a living room, or a picnic table! The case contains the following: 103 white ‘number’ tiles (10 sets of 0-9 and 3 joker tiles), 87 blue ‘symbol’ tiles (35 equals, 18 plus, 18 minus, 7 multiply, 7 divide and 2 joker tiles) and Instructions (English, French, German, Italian, Spanish)

(Basically Bananagrams with number and mathematical operator tiles instead of letters.)

name: Sorting Shapes Cupcakes
description:
Children roll the die, move the pawns around the cupcake top and fill in their cupcake puzzle card in this early board game.

Early board game extends the learning and the fun. Reinforces shape recognition, attributes, matching (visual and tactile discrimination) and following directions. Children roll the die, move the pawns around the cupcake top and fill in their cupcake puzzle card. Includes 30 shape cards in 6 shapes, 4 self-checking cupcake puzzle cards, 4 pawns, large foam die, cake mix box, Activity Guide and game board that measures 14"L x 12 3/4"W. For 2–4 players. Grades PreK+.

name: Where's My Bottom?
description:
Be the first to match your animals with the correct bottoms.

The Where's My Bottom Game is an exciting early learning game which teaches animal names and matching, encourages observation skills and develops hand-eye coordination.

name: Agents of Mayhem: Solo & Co-op Expansion
description:
Now play solo or cooperatively with your friends against Athena as either MAYHEM or LEGION.

These are more than just cards. The 'Athena AI' was developed for military training games and tactics analysis. Athena innovatively uses Object Oriented Programming in a card deck that rivals video game AIs!

This is the same AI system used in Conflict of Heroes board game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Video Game Theme

name: Amerika: Cruise Missile Attack – Surface Missiles In Amerika
description:
The following rules will help you incorporate these new units into your AMERIKA game. Feel free to pick and choose which ones to use so long as all players agree. These can help balance the game when players of differing skill levels play against each other, or add new dimensions and strategy for advanced players.

German rocket technology began early on as a means to defend the coasts of Fortress Europe and cause fear or destruction from long range. Learning from the Nazi V-1 program, the U.S. began development of the JB-2 Loon, a near copy of the feared V-1. In Amerika, these technologies have become battle tested by both sides by 1946 and are ready for deployment to the battlefield.

This expansion allows players a new type of weapon on both sides of the battlefield.

Helping both forces to disrupt enemy actions, cruise missiles are used during the Conduct Guerilla Attacks phase.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: Amerika: Silverbird – Germany's Space Plane
description:
The Sänger Silbervogel “Silverbird” bomber developed from the idea of an intercontinental bomber that would glide around the world on the fringes of space and the Earth’s atmosphere. Launched from a base in Nazi Occupied Europe, it would travel down an approximately three-mile long monorail track, launched initially by V-2 rocket engines into space at a speed so fast, it would circle the earth in only a few hours. Its payload was to be a single composite bomb containing nuclear particles in a fashion similar to “chaff”, with an initial detonation in the higher atmosphere above a city to ensure complete coverage of the nuclear material.
The bomb itself was a 5,000-pound high explosive warhead wrapped in special insulated blankets of radioactive silicone, detonating at about 2,000-3,000 feet above the target city. The end result would be radioactive sickness and death for those on the receiving end.
After mission completion, the bomber would glide back to Germany reentering the atmosphere gradually and landing at a specially designated airfield. The cost of producing the bomb and the bomber itself though would render this weapon as a relatively expensive endeavor suited mostly for preemptive strikes against heavily fortified cities with the aim to wipe them out quickly.

-description from publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction, Wargame, World War II

name: El País del Antichollo
description:
The board game adaptation of one of the "consolation games" seen in the popular spanish TV show "Un, dos, tres... Responda otra vez". The players must advance trough the board facing challenges and popular culture questions. When they succeed, they receive money, and when they don't, they lose it. Also, the board is divided in numbered sections. If the dices sums the number of the section in with the player token stands, the "antichollo" eats them and they lose all their money, but keep playing. The one who has more money when the first player reach the other side of the board, wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ordleg
description:
Ordleg is a domino-like card game where you get points by creating 4 letter words.

The game contains 48 word cards + 6 rules cards.

name: Tiddlywinks Golf Game
description:
This is a golf simulation game where one flips their ball (a tiddlywink counter) towards the hole. For each hole, the players construct a fairway of par 3-5, with or without sand traps or water hazards. A player's score at the end of any hole is equal to how many times they needed to flip their ball (counter) plus any penalties they received. Whoever has the lowest score at the end of either 9 or 18 holes, wins.

—user summary

name: Unemployment
description: In this roll-and-move game, each player is attempting to either become the first player to get a job or to be the last player to go bankrupt. On each player's turn they roll the die and move their pawn around the board. Depending on which space they land on, they will most likely draw a card, which will either give them additional qualifications to get a job, interview advice, or contacts. A player can use these cards to move into the Interview Space, and with a little luck and the right cards, the player can win the game. Similarly, players will also collect "Mail" cards during the game, which are bills they must pay periodically. Thus, a player may end up going bankrupt due to their bills before they have a chance to find a job.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Catch the Cat
description:
Catch the Cat is the chess board game based on the educational programming language(Scratch). Players use the commands of the Scratch program to move their pieces.

Players can build up their computational and logical thinking skills during play the game and feel familiar to the words and frames which used in Scratch.

—description from the publisher

name: Rumpus: A Delightfully Simple Card Game
description:
It’s been a long week and you’re feeling rowdy. Roll up your sleeves – it’s time to start a rumpus!

Rumpus is a pocket-sized betting card game that is incredibly easy to learn and play. Aggress other players to show what a desirable gentleman you really are – but don’t pick a fight you can’t win! Oh, and please don’t start an actual fight. You are better than that.

In Rumpus, each player draws three cards, then chooses one card to place face-up in front of them so it is visible to the other players. Each card will consist of one of three symbols - Bicycle, Mustache, and Top Hat. At the beginning of each turn, the player with the Your Turn card must choose an opponent to fight. The players not involved in the fight may place a bet on who they think will win; be careful though, your bet cards will be lost if your fighter loses the fight.

The fighting players will select cards from their hand of a single symbol to play. Once both players are ready, they will reveal their selected cards to see who wins the fight. The player with the most of symbols of their suit wins the fight; in the case of a tie, there is a listing of which symbols are most effective against another symbol in the instructions (think Rock-Paper-Scissors). The winner will take a Victory Card and must read the description on the card out loud (e.q. "Good Show!"); the other players who bet on the winner will take their bet cards back and draw an additional card from the deck that can be used for future fights.

Once all of the Victory Cards have been drawn, the game is over, and the player with the most Victory Cards is the winner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Super Me!
description:
It's Easy To Play!

Flip over an Emergency! card
Make a Super Me! match
Be a Superhero


This game was developed to help kids recognize opportunities to help others. Anyone can be a superhero by helping!

—description from the publisher
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: ちぇいにんぐ (Cheiningu)
description:
ちぇいにんぐ (Cheiningu) is a card game where players try to, or not to, connect two cards of the same color (Cheiningu means 'chaining').

There are 90 cards, 10 cards for each of 9 colors, in the game. The game is published in Japanese but is language free in gameplay.

Players take turns placing a card on the table to form a four-column grid. When a pair of cards of the same color are connected, orthogonally or diagonally, that player takes these cards and scores points, and the taken spaces are filled by existing cards in a certain rule. If another pair is made, that player takes them and scores again, which is called chaining. Repeat the process until no pairs are made.

There are several game modes. In one mode, you just draw a card and place it, and you should take as many cards as possible. In another mode, you choose one from your hand of two cards, and you score negative points if a single pair is made in a turn; only chainings are counted positive.

In another game, special cards may be added to change the rules slightly.

Depending on the game mode, the player with the most positive points or the least negative points wins the game.

—User summary

同じ色が縦・横・斜めのいずれかに揃えばカードをゲット♪
カードを集めたり、マイナス点として押し付けたり…
付属のカードで遊び方いろいろです♪
小さいお子さんから大人の方までみんなで遊べるカードゲーム！
《プレイ時間10〜15分・プレイ人数2〜10人》 基本の遊び方は2種類。
さらに発展ルールで遊び方のバリエーションが増えます。
一撃堂オリジナルゲーム第1作目 カードゲーム「ちぇいにんぐ」

—description from the publisher

name: Race To Space
description: In Race to Space, players embark on an epic battle of wits earning points and game advantages by completing mission quests. Avoid treacherous sabotages, swaps, steals and other shenanigans while navigating through mini games such as Rock-Paper-Scissors duels, instant win chances, and dice challenges. Blast off with this Space Age game designed to re-define learning as an out of this world experience! Finally, a game for kids who wish learning was fun!

name: MiniCity
description:
Minicity, the funnest game to learn English with friends. Explore this coloring and exciting city full of surprises!

It consists of a colorful and vibrant circular board where you can move from the launch of a dice. Players start at the Bank, then passing through different places and stores in the miniature city. They can buy all the places and adding workers and products related to every place or shop. And all in English!

Every time players stop at the social media icons, they receive “social media messages” through the messages cards and get ready for different surprises and actions to do at MiniCity. They can be lucky, or not so much!

Players can role play to “work” as a bank teller or a realtor while playing. Also, they can use Minicity cars and taxi, if getting some of the lucky messages.

The player with the most places and most money at the end of the game will be the winner.

name: Boxitale Mini
description:
An interactive assembly adventure game Boxitale mini assembly adventure game uses a smartphone/tablet to stream an original animated story.

The story is full of challenges that need to be solved using Boxitale's special connectors and rods.

Once built, the result is uploaded into the story.

name: Murder à la Carte: Murder in the Orient
description:
Shanghai, 1937. It's a confused, chaotic and cosmopolitan kind of town. Local businessman, Fu Manchuria has invited a mixed group to his house to have dinner, but regrettably the host himself will not be present. He's been detained upstairs. Detained by person or persons unknown. He was found in his bedroom, bound and gagged, and with an ivory chopstick through his heart. In short, he's dead.

So who killed him? It can only be one of his guests, which
means that at least one of you is the murderer. Luckily the
private detective Marlowe McClue is here to help you find out who that person is.

name: Pax et Bonum
description:
Traveling with monks pawns, players experience many adventures together with St. Francis, for example, help poor people by sharing bread, talking with a wolf, dressing sick deer and others.
The contestants get a mission to collect all the fruits of the Holy Spirit (Love, Joy, Peace, Patience, Kindness, Goodness, Faithfulness, Gentleness, and Self-control). Strolling along the stone streets, they decide which way to go to get individual tokens.

The goal of the game is to collect the nine fruits of the Holy Spirit as soon as possible and to come with them to St. Francis.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Benedetto, Polskie Gry Planszowe (Polish Board Games)

name: Yolè
description:
Each player moves 7 playing pieces (lalo) around the board (ikodok) and tries to catch the enemy pieces. Movement is from one line (nayico) to the next and is determinated by 4 keramic disks (chinamotes) with a blank side and an symbol on the other side. The rolls count as follows:
4 blanks = 4 points
4 symbols = 3 points
3 symbols or 3 blanks = 0 points (kaika)
2 symbols and 2 blanks = 1 point (yolè)

When a lalo changes from the sixth nayico to the opponent half of the board, it has to pass a circle (lapel). Any lalo who lands directly on the lapel has to remain there till the player rolls a yolè. On the lapel no lalo can be caught. Several lalos may occupy the lapel at the same time.
The player who manages to catch all 7 opponent lalos wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Captain Underpants Sign Changing Game
description:
Join George and Harold as they wreak havoc changing the signs everywhere! Earn the most items from Principal Krupp's confiscated items drawer by rearranging words into side-splitting, ultimate prankster phrases. Turn "Go Jerome Tigers" into "Go Roman Gods!"

A silly sport of side-splitting, sign-changing fun: includes 30 signs, three hint cards, 90 double-sided letter and blank tiles, dice, prankster items, and instructions.

Join George and Harold as they wreak havoc everywhere, pulling pranks and cracking jokes with whatever they can find.

Earn confiscated prankster goodies from Principal Krupp’s desk
Based on the popular book series and highly anticipated 2017 Dreamworks film, Captain Underpants: The First Epic Movie.

—description from the publisher
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: バハムート ゲート 拡張: Attack of Cthulhu (Bahamut Gate Expansion: Attack of Cthulhu)
description: This is the second expansion for Bahamut Gate (バハムート ゲート). It includes two new bosses and three new player characters. The game also includes a new play mode for three to five players whereby one of the players is working against the rest of the group.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Internet Gekkies
description:
This cardgame is about crazy YouTube memes.
You try to earn 1000000 views by blocking, stealing, bluffing.
The game has 60 cards

The game has 6 type of cards.
The view card earn you view-points
The red cards are for blocking
The yellow cards give a bonus
The green cards give you extra cards
The orange cards give an interaction with another player.

When playing a card you have to say the text out loud.

Each card has a qr code on the back then sends you to the YouTube meme depicted on the card.

—user summary

name: Harem Wars: Harem Combat
description:
This expansion adds an additional 120 cards to the game, a set of special Harem dice, a new game mat AND a set of instructions on a new way to play the game. The game mode will allow you to also play alone making the game for 1-4 players.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Mature / Adult
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Set Collection

name: Gusha no Hitsugi
description:
愚者の棺 (Gusha no Hitsugi, "Fool's Casket") is a test-your-luck game from Polygonotes. A band of heroes have found an ancient treasure horde, but before they can take any of the prizes away they'll have to get by the ghosts that haunt it.

Each round you'll try to get a piece of treasure by drawing from the ghost deck. If you draw a ghost with the same element as the treasure you can keep it, but if the fourth ghost of a type comes out it'll play a trick. Exactly what the trick does varies by type, but it includes swapping your treasure with the top of the deck, swapping someone else's treasure, or even flipping the deck upside down.

You can choose what treasure you go after, so will you go for high points, the safe bet, or try to interfere with the other players? You can avoid ghost types that are about to play a trick on you, or you can go after them to trigger the trick on purpose.

The first player to ten points wins the round and escapes the tomb with their treasure - and their life!

—user summary

name: Tumblin' Monkeys: Banana Bandit
description:
In this children's dexterity game, players must take it in turns to remove monkeys hanging from the trees to their personal crates, using only a palm branch. They have until the wind-up monkey climbs the vine to collect as many as possible, then passing to the next player.
Play continues round the table until the trees are clear and the monkeys of varying colours and points value in each crate are totalled to find a winner.

—user summary

name: よくばりパフェ (Yokubari Parfeit)
description:
User summary
よくばりパフェ (Yokubari Parfeit) is a Japanese game of push your luck, eating delicious cakes and ices. Players roll the dice against the cards drawn, and try to consume the luxurious cakes. But if the cakes are too sweet or too cold, the player cannot take the 'mouth burst' and fails (run to the bathroom!). Players can choose to swallow early on, and reduce the cards they hold. But if you take too long, other players will finish before you.

The game has very cute graphics, but Japanese reviewers say it is contrary and the decisions are hard for a party game.

Publisher's summary
Shake the dice and pull up the mountain-like parfait piled on a plate!

Is it already the limit? Is more still possible? ?
If it is not early, other people will eat it!

But my head is nervous ...

But it's okay, let's pour a cup of tea when it's too late.

ダイスを振ってお皿に積まれた山のようなパフェを頬張ろう！

もう限界？まだまだいける？？
早くしないと他の人に食べられちゃう！

でもまって、頭がきーんと…

でも大丈夫、いざとなったらお茶で流しこもう♪

name: Piment fort
description:
From the publisher:
"Laissez libre cours à votre imagination! Tentez d'être le plus drôle en complétant les énoncés proposés par l'animateur et accumulez le plus de cartes PIMENT FORT pour remporter la partie."

name: Muumipeikko ja ystävät
description: Find the missing items in this fun variation on a memo game. The first player to collect three correct tiles wins the games. Teaches children shapes, colours and numbers. The colourful content also makes learning fun.

name: Alley Oops!
description:
"Alley Oops! - A Raucous Game of Stumbling and Tumbling for Klutzes!”

Play the raucous game of stumbling and tumbling, Alley Oops! In this traditional American game you roll your colored magic tumbling bean on the ramped game board into a scoring hole. It’s fun and harder than it looks. Classic and addictive fun for the whole family in the original 1930’s retro box. A unique gift for any classic game collector.

The name Alley Oops comes from French Gymnasts, who yell “Allez Hop!” (Let’s Go!) before tumbling on the gym mat.

—description from the publisher

This is a replica of a vintage board game from the 1930s.

name: Viivi ja Wagner Parisuhdepeli
description:
How well do you know your partner?

The game is meant for grown-ups in a relationship, and is played in pairs. The pairs take turns in reading out loud questions or statements, and they have to answer or react to them. If they give the same answer, they get to move on the game board.

There are 4 categories of questions:

love/eroticism
home and relationship
the past and the future
money and work


—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Jean Paul Sartre's No Exit
description:
Jean Paul Sartre's No Exit is a 3 player Print and Play game taking roughly 5-10 minutes per round. Players move their strangers to one of several sofas then score at the end of each round if the right strangers are on the right sofas to fulfill their personal motivations. It is almost impossible to avoid repeated stalemates unless you manage to manipulate and persuade the other players. With nothing to offer or threaten you must convince them to act against their own best interests.

Jean Paul Sartre's No Exit is themed as a boardgame recreation of the play No Exit by the French philosopher Jean Paul Sartre. It is the source of his most famous misquotation "Hell is other people".

—description from the publisher
categories: Bluffing, Book, Educational, Political, Print & Play

name: Unsere Jahreszeiten
description:
The seasons are completely mixed up!

In Unsere Jahreszeiten, the players help get the season tiles in the right order again. The player who has a good memory and is lucky when spinning the disk will be the first one to place four different tiles in front of them and win.

—description from the publisher

name: Twilight of the Sun King: Scenario Book 2 – Great Northern & Ottoman Wars
description:
The second scenario booklet featuring battles from the Great Northern War (1700-21) and the Ottoman wars of the period is also available. It features the following scenarios
Ottoman Wars Scenarios
Parkany, 1683
Pruth, 1711
Peterwardein, 1716
Great Northern War (1700-21) Scenarios
Narva, 1700
Crossing the Duna/Riga, 1701
Kliszow, 1702
Holowczyn, 1708
Lesnaja, 1708
Gadebusch, 1712
Storkyro, 1714
categories: Age of Reason, Book, Miniatures, Wargame

name: Think: Mandala
description:
This is one of the Ravensburger "Think" games, a brainteaser/mental exercise game-series.
These games are good for mental training, e.g. in creativity, concentration, imagination, logic and so on.

name: Der kleine Ritter
description: To flip with two jettons instead of dice-throwing and walk to the castle

name: Bezzerwizzer Bricks: Sportens triumfer
description:
A small 60 card quiz game about sports.
Also has a category tile to make this an expansion for the big Bezzerwizzer games.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Ilmajääkärit
description:
War-themed abstract game published during the Second World War, where one player controls 8 paratroopers that are randomly placed in the center of the board by rolling dice, then try to move to place demolition charges in marked locations in each corner of the board. In each corner begins 4 defending guards, mechanics, pilots, or gunners, for a total of 16 defenders, that are played by one to four players. All pieces are paper standees and the rules for all types are identical. Surrounded pieces surrender, and no piece can move in the gap between two enemy pieces. The board is laid out with white circles that only paratroopers use for movement and red circles used by the defenders. Dice are only used for the paratrooper set up, with the rest of the game being deterministic each player allowed to make 4 moves, divided to 1-4 pieces as they wish.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Know Canada's Transportation
description:
Part of a series of card decks released during the 1967's Centennial celebrations of Canada's Confederation. The cards are bilingual and contain trivia about various modes of transportation used in Canada from First Contact to the mid-20th century. This is primarily a trivia game, with quaint illustrations and quick facts for children and teens to learn. There are no formal rules for using these cards as a trivia game.

As with other games in this series (such as Know Canada's Heroes) this deck also includes rules to use the deck for other card games. This deck includes two rules cards to play Rummy and Triplets. The proposed Rummy is the classic 2 to 4 players version of the card game. The rules for Triplets describe a simplified 2 to 4 player version of a game most often called Indian Rummy or Pablu. In this version of Rummy, sets of three provide more points than in classic version.

name: The MINTese Falcon
description:
A hard boiled noir detective yarn -- in a mint tin.

Follow leads and ride taxis to travel to different locations in the city. Choose a low-life character to encounter, and read their story. Find and collect the pieces of the priceless falcon statue. Use a remaining lead or a taxi to get back to your office. Resolve one final encounter to find out who killed your partner, and win the game.

"Someone killed my partner. They think I did the hit to steal the priceless falcon statue, but I didn’t do it. Now I have to scour the grimy locations and back alleys of this city, find the missing pieces of the statue, and get it back to my office in one piece. I’m going to clear my name, find the real killer, and avenge my partner. Or die trying. Either way, someone's going to pay. In this city, nobody's innocent."

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck

name: Revolutionary War Battlefield
description:
A simple game where the British and Continental armies move around a board to capture enemy pieces, place their flags signifying the capture of key locations, then move on the enemy's capital to capture it an win the game.
The game can also be won by destroying the enemy army. Movement is by die roll. the pieces are designated as infantry, cavalry and cannon and have differing qualities. The rules are one page, and is vaguely reminiscent of the American Heritage series game Battle Cry.

—description from the publisher
categories: American Revolutionary War, Children's Game, Wargame

name: Cutthroat Captains
description:
You’re vying to become the “Most Dreaded” Captain of the seas. Dread points are earned by spending booty at ports and by returning alive. For each Dread point earned, gain 1 jewel.

Each Captain commands five pirates. When pirates meet up in the seas, they form a crew (place your pirate on top). Any time a pirate sets sail, he takes his crew with him (any piece above in the stack). Sailing into a Whirlpools flips the stack. Gather cards to control the winds and the seas.
Scoring:

1. Earn Dread Points by spending treasure at port on supplies, rum, and entertainment.

2. When crossing the scoring line, the pirate’s stack that is crossing receives 1 Dread Point per piece in his or her stack. Other pirates along for the ride receive 1 point per piece of their own.

The first pirate to earn 10 Dread Points wins, and is the most dreaded Cutthroat Captain.

—description from the designer

name: Operation F.A.U.S.T.: Special Antiquities Promo Pack
description:
Pack Contains:

5 Paintings: 2 Degenerate, 2 Forgery and 1 Regular
1 Statue
1 Altar Piece
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, World War II
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment, Take That

name: Top Word
description:
The deck has 100 cards, each with a letter and its point value. (The letters have either a goldenrod or a turquoise background, but this has no game value.)

Each player is dealt 7 cards, and 7 more area dealt to the initial discard pile. In turn each player may discard any number of their cards and then draw that many from the deck or discard pile (but not both). This is done a second time, and then players have 60 second to form their hand into words. Players then get the point value of all the cards in the longest word they make, with a bonus of 10 points going to the best hand (typically the hand with the longest word). Hands are done until an agreed time is expired or an agreed winning point total is reached.

—user summary

name: Ett frågespel om medeltiden
description:
A trivia game about Middle Age in Sweden. Cards contain a picture hint and three text hints. Rules contain a couple of ways to play.

—user summary

name: Jokkmokk ambassadör
description:
”Jokkmokk - by area the second largest municipality in Sweden. Within its borders lie the national parks of Sarek, Padjelanta, Stora Sjöfallet and Muddus. Here is a lot to see and experience. You who do not know a lot about Jokkmokks municipality will learn tremendous amounts.

In this game we will bring you on a tour through Jokkmokk. The game is about moving though the municipality, answering questions and trying to become an ambassador for Jokkmokk.

The game rules are easy to follow and you win through a balanced combination of luck and knowledge.

A family game for 2-6 players from 11 years old.”

—Box description
